text: Excellent!! To walk in on a Sunday Labor Day Weekend at 8pm and be seated in 28 minutes in phenomenal!! Service was excellent! When you see even the owner helping out, you can tell everyone is invested in getting people served and to keep everything flowing. The food was excellent! Servings are big enough to share and best part is they split the plates for you!! This was our 1st time in Chicago and found this restaurant on Yelp! Glad I followed the reviews here! Will definitely be back!!

Within walking distance from our hotel, this restaurant was a pleasant surprise!  The service and food were amazing!  The pistachio cake was a great finish to the meal as well. I'll keep this restaurant in mind for my next visit to Chicago!
Wonderful Italian food. Love that they offered half-portions of their pasta and risotti. Risotti was absolutely delicious.
First time in Chicago, with my wife and friends, this is the place to be! And the place to eat great Italian food! Make your reservations soon!

Yum!!!! Good wine, great appetizers, awesome staff, fabulous food... love it all. We had a cruise set for 7.... so we went in, ordered and ate... the staff accommodates our need to get in and out! Really great tasting food!! We ordered the specials instead of the menu! Great place!! Loved it!

Had the chicken Parmesan - not impressed. They brought a whole thick chicken; breaded it and covered in Parmesan and sauce. Would've been happier with a thin cut and veggies. Honestly I would've enjoyed the chicken Parmesan at Olive Garden better and would've cost a lot less.

Traditional Chicago Italian. We have been here a number of times and have never been disappointed. So convenient to Mag Mile, Streeterville, River North, Navy Pier and Medical Center. Service is efficient and friendly and the food is tasty abundant and authentic Italian. Fettuccine Bolognese was piled with a tasty very meaty sauce over al dente fresh pasta. Salmon over spinach was tasty and meaty and fresh. Great place to begin or end an evening.

5 stars easy! Impressive service and food is HEAVENLY. I'm talking every bite of likely anything you order. The place is a little pricey but you get what you pay for. Shoutout to Chris, our server, he checked in with us at all the right times. Would highly recommend!

Wow! Now this is what I call Italian! If you are craving some delicious pasta, wine or cocktails, this is the place to go. We started off with a Caesar salad which was delicious. You can tell the dressing is freshly made and the croutons are so so good. I also had a mango martini that was out of this world! Highly recommend!  For my entree, I got the gnocchi in vodka sauce and my grandmother got the ravioli. BY FAR THE BEST GNOCCHI AND VODKA SAUCE I'VE EVER HAD. The gnocchi is fluffy and cheesy tasting. The vodka sauce is creamy but not artificial. The ravioli were also delicious.  The prices were definitely reasonable! My only qualm was that I wanted to add shrimp to my gnocchi and each small shrimp was $2. Seems a bit pricey for each shrimp. But still tasty. I'd probably not add the shrimp next time though.  I will definitely be coming back!

One of our favorite Italian restaurants. We go here every time we are in town since it's right next to the Ronald McDonald House. The owner is always so friendly and the ambience is always so soothing. The cannoli is my daughters favorite.

Everything about Volare was top notch. I worried we'd be turned away at the door in our somewhat shabby tourist attire complete with dirty sneakers and bags of souvenirs. We were treated like honored guests, seated at a lovely table and well taken care of the whole time. The Volare Pinot Grigio is the best I've ever had. Warm bread, including focaccia with kalamata olive bits kept coming. Everything was beautiful, charming, and perfect. I want to eat here every time I visit Chicago. The family has one other restaurant-it's in Rome. I hope to eat there someday too.

I've been a frequent diner at Volare and have never been disappointed. The food and service are terrIfic.  So many tempting options you'll require a second visit to satisfy your craving at this Italian mainstay.  Save room for dessert.

Wonderful! Came in on Saturday night after an afternoon play and we were ready to eat! Started with stuffed clams & special shrimp appetizer--so delicious!  We wanted practically everything on the menu, but stuck w/ the sea bass, osso bucco and eggplant parmigiana. Fabulous! And yes our eyes were bigger than our stomachs so we ordered canollis & cappuccino! We loved this place!  Fabulous food, service, drinks were outstanding--can't wait to go back!
Consistently great food! I always make a point to come here when in Chicago. I love their seafood pastas.

The food is very good, but the portion sizes are very unpredictable if you order takeout. I have ordered here about 10 times and sometimes I get a decent amount of gnocchi that works for leftovers. Other times, I do not get enough to feed my husband alone.
I'm so glad we found this place to eat at on our last night in Chicago. The food and service was amazing and we will definitely come back on our next trip. I highly recommend this restaurant!!

Went here with the wife and 5 yr old son and was pleasantly surprised. We had a 8pm reservation and we're seated promptly at a great outside table. The food is old school italian and simply awesome. We have been back a few times since and also had food delivered from them to a condo downtown where we were staying. I love this place and will be back again soon.

I take back everything I said! After a not-so-great first experience (henceforth, I will never review a place unless I've been there at least twice), this time was a downright PERFECT dining experience! We had reservations and were seated promptly. It was a gorgeous evening and we chose to sit outside. We were greeted immediately, and drinks were delivered promptly. We were not in a hurry and our waiter, Jesus, respected this and his service was perfectly timed, from start to finish.  From drinks to salads and entrees, to dessert, it was an excellent experience. Food is genuine Italian and clearly not just homemade, but made with love. Everything here is excellent...and delivered HOT. The ravioli and risotto were spot on. So thank you for everything, Volare. Keep up the excellent work, and I can't want to come back again when I am in the mood for a real Italian experience.

Amazing food, fantastic service and great atmosphere - what more could you want?  We had such a great experience for dinner that we came back for lunch before leaving Chicago.  Both meals were outstanding.
Doing the tourist thing and ordered delivery to our hotel. Our order arrived on time and was so very delicious and perfectly prepared.
I ordered the caprese salad and ravioli palmadore. The caprese salad was good but the ravioli was excellent.
Excellent service and staff completely accommodating. 6 meals all excellent. Nice size portions. Unfortunately we were so hungry and ate every morsel before I took any pictures.

One word. AMAZING. Only waited 10 minutes for a table and the manager gave us a second round of our drinks on the house. The food is fantastic, especially the carpaccio appetizer. So glad I tried this place out.
Wow wow wow. Freshly made from scratch! Flavorful and outstanding. The service was great just like the calamari. The marinara is out of this world. Try it out!

Food and service were amazing! It was real Italian food. Packed house and a pretty large place. It was very face pace and those employees deserve a round of applause for their team work.  I sat at the bar and the bartender recommended a meal which was amazing. He was even one step ahead of me only ordering a half portion since it is a huge serving. Looks like a ton of repeat customers. I would recommend this place for food and service.

Volare is a nice little restaurant in Chicago.  We went there based on the Yelp reviews and the recommendation of the front  desk clerk at the nearby hotel that we stayed in.  After making reservations, we started our "short" walk from our hotel.  20 minutes of walking, and we were there.  The lobby was packed and more people were arriving.   We were seated promptly.  Unfortunately, the table that they gave us was right next to the entrance and very dark.  My wife objected as we could not see the menu.  They immediately moved us as soon as a table opened up minutes later. We ordered their Fettucine alla Bolognese, Rigatoni all' Arrabbiata, and a Linguine Arselle e Bottarga.  The food was good!  The Rigatoni came in a spicy tomato sauce with Pancetta in it.  I liked the spiciness of the dish.  My daughter and I liked the Fettucine alla Bolognese.  It had lots of meat in it.  The sauce was perfect.  The Linguine was basically a linguine with clams.  My wife liked it.  Unfortunately, it was too dark in there for my camera to take good pictures without using my flash and blinding all the other customers.   The food was good.  The service was good. One of the managers there even hailed a cab for us after we finished dinner so that we wouldn't have to take the 20 minute walk back to the hotel.

3.5 rating. Actually a bit disappointed and felt like I was oversold by Yelp reviewers. The gnocci is amazing; don't get me wrong; but the restaurant didn't really 'wow' me. Our service wasn't great and I felt like either the server was too busy to take care of us or put his priority on other tables. The support staff was beyond incredible though. Splurged for the Chilean sea bass special and the fish was wayyyy better than my veal in lemon sauce. They say that the proteins come with sides but it was just two potato croquettes and some steamed broccoli so if you want sides, order sides. (We went the four-course route of app, salad, primi, and secondi and only spent $150!) There is better Italian in Chicago to be had.

This review is a long time in coming.  I have had so many wonderful meals at Volare.  I am sorry to say, that I am not very good about posting reviews on social media.   On Friday we started out a celebration weekend for my soon to be daughter in law at Volare.  We could not have picked a better place.  The food was outstanding, the staff was on top of their game.  I had a last minute request for a dessert for the guest of honor,  Benny the owner and host brought out a beautiful cake.  This really tied everything together.   I want to say thank you to Benny and the whole staff.
Black spaghetti and tiramisu are yum :)) I like their interior and exterior too. Ppl are good as well. Overall, I like this restaurant. xx
Simply fabulous Italian food, wine, and service.  Had the special raviolis stuffed with short ribs.  Great selection on wines (barbera).
one of the best itallian restaurant in chicago. they also have gluten free pasta which is as good as the r3gular pasta.

I want to go home. If the waiter would look at me I would make that hand wavey gesture in the air for my check. I mean I don't want to be a dick. I get it, places get busy and things can take longer than normal. But I wish I could get the check. Now at this point we are done with the meal.  I had the linguine and my wife had the spaghetti Pomodoro, neither dish impressed us. Now before we got a table we had waited an hour for the table, but that was expected for a busy Saturday night.  The drinks my wife had at the bar were really good, she was drinking the Mango martini.  And I know she would go back to the bar for those drinks because she was in love with it.  So the drinks were excellent.  The food and service at the table offset that experience and just made use want to leave.  So here we are sitting at the table waiting for the elusive check to put a bow tie on this whole bunch of... meh.

First off, we absolutely loved the food, waiters, and (I believe) the owner of the restaurant. However, I echo several other reviewers that the host service needs improving and consistency in courtesy. Today, my husband called ahead and was told the wait was 5 to 10 minutes. When we arrived, he went to the host stand but it took a while for someone to greet him (after 2 of the hostesses just glanced at him and said nothing). When we were that told that the wait was about 30 minutes, my husband mentioned the call he made 5 minutes ago but one hostess flatly replied "25 to 30 minutes" (mind you, we got there before the dinner rush). As we were walking out to wait, an older sharply dressed man (the owner I believe) redirected us inside and showed us to an open table. After that, we had a delicious dinner and our waiter was fantastic. Nevertheless, hosts/hostesses are the face of a business and we unfortunately have experienced their haughty demeanor in the past as well.

I'm from philly and this was one of the best Italian meals I've eaten. Absolutely delicious sauce...lasagna, chicken parm were made to perfection. Wonderful service and an easy walk from hotels on north Michigan Ave!

Love love love food here! First awhile we sat on the patio because the weather was fabulous so we didn't experience the ambience. We had the Bavette alla carbonara di mare and it was the same as I had in Rome except minus di mare, my favorite! I recommend. I don't get carbonara in United States because it's too saucy and too rich , but at Volare the carbonara was perfect! We also had the lasagna and gnocchi, and it was great, my husband and daughter enjoyed very much. For dessert- we split truffles chocolate cake - delicious, small portion but because it's rich it was just finish of the dinner . Now I'm looking for an excuse to drive 5 hours to come to Chicago so we can eat here again

Recommended by a relative. You can guess that it is Italian. Good place. I had a custom Pasta Dish ($18) with linguine, mushrooms, peas and tomato sauce. Delicious, but I must say it tastes just like my homemade sauce, which is also delicious. My wife had a similar 1/2 order custom Pasta Dish ($6) with linguine, olive oil and cheese. Also delicious. I ordered wine and there was a mistake. Not sure if it was me of the sommelier, probably me. The great thing is that they went with what I thought I ordered and charged me accordingly. This place is worth a visit.

This is definitely the best restaurant I've ever been to. I was in Chicago for a week I went there three times because it was so good. There service is great. The food is great to. The three things I would recommend the most are penne spaghetti and pizza when you go there. If you go to Chicago you need to go to volare. Now you know you most go to volare

Went back yesturday for lunch and had another awsome meal. Just wanted to make a quick update to say this place is also, at lunch time anyway, good for kids. We were out running arrends and had my 8 year old with us and stopped for lunch. My son can be pretty picky so I was a tad concerned. But our fabulous waiter, who somehow always remembers what I ordered last time lol, was able to accommodate his request for plain mozzarella and a cheese pizza. He ate half of both by the way which coming from my son is HUGE praise because he eats like a bird at meal time and is super picky.

Disappointing at best. First, the positives ... the service was great and the staff were attentive. The bread was tasty and our water glasses were full. Our mussels appetizer was tasty. Unfortunately, the dinner menu is slightly different online than the one presented, which was disappointing. Then the risotto and paella,items were pasta based, not rice based -- as in none. who knew? By the time we suspected our order was in. The waiter was very accommodating, but failed to mention the hefty price tag of that accommodation. Our order took a long time and by that time we had eaten our appetizers and bread and the break was too long -- dinner was a let down. Then, we get the bill and we were charged $9 for a small bowl of gluten free noodles that it was really too late to enjoy. We left much of the food uneaten, paid and left, more filled with disappointment than a nice meal.

Absolutely amazing is a definite understatement.  This was my second trip to the Chicago North River area from out of town and my first visit to Volare happened 2 years ago.  I returned this week and one of the first things I did was to check how far away Volare was from my hotel.  I have raved about this place since my first visit, 2 years ago.  As a half-Italian native NYer, I am an Italian food snob of epic proportions.  I have literally told everyone that goes to Chicago that they HAVE to eat here... it's hands down the best Italian food I've ever eaten (outside of home cooked Sunday meals, of course - Hi, Ma!) The Gnocci a la Vodka is melt-in-your-mouth delicious, and the portions are just right. It's my absolute favorite dish and it was perfection.  Volare is a solid 5 stars. If you don't visit when you come to Chicago, you're seriously missing out! Thanks again for a wonderful meal, Volare! I hope to see you again soon!

Regret not trying this place out sooner. It did not disappoint.  The good: -Great portion sizes- $4 for a house salad yields you a lot of greens. -The seafood appetizer (grigliata mista) was one of the best I've ever had. The seafood was so fresh and tender. Will definitely be ordering this again. -Salsiccia (Italian sausage) pizza was delicious and tastes just as good the next day.  -Gnocchi with vodka sauce was perfectly cooked and would definitely order again -We also ordered a custom-made salmon pasta. Salmon tasted fresh but probably wouldn't order salmon again. Their shrimp and scallops are better. The bad: -If you are ordering for delivery, make sure to ask for lemon with the grigliata mista appetizer.  Also, the second time we ordered this, it was still delicious but a little too charred and heavy on the oil. -Broccoli rabe was a bit too oily and very bitter.  I love my bitter greens but this was a bit much.

Gnocchi, how I love thee! I was introduced to Volare some years back and whenever I'm in that area of the city I try to make a stop. The service is superb and the food, well it's what keeps me coming back. I have had the ravioli and the gnocchi, both melt in your mouth. I will continue to return to this gem!

Volare is a quintessential neighborhood spot serving consistent, authentic old school Italian cuisine. Delicious! Bravo! It is a favorite of locals who live in the neighborhood - which is always a good sign. I question anybody who doesn't enjoy a meal here because I have been going sporadically for about 14 years and have never had a bad experience - except once on my birthday when I had to wait 45 min for a table when we had a reservation (before they expanded). The servers and Management are knowledgeable and attentive and the atmosphere is that of a very busy old school Italian restaurant - always lively. I love it. I love the bread service and their foccacia rocks. I also recommend the squid ink spaghetti with shrimp scallops and crab. The gnocchi with the vodka cream sauce (kill me); decadent melt in your mouth pillows of love. If you don't like it- I'm forced to question your sanity (wink). Highly recommend.
What an amazing service, excellent dinner.  This is the best Italian service I have by far ever experience. This restraint is a must.
Very nice ambience and great food. Had the gnocchi a la vodka (ricotta gnocchi!) and it was very good. Our server Pietro provided excellent service! Prices were not expensive.

The service here is impeccable. The food is good. The first time I came to Volare I had one of their specials and it was phenomenal. On this visit I had the chicken parmigiana off the standard menu which the waiter recommended. I thought it was very good but nothing special. Not a dish that would make me say it's the best Italian I've ever had. The menu seems a little limited for me, but I don't eat seafood, although one in our party got the seafood special and said it was amazing, and I don't eat veal which is also in a lot of the dishes here. Everyone else at the table loved their meals and we all had more than enough food. From my past experience, I know this place has truly amazing food, I just wouldn't say it's the chicken parmigiana.

An old school Italian Restaurant that was very accommodating.  Had a reservation and was seated right away.  Met the owner Benny who seated us.  Service was on point and the food was homemade and delicious. Enjoyed a Chicken Parmesan and Gnocchi dish that was outstanding.   House wine was great.  Good size portions so no room for dessert.  Enjoyed the meal and will definitely return when coming to Chicago.

Completely undercooked pasta. I'm talking there was still some CRUNCH to it. Wow. Amateur mistake! Told the manager, he offered me more food. I told him no bc I don't trust that they know what they are doing lol. Undercooked pasta that is still crunchy is pretty bad for the prices they charge. Will not be coming back.

Great gem in the city.  The place was busy, and they moved everyone through the wait.  I would recommend you make a reservation, otherwise you might wait.  The wait staff is busy, but they do a great job.  But sometimes we wanted something and they were so busy we felt a little neglected.  It took way too long to get the bill.  BUT that is not a big deal when you have a busy place with very good food. The food was fresh and hot and nice Italian dishes to choose from on the menu.  The prices were very reasonable.  I had a nice salad and risotto.   I would highly recommend this for good food, nice atmosphere and extremely reasonable.
The food is delicious and the service is great. I ordered the Volare salad and a half order of the squid ink pasta.

My husband and I dined here with a friend on Sunday night. We frequently order takeout or delivery from Volare, but this time we decided to dine in. We had a reservation at 8:15, well after peak hours for a Sunday dinner, and were seated within 10 minutes of our reservation time. We were observing Ramadan and were literally starving, not having eaten since 3:30 AM. We received our appetizers and beverages in a timely manner, but our friend did have to ask the wait staff to bring us the complimentary bread the first time. I would have expected it would automatically be served immediately after our water glasses were filled. Once we were done with the first batch of bread, the wait staff asked if we wanted more bread. We said yes because we were literally starving all day. However the next batch of bread didn't come until right before our main entrees came, which was pointless. Our main entrees took forever to arrive! I believe we placed our order around 8:30, and we didn't receive our entrees for at least an hour after our reservation time. We asked our waiter a couple of times for the status of our food. The restaurant was not busy at the time. In our section, less than half the tables were occupied while we were waiting for our main entrees. We ordered a couple of chicken parmesans and a margherita pizza, so nothing fancy. There was no explanation as to why there was such a delay. We have all dined at Volare before and the service was much quicker before.  Our friend was served his dish by a gentleman who appeared to be a manager because he was wearing a suit. The gentleman made a comment along the lines of "Did you think the chef wasn't going to feed you? Of course he was going to feed you!" and our friend took offense to that. We thought it was a very rude comment. Why wouldn't the chef feed us? We're paying for the food! This experience left a bad impression of the dine-in experience at Volare. I don't usually enjoy dining at Volare because the noise level is high, but I agreed to it on Sunday night because it wouldn't be as busy. We like the food at Volare because the pasta is handmade and very fresh, but there are also many other Italian restaurants in downtown Chicago with better service with similar food.  My husband and I used to dine at Volare for special occasions, but in 2014 they took his favorite dessert, the creme brulee, off the dessert menu, so we stopped dining at the restaurant regularly. Also in 2014, we had gone with some friends and ordered a seafood dish, and the shrimp was disgusting. I suppose it wasn't fresh, and being from Texas, I expect a certain quality of shrimp. This isn't a problem limited to only Volare in Chicago, as other downtown Chicago restaurants seem to have the same bad supply of shrimp, but I will never order any dish containing shrimp at Volare ever again. The cafeteria at my office has better quality shrimp! Also their meat sauces all contain pork, so I suppose if I want spaghetti with meat sauce, I will have to make it myself at home. That's unfortunate because I had been craving spaghetti with meat sauce, but I don't eat pork. Perhaps the service was slow because the restaurant wasn't busy and they weren't in a hurry to turn over tables. We don't plan to dine in at Volare again.

We recently made a road trip to Chicago for a weekend getaway. Of the various things we did one of the major highs was visiting Volare. Let's start at the front door where you are warmly greeted by about 3 different people... LOL Walked to our table which was balanced which is a pet peeve of mine wobbly tables that is. We were given some of the best breead to chew on with wonderful olive oil and parmesan cheese. My husband ordered the black spaghetti with seafood in a red sauce which he still declares is the best pasta he has ever had!!! I ordered the Seafood Carbonara which was superb!!! After finishing half of our plates we bravely ordered the obligatory Tiramisu with a 10 year tawny port. The dessert was awesome but he real surprise was the port! Anyway I can promise that this will not be the last time we visit VOLARE.

Great great food. Awesome ambiance--you get the full Goodfellas introduction with no less than TWO maitre des whisking everyone to their tables. The whole place is prideful in what they do...top notch service. Loud, hearty, cinematic. I'd recommend for a date or for an office party...

A most legitimate Italian restaurant experience. Amazing food selection. We tried most of the items in the menu given our large party. The Aioli pasta was amazing and so was the vodka sauce gnocchi. Veal limone and sea bass a must for those who shy away from pasta or need a secondo piato.  We even tried the pizza which was coupled phenomenally well with a glass of Brunello de Montalcino.  Friendly service you can only expect from Italians themselves. Bravissimo

My husband and I came to Volare for my birthday.  The service was great, Blanche did an amazing job and had many great suggestions. We met the owner Benny and he made us feel like family. I had the lamb chops and they were superb the best I have had! I would definitely recommend this restaurant!!

Yelp suggested this place for lunch and I'm so happy it did. Patio was open and it was nice so I sat outside. Started with bread good just no garlic, I had the squid ink seafood pasta omg it was so good and a huge serving for lunch, I finished it for dinner. Very good I would go back again.

We had a fantastic meal again! Service is outstanding - there is a very strong hands on approach by the management giving great care to detail.  This is without a doubt one of the best restaurants in Chicago.  On the last trip we went for traditional Italian food which was excellent.  This trip we tried two specials which were adventurous but amazing!
Nothing special about the menu. The pastas we ordered tasted alright. Tiramisu was very disappointing.

The sausage ravioli with sun-dried tomato special was one of the best pasta dishes I've ever had! We split a pomadoro salad, and it was excellent. My husband's veal medallions were tender and tasty! The service was friendly and attentive! Gotta go there!

As an avid lover of Italian food, this place was hard to pass up due to the popularity and raving reviews. The proximity to the red line didn't hurt either! The atmosphere can be interpreted as a little more on the fancy side from the dim lighting (I actually saw someone use their phone's flashlight to look at the menu) and numerous utensils for each place setting on the table. There was a great variety of different dishes (pasta, pizza, risotto, etc) that range from about $15-$30. Might seem a little pricy, but I can vouch that the quality is definitely up to par. And the portions are very filling as well. Both my friend and I got pasta dishes and they were both delicious! Not to mention, the bread that comes to the table is also very good as well! As for dessert, I tried the tiramisu and it had a slight coffee flavor, not as strong as it usually is, which I really liked.  The service was really great as well. Our waiter was very attentive to our table even when it got busy during the dinner rush, and my water was filled every time I was low (and I drink tons of water, so they were consistently coming to our table every time which I very much appreciated!).  Overall, I would definitely recommend this restaurant for a fancy meal with a friend or even a group of people.
The food was excellent.  Went there last year and back again this year while in Chicago.  Popular place even late on a Sunday night.   Would highly recommend.  Price is right and the food was great.

Ridiculously good.  Reasonably priced.  Exceptional service.  The overall experience is incredible.  I took my daughter here for her first REAL Italian meal.  She ordered a Caesar salad (that was the best Caesar I have ever tasted), the Black Pasta with scallops and shrimp, and the Chocolate truffle cake.  Real tears were shed- not kidding.  I had the pork chop special with apple sauce and asparagus- amazing!  I don't know how you do Italian much better than this.

Fantastic meal with fantastic service. Volare did a great job accommodating our group of 12 last week. We ordered a bunch of different appetizers, which were all fine. The main courses, though, were outstanding. I had the gnocchi alla vodka sauce. Some of the other dishes were the lamb, clams with linguini, and the seafood plate with octopus, squid, scallops, and shrimp. Delicious!! Another treat - the Italian Mule, which was essentially a Moscow Mule blended with lemoncello.

Utter garbage. Avoid avoid. Extremely rude waitstaff and the server spilled onto my friends shirt, no apology just returned with additional wet napkins. Ruined her shirt. Do not let them seat you anywhere near the kitchen. Also the food was bland and overcooked. For the amount of sauce that splattered across my friends lavender shirt, ruining it, her meal should have been comped since she is out an expensive shirt now. When asked to speak to a manager when leaving the gentlemen gave a huge eye roll and walked away from us. Nice customer service.

Really impress with this place! I was looking for lunch close to my hotel then this place popped up on yelp. I did not expect much when I saw it was almost empty, but I was wrong. I ordered Insalata Volare, mixed green with heart of palm. It was very refreshing and it had right amount of dressing. I ordered black ink spaghetti with seafood rose sauce. The dish came out piping hot. Pasta was cooked perfectly al dante. Seafood was cooked just right and the sauce was very delicious with ton of crab meat!!

Terrible experience. Made a reservation the night before and requested an outdoor table. Was told that was no problem. Arrived the next night for my reservation and was shown to an indoor table. I said no, I requested to sit outside. The manager said it would be a 10-15 minute wait. I went outside and saw that not a single table even had their main course out. Went back inside and asked the manager how confident he was about his 10-15 minutes. He said he didn't even see my name on the reservation list. He then showed me the list, I pointed to my name and the note next to it that said "outside" with two stars next to it. He said, "Sorry, we missed it." I then left. Don't make promises you can't keep. Don't quote me a wait time that's clearly wrong. Disappointing night to say the least.
We loved that place ! Perfect for lunch with kids. Nice entrees, taste was awesome. Good selection of wines too. We'll come back asap.
We ordered the Carpaccio, the frito misto and I got the black pasta. The food is great, ambience is reminiscent of Italy.
Great service and food. The pizza was really great especially when the waiter suggested an option that was not listed on the menu. Salmon was also very good.

When I go to Volare, I feel like I'm home. The food is delicious and always cooked to perfection. Plus, the staff is outstanding. They are warm, gracious, and welcoming. From the valets,Marcos and Raphael, to the man that is like an orchestra conductor, Benny.  He works non-stop with his excellent staff to keep the restaurant rolling like a well oiled machine.  If you want wonderful Italian food and want to be treated well, you need to go Volare. A true jewel in downtown Chicago.

Had at reservation at 7:30, got a table at 8:40 on an outside table in a cold spring night. Half our table was freezing the other boiling under a heat lamp. Then the service was extremely slow. Food was good but not worth the wait. In fairness, have been in the past and had a great experience. There's tons of good Italian restaurants in the city. We won't be back.
We were here again for a couple more times for both lunch and dinner. No restaurant weeks anymore but price was still very reasonable for the location, service, and food. Keep up the good work!

I was there a couple of weeks ago. I had the filet of beef - it was the best filet I had, all month, during my visit. The caprese salad was good, the chicken Parmesan was good, the only thing I didn't like was their version of vongole. Service, food, ambiance all great.

I'm so glad we found this Italian restaurant in downtown Chicago! I love the location and the ambient of the place and the food is so delicious. The staff is so nice however we've had a reservation and still had to wait 15min to be seated.. the portions are huge we couldn't finish it with hubby. Great place to have a bday or anniversary dinner or just a casual date night. Will be back!

I was at Volare in mid-April while in Chicago on business. When we arrived the host greeted us with a warm smile and seated us immediately. The waitress who came took our drink orders after giving her opinion on good wine pairings. We had gnochette with fish, Ricotta gnocchi and something spicy. Everything was delicious and we were given the option of having our foods served family style. Portions were huge and we had left overs to take with us. The owner was busing tables, keeping an eye on service and checking in with the patrons. It was a wonderful experience that I would love to repeat.

**** for the Caesar salad  ***** for meatballs ** grilled seafood (Grigliata Mista) maybe because my order was sitting in the car for so long, the texture was off  * for delivery. Promised to deliver in 45min-1 hour but I didn't get it until 1.5 hours later.  * for receptionist. They kept saying don't worry but I did worry. They could have called the delivery person but didn't until I called again to insist. I wanted to thank Benny's response on my review and will give it another shot next time I am in Chicago.

Simply phenomenal! Amazing food. Great drinks. Amazing staff. For an appetizer, I had the margarita pizza which was cooked to perfection. Then I had the gnocchi in the vodka sauce which was definitely one of the best pasta dishes I have ever had.  This is a MUST try if your in Chicago.

Came here while in town from NYC, and Volare did not disappoint! The food, atmosphere and service were top notch. We split a ravioli special as an appetizer rather than a main...I ordered the salmon and my husband had the chicken parm. Our server was fantastic! Would highly recommend if you are in town!

Best meal of our trip. The wait staff was fun and attentive but it was the food that almost brought us back the next night! We had both of the specials, pasta with truffle and ricotta and sea bass. We'll definitely be back anytime we're in Chicago!

I wish I could give this restaurant more than 5 stars, because it sure deserves them all!  Volare is an upscale restaurant not far from the Magnificent Mile and I never fail to eat here whenever I am in Chicago.  Not only does Volare deliver excellent service excellent, you will feel pampered and well taken care of.   The high quality of their dishes has been really consistent and has consolidated Volare as one of the best Italian restaurants in Chicago... With a Sardinian flair thanks to the owner Benny!  I highly recommend their appetizers, the Malloreddus alla Sarda and the pork Sardinian-style, which are made with fresh ingredients and taste like heaven!
Not a great experience. Tried Paella and it was not really good. Only thing i liked is the complimentary bread they gave. I would not recommend. One time try

Picked this place for its location and we're very glad we did.   You immediately feel welcome here - hostess and bartender was great even though it was beyond packed. We waited for our table less time than we were told at arrival. Great entrees for both, not sure you can go wrong here.

Over and over Volare delivers excellent food and service.  The bread, olive oil and cheese is great, we had a salad with prosciutto, buffalo mozz, tomatoes and beets. Excellent, simple, clean and delicious. We had the gnocchi vodka and a fusilli with a veal ragout sauce with a touch of cream.  I think their vodka sauce ranks top 3 in the city and is always consistently excellent.  The fusilli with veal ragout was meaty, but not too meaty for me.  It had a touch of cream, but definitely not too creamy.  Flavor was great and it was a hearty dish with plenty left over from both.  The sommelier saw us look at the wine list and came over immediately and helped us choose a bottle for us that we liked.  Our server and busboy/man didn't miss a beat.  This is one of the best old school italian places in the city and I'd recommend it to anyone.  In fact, the night before we went, a few guys from LA were asking where to get Italian and had heard of RPM and Quartino.  While I've never been to RPM but know it's very good, and have been to Quartino countless times and like it, I asked if they were looking for fancy italian, small plates italian or old school Chicago italian.  He said he wanted a big bowl of pasta, old school side, so I said they had to go to Volare then.  I hope they did and loved it!

I took my mom, daughter and her friend to Volare on a trip to Chicago. I will be returning on out next trip to Chicago. Service was excellent. Food was out of this world. I had the snapper and risotto special. Others with me had pizza, lasagne, ravioli, tiramisu. We all shared and everything was excellent. I highly recommend this restaurant.
Delicious food, although slightly pricey. The least expensive glass of wine was $8. Authentic atmosphere and classy service. Seems to host a crowd of 30+ year-olds.
Had dinner here and was very pleased with everything from the service to the quality of food. The corkage fee is a bit high for what we're used too ($25).
Chicken Parm was to die for!!! Great service, fantastic food! The Manager really took care of us.

My first time that I dined at Volare was in 2003. It was amazing. 14 years later in 2017, the flavors are as I remembered them. I ordered the gnocchi alla Vodka then and now. Awesome then, awesome now.  The staff was head over heels kind and accommodating. As we were waiting, the kitchen surprisingly brought a plate of pirouette cookie for the kids. You need it, you get it. Want it cooked a special way, a different sauce, pasta, or anything, you've got it. I will be returning to Volare the next time we are in Chicago for an evening meal. Memorable as always. Thank you Volare.

The food was quite good. It was packed with people on a Friday night but the service was AMAZING. Every wait staff was kind, courteous and very attentive. They accommodated my 81-year-old mother and her wheel chair. The heirloom tomato, beet, prosciutto and fresh mozzarella was wonderful. I highly recommend the gnocchi with vodka sauce.

Chicago, Illinois- This reservation hot spot is worth the why-am-I-waiting-when-I-made-a-reservation-yesterday wait. The multiple staff dashing from table to table made sure our beverages didn't fall below half full- what optimists. They shared specials as well as recommendations and were careful to inquire about allergies and dietary restrictions. I wanted something that wasn't on the menu- a simple alfredo sauce- and it was crafted in the open kitchen before my eyes and delivered hot and fresh. The homemade noodles and sauce were the best I've had. It's not often I polish off an en entire pasta dish. This was an exception.

I am so disappointed to write this review. My husband, my in laws and I all absolutely love this place. However, tonight was a less than stellar experience. Our waitress, I don't remember her name but she is blonde with thin hair and seems hyper and talks very fast. It was tonight 3/24 we sat across from the bar. Everything started off fine. They brought in a wine specialist to make sure we got the wine we wanted- he did great. We ordered our food. Soup salad and appetizer came. Then busser or whatever he was would come by and clear things but stick his hand right in our face while we were eating- it was so rude! Then the mains came out and they got my aunts meal wrong. The waitress kept arguing with my aunt on how my aunt did order what came out. I'm sorry but regardless you DO NOT argue with a customer. Suck it up, own it and just fix the problem. She continued to bring up the situation even once the correct dish was brought out. We could not believe  that she kept insisting that the first dish is what my aunt ordered. How awful!!! Then my aunt thought her meal was just ok but didn't say anything. She ate some but was full. The waitress came back and was like "oh you didn't like it" my aunt replied with it was fine and the waitress kept insisting that my aunt did not like her meal in a condescending way. It was very rude, unprofessional and I couldn't believe it was happening in such a nice place. I'm most disappointed because I raved about Volare and I feel like it was so disappointing for my mom and my aunt.

This place is always good. I'm really glad they expanded it and it doesn't seem to have lost any of its quality. The food is always fantastic and fresh then I enjoy the relaxed atmosphere. Many of the waiters there have been there for years and are just fantastic.
Outstanding service and even better food.  I had the black squid ink pasta with scallops cooked to perfection.   Will definitely come back when visiting Chicago.
Cool spot. Went on a Saturday night for take out. Pretty packed. Nice, Professional service. Had a couple pizzas and a drink in the bar. Would definitely go back for a date night

I visited Chicago for a conference and tried Volare. Great! They say that an Italian restaurant makes you feel like part of a big family, and Volare did so. Packed on a Wednesday night. The chicken cacciatore had a wide spectrum of flavors; took me back many years to my mother's cooking

You know you've found a good restaurant when you need a reservation on a Monday night at 8 PM. The place was crowded and fortunate for me I was alone so I was able to eat at the bar without waiting. The food was excellent. I had Spaghetti Neri Al Pesce, which was squid ink spaghetti with jumbo gulf shrimp and see scallops in a tomato cream sauce. This plate had good reviews and I was not disappointed.

I've taken clients here multiple times; however last time I went, I had a horrible experience. Made the reservations earlier in the week and arrived about 20 minutes prior just to be safe. Apparently there was a private party going on in the back area. I sat at the back bar which didn't seem like it was part of the party and wanted to order a drink while waiting. I was told that those seats were reserved for the party, yet no one was sitting down, they were all on the other side of the room talking. Ok, fine. So I got up and waited in the middle area, but 2 minutes later, some other gentlemen were seated there and told it's fine to sit there while they wait. Now, I don't play the race card, but I felt pretty discriminated. Maybe it was just a mix up, but the bartender saw me and should have said something when the floor manager said it was fine for them to sit there, when I had just been there. I'm not asking to be treated like a king, but at least say "sorry, the floor manager just made an exception, can I get you anything while you wait." Something. He said nothing. Like I said, I have brought multiple clients there for dinners and never had an issue, but the way they handled it was terrible and I felt not welcome. I won't be back. Lesson to management, every customer is important and should be treated with respect.
Food was awesome, but the service was meh.  Prices are really good and the portions are large.

Good food, decent service. But they don't tell you about "hidden" costs. The waitress offered spinach instead of mushrooms for my dad's salmon dish bc my mom thought my dad didn't like mushrooms (but he does). Dish came had mushrooms but also added spinach. Then the bill came and there was a charge for $5.00 of Spinach! Way overpriced! Also, we asked for some marinara sauce on the side for my moms gnocchi and they charged $2.00 for it. Most restaurants don't charge extra for that stuff. And I think the waitress should tell people when there are extra costs. I also went to this restaurant with a friend who got the "special" and it was $70!! Way more pricey than the rest of the menu and again I think they should've mentioned the price. There are times even with a reservation we have had to wait over an hour which is frustrating.

My wife and I were pleasantly suprised by the warmth and high quality service we received here. Before we could sit down and take off our jackets we were greeted by the waiter, given menus, and served bread. The food was great too. We got the li guine with clam, pomodor, and grilled octopus, and would order them again.

Usually, we love this place but the bread they sent us for delivery was a joke--a burnt, inedible hockey puck. Left a bad taste in my mouth (figuratively and literally).  It was a shame as the rest of the meal was quite good but, in my mind, it only takes one bad apple to ruin the bunch.   This poor excuse for bread from an Italian restaurant was inexcusable.   Who sends that out from their kitchen?

My coworkers and I were in Chicago for a weekend seminar.  The hotel recommended the restaurant and we happily complied.  The staff were super friendly and engaged with us promptly.  Our waitstaff complied with a special meal request and the kitchen staff came through. We all enjoyed our food and all left stuffed.  We would not hesitate to visit again.  The eggplant was great and the gnocchi delicious!

Top Notch Service - You Feel Like Family  I travel for work and one of my colleagues recommended I try Volare. I love Italian food and can be pretty picky about where I eat. However, from the first bite of handmade pasta I was hooked.  I fell in love with gnocchi again here...Volare makes incredible handmade pasta and delicious sauce. I'm always given the option to add meat to my meal so I opt for one of their flavorful meatballs.  Great Dishes: Ravioli di Ricotta and Gnocchi alla Vodka  In addition to the outstanding food, the service is wonderful. I eat alone when I travel but I never actually feel alone when I'm here. The staff is very friendly and attentive. The host is incredibly charismatic and he takes the time to learn something about you so when he sees you again there is a feeling of connection and familiarity. I always feel really special when I'm here.  10/10 would recommend. If you love Italian food this is the place for you.
We had a very nice meal.The food was tasty and fresh and great service.would go back for sure.Cant go wrong here

This place serves amazing food and has the most attentive service I have ever experienced. Water glass never hit half empty and the servers were so polite. Definitely the best Italian restaurant I've been to. Next time I am downtown, I will be back. Great place to take your date. Food is just i little pricy, but you get what you pay for, and that is amazing food. It is a little crowded tonight, but that is to be expected for a place as amazing as this.

I went last year for restaurant week with a party of 6. Everyone loved it. The food was amazing and the staff was really nice too. Went back this year again for restaurant week with a different party of 5 this time and they all really enjoyed it as well. Some of us did the restaurant week (which I thought was one of the best deals on the list) and the others ate from the regular menu. Our waiter (with a stereotypical Italian accent that did seem authentic too) was really great too!
Restaurant week sucks. Tiramisu super bad. Pasta salty as seasand. Beef tastes like brown paper.

As my second meal at this restaurant in 4 years, I was happy to find that the quality was still very good.  Service from the staff was outstanding too.  The house special salad was very tasty.  The veal parm was perfect.  The lasagna was full of flavor and we were told by the staff all of the pasta is fresh made every day.

Too bad they closed Lombard's location. I was a little disappointed. I came here with my girlfriends to celebrate my friend's birthday. We had a stubborn waiter. Stubborn meaning : we wanted to order some appetizers and 1 entrees at the same time but our waiter said we can't! (We weren't ready to place all our entrees yet but we were so hungry.) We asked the 2nd time requesting to put our appetizers and 1 entree. But he refused and said a bunch of things that doesn't make sense ! Anyways, food was awesome. We ordered black squid  ink pasta, mussels, gnocchi, seafood paella, and lasagna. Black squid ink pasta and seafood paella were my favorites. The flavors were on point !  I need to come back soon!

I visited as a redo after a failed dining experience elsewhere.  When I got here, I ordered a seafood risotto dish that was ok but really my bowl of fish.  However, the service here is over-the-top and my waitress and the manager of the restaurant took amazing care of me and brought me a seafood spaghetti dish that saved the day.  I would certainly return and recommend lovers of seafood and Italian food to try this place with the assurance that the restaurant staff simply will not let you fail to find something you can be pleased with.  I will return if time permits.

Incredible food every single time! I've been here for lunch and dinner many times throughout the years and it's always amazing. Huge portions at reasonable prices. Highly recommend for anyone visiting the area.

I come to Chicago once or twice a year and always eat here. The place is constantly busy but once seated you get great attention. The food is always good with large portions. Prices are very fair for such high quality and great service in a very desirable location. Bar drinks tend to be a heavy pour, so pace yourself.   My favorite Italian restaurant anywhere is the original Il Mulino in Greenwich Village, New York which is enormously expensive. This place is a good second, with a much less gut wrenching price tag.

Only halfway through our meal and already 5 stars. Had the grilled seafood appetizer and kale salad. Shared. And totally full. Great service. Great price point. Don't come here. There won't be room for us.
There is no better place than this for Italian and Bobbie the bartender is fantastic, everyone on staff and the owner are great! If you want the best plan to go to This RESTURANT!!!

Went to Volare restaurant last night for the first time but definitely not the last. This establishment defines the meaning of service and putting the customer first. From the moment we arrived we were treated with respect and catered to in a way that most should take a lesson from. The food arrived in a timely fashion and was absolutely delicious. I personally had a seafood medley and my compliments to the chef for absolute perfection. I am definitely not the type of person to blow smoke so when I give this caliber of review you can bank on having a wonderful experience. Looking forward to our next visit.

My brother, my cousin and I had planned on a dinner outing together and she picked Volare out of a few other, less traditional places we had in mind. We made a reservation for a Saturday at 5pm. Snagged some super convenient (albeit rare) parking nearby on Grand ave and hoofed it over to Volare. You can't miss the place from the street, it has a huge sign! The inside is perhaps a little smaller than it looks. It's got the classic white table cloths, a dark, dimly-lit atmosphere and a very nice Italian flare to it. We were charmingly greeted and shown to our table by a guy who I think was the owner.  I started with not a glass, but a "quartino" of house chianti. It was probably just under two full glasses, but only slightly more $ than a single glass; a good value. The chianti was perfecto! We started with an order of fried calamari. It was simple, just fried and served with a marinera sauce as well as a tomato-horseradish sauce. It was very good, but I've had better! For our entrees, we also kept it simple and just ordered one dinner each, suspecting the pastas would be a large portion, and we suspected correctly! My brother had gnocchi with vodka sauce, my cousin had the fish special of the evening, which was a fish similar to a sea bass over a spinach risotto with clams, and finally I had the well-known squid ink spaghetti with seafood. My brother's gnocchi was the textbook definition of perfect gnocchi. It was not potato gnocchi but rather ricotta based, which are far more rich. Couple this with an amazingly creamy vodka sauce, it was delizioso! My cousin was a little hesitant about what to get, and impulsively decided on the fish special after hearing our server explain it a couple times. It was a seabass-like fish (some kind of sole, maybe?) over a spinach risotto with cherry tomatoes and clams. I tried it and it was broiled perfectly, prepared simply (but nicely) and the risotto went well with it. My spaghetti neri al pesce I was also a little hesitant about, because while I enjoy seafood this was a lot of seafood in and on one plate. The dish surprised me though and wasn't nearly as fishy as I thought. The pasta was cooked perfectly al dente, the scallops and shrimp were great, and the crab blended right in. The sauce was incredibly rich and slightly acidic. I opted for some cannoli to-go. I thought they were good but I've had better. Our server's name was Fabio. He was great! Had a very thick Italian accent and made some thoughtful suggestions as well as got us everything we needed and checked up on us.  Overall our experience at Volare was fantastic. Can't think of anything that wasn't good, the service was on point, and the prices were appropriate for a restaurant with this high caliber of service and top quality food. It is more of a traditional Italian place, but everything is done perfectly.  Highly recommend. 5/5

Bustling neighborhood Italian place.   Excellent​ energy.  Great food.  Super fast, on point service.  If  I lived around the corner, I'd be here twice a week.  I had linguine with clams.  Large portion of fresh clans in the shell.  Cherrystone?  Lovely plate of comfort food. Wife had chicken parm.  Beautiful example of a classic dish.  Large portion. Nice, reasonably priced wine list.  We just ordered by the glass, but wide variety of choices to satisfy anyone.

Decided to try Volare after adventures at Navy Pier with my daughter. We were seated right away. The seating is alittle cramped but o well. It didn't bother us. Our waitress last night before close (I can't remember her name) was awesome. She checked on us periodically and assured us our entrees would be out momentarily. They were alittle busy. The food was phenomenal. My favorite part was the moscato and pear and cranberry bread pudding in a brandy sauce. Deliciousness! Will definitely be back.

Horrible service, went there for a birthday dinner, staff was very rushed and the food was mediocre for the price. Took 30 minutes to get the check and never mentioned anything about dessert? Tight space, interruptions and staff attentive to customers needs to be addressed. No mention of a birthday cake for the celebration, that was horrible, since i boasted to my friend how good the place was. With all the restaurants in Chicago go somewhere where the customer is appreciated and service / food is of better quality. would I go again, NOT
There is nothing I can say which others haven't already hit on. If you like delicious Italian food... Come here!

Sitting here right now, unhappy with their front organization. We made a reservation, showed up on time, had to wait 15 minutes to be seated. That would be OK, except 3 other couples were seated before us, all of whom showed up after us and 1 couple did not have a reservation and was told 15 to 20 minutes, then sat before us. Not a happy customer starting off. I hope it gets better. Update after eating: The food was really, really good. Bruschetta was delicious, caprese salad okay but not my favorite, our pastas were superb. Drinks were fabulous.  Our waiter, Paul S., was excellent.  The second part of the experience was definitely worth another trip, and a recommendation here and to friends, but I really hope they improve their hosting. It almost lost them our business, and almost cost us a delicious meal.

Came here with my family and it was kid friendly. Everyone in the staff was extremely great and our server Sarah was fantastic. We didn't have to ask for anything, she anticipated our every need. Food was terrific, very heavy meal but that is expected for Italian. This is why I rarely eat it, I go comatose afterwards.

Amazing Italian food!!! It was so good! My entire family loved it and that's saying a lot considering there is 9 of us and we all like different dishes!! We had the lasagna, rigatoni bolognese, Alfredo with angel hair pasta, the vodka gnocchi, the margarita pizza, bow tie salmon pasta, veal limone, veal parm, and Cesar salad. They were all AMAZING!!! Fresh and made to order, true traditional Italian food!! We also had canollis for desert and they were phenomenal too. I can not say enough wonderful things about this restaurant! On a side note, the rigatoni is definitely in the spicy side so if u don't like spicy then don't choose this one ツ

Excellent food. Great service. Great atmosphere. Very authentic Italian food. Pasta served perfectly al dente. Loved that the waiters were Italian. The linguine with clams was delicious! We'll be back for sure.

Homey, intimate, and authentic are all terms I would use to describe volare. Everything from the decor to food exuded old-school Italian warmth. We started with a couple cocktails and the calamari, then enjoyed a fantastic cabernet with our dinner. The fusilloni with veal ragu was surprisingly good, and my wife loved the burrata and filet with rosemary. What a gem volare is in this neighborhood, we will be back!
great serving sizes. classic old school chicago italian. not cheap

If you're looking for authentic Italian food, then you've come to the right place! Amazing food, great prices and awesome atmosphere. My boyfriend and I are from Boston, so we have some of the best Italian food around (The North End) but I have to say, this place may be one of the best Italian places I've eaten at. Now for food, I had the Ravioli di Ricotta and it was out of this world. He had the Spaghetti Neri al Pesce and he said it was absolutely delicious.  Bottom line, if you're looking for a classic Italian dinner then this is the place you've been searching for!

Really an incredible experience.  Setting under the atrium on a cold brisk day and the warmth of a smooth Italian coffee in hand. Great oasis from the work day, alone or with friends. The fresh prepared Mediterranean food is the icing on this place. Service is quick, friendly and attentive.
I loved this place. Some of Best calamari I have ever had. And really great marinara! Took my 12 year old son and he loved his pizza as well.

One of the few times I had not used Yelp to guide me to a restaurant when I'm on the road. In this particular case, it was combination of the afternoon temperature of 14 degrees and my hunger that caused me to stumble onto Volare. Being from Hawaii, I am not used to sub 60 degree whether so it probably had more to do with getting out of the cold that led me to this great spot.  Food: Even though I was pretty hungry I didn't want to have an overly large lunch as I was planning to have a great dinner on my last evening in town. Seated quickly at a high top, I had a few minutes to peruse what other Yelpers had to say about the offerings. I ended up going with a bowl of chowder and the Insalata Mediterranea. The soup and fresh bread really hit the spot in warming me up. The seafood salad was huge with large pieces of scallop, shrimp, calarmari, and octopus. The Octopus to me was what really stood out, cut in large rustic portions, grilled nicely, not chewy or tough, and with a wonderfully sweet flavor. There was lettuce under all that delicious grilled seafood..enough to provide some textural differences but the focus is squarely on the seafood. Service: I'd say pretty good service. It was lunch on a Thursday a little after 1 pm so while the restaurant wasn't packed, there was still a pretty decent sized lunch crowd. I was happy with the level of service and the dishes were timed pretty well. Atmosphere: Bustling Italian restaurant with a nice bar area, open kitchen with a pizza oven, it was a comfortable establishment for both small parties and large groups. Value: Pretty good value as my salad ($16) was  reasonably priced for the size and amount of seafood included. It was large enough to share with 3 or 4 people if ordered family style. Wish I could have tried more items but difficult to do when dining alone. Wide range of prices also available to fit many budgets. Overall: I was happy the cold drove me into Volare, I probably would have never found this gem if I my nose wasn't about to freeze off my face!  I'd love to return in the future to sample more of their offerings!

This restaurant could be really good if it stopped cutting corners. Two excellent fish entrees were marred by stale bread at the start of the meal and a stale cookie in the dessert sorbet. But since the place was full, I doubt they care. Service was good.

The food was good and especially the Tiramisu, delicious. The service though was disappointing. We were a group of 10 and the servers were in a terrible hurry at all times, whether it was placing the order or clearing the table after we'd paid. I wouldn't come here again, and especially not in a large group.

This place was amazing! I suggested another Italian restaurant but my colleagues selected this and boy am I glad they did. Our hostess recommend the gnocchi vodka with the caramelized ground sausage and WOW it was amazing. Coworkers had the seafood spaghetti with squid ink which was amazing. Will be going back next year.

Holy cow this is place is amazing.  We were looking for a place to eat near our hotel and found this gem of a restaurant.  IT was hopping!!  You can see the kitchen and see the type of care they put into the food.  We ordered the seafood pasta with red sauce...I know I forgot the Italian name . But it was amazing.  We also got pasta bolognaise for the children and they really enjoyed it.  Especially our picky eating children.  I cannot wait to go here again and it will be a must visit next time  I go to Chicago.  Also, the prices were very reasonable and the staff were incredibly polite and attentive.

My favorite old school Italian restaurant. Every meal here has been delicious. These guys are not pretending. Prices are completely reasonable.  Today: Caesar salad, prepared as it should be with strips of anchovy, sliced (not grated) fresh parmigiana. Gnocchi with arrabiata, which is not on menu but server did not skip a beat when ordered. Gnocchi of perfect texture and blend of flour and potato. Arrabiata was a perfect temperament of anger, red pepper and garlic in the right mixture, and served piping hot.  Viva Volare!

This restaurant was a huge surprise for us! We had a group of 6 and we could not get a table anywhere else that did not have a wait for 4 hours, but we called Volare and they could seat us in 45 minutes so we rushed there.  The waiting area was PACKED with people and it was kind of awkward standing up against people who were seated trying to enjoy their meal, but after reading other people's reviews, it seems like this place is always packed and cramped.   We were seated pretty quickly and the atmosphere of the restaurant was so cozy and warm. It felt like we were eating in someone's formal dining room in their house. The service was also very warm and friendly.  Food: DELICIOUS!!  - Bread: very good! There was one that had garlic on it and one that was plain - Calamari: crispy, large portion - Spaghetti Neri al Pesce - black spaghetti with shrimp, lump crab, scallops tossed in a creamy rose sauce - HEAVENLY!!  Super flavorful and they did not skimp on the seafood! Large shrimp and scallops and the lumb crab was mixed in with the sauce.  I took a photo of this, but the photo does not do it justice at all. This is a great place to go to for date night, or even a group event - just understand that it gets pretty busy!

This is an excellent option for Italian food if you are in the area. It's definitely a touristy spot because it is close to Navy Pier, but I would say it's an authentic Italian cuisine. Every dish I've had here here has been pretty solid. The ravioli, chicken parm, and pasta dishes have all been delicious. It is a cozy restaurant, maybe a little cramped in my opinion. The service has always been fantastic. Very prompt and informative on the menu. Italian restaurants are a dime a dozen in Chicago, but I do think Volare hold their own!

I'll preface my review by saying that although I like pizza a lot, Italian food is generally not my favorite cuisine. I can take it or leave it and be fine. I have eaten at Italian restaurants that blew me away though, but this one didn't do much for me. That said, if you love Italian food you will probably enjoy this place. On to the food...my friend and I came here a couple weeks ago. I ordered the ravioli, which was good, albeit pretty heavy, and my friend ordered the squid ink pasta with seafood. He seemed to love it and ate the whole thing. I tried a bite and the squid ink flavor was too overpowering for me personally. We split 1/2 a bottle of wine that was good and the server was good about pouring that for us. Our waiter was a bit odd and didn't seem to understand our simple orders for some reason. I do like how you can get 1/2 orders of some of the dishes and of course that the pasta is freshly made. I do not like how most of the sauces are cream-based and nothing on the menu really stood out to me. Also the ambience of this place feels a bit stuffy and old school. I'd come back but not anytime soon.
Definitely full points Italian food. Never disappointed by any course here. Tiramisu is perfect as well.

This place is my GO TO Italian restaurant when I visit Chicago, This is coming from a full blooded Italian by the way. Everything at Volare Ristorante is made from the heart and is exceptional once the food hits your palate. I can tell the restaurant try's hard to give you that Authentic Italian experience. In my opinion this place definetly delivers! Their owner Jonny is a great guy! who's always there when I come and is ready to meet you at the door. You don't see many owners do that now a days. A lot of the pasta's and the sauce's are homemade and the design your own antipasto is an extra wink on the menu! I love coming here because they treat you with traditional Italian hospitality! Just writing this review I can't wait for the next time I can come here with my dad. Its very rare for me to say someone else makes better minestrone soup then my mom shhhh!! lol this place is great! First Class! Led Zeppelin

Absolutely amazing place! I travel a lot and often eat alone- and that is when you can really see true service. Despite restaurant being full- my server remained fully attentive and considerate. He even gave me a recommendation for a jazz bar! Service was top notch all around!  And food is perfect!! I had seafood pasta a special for the night and a glass of perfect wine. Overall amazing experience!!
Had an excellent meal with my daughter and her roommate from college.  The gnocchi and risotto dishes were excellent.

The food is fairly good. The bruschetta in particular was very well done and fresh, they definitely served it almost immediately upon putting the tomatoes et al on top there was no sogginess there. The clam chowder was also really good, more spiced and not as thick as classic clam chowder but definitely much better for it. The mains were alright, the whitefish + prawns was quite solid, the black spaghetti with shrimp and scallops was unremarkable, the flavors were a bit muddled and every thing in a bite seemed to have the same texture. At the end of the meal I asked for a to go box for the remaining food, and it simply never came. We were handed the check and I asked if the box of leftovers was still coming, the waiter said he wasn't sure and he'd check with the bus boy that took the plate. When the waiter came back to take the credit card he didn't mention it, nor when he returned after running the card. I figured it was already thrown out at that point, and I wasn't too torn up about it, but not even getting a response when just 'He didn't hear you' would have sufficed was definitely a service failure. All in all, pretty good food. For being in River North the prices are pretty standard. You could probably do worse, and probably better.

Favorite Italian Restaurant in the city!  Gnocchi alla Vodka Sauce add crumbled sausage is a must.  Blackened seafood spaghetti is a close second.  You can never go wrong with the Chef's special.  Old school vibes, with beautiful decor make you feel like you're in Italy.

We were looking for a restaurant to accommodate a large party for a team dinner the day before.  After attempting to make several calls and researching places online and having no luck, we called Volare.  The service was wonderful, and the food was delicious.  I would highly recommend Volare if you are looking for a classic "home style" Italian restaurant with good food and attentive service.

Get the salmon. Somehow this place is able to cook it to absolute perfection. So much so, that I came back and ordered it again while I was in Chicago. My friend had linguine and clams which she said was delicious (along with the bread they bring to the table - I don't eat gluten...) I recommend the rapini side.  Their house salad is simple and delicious, in a great dressing. They have great wines to choose from and a bar to sit and eat at, if you don't want to wait for a table. I recommend getting a reservation if you plan on going here for dinner, otherwise you will wait. All of the staff were very friendly, making our overall experience a great one!
Best Italian food in Chicago (thats saying something!). Great service and food. 1st class operation. Love the oso bucco, rissoto and grigliata mista.

This place was honestly one of the best Italian restaurants I've been to in the city. Everything they make has incredible flavor and is worth every penny you spend. The staff is very knowledgeable and always attenti

Made reservations for 8pm initially and moved them up to 7 without any issues. The waitress we had was super helpful (we were vegetarian) and she gave us many options and even a build your own. We ordered the gnocci, pizza, and spinach fettucini. All were delicious! Personally, my favorites were the gnocci and the pizza. The pizza was made in a brick oven and was slightly crispy but then the crust was just the perfect amount of doughy. The gnocci was amazing. It was clearly made from fresh ingredients and melted in your mouth. The vodka sauce was also incredible. The service was great...very quick and super nice staff. Also, lovely atmosphere! Would definitely recommend this restaurant.

Very delicious food! I ordered takeout while in town for the weekend and the Ricotta stuffed ravioli was absolutely wonderful. The seafood Presco was good but almost like it was missing something. I still enjoyed both dishes and would highly recommend it. Next time I'm in town I will be dining in!

I love Volare...every time we've visited this restaurant it's been a complete home run.  Great food, reasonable prices, wonderful hospitality!  We've dined here many times over the years, sometimes just the two of us, sometimes with a larger family group and the quality of our experience has always been the same - just terrific.  Thank you to the entire Volare team! Volare gets very crowded (everyone knows it's the place to go for a great meal!), so I highly recommend making reservations (even if it's just two).  And it can be somewhat noisy, because it's crowded.  So it's not the place to go for an intimate, quiet evening.  But it's worth it, well worth braving the crowds and noise, to have such terrific food and service!

Very busy place.  To be seated right away you have to make a reservation first or you will have to wait at least 30 min or more depending on crowd but it worst to wait if you want to have a good Italian food. I really loved  everything starting from the bread finishing with guy who was a bus boy ,he was so caring and helpful. Stuff is super friendly,service was fast ,prices are fair for what you are getting .I really enjoyed everything. I will be back for sure :)

I've had this one on the bookmark list for quite some time. When some Italian friends were coming into town I immediately suggested Volare for dinner. This place was packed when we arrived at 7 PM on a Friday night -- I definitely recommend making a reservation! Like Nicole W said, Volare is legit! We spoke some Italian with our wonderful, prompt, and sweet waitress. She gave excellent recommendations and our party of 6 shared calamari and a burrata appetizer. Everyone loved their dishes which spanned from fresh gnocchi, a pork dish, a pasta special with salmon, and short ribs. I had the Spaghetti Neri al Pesce, which was massive and delightful! Great food, great company, great service. I also recommend the Bellini; I know I really loved that! ;)

It was a pretty good Italian restaurant overall. There were only two things I think can be better. First, the bread was just ordinary, which can have more flavor or at least be warmer. Secondly, the penne I had today was a little too hard. I personally like well-boiled and soft pasta. Anyway, I would recommend friends to go there.

Old school Italian restaurant, done well. The pastas were good, we had the spaghetti with grilled chicken, and the ravioli. The grilled octopus, calamari, scallop, and shrimper appetizer was also good, fresh tasting. Service was excellent and very friendly. You know what you're getting when you go there, and it's Italian comfort food. Good job, Volare.

This place, what a gem.  I was asked to go here and wasn't sure what to expect as I personally had never even heard the name before.  How have I not been here?  and when do I get to go back?  Its cute.  Its busy, kinda cramped, but its fun and cozy.  Its a mix of a ton of people that are regulars and then apparently people with good friends that are letting them in on the secret of how good this place is.  On to the food...shall we?  The caesar salad, the caprese con bufala...both YES PLEASE.  Grigliata Mista was excellent.  The flavor and texture of this mix was perfect.  As for the mains, the salmon was perfect.  Cooked to perfection.  Juicy.  Flaky. Come on.  We also ordered a pasta dish.  It had the perfect kick to it and was cooked to perfection as well.  All of this was accompanied by lots of Pinot.  Volare, so pleased to have made your acquaintance.  XX

We just got done eating here and this place was amazing!  Our waiter Paul was great and very accommodating. He made an item that wasn't even on the menu, and turned out amazing. Definitely worth a visit and don't forget their tiramisu.

Came here Sunday night. Service was great, very attentive. The food was good- I got the lasagna, which tasted great, although the massive amount of cheese topping it made it feel a bit pizza-y, and I wish there was more tomato sauce inside it. Overall I enjoyed it very much. The wine selection here is good. A little more on the expensive side, but reasonable for the experience.
This place has it all: great food, great drinks, great service, not noisy, and reasonable prices for the quality of the food and service.

2.5 stars for this very average Italian food restaurant. It must be on the tourist cattle run, we were the only native Chicagoans. The rest were loud tourists and suburbanites, with loud bratty kids. THe food,,,,,,,,heavily salted and Italian by name only,,,,,,Salmon with pineapple???? I didn't know they have pineapple in Italy! Service,,,,,the pushy waitress prematurely came to take our order three times; trying to get us out of there as quick as possible. When we told here we weren't ready to order yet, the fourth time, she hovered over us until we did.  If you want authentic Italian, there are lots of better places than Volare. I'd skip this one.

Although a bit touristy, Volare delivers on authentic Italian food.  I came two nights before the Chicago Marathon, so the restaurant was definitely packed. We got an 8:30pm reservation, but, like many other patrons who probably had an 8:30pm reservation, we were not seated until 9pm and had to wait in an awkward ramp way between two parts of the restaurant. So, I wasn't really feeling pleased. Once we finally got a seat in the heated outside area, I calmed down a bit and started to pack my face with the bread. Good bread and good olive oil. My hanger subsided a bit. Since it was before the big race, I wanted to keep it easy, and they had the perfect dish for me:  Spaghetti al Pomodoro Fresco ($17, spaghetti with fresh tomato sauce and basil in olive oil topped with ricotta). The dish was big and had fresh ingredients - though I definitely feel like I've had fresher pasta in my day. Nonetheless, it did the trick.  Definitely has a bit of charm, and there is something for everyone on the menu.

We had a reservation for 8:30 and were not seated until around 9pm. Though, it was a Saturday evening. Once we were seated the service was prompt. The server offered his honest opinion on whether a half pasta dish serving was worth the extra couple dollars. The maple glazed salmon was very delicious. The Gnocchi served with vodka sauce is thick and tender, also very good.

If you follow my reviews, you know I'm Italian. Volare is like being at my aunt's house for Christmas. It. Is. loud. But also friendly and familial.
