And you may have to do a little bit of dancing, just to avoid bumping into people. You'll also wait a long time to find somewhere to sit down and eat, even if you have a reservation. Reservation here means you've reserved the right to wait.  Food is legit, although I didn't love my fussiloni ragu. Too many peas for my palate. It was however very filling. So filling that I couldn't try dessert. If this were truly like my aunts house I could sit a while to digest to think about dessert. With the long lines however, I left after dinner.

I posted a few years back and wanted to post again to say how much we LOVE Volare. We go at least every other week. Pasta, veal, minestrone, fabulous salads and nightly specials. Wonderful service. Always hot. Excellent prices for the city. Go Go Go!

I loved the old neighborhood charm of this restaurant. The staff greeted regular customers like family (or maybe they actually were family). Service was good except we were not seated until 20 minutes after our reservation time. The hostess, bartender, and our waiter each independently recommended the black spaghetti with calamari, scallops, and shrimp in a red cream sauce (Spaghetti Neri al Pesce). I thought the food was very good, but not spectacular.  Appetizers and pastas can be ordered as half portions. We thought this was a great idea. The half portions were plenty of food, and as an example my wife could not finish her entree.

nicely tucked away in river north, the environment is good, it can get a bit loud when there are a lot of people dining. our server is great, despite the heavy traffic, she still came by often to make sure we were doing ok the food is great, i got the spaghetti neri with seafood, the sauce is very tasty with chunky crab meat in there and the spaghetti itself is very good too, i also like how they have a lot of scallops and shrimps on top

I have been here twice (once to celebrate my moms birthday and another to just bring my girlfriend).  Both times were fantastic!  Between all of us, I think we have tried 4 different dishes, and every single one has been delicious and definitely worth getting!   If you are in the mood for some real italian foods, or even a good steak, this place is the place to check out for sure!  If you are going later at night, consider getting a reservation.

Nice white table cloth restaurant, but it's in a touristy spot so expect a lot of shorts and sneakers. The pastas are good and the pizza is excellent. Service is good too. I just feel like the clientele brings down an otherwise elegant place, but that is in no means an affront to the restaurant itself.

I have Italian in my blood line, and my first job in high school was being a hostess at the best Italian restaurant where I grew up. Needless to say; I know good Italian food. I really, really enjoy Volare's menu. The only reason I am rating 4 stars is because on my last delivery there was a small bone in my chicken, but no biggie. The portions are nice, and I usually have lunch/dinner for the next day. The prices are maybe a little high, but if you want good food it comes at a cost. I also like that you can phone in a delivery order; in my experience a lot of restaurants say "you have to order on grub hub or post mates." I've only eaten at the restaurant a few times and it was busy etc. but the service and dinner was super! Baci to Volare!

Great food, service,  and atmosphere.   My mom and I ate here today for the first time.   I ordered lasagna and my mom had the lamb chops.  Both dishes were delicious and cooked perfectly.  The waitress was available when needed and explained menu items.  On top of the great experience, it was raining when we left and we were given an umbrella!

Great experience, atmosphere, food, and waitstaff! After spending a day at Wrigley field, I felt I'd had enough to eat and drink for the day - planned on getting soup and salad... then along came our server, Blanch...great personality and knowledge of the good and drink menu - her enthusiasm, love of food and drink, and  descriptions of the featured dinners changed my mind- I ended up ordering the seafood feature and it was amazing- along with the house white wine Via Volare. I could not eat it all but would have been disappointed had I not ordered it-this is one of my favorite places to eat Italian in Chicago, with the option of indoor or al fresco dining. Blanch certainly enhance our dining experience! Will return ... again .. and again ...salud!

Went last night. The owner seems to have a lot of connections with the locals, but didn't pay any attention to other tables. Also, our seafood pasta had shells in it. The menu described the pasta as having lump crab meat - which was really pureed. When I mentioned it to staff they said they knew about it....as if this was how it was supposed to be served?!?!?! The scallops were yummy and the black pasta was tasty, but the shells were such a turn off.
Great italian wine and really good service. However wasn't impressedwith the food. Their bread, calamari and fruiti de marre (not on menu) wasn't the best.

Not our best experience!  We were there on a Sunday night and the server indicated that the kitchen was "overwhelmed" after waiting 40 minutes for meal.  Ambience wAs average and very, very noisy.  With so many great restaurants in Chicago, will probably not return.
The pasta here is awesome. I really enjoyed the spinach fettuccine with bolognese sauce, and the lasagna was also great. Takeout can be a bit slow, but it is worth it

Awesome! I usually test an Italian restaurant based on their basic dishes then get creative with the 2nd/3rd time. Went with the chicken parm with pasta and  sautéed spinach. It was incredible! Sauce was perfect. Highly recommend this place. Couldn't get a reservation so ate at the bar. Met some great people who just got back from the Cubs game. Service was great too.

A very busy excellent restaurant, offering old world Italian charm. Excellent food, service, and, atmosphere. They offer both inside and out dining. The staff is most attentive and professional. This is a favorite of locals as well as visitors to Chicago. The menu is extensive, featuring steaks, seafood, fresh homemade pasta, and, salads. We had their octopus, calamari, shrimp appetizer, which was excellent. We had there fresh pastas, including there gnocchi in a vodka cream sauce, and, there ravioli. Both were excellent and well prepared. The offer a full bar and an extensive wine list (both bottle and by the glass). This was a new find for us, and, will definitely return on our next visit to Chicago..

Your basic Italian restaurant in Chicago. Traditional dishes are good, entree sizes are fair for the price. Wine selection and desserts are delightful. Don't expect a slow paced, leisurely meal with friends or loved ones. They turn tables quick and want you to move though your meal at a fast clip.

Would give this restaurant 5 stars but our server made our experience pretty stiff from beginning to end. With some improvement in this area this experince can be a winner. We'll come back to that. The covered patio seating is welcoming on a cool evening although the white linen tables inside are not a step down. Equal opportunity ambiance. Hostesses young but in control of this busy place and management constantly roving about, in tune with the pulse of each table. It is their observation and the attentiveness of the neighboring server Robbie that helped us to laugh and smile in between stiff interactions with our assigned server. Our Warm Kale Salad was divine. With bits of pancetta, pine nuts, cece beans, white beans and more. Unfortunately, our entrees came within minutes of the salad causing our food to be set on the side of the table. A manager did eventually observe this and took them back.  This brings me back to the server. From the start he pressured us to make decisions quickly coming back to our table twice although our menus were still up.  When I ordered the Black Spaghetti with seafood. He asked if I've ever had it? Did I know what Black Spaghetti is? A little practice on how to suggestively sell and inform guest without insulting them, I think is in order. My husband's Lasagne was meaty, cheesy and large. Yum-my! The Black Spaghetti was delicious, scallops perfectly tender although the shrimp a little tough. Thanks to Robbie we could order a glass of wine through her. As our server didn't have a habit of checking on us. Wasn't even aware of the many meals that came at once. Or maybe he rang them up that way? The Goat Cheese Cake can be enjoyed by even non goat cheese lovers. Hair in our Lemoncello could have been exchanged but once again our server wasn't aware of it.  Thanks again Robbie, for allowing us to catch her as she served other tables.

Hidden on the edge of an interesting location on the North side of the river, the inside changes into a high end pleasant experience.  Most of us ordered the house special linguine with mushroom and tomato sauce.  The short rib is excellent.  The black spaghetti is surprisingly good with an unexpected twist.  The sea bass is well done with a side of potato and broccoli. Our server was the best I've had.  You can't go wrong with your choice on the menu.  They keep you well attended and comfortable during your stay. We will come again.

We started with Beef Carpaccio, a favorite of mine, and our friends at Volare did not disappoint.  It was excellent, the mustard sauce....SO GOOD! I usually like a mustard sauce with my Carpaccio but rarely does it stand out and make the dish. Light with plenty of caper bite.  When I asked our very attentive and "authentic" (as called himself) Italian waiter what I should order he took away my menu and said "You will have the Osso Bucco." Bold move.  I did have the Osso, it was fantastic, the wine and cocktail selection was also very good.

Went here for a anniversary dinner with my fiancé. We made reservations for 8:00 and did not get seated until after 8:30. So be prepared to wait on a weekend and don't let it ruin the night. I ordered us a bottle of champagne and the Grigliata Mista as an appetizer. The menu said it consisted of scallops, shrimp and octopus. The plate had mostly octopus with a few random shrimp and scallops. Tasted great but be forewarned.  For dinner my fiancé ordered the gnocchi bolognese and I ordered the fettuccini with lamb meatball special. My dish was incredible. I rarely enjoy white sauce in pasta, but this dish was more of an oil base rather than a cream which hit my pallet perfectly. The lamb meatballs were a nice change of pace plentiful on the plate. My fiancé's gnocchi bolognese tasted great. Easily one of the best we have had. Antico Posto in Oak Brook is still our favorite gnocchi by far with their ricotta base. This was one of the factors in our four star review. Overall if you are looking for a great romantic dinner in downtown Chicago that won't break the bank, this is a fabulous option.

Not sure what happened with us but kinda disappointed... Due to the stellar reviews here on my fave app, my boyfriend and I chose to try Volare instead of going to one of our usual Italian spots. I actually work on Michigan Avenue and always see it packed so I've been curious any way about the food.  Perhaps it's because we just took a trip to Rome but I wasn't impressed with the food here. Or maybe I didn't get the same chef that everyone else who had a great experience had. Or maybe we ordered the wrong things. Yes the portions are generous, but I would hope so for these prices. We ordered a meat plate ($14), Vongole al Forno ($14) and the Fusilloni al Ragu di Vitello ($20) and Spaghetti Neri al Pesce ($24). We also ordered a piece of Tiramisu to go since everyone raved about that (even those like Alex A. who hated everything else). Pictures are below. Pasta was super saucy and salty but no depth of favor. The Fusilloni was like a mushroom stroganoff and the black spaghetti was just that. Black colored spaghetti with seafood.  I am giving 3 stars because our server was nice. Not awesome. Just nice. Also for the generous portions. I hate when food is expensive and you're still hungry. That won't be the case here at Volare. You just will probably be super thirsty from the excess salt and still have a craving for pasta because this place didn't hit the spot.

My husband and I went to celebrate our first wedding anniversary.  The food was amazing! I love that they offer half orders because a full order would have been too much for us to eat. The bread was great and the servers were on their a-game with refills.  Also, I liked the fact you can order food from the bar if you want.  The only thing that would have made the experience a "5-star" rating would be if the server we had would have been more interactive with us.  Overall great experience.  We will be back when we visit Chicago!
Loved it! The meals were all homemade and made to order. Simply Delish! will be back!
The food here is amazing! Perhaps the best Italian food in Chicago. It is super noisy and the tables are close together but if you want a great Italian meal, you can't go wrong here.

Located in a quite side street off north Michigan, this Italian restaurant is conveniently located. I came to this restaurant upon reading Yelp reviews and for the most part, it has lived up to the comments. We ordered the fried calamari which came very quickly and was decent. Served with a tomato and seafood sauce, the dish was nothing special to write home about. The skin was nice and crispy and very traditional.  For the main, we ordered the special pasta which was a seafood linguine with clams, mussels, scallops, shrimp and calamari in a spicy tomato sauce. The sauce was fabulous, the scallop and shrimp were great. The pasta, however, was not fresh as I thought it would have been after reading some Yelp reviews. So that was a bit disappointing.  Portions were nice and big and we had to take both of our dishes home. The staff were very friendly and attentive from the moment we stepped into the restaurant.  I would recommend this place for a family affair or a quick dinner out with friends.

Good was good but expected a little more flavors but the employees were great. We went during lunch and it was not busy at all.  Service was great  Person who ordered the veal and meatballs really enjoyed their meal  Gnocchi need a little more flavor but not bad Chicken was tender the spaghetti was lacking flavor  Lasagna I was told was delicious

Came here with some coworkers and had the paella (I know right, strange choice for an italian place but it caught my eye). It was a tasty italian-ized version of paella. Coworkers enjoyed the pasta they ordered. It was a bit loud, but the service was great. Probably will be back at some point!

Alright, a million places in Chicago to choose to eat Italian right???  But, go out of your way to choose this place.  A simple dish like Spaghetti Caprese....most places screw this up with not fresh ingredients, or overdone spices, or flat out bland nothing special spaghetti!!  Not here!!!  Out of this world great flavor, fresh ingredients, perfectly done.  Their Rapini, spectacular.  The Olive oil they choose to use is wonderful. The perfect amount of red pepper, garlic (take in mind I love garlic).  Their meatballs in all honesty I would say are very good, but in my opinion, missing something. Meatball get 4 stars.  But, Next to my favorite Italian restaurant (in NY), I do believe Volare is right there!  If your favorite Italian restaurant is Olive Garden, pass on this place then...your head might explode when you taste what real quality fresh Italian food is!!!!

Please.  This place had me excited when I read the reviews.  Then completely disappointed when I was there.  Good was lacking and way too salty to start. It was a late-ish dinner (8.30)and a small party of 2.  Seating was more than available, which was surprising for a place with such high rating.  That should have been my first warning to get out. Seated and ordered.  Took 15 minutes for bread, another 10 for balsamic vinegar, and parm never came.  Kinda sad when basics aren't available, but maybe too spoiled from nyc area. Ordered the hot octopus app (don't remember the full name) which was the best thing we got.  Only reason I didn't give this place 1 star.  Also got the rigatoni, which was so salty.  We were too tired to complain, so we mentioned it to our waitress instead of having it sent back.  Instead of appreciating the comment, she chose to treat us like crap afterwards.  Should have actually returned the food with such bad service (now really knowing to get out).  Also got the mussels, which were way too oily and way too much garlic.  At one point, I forgot it was mussels and not rubber in garlic sauce.   We then got the check (which came out the fastest) and paid with normal 18% tip.  Not worth it.  Definitely not coming back.

I am sad I live in Hawaii in times I want good Italian food. This place is as good as it gets in every way Italian. From customer service to the food itself... amazing. My mouth is watering now just thinking about it!

This was the restaurant of choice to close out a weekend filled with great food and drinks. We saved the best for last!  The vibe was definitely different than the other establishments we had visited over the weekend.  Old school rustic Italian charm is abundant! The wine was great ( I got the Chianti) and the food was top notch. They offer half portions of all the pasta dishes, which is perfect!  I ordered the gnocchi in vodka sauce.  The half portion was the perfect size, after starting with a small salad.  The gnocchi was incredible.  Doughy and rich, a perfect accompaniment to the wine.  The service was great as well.  Don't skip this place!

Very traditional Italian restaurant that was fantastic. To start they have a great wine list that comes with a sommelier who was very helpful.  The menu is awesome so many choices it's tough to decide.  We each started the Volare salad which was delicious. She had the beef carpaccio that she said was to die for.  I had the spinach linguine w Bolognese sauce with homemade pasta, yum.  I can't imagine after all that having another entree but they many off 2nd entrees that also looked great.  They have a nice outdoor dining area & the service was excellent.  If you're looking for a traditionAl top notch Italian restaurant  look no further.

I was underwhelmed by my lunch here. Was craving some tasty Italian food and stopped by at opening time (11:30am). Had a bowl of Spaghetti al Pomodoro Fresco (fresh tomato sauce with basil and ricotta). It was so boring/flat. Even with chillies and fresh Parmesan. The garlic bread was almost burnt and low on garlic and my side of meatballs were sad. My friend didn't enjoy her lasagna either. Should have gone back to RPM. Tourist trap IMO.
Excellent place for large party or small.  Kitchen is open and looks great.  I ordered seabass and my friend ordered stake.  Both were amazing.

Went for dinner on Sunday. Food was good. We had what seemed to be popular dishes- seafood pasta with Squid Ink pasta and Chicken Parm. Meatballs are very good. Friendly, loud, and, fun Italian restaurant.

We had a table on the patio, and you can't beat it.  The service was fantastic, Dov was attentive, patient, and lovely to our table.  The watermelon salad was spectacular for the summer.  Top notch spot.

So very amazing! The food was delicious, fresh, and flavorful. The service was spot on and helpful. She made great recommendations and brought us a dessert plate that was to die for! The outside seating on a breezy night was just the thing in a hot summer night..
We love Volare!!  Every time we go, we enjoy the atmosphere, the incredible service, and the outstanding food!!  Highly recommend but make sure you make reservations!!

I was visiting Chicago with my family and a guy i met in a elevator told me to go try valore (I should have known better). Im a big foody so i decided to try it out. It was horrible. I got the ravioli cuz that was the waitress suggestion but it was really blend. No flavor. I would not go back to that restaurant.

Memorable! Great Italian food. Lemon veal so tender. Mussels nicely done in red sauce. Bustling atmosphere. Appies, main and bottle of wine in and out in over an hour - just in time to catch fireworks at Navy Pier. Not a lingering romantic spot
The best Italian food I've ever eaten. Impeccable service. The wait staff get pleasure from your enjoyment of eating their wonderful food.
Favorite Italian place to go when we're in town.  We've been there many times and always leave happy!

Absolutely amazing food and service. Hospitality and ingredients are on point, if you want some delicious Italian food at a great price I would definitely recommend Volare. Even the owner came to our table to find out how everything was and how we were liking our experience. Absolutely phenomenal Italian restaurant, definitely check it out if your in downtown Chicago and craving Italian!
Great Risotto and Gnocchi. Cant go wrong with these selections. Highly recommended for in restaurant dining and delivery

Our server, Miguel, was great! He answered our questions and explained the dishes we were considering in precise detail. The linguine and clams were exceptional!! I believe there are multiple locations for this restaurant, and we're at the one close to the Navy Pier. All I can say is.....GO THERE! My wife and I will definitely dine at this restaurant when in Chicago for business or pleasure.

Excellent, the food the atmosphere and the service. The spaghetti i had was a black spaghetti and that was the first time ever, with shrimp and scallops. My coworker hada veal with some type of pasta and she said it was great. Its not expensive.

The food is excellent. The black spaghetti with seafood was an instant favorite with its fresh well-seasoned scallops and shrimp, and homemade black (squid-ink?) pasta. Also I like that you can order half-orders of their pasta dishes. Gotta dock a star for my server. She was helpful at first, but when I ordered more food, she actually replied "Wow, really, that's a lot of food!!", and I even caught her roll her eyes. How rude. Dammit I was hungry and skipped lunch, so please don't judge:/
Great Italian food in Chicago. Had the calamari for appetizer and it was delicious. Chicken Parm and Ravioli was delicious. Highly recommend if looking for a great Italian dinner in the city.

Tired family of 5, near closing time - so we were ready for a Grumpy family dinner.  However the staff was very friendly and provided us with an exceptional Italian experience.  Our waitress was a hit with the kids - "Don't worry about the menu, just tell me what you want and I will make it happen". Oldest kid had Spaghetti with Butter Sauce, Shrimp, Scallops and Calamari.  Service and Food were exceptional and at a very reasonable price.  The whole atmosphere was uplifting  - I will make this a stop on my next Chicago visit.

The food is so authentic and delicious. I really really liked they have a Italian radio station playing the whole time. Portions are large. The best pasta a la boloñesa with a lot of meat. Bread is tasty. Compare to price/portions is a great deal. Service is outstanding, they threat you as a  padrino.
Expansive food and wine menu. Everything we ordered was great... Classic honey Italian restaurant vibe. Would definitely come back

Excellent food and excellent service! We had a party of six and the restaurant was very busy, we called ahead and they said it would be a 45 minute wait. When we got there we gathered at the bar until our table was ready to pass the time. We hadn't even ordered our drinks yet and the manager came over and said he had a table for us! We got the calamari and bruschetta as appetizers and they were both excellent. Every person enjoyed their entrée and the service was very good. Unfortunately no one had room for dessert (as plates were practically licked clean) so I can't comment on that but this was definitely a gem of a find and I'll be back next time I'm in Chicago.

This is my second time coming to the restaurant. I came here for lunch today, and we were all really disappointed. The service was good, but the food was not tasty for the most part. The salads were not that great. We got two pasta dishes and lasagna, and none of us were impressed. The flavor was really bland, and there was no attention to detail. The only dish that was good was the grilled seafood appetizer. I eat out a lot in the downtown area, and I haven't had this bland of food in a long time.

This is a review for their service, which was so poor, I didn't bother sitting. I came to have pizza before a movie on a Tuesday evening. It was busy, but there were seats. I was born & raised in Chicago, and like many people, I love ALL pizza. I approached the hostess, told her I had a party of 2. However, I asked if the pizzas come in slices, to which she responded no. I asked how many people one pizza serves, since I was with my boyfriend. She ignored me to say goodbye to their patrons. So I had to ask a few times, which I could still look past because we're in River North. Their inappropriately snooty manager kept interrupting me with patronizing attitude to ask what sort of pizza I was looking for, and if I wanted deep dish Chicago, I should go to Giordano's, because they only serve authentic Italian thin-crust pizza there. I told him I was from here, and I did not want Giordano's. This is a place that is categorized as $$, not $$$ or more. They offer takeout & delivery. Don't you dare assume I don't deserve to sit at your restaurant because I'm not white like 98% of the guests there, despite my perfect English (regardless of language, they should welcome guests of all ethnicities). Ladies were dressed in casual dresses, and men generally wore polos and khakis, yet there was a sign claiming a "dress code." Any restaurant should welcome business (my boyfriend and I were dressed appropriately to have dinner in the summer), and classy places would know that customer service is KEY. I told the hostess, "I was going to sit down and eat here, but I'm not going deal with you & your staff's condescending tone," and I left. However, considering the way I was treated, I doubt they heard that. I will not be back. Ever.

5 stars all around. Went aline.  Fast seating at bar. Amazing Limoncello, attentive but busy bar tender.  Went for the grilled seafood appetizer.  $17 but amazing!  Followed that up with Clam Linguini.  Not a big fan of clams but had to try it and it met all expectations (though i am not a clam fans)  even had enough energy to try a Tiramisu appetizer.... Sadly for u writing this review before i have it... But it must be as good as everything else.  If you in town for business or want good pasta and grilled seafood, try this place u can't go wrong!

If I were judging this restaurant solely by the food, it would hands-down be a 5 -Star Review. From the Bruschetta appetizer, to my Pollo Arostro entrée, I could not stop eating either until well-past the miserably-full state. I only blame the service for our rating. Our waitress attempted to dissuade us of my meal, based on the time it took to cook, and forgot to refill our glasses or even give us our check. Either way, I would definitely eat here again. The food was delicious.

Can't hear the fireworks they were super busy to get a late night push in the food was still spectacular. I ordered the margarita pizza in the pie even at 11 o'clock at night was spot on. The Chynna has to be taken into account when it's a Monday in the late night push this all coming from the crowd firework enthusiasts and drinkers. This is my first time here and from the looks of the kitchen patio in the restaurant the managers on duty everything is top notch

This place was nothing special.  After I saw that it got 4 stars based on over 1,200 reviews,  I was expecting much better food and service.  The food was standard Italian fare but nothing to write home about.  I had the lasagna, and after my first bite,  I thought I was at Olive Garden. Sometimes, when you eat at a particular restaurant,  excellent service can make you forget that the food was subpar.  That was not the case at this restaurant.  Our waitress never asked us if we wanted anything to drink, she avoided all eye contact, she didn't talk about any specials or mention dishes that she likes.  This was all fine because we were looking forward to the food.  Once the food had arrived, the waitress kept forgetting to bring us items we had asked for....including bread, drink refills, etc.  I'm pretty sure,  she wouldn't have brought us what we had asked for if I hadn't reminded her a few times.  Chicago is a great place full of excellent restaurants....don't waste your time or money at this place.

I went to eat dinner and ordered the salmon. It was set in maple syrup and pineapple. The salmon was to sweet for me  because the sweetness overpowers the salmon. I went with a group and one of them got the lambchops and they were DELICIOUS!!! Over all it was a good restaurant.

One of the best original Italian restaurants in the city.  Everything from start to finish was delicious - bread basket to veal parmigiana.  Service was great and they have a convenient outdoor patio.  They lose a star because the bar is too small.

Italian is one of our favorites! The pork chops are wonderful: we also had the pork chop Parmesan and it was fantastic. We met some very nice people here this week. The spaghetti and meatballs add sausage is wonderful too.

This place is probably the only 5 star I will give while I am in Chicago other than at Wrigley field. I stumbled upon this restaurant by accident with my mom after working one day and got right in. It was about 6 and it was busy but there were a few open tables. The entire experience was outstanding. The server was attentive and well informed about the menu. The entree was taking a little while to come out and he brought us free appetizers to apologize. I ordered the lasagna and my mom got spaghetti and both were delicious. By far the best lasagna I've ever had and I order that dish frequently. The best part was the price. For being a fancy restaurant where you have to dress up and the whole nine yards I was expecting a hefty bill but for two people it only came out to $39. Thats a steal for the quality of food and experience we had. We enjoyed it so much we ordered deliver pizza and salad s few nights later and they didn't let us down. The food was there in under 30 minutes it was hot, and equally as delicious as the night before. Congrats guys. You're doing a great job.

Had a disappointing dinner here last night...Caprese salad was weak...no balsamic and served at room temperature....we got the grilled mixed seafood which was really just octopus and calamari...there was only one shrimp and one scallop in the mix. My girlfriend got the arrabiata which was very underwhelming. Some things were good. I had veal parmesan which was nice. The bartender was very generous with the amount of gin he put in my martini. Prices are reasonable I've been here once before and had a really good experience...last time i got the squid ink pasta and it was great.

We ordered the volare pizza. Incredible. I was in the mood for a thin pizza with prosciutto and it hit the spot. Then we ordered the gnocchi. WOW. It was like pillows. Absolutely delicious. Then the focaccia that comes with it was so soft and amazing. I can't explain how satisfying this meal was. Oh yeah, I had it delivered and it was still perfection.

This place was recommended by a former resident who said it was his favorite Italian place in Chicago. It didn't disappoint! Owned by Italians, this charming place has a great patio and plenty of seating inside. I had the lasagna and my colleague has the gnocchi - both were fantastic. Very flavorful. They also have an excellent wine list. I spoke with the sommelier who gave us an excellent recommendation based on my preferences. All in all it was a great experience!

Was in Chicago on vacation. Went to Volare for dinner. The food was exceptional. The salad and pasta were perfect. Had the vodka pasta that tasted just right. The salad was also very good. This is a special place.

My boss loves this place, and has chose it as his primary resto to take a group of employees and customers whenever in Chi-Town. It is a huge space complete with two bars and an open kitchen, and was packed to the brim on the Wednesday night of our visit. The owner is your typical, if abrupt Italian host. I loved how he barked to our party of 15 when it was time to be seated - "Ok, lets go!" Yessir! He did stop by our table when the madhouse quieted down, and was all smiles asking if we had a great time.  Our main server was an extreamly seasoned pro, and handled our large group as if she has done so a thousand times before. I am sure she has. We ordered several antipasti's for the table, my absolute favorite was "Our Signature Insalata di Mare 18 Octopus, calamari, conch, shrimp, marinated with garlic, lemon, extra virgin olive oil, parsley." All participants were fresh and delish. Great starter.  It had been two days of eating beyond my comfort zone after having dieted for several months, so I went basic for my entrée : "Rigatoni all' Arrabbiata 16 Spicy tomato sauce with pancetta and garlic." Simple, but excellent with perfectly cooked rigatoni and a wonderfully tasty sauce. It is apparent that they have indeed been doing the Lords Work since 1997. When in Chicago, this place will satisfy your old school Italian cravings.
Amazing. Our server Gustavo was the best and the food was fantastic. Get the grilgliata mista it will not disappoint.

Just ate at Valore and couldn't be more pleased. Blanche our server was great. Tried the black spaghetti (squid ink pasta) with shrimp, crab, and scallops. Delicious! I wouldn't hesitate to eat here again. Even the same dish. Worth every penny.

I really wanted to like this place, but the food really just didn't hold up to the price they charged. The service and hospitality was five stars, but the food lacked so much I couldn't give it higher than a four. My husband and I went to Volare on our recent trip to Chicago. We both ordered their specials, I had their seafood gnocchi with sauce and he ordered their salmon with saffron sauce.  Both were ill prepared. It's possible they have new line cooks, or were rushed but both dishes just didn't turn out right. Maybe others will have better luck.
We ordered pizza, salmone and a salad.  Their dishes tastes awesome. Their service is really great as well. Highly recommend this place.
One of the best meals I've ever had. Customer service was outstanding all the way around A+

Amazing food, fantastic service, friendly staff! Great at the "staples" like pasta and soup, as well as meats and fish. Five star food, five star service, and fast seating. Do reserve! I travel several times a year to Tuscany, and, their pasta reminds me of down to earth Tuscany cooking. Go!!!

Might be my favorite restaurant in Chicago. I've been to hundreds, and when I go all I care about is the food and service. This place excels at both. It's loud, it's really crowded, it's not a glamorous place, doesn't have live music, and you may have to wait at a crowded small bar to be seated. At that bar, a little Italian bartender may yell at you and anyone else. But, once you are seated? Great service. Helpful, friendly, expedient. The food is the best part. Is it authentic Italian? I don't know. I've never been to Italy. Most people who claim they "know" what "authentic" Italian really is haven't either. What I do know - it's damn good food. Pasta, grilled octopus, wine, and my favorite - the Filleto di Manzo. One of the best tasting steaks I've ever had. Love the sauce, always perfectly cooked.

Had the mix greens salad, calamari, veal parm (not breaded)...everything was perfect.  And thank you for the complementary Limoncello...a perfect ending to an excellent meal.  I'll come see you guys next time I'm in Chicago.
Delicious authentic Italian food with good service even on a busy Friday night. Clearly management is doing a great job adding the personnel touch to get us seated. Even shrimp cocktail was terrific.
For high end restaurant, very average.  $45 steak was cooked poorly, service was non existent, and the best part of meal was expresso

Came here twice. The first time the server was very pushy about ordering more and would not give us much privacy. Then while we were eating, he was pushy about the check. Second time- the server was almost impossible to get a hold of. We had to ask for water and bread multiple times. It was really uncomfortable.  Very disappointing.  I really wanted to like this place, but it just seems to be another one of those over-priced over-hyped trendy places of Chicago that usually never meet my expectations after moving here from LA/OC.

This place is a real hit or miss, and it's mostly a miss. It's a loop restaurant that mostly caters to tourists and is cheaply priced, which probably explains the unusually high reviews. Here's what I had: * Bread and olive oil. The olive oil tasted rancid and vaguely watery. No thanks. * Tuna Salad. This is literally tuna straight out of a can -- it comes in huge, cold, chunks -- mixed with some tomatoes, beans, and vinegar. Inedible. I wouldn't serve this to my worst enemy. * Seafood platter: fried calamari/squid/shrimp/etc. Quality of the frying is highly variable. Served on a bed of lettuce. No sauces or spices. Boring. * Squid ink spaghetti: actually pretty good. The only worthwhile dish I had there.  I would give this place one star if not for the squid ink spaghetti.

Amazing place I am a Tourist from Miami Edwin a bus boy he was extremely kind. I felt right at home Carl the bartender was ver efficient and helpful finding fast service. The food is spectacular with authentic Italian taste.

Usually rate Volare a 5,this tie a stretch for the 4 stars. We had reservations for almost a month and looked forward to it as always. It was pretty crowded and the hostess was telling people without reservations it would be an hour wait. When they seated us,I hesitated when she took us to a high top table in the bar area. I should have trusted my instincts,but didn't. NEVER allow yourself to be seated there if you want to have a conversation,or even dislike being constantly jostled during your meal. The only reason I didn't ask to be reseated was our server-Charlene.She was awesome! Food was ok,salad was excellent. When my partner flagged a management person down to express his frustrations,she gave lip service and apologized but t certainly wasn't sincere,even when she offered to comp  a dessert. Oh well,live and learn.We will go back but will be much more selective of where we are seated!

My parents live in Streeterville so Volare, Coco Pazzo, and Quartino are our three go-to Italian restaurants when we want to eat at a place by them.  My two favorites are the gnocchi a la vodka and the Risotto Fattoria.  The gnocchi comes drowning in a creamy tomato vodka sauce that you'll be sure to dip the delicious complementary Italian bread into after you eat all the pasta.  The Risotto is creamy and cheesy and comes with sweet peas and large pieces of chicken.  My boyfriend's favorite is the Quattro Sagioni pizza, which is a thin crust pizza with San Marzano tomato base, topped with fresh artichokes, black olives, prosciutto, mushrooms, and mozzarella.  It's crispy and served hot out of the oven!  You can get a half or a full size of the pasta dishes so I'd definitely recommend mixing and matching so you can try more dishes!

W-O-W!! Okay, long story short, went here for a lunch with co-workers so I could take a picture of my Chicken Parm without looking childish in front of our owners/investors. Anywho!!! We sat outside and it was beautiful. What I really like about the outside area is that, even if it is hot, the restaurant is on a shaded street. This makes for a nice outside lunch/dinner without being baked! The bread basket they bring out has excellent. They have a harder French bread and something like a Focaccia bread in smaller pieces. The Focaccia bread taste sooooo good in the olive oil yum! Okay, soooo since I have never been to this place I decided I would play it safe and order the Chicken Parm. Honestly, if an Italian place messy that up, they shouldn't be in existence. I have to say, this place nailed it!!!! The pasta sauce was some of the best I've ever tasted! Italian is one of my favorite cuisines so I can be very picky, but this place earned every star. They service was great. Making reservations was easy. They are not on opentable, but calling in was simple enough. Friendly, amazing food...yum!

I'm on a bus trip from Boston and wanted Italian, so I took the recos of fellow Yelp'ers and headed here. The lasagna bolognese that I had was literally THE best piece of lasagna I've ever had! Moist, cheesy, meaty and just the right amount of spices. As I walked in, I was looking around to decide between table vs bar. The owner greeted came right up to me, and escorted me to the "back bar" where it was a bit quieter and I would get a bit better service. The bartender was exceptional and catered to me like I was the only one there. From my seat, I had a view of the kitchen, which was awesome to see how about 10 chefs and cooks crank out the food. And you know when a place is this packed on a Monday night, they're doing something right! I give this place 5 stars all around, and can't wait to go back and bring friends.
Wow this was a GREAT meal. Started with the minestrone soup them the gnucci. I've give it a 10. Super friendly service. Found the place while taking a long walk thru Chicago and highly recommend it.

It pains me to write this review. I have talked up this restaurant to all my friends. I also USED to get delivery quite often because even with delivery their pasta was perfect el dente. I just received an order $40 worth of food (that included tax, tip and delivery) - When it arrived I was stunned. I thought it was half orders of everything (mind you I know their menu like the back of my hand). I email grub hub about my disappointment thinking they were ripping me off. Grub Hub got back to me immediately (they called the restaurant) and said they changed their menus recently. I then called the restaurant and they verified they cut lots of menu items in half 2 weeks ago. However, the price did not budge. Same price for half order. Disgusted.  I went back to my old orders on Grun Hub and dining in just to double check. Sad. On top of it, it appears the quality was also cut. Kales salad was almost all kale and brussel sprouts, maybe 20 white beans, 4 pancetta small pieces, and only 2 chickpeas - yes i counted. Caprese salad had no balsamic( although listed on menu), and 1 basil leaf - usually you have a basil leaf per stack. Done.
Good classic Italian food and great service!

Fabulous old school place with a huge menu. Calamari is available grilled or fried. I had the grilled, which was deli idiots and relatively guilt free. Steamed kale salad was unusual and tasty. Basket of different  kinds of very fresh bread was excellent.  Good service and ambience. Reasonable prices. Half a block away from some of the trendy Michigan Ave spots, but worth the short walk.   Definitely going back.
Had the bruscetta and ricotta gnocchi. Everything was good, but not great. We sat out and it was great.

I ordered the grilled seafood appetizer and I'm not sure if it was supposed to be cold, but it definitely was ice cold and it was fairly chewy. I eat bolognese ALL. the. time. and Volares was definitely bland, and it was more of an oil with dry ground beef on top as opposed to a meat sauce.

Classic Italian at it's very best!  I got a chance to come here with my family our last night in Chicago. The restaurant was quite busy however, the owner came out and personally escorted us to our seats. I don't know what made us so special, but I'm definitely not complaining. The restaurant doesn't look like much from the outside, but inside it's adorable! Our waiter was friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. We all indulged in some vino, pasta and even dessert! It was the perfect ending to our trip. I loved everything about this place.

Just stumbled upon this restaurant. The food was fabulous and our waitress, Charlene,  made our experience memorable. She was so friendly, helpful and made us feel so welcome! What an awesome spot... I'll be back.

Excellent service and ppl.  They offer family style and individual dinners.  Unbelievable Wine Selection.  Some of the best service in America.  Owners and staff very accommodating.   Get the: Baked Chicken Chicken Parmesan Lamb Chops

Volare had the best lasagna I've ever had.  It was a large portion, so I brought the rest home and enjoyed it just as much the next day.  The service here was good.  My group made reservations close to closing time, but the staff stayed late with us and did not seem upset by it at all.  The pricing was a little towards the expensive side, but the size of the portions completely made up for this.

Volare is the kind of place you can take anyone to and know the food and the service will be excellent.  A relaxed atmosphere in which everyone seems to feel comfortable. The staff has been at this long enough to know if customers want that 'hey! good to see you again! banter or to be left to their private conversations. This is a place I don't ever mind waiting at the bar for my table to be ready; I am guaranteed to meet someone and start a conversation.

I cannot wait until I can come here again! We came here on a busy Saturday night. The hostess' and the manager made sure to seat us as fast as possible. I loved the atmosphere in this restaurant...Italian places to me seem to always have some type of special feel to them and this place had that. I had an alfredo pasta dish that was to die for and my fiancé had a spicy sausage pasta dish. He loved it too. I ordered a little tiny bottle of prosecco to sip with my meal and it was cheap and yummy. Service was great overall. When I am in Chicago this will be a must for us.

I have to say I am disappointed at what I experienced after ordering from here. Ordered a margarita pizza with no cheese. Traditional margarita pizza has little blotches of mozzarella cheese on it, this thing came with traditional american style cheese on it and the little blotches on mozzarella cheese, when I asked for no cheese lol My partner got the gnocchi everyone on here raves about, he liked it a lot and it was a bit too creamy for me, but good. I got the spicy rigatoni with no meat on it and it was pretty good, but not good enough for the price paid for it (can get better elsewhere in Chicago) My partner also got the mussels dish and also liked that. Will not be returning for a while.
Good bolonese, but a little dry. Good bread and great wine list. I would definitely return. They servers are nice and seem to know the city well. The GM is so friendly!

5 Star dinning experience.  I took a group fo 30 to the restaurant and everyone was extremely  impressed.  The food, staff, and hospitality was amazing.  Authentic Italian cuisine, knowledgeable staff, and professional experience. I travel routinely and can tell you this is on my "Favorite List" of restaurants across the country.

Volare, a Chicago Gem!  One of the best Italian restaurants where the service is fast and the food is exceptional!  Upon entering the restaurant, a roomy outdoor seating area offers a warm embrace of a scenic dining area.  The soft green awning coupled by the potted plants offers inviting European charm.  The interior is simple, small but roomy.   Immediately, the patron is greeted by a very friendly hostess with a big smile and genuine propensity to help.   The highlight to Volare is the amazing food!  To start, the Calamari was the best I've ever had!  The breading was light and not oily/greasy at all and the actual squid was cooked to perfection, soft and tender, not chewy in the slightest bit!  The spaghetti and meatballs was very flavorful with the meatballs displaying a perfect texture and the pasta a precise firmness.  The sauce is perfect for garlic lovers, tangy but not tart.  Finally, the Coup d'etat was the special on the menu that evening:  Chilean Seabass!  What a slice of heaven;  the fish was soft, flaky, almost sweet and absolutely delicious.  Most places don't need to include anything else with their fish but Volare takes it a step further by including a bed of black rice (ala Spain) which stands on it's own as dish. The combination of the two makes this an unforgettable meal of a lifetime!   Volare:  Quaint setting, great service and Unbelievably tasty food makes this one of the best restaurants in Chicago

What an amazing, authentic Italian restaurant. Extensive, wonderful wine list as well - vino noble di montepulciano is where it's at!  One of my favorite things is that you can get almost anything in the entire menu in a half portion! It's great for if you're trying to watch how much you're eating, or alternatively, if you want to try twice as many things! Specific recommendations: If you're into  mussels, get these - they're ENORMOUS and perfect. I also HIGHLY recommend the squid ink pasta. It's incredible and I get at least a half portion every time I go ;)
Great customer service! Amazing food! We ordered the Spaghetti Neri al Pesce and we were mind blown!

Got there shortly before noon on a Friday. My first impression was an overwhelming smell of bleach. The waiter was very old school Italian. The sausage and Swiss chard soup and bruschetta was delicious. The calamari was tasteless. The entrée was risotto with shrimp. Why can't restaurants take the tail off the shrimp!?! The risotto was tasty but heavy.

Italian cuisine is not on top of my list, but our company had a dinner party and they picked this restaurant. We had calamari for appetizer and it was good. I ordered black spaghetti with shrimp, crab, and scallop and I was impressed. The sauce was creamy and tasty with chunks of crab meat. The portion was quite big so I did not have a chance to try their desserts.  Great dining atmosphere, very attentive staff, and great food.
It was amazing food!!  We got the Caprese Pasta, and it was probably the best ever! They also served very good bread.

This place exceeded our expectations! The customer service is great and the food is phenomenal! BEST chicken parm ever!!!!!!  It's a must go if you're in the area! It's walking distance from the Chicago inn and very close to all the shopping !  Loved it!

We visited this restaurant while on vacation in Chicago. For such an upscale place we were rather disappointed. We had great service but the food was awful. I ordered the Pollo Arrosto. The vegetables were drowning in butter and lemon sauce to the point of pure mush. And the chicken was very greasy from being fried. My husband ordered the Barciola Di Maiale Ripiena. It was very mediocre.

Good food and was still able to make last minute open table reservation; although the concierge at the hotel called ahead  for us- guess no open table points for me. Anyway the staff was warm and welcoming and the dining room, while packed was still charming and friendly. Our waitress forgot to mention the daily specials and we were a little disappointed that what we thought we ordered after spying it on another table wasn't quite it. Otherwise, the food was yummy and very fairly priced. Happy to have made the decision to visit this place around the corner on a cold and rainy night.
Most of my comments noted in the check in, outstanding everything!!!! Sort I didn't post photos but the food service and ambiance was outstanding!!!!
Delicious Food. Good atmosphere and outside setting area. Try the seafood grilled appetizer. For main course the Black Spaghetti.

Last night we had a tremendous dinner at Volare!  We started with 2 nice cocktails, both perfectly mixed.  We had the sea bass and veal limone entree's with the spinach and the meatball sides.  Every item was incredible and I am not easy to please.  We finished with the key lime tart and lemon sorbet desserts that were great as well.  All of this with a nice bottle of the Rochioli Pinot and it was a perfect evening!  Thank you, Johnny!

Went on a saturday afternoon, 5 tables were taken. Restaurant is pleasant inside and so was the wait service. The food on the other hand was atrocious. We recived the gnocchi and risotto which looked great. However the food was very hard. I sent the gnocchi back and when it returned...hard again. Same went with the risotto. What about their calamari? Bland underseasoned. Their table bread was their most redeeming factor.

So me and my girlfriend decided to try this place as recommended. We walked in and we were greeted like kings and queens. We were escorted to our seats. The atmosphere was very nice. Out waiter was a little inattentive, and seemed to be lacking experience. To start off we ordered a half order of clams and a half order of calamari. The clams were extremely small and just alright. The calamari was fantastic. Nice thick pieces of calamari fried to perfection. Best calamari i have ever had. I ordered the clam linguini and my girlfriend ordered the spaghetti. When i got my linguini it was steaming hot. It had at lease 12-15 small clams in and around it. The dish had small pieces of garlic in it and was fantastic. It had alot of flavor with the right amount of clammy taste. All in all, i would definitely recommend this place if you are looking for a great meal and not to worried about the waiting staff.
Sea bass my favorite.  My wife had salmon. Delicious.  Servers been there for 10 years.  Very pleasant.  Enjoyed the busy atmosphere Thursday night downtown.
Veal parm to die for. Tasty raviolis w meatballs on the side. Unbelievable Chianti Classico Riserva. Great service, lively but not too loud. Highly recommended!
The calamari appetizer and the black squid spaghetti are very good. Would definitely recommend it. However the waitstaffs are quite inattentive.

Food was good but not great.  Seemed to be a little heavy with the salt.   Service was very good.  Restaurant was very busy so maybe other dishes are more remarkable.  Veal with lemon and Chilean sea bass were both good.   Staff thanked us as we were leaving which is always a nice touch.

I was really underwhelmed by my experience here on Friday.  My boyfriend and I sat on the patio and the heaters were on which was nice. Things got weird very quickly. We were seated and were not greeted by a server for at least 5 minutes. We also didn't have any menus so we couldn't look at drinks or food as we waited.  One sever brought us menus but no drink menu. Shortly after it looked as though two servers were competing over who got what table. So awkward. Our bread looked like it had been eaten before it served to us. I didn't even touch it because it looked like it had been sitting out for so long.  On top of that the wait staff kept opening and shutting the door on the patio which let in so much cold air. One guy in particular would come in and literally do nothing walk out and walk back in. It was really annoying. We ordered carpaccio- it was just okay. I ordered the pappardelle and that was good. My boyfriend ordered the pasta with clams in white wine. I wasn't very impressed at all with it.  Our waiter did a good job when it came to being attentive and friendly.  However, Volare just isn't what it used to be 3-4 years ago. I think it's gone downhill and I haven't been very happy about my dining experience the last 3 times I've gone.
Not great service. Ordered at 9:45 with a 20 minute timeframe. Finally got it at 10:30.  Typically it's excellent food and great service but the food was only good and the host wasn't friendly.
Great atmosphere and staff, Benny is the star! Delicious food every single time I visit, great place for any Italian dish favorites.

I've been wanting to come here for SO LONG and my boyfriend, who lives down the street refuses, because he thinks its a tourist trap. But alas, I got him to compromise - take out. He ordered a chicken parm and I grabbed the squid ink seafood pasta. At first glance, I was thrown off at what a ripoff his chicken parm was and what a great value my pasta was. His portion was tiny, and I had lots of leftover. As for my pasta, the ingredients were definitely quality and the portion given was generous. My only complaint was that the pasta was cooked a tiny bit too al dente for me. Now if I could only convince him to dine there with me...

Ate here on a Thurs night. Glad we had reservations as the place was packed. Our server Miguel was excellent and insured we had a great dining experience. We started with the sausage and peppers appetizer- made fresh in house. Delicious!The half portion was plenty for 2. The pasta also made fresh in house. My wife had the ravioli. She loved it , very tasty. I had the lasagna, also very tasty , but to me a bit heavy on the salt. All portions Chicago sized and very reasonably priced . Overall a very pleasant dining experience. Service was attentive but not intrusive. We will come back here next time in Chicago.

Excellent service and it started the minute we walked in the door and ended when the manager came to the table after our meal. We saw attentive service at every table around us. The did was delicious and beautifully presented. Cannot wait to go back to Chicago. Will definitely be returning.

Sorry.  Maybe 2 and 1/2.  My pounded veal chop looked store bought with no hands that touched it.  But bigger issue was the gravy ( tomato sauce). Not very tasty. Not sure how this place gets great raves.  None of our foods were great.  The salads were tasty but not made fresh.  How to know?  The drippings of the juices were all over the plate. The beets for example. And they came out one minute after we ordered them. Pre made. No hands on.  Sorry. Dessert. Bread pudding.  Sauce to sweet to taste anything else.  Overall. A fair experience. Not to be re done. Sorry.

Worst Italian experience! I picked this restaurant tonight anticipating a romantic day with my boyfriend. The feel wasn't romantic but I kept an open mind. The bread was Mediocre but I kept an open mind. The fried seafood appetizer was Just disgusting and made me really question what was to come- burnt, and also tasted like it was cooked in dirty oil. I'm not terribly picky but I couldn't eat It at all and my polite boyfriend ate it all. Neither of us had admitted to each other we were fully grossed out at this point- neither of us liked my salad either (it was honestly slimy and the color of house insulation, like the pink panther threw up on my plate) but again wanting a romantic night I shrugged it off. When the entrees came (i ordered the veal Parmesan, he a chicken dish, and we also ordered papardele to share) I was instantly grossed out by presentation alone. An almost $40 veal dish that just looked like diner food- a huuuuge piece of meat absolutely covered in cheese, rather than a focus on quality ingredients. At this point we both admitted that this was one of the most hilariously bad restaurant experiences we'd ever had, only not that funny at $110 before taxes. We boxed 75% of our meals up, in case we get really desperate (I'd personally rather have Barilla and Classico but we figured we may eat.)  Afterwards, my boyfriend told me he was going to pop the question tonight but couldn't bare to have a proposal sullied by the worst meal of all time. I can't blame him, but wtf Volare, you guys must be paying for positive reviews because the food is just disgusting. Interestingly, unlike other posters we found service to be fine. Still, even my pathologically polite boyfriend even gave me the green light to tear this place down on Yelp; it was just that bad :(. Not even mediocre, which I would have not wasted my time posting over...actively yucky.
Tasty plates. Parmigiana, lasagna, risotto, pizza... Everything delicious. The service is perfect. Friendly waiters and good ambient. And the price is fair too. Strongly recommended.
had a delicious lunch - gnocchi with vodka sauce - gnocchi were delicate and the sauce was superb - service was great

First let me preface this by saying I am from Saint Louis - home of the Hill, some of the best Italian food around...  This place has great ambiance and atmosphere is classy.  The food was very good, but not "oh my god I'm going to...." good like the Hill.  I was annoyed at the $10 glass of house wine, and waiting 30 minutes even though we had a reservation.  The service was...acceptable.   I would have selected 3 stars, however...  we walked past the following afternoon after leaving the slammed restaurant and the owner/host at door?  Was outside setting up a sign, greeted us, and said "I hope you gentlemen enjoyed your meal last night."  Wow!  I'm impressed at his ability to remember individual customers especially considering it was our first time!

DON'T GO HERE!!  I am easy to please when it comes to simple dinner like fairly straight forward Italian food.  This restaurant is like a nightmare hurricane of suburban blandness mixed with a crowd of people that act like they are eating their last meals which they drag on endlessly. I wanted to eat at 7:00pm last night, I called for a reservation, and the earliest was 8:45pm- sure ok let's be adults, I took it. Upon showing up on time and famished, it the most stereotypical idiotic response at the desk, "Oh we're so slammed, go to the bar and we'll have a table momentarily".  AN HOUR LATER, after watching countless geriatrics come and go without waiting, we got a server whom was triple sat in the back.  Water five minutes, bread, ten minutes, drinks, 15 minutes, apps, 25 minutes, entrees an hour later.  The food was all drenched in olive oil and butter.  Eating here was like eating at Country Barrel on a Sunday after church in the deep-south, loud, annoying, and terrifyingly poor at performing everything. The food and wine are all double the price they should be even for this neighborhood.  It took 2.5 hours for a piss poor dinner, a few block from where I live, please do not make the same mistake. Unreasonable wait times for everything, all overpriced by 100%, bland food, terrible atmosphere, and I was sick for the rest of the evening from the amount of butter and oil which they used in an attempt to drown out their lack of culinary ability at a level akin to the melting arctic glaciers. I would never, ever return to this restaurant or their suburban counterpart in Oak brook, interestingly the headquarters of McDonalds, which even more astonishingly enough has better quality food than this shame of a restaurant.  Volare is a horrid choice for anyone ever, and you should not eat at this restaurant or bring anyone out to this establishment unless you wanted to poison them for killing your first born child. Ciao!

The food and service were both great. We ordered calamari and caprese salad as appetizers. Both were excellent. Had the chicken Parmesan for my entree- also excellent. Other people in our party ordered the gnocchi, lasagna, veal, and clam pasta. Everyone was happy with their meals. The manager stopped by our table to make sure everything was okay too, which I always appreciate. The only reason it was not a 5 star experience for me is because it was very loud and warm in the restaurant.

I appreciated the great Italian food I had at Volare. We called last minute and they squeezed in our 8 person reservation for the prime time hour of 8pm. The menu had something for everyone. We got calamari and caprese salad which was an excellent way to start the meal. We followed it with an amazing Caesar salad. I got a lasagna entree which was delicious. I also tried some of my friend gnocchi a la vodka which was on point. Great place for Italian! Very accommodating.
Classy establishment with very attentive staff.  Food was excellent and expansive wine list.

Great Italian food.  My only major complaint with this restaurant is how they handle reservations. Each time I have gone, I have waited more than 30 minutes to be seated despite having a reservation, which I find unacceptable. On one occasion, we asked to be reimbursed for the valet parking, after we had already waited 40 minutes past our reservation time, because we had purchased movie tickets and did not want to miss the show. The restaurant manager did not apologize for the delay and he was not willing to reimburse us for the valet parking. Instead, he seated us and said that we would be out in time for the show. However, it took forever to get our food and we ended up having to inhale our dinner to make it in time for the movie. Not a pleasant experience at all. Significant improvement is needed with the reservation system. An apology from the manager would have been appreciated.

This place is very good. In a city full of terrific restaurants, especially Italian restaurants, it is great to find a place that surprises you. I was here on business a few months ago and we ate there two nights in a row. I went back last night and was not disappointed. In fact I was more impressed. I had the squid ink pasta with seafood. I substituted red sauce for the brandy cream sauce. The pasta was probably as close to perfectly cooked as I've ever had. My friend had the salmon which looked beautiful and he said was "outstanding." Service was very good and attentive. The place is A little loud; but that's a small price to pay for great food.

This place is wonderfully delicious, attentive and loud.  We got into the city last night around 8:30, and called to see if we could get a table, and they said, "Come on over!"  We walked from our hotel, The Gwen, and we were there and seated in 10 minutes. The service was very attentive and the staff noticed avert thing we needed, bring a new knife to my son with seconds after he dropped it on the floor.  We were tired from traveling and not too hungry, so we will be back soon to try more because everything we had was delicious.
Excellent service, Paul made great suggestions. Food was incredible!  Thanks for a great pre-birthday dinner!

Grabbed take out here via GrubHub. Not bad, not bad. I did the Pollo alla Parmigiana (aka Chicken Parmesan) and an order of the Spaghetti Neri al Pesce (squid ink pasta) for the lady. The Chicken Parmesan had a generous portion of pan fried chicken cutlet smoothered in pomodoro sauce and mozzarella, however the side of spaghetti was rather skimpy for $18 IMO. It's hard for me to justify the value here. On the contrary, the Spaghetti Neri al Pesce was loaded with shrimp, crab, and scallops well worth the $23 price. The black spaghetti was cooked perfectly and tosses in a hearty sage, brandy, and cream sauce. VERY GOOD! And yet again, I enjoyed other people's dishes more than my own... Maybe I should pay attention more to what people on Yelp are recommending and stop being so basic.... Spaghetti Neri al Pesce all the way!  'Til next time, cheers!

My girlfriend and I went to Volare for our anniversary and while we had a good time, it could have been better.  We had a 7:30 reservation and weren't seated until 7:50.  They could have told us to go to the bar, but they kept saying that we'd be seated very soon.   Then, the bottle of Bordeaux I asked to have at the table upon arrival was out of stock.  They were helpful in selecting a comparable wine though. The Chilean Sea Bass was very good, and we both enjoyed the fried clams, but the tables are packed in very close together and the service was just fair. Would consider going back on a non-weekend night when it's not so packed and servers are knocking past you, but definitely not a favorite.

Their black spaghetti with rose sauce is absolutely amazing! Seafoods that go in the pasta are fresh, and you can smell the ocean in the pasta. It is, by far, one of the beat pasta I've ever tried. It looked like they used crab meat in the sauce that just blends with the taste. I highly recommend this place!

Volare's may be perhaps the best Italian food I have had in the States.  We also happen to visit during Restaurant Week, so there was a prix fixe menu that was to DIE FOR!  Explosion of taste, variety, and experience.  How often do you get to try braised baby cuttlefish and suckling pig all for $33?  In Chicago?  EXTRAORDINARY. OK, really Yelpies...raise your hand if you have even tried cuttlefish?  I hadn't. It was a feast of flavor.  You can check out the full Prix Fixe menu in my photos, but I had the Braised Baby Cuttlefish with olive oil and garlic, which was served in the most flavorful tomato sauce.  The homemade tortelloni pasta dish was a great second course.  Then there was the suckling pig which was cooked crunchy, served with Sunchoke chips, sauteed mushrooms, and a wine and dry fruit sauce.   Can you tell I had a great time?  I was taking pictures of half eaten courses it was so good.  When you are snarfing down a great dish and in the middle you think, "Oh, I need to get a shot of this for my Yelpie friends, you know you are a Yelpie Nut Job (official title, I think). The service is impeccable.  The garlic abounds.  The bar is fully stocked, and the wine list is BRILLIANT.   Go ready for an experience.  But try not to settle for a mamouth bowl of pasta.  Explore and experiment.
We had the mussels and black spaghetti with lump crab, shrimp and scallops. The most wonderful seafood/pasta combo I have ever eaten.

Fantastic restaurant to spend our last night here in Chicago. We had a very friendly welcome and were promptly shown to our table. The waiters were very helpful regarding the menu and the service was very good. As for the food, it was fantastic, couldn't fault it at all. Would certainly make a visit again if back in the area
Great service. I don't normally order pasta at restaurants but went with their spinach pasta special and it was incredible. Very good service as well.

I love coming here. Whenever I visit Chicago I automatically come here. Been doing it since 2002. Had a delicious chicken breast covered with spinach and cheese. It was Tuesday special. It came with broccoli and these hot hot potato French fries! Also had the red snapper. They give you focaccia and bread. Just a great meal.

I went here for Valentine's day with my girlfriend and everything was perfect. The food was delicious, the service was proper, and even the owner came around each table to check on us. I  recommend this place for anyone interested in eating some amazing Italian food.

Food was delicious. Service was way off. We didn't see a menu for 30 minutes. A server didn't stop by for another 10 minutes after that. The bartenders were swearing loudly and talking about "douchebags" which I didn't think was classy for a nice Italian restaurant.
A bit fake on the Italian staff, but the food was great. The mixed grill appetizer was very good. Portions were good size.

We always enjoy coming to this place and our last visit (December 22) was no exception.  Our server (Refaat) was fantastic!  He was one of the best servers we've had at any restaurant in Chicago (including those that cost double or triple a meal here).  We brought our two girls (ages 6 and 3) with us and he was incredibly kind and thoughtful with them.   The portions are massive.  My wife loves their risotto and has it every time we visit, even though it usually looks like she didn't touch it once she's done.  This time, I tried the Fusilloni al Ragu di Vitello and it was incredible!  The girls had the pizza (I tried a piece and it was quite good too).   We had a nice bottle of Barbaresco with the meal.  Their wine list is decent and there are some good values to be found in the Italian section, but prices are a bit steep for some bottles.  They also tend to substitute vintages, so check the bottle carefully when it's brought to your table if that matters to you. Overall, one of the best Italian places in Chicago.  It's always crowded for dinner, so make a reservation, even on "slow" days.

I absolutely loved this restaurant. The wait staff is the nicest you will ever come across. Silvana was our waitress and she was the sweetest!! The food is spectacular. Such a nice restaurant for a nice evening out and especially if you're in the mood for italian!

The service and food are fantastic!!! An old school Italian atmosphere where your greaten by a host and waiter, Jesus, at the table an attentive bus staff who never left a single dirty plate on our table and a water glass that was always full. The BEST Italian restaurant in CHICAGO!!!

Came across this place due to Yelp. The service was outstanding. My drink was never empty it was always filled. Server and busboy were always around making it easy to ask for anything we needed.  I would strongly recommend this place! Food was authentic and so tasteful!
The dishes are traditionally Italian flavor. But they not are as great as expected, especially the main courses. The environment is good.

I was in Chicago for work and was famished! We went around 6:30 and didn't have reservations so was lucky to be seated on a Friday night. Place was packed by 7:30PM. It was restaurant week so they had the choice of a prefixed meal or menu. We went with the prefixed and everything was amazing! Great portions and delicious food. Service was exceptional.

A friend and I ordered takeout from here via GrubHub so this review is strictly based on the food. I ordered the Fettuccine Verdi alla Bolognese and it was to die for! I'm usually not the biggest bolognese fan but I wanted to try something different and it was definitely a good choice. I really loved the spinach fettuccine which gave it some added flavor, since I probably wouldn't have ordered it if it was just regular fettuccine. My friend ordered the Fusilloni al Ragu which was just as good. Both dishes didn't skimp on the sauce which is always a plus, and we each got the half order which was more than enough to fill us up. You really can't go wrong with an order of pasta for about $8 for dinner. Highly recommend if you're looking for some good Italian in Chicago!
We were able to get last minute reservations here on New Year's Day. The food was good, and we had a very personable server.

Went here last night with family from out of town. Wow was this place was popping. They were more than a bit tardy with our 8:00 reservation, however Benny noticed and more than made up for it with more than a few favors. Treated us like family the rest of the night. The food is the best around, which helps too. Thank you for a great dinner last night!!
Wow! I had the best zuppetta di cozze in a long time. It was awesome!! Wine was fine. It was overall a great gluten free experience!!

This was our first time here. The food was excellent,our server Charlene was excellent, John the host was excellent..the music was really strange. Kind of killed the ambience. please change the music it's disruptive!!

We came here on a Saturday night with a few friends. One of them had been there before so he ordered for us a few apps which were the beef carpaccio and the bruschetta, The bread on the bruschetta was grilled really nicely and tomatoes had a nice fresh taste. For an entree I ordered the pappardelle with ricotta and tomatoes. The pasta was al dente just the way I like it. I liked the overall vibe of the restaurant. An overall nice experience as a vistor.

I came here for dinner. We came at a perfect time around 6:30, so that we were seated almost immediately. However, if were to have come an hour later, there would have been a considerable wait to be seated. The service here was excellent. I really liked our waiter taking the time to explain the specials and the individual dishes. The menu had so many options to choose from that it was almost overwhelming. For appetizers, I got the grilled calamari, shrimp, and scallops. I really enjoyed the tenderness and texture of the seafoods. For the main course, I had to get their gnocchi and sausage. The gnocchi was absolutely amazing. It immediately melted in my mouth and cooked perfectly. The sausage was also excellent. I would most definitely come back here and recommend it for anyone interested in good Italian food.

I don't understand how people can give 5 stars for this restaurant. We went to this restaurant because of good reviews from other people. Oh,boy.. it was the worst italian restaurant I've ever been. Even though it was a weekday, service was really slow. And food was tasteless. There are way better italian  restaurants in downtown.

I'm finding it hard to reconcile my visit with Norm J's 4-star review. The food was dismal. It's a quaint little classic Italian style joint in the same way that all the Greektown restaurants (which I avoid like the plague) are quaint little classic Greek style joints. There is nothing wrong with keeping things traditional and old school...IF you do those things right. And Volare, like Greektown, just doesn't do 'em right.  The dishes are large and sound and look appealing enough as they're plated nicely. But they're basically tasteless. Carpaccio Manzo ($10) was meh. Go get Devon Seafood's brilliant beef carpaccio at their happy hour. My Salmone Al Forno ($23) and her Vitello Limone (that's veal, $24) were tasteless. Her veal cutlets were these scraggly little pounded down things with maybe a dousing of flour and a tasteless sauce. Perhaps that's karma for ordering a baby cow taken away from its mommy in its sad short life. Drinks and dessert were okay with the tiramisu standing out...it must be outsourced from somewheres (I'm talking like an Italian now) that cares about food. The limoncello martini done fuq'd me up too, which was necessary to endure this $115-before-tax-and-tip disaster. The cappuccino was lame. If they served this in Boston's North End, a little Italian grandma would chase them out with a broom. Server was an awesome, fairly fresh off the boat, Italian guy, didn't know these still existed. Refreshing. And menu prices were whole dollar amounts, not my HATED $XX.95 or $XX.99 crap that does not befit a restaurant of a certain caliber. At the risk of being "Trendy Boy," take your money to RPM Italian or some newer, more innovative Italian joint 'round town. And don't ever go to Greektown while you're at it!
Great atmosphere...excellent food.  Fresh seafood and delicious panini.  Relaxed 2.5 hour Italian lunch.
Typical traditional Italian.  Nothing special.  Good wait staff but just average food.  Will not return.

We ordered delivery from Volare tonight and we were so impressed! Seriously I want to go for dinner at the restaurant tomorrow. We got the minestrone, prosciutto and a large order of risotto - plus they threw in some bread sticks without us ordering them. Everything we ordered (and didn't order) was amazing. The risotto was out of this world. Thank you for the great dinner!

A great Italian restaurant, short walk from Michigan avenue. Experienced excellent service, delicious veggie pizza and ravioli in white sauce. Had an awesome time with my bestie there..would highly recommend!!

Excellent service (although I think their host stand needs some small improvements, but they've always been friendly) but I really like the feel of the place and their service is always so knowledgeable and friendly
