We decided to eat here on New Years Day with about 90 minutes advanced notice. The restaurant allowed us to make a reservation for a party of six and seated us immediately upon arrival. The waiter was fantastic and so was the food; even our three kids even loved it.

The food is not good. Don't waste your money.  We only came here because it was close to the hotel we were staying at and wanted a quick bite before flying out. First, the atmosphere at the restaurant is pretentious, and we were looked down at by the waiters who were hovering over us and clearing our tables while we were eating. A half eaten pizza does not look like an empty plate to me. Additionally, I was taking a bite out of my meal and the waiter pulled the plate from under me. It was clear we were not welcome and were not wanted there.  Secondly, the food tastes sub-par.  At best, it tastes like food court Italian food when you take your lunch break while working a retail job. Even then, it's better quality there than this restaurant. I don't know who gives this restaurant good reviews, but I visit New York and Italy often where Italian food is genuine. Again, don't waste your money. I regret that this is the last restaurant we dined at before leaving Chicago.

We went here for lunch and it was a nice, cozy hideaway from a blustery, cold day. The service was on point, the wine was good, and the food was tasty. I especially loved their arancini. The atmosphere is old school Italian, complete with old school Italian dudes enjoying their meals. I'm only holding back a star because I didn't have any "oh my GAWD" moments food-wise. As I said, it was all very good though. I would definitely go back.  We went for lunch on a weekday and had no issues getting a table.

We had the most amazing time with best friends out at Volare in Downtown Chicago a few weeks ago. We started off with their Calamari and fresh bread. Our server paired the most amazing white wine with our dinners, as we all had one of  the specialties for the night. The noodles were the freshest I've ever tasted, my seafood was fresher than some I've had in Florida, and the overall charisma of the restaurant was one of the best I've ever been in. I can't wait to come back again!

We were in this restaurant for 1 hr. and 50 minutes.  Of that time, we spent more than half the time waiting.  We waited for drinks (15 min.), waiting for our appetizer (20 min.), and waiting to order our entrees (10 min. after we finished our appetizer), and in general, waited for our server to reappear during the whole visit.  She managed to spill tomato sauce on my iPhone, and basically, just tossed our food on the table and bolted away. When we finally got  our entrees, mine was wrong and the response was a lame apology and no attempt to correct the situation. When the server finally presented the check, she made all kinds of excuses, effectively blaming the bad service on the kitchen's inability to deal with groups that night.  I don't care what the problem was or who was at fault.   This was a bad reflection on your restaurant.  If you can't handle big groups, don't accept the bookings.  What a waste of $100.

We saw this place in the morning and passed up several eateries to come back and try this one.  It took forever to get service and then the waitress was straight up rude.  We didn't have menus and her attitude went down hill from there.  During the ordering process, she wasn't helpful about answering questions about the menu.  Too bad.  The food was pretty good.  We had a really long day and could have used some Chicago hospitality but didn't find it here.

This place was phenomenal, the best Italian food I've had in a long time. My friend got the chicken pasta and I got a truffle pasta. I highly recommend this place if you're looking for authentic Italian cuisine.
Pretty mediocre pasta. For the price, certainly expected better

I have no idea why people say this place is so good. The atmosphere is ok but kind of tracky holiday decorations. The calimari was chewy, the clam appetizer was salty. The bread was mediocre. The special soup was average at best. The black spaghetti was bland and the shrimp tasted quite old. Needless to say we passed on dessert and got out if there as fast as we could!
Delicious house-made pastas. The Pomodoro sauce is so good I want to drink a bowl of it. Had the eggplant rollatini which blew my mind. Not to mention the great, attentive service.  Can I live here!?

I ate at Volare last August when I was visiting Chicago and it was so amazing I actually felt that I owed it to them to write them a review. Everything was perfect from the service to the amazing food and I couldn't believe how reasonable the prices were for what we ordered. We shared a salad and a pizza and another appetizer and also had several cocktails and the bill was shockingly low for everything that we had. Even their soft, fluffy and moist bread they served while we were waiting for our food was amazing. They gave us freshly grated Parmesan cheese with it that we put in the oil and balsamic and it was so good we couldn't stop eating it. Their homemade lemoncello martini was delish too. We had a great time and the food was amazing but one of the things that really stood out to us the most was the really great attitude and work ethic of everyone there from the top down. The busboy was so nice and so hard-working he was just busting his ass all night. So was the server too. We watched him hand cut a large chicken into sections for a table at the table side and serve the side dishes from hot pans to their plates making an even split among them. Right then we were in love. The manager was even seating people running around, as they were busy, and still managed to make cutesy jokes to is every couple times he passed the table. after our meal I had to thank the owner who of course was there also running around working hard most the night. He was friendly and gracious and invited us to check out his steakhouse which we didn't get around to but we have must've stayed there for over two hours just loving being there and loving the food and the service and I would love to go back next time I'm in Chicago.

HAVE AGAIN: The Spaghetti Nero was fabulous! Wonderful! Delicious! And the Italian bread was the best I've had since my Italian grandfather took me to a long-gone Italian bakery in 1971 on the south side of Indianapolis. They let me buy a loaf for $3 and added butter and parmesan cheese to the bag. Great restaurant! NOT HAVE AGAIN: The stuffed beef special - braciole - was good, but I would not order it again.
Ordered Ravioli di Ricotta to go for $12.16. I got 4 thin cheese ravioli. Certainly not worth it. It's rather pathetic and feels like a sad appetizer.
One of the best Italian restaurants in town.  Everything is great here.
My lunch here was so amazing, I couldn't wait to write a review. Not only is the food amazing, but the service is A-plus. This is real Italian food, and it's INCREDIBLE. Highly recommended!

Full house as usual.  Reservation a definite requirement on a Saturday at 8:30.  Prompt service.  The mussels in red sauce is my families favorite appetizer. Pastas are great.  Have tried many of the main dishes in the past, usually just OK.  Hard to find decent steak at an Italian place that specializes in pastas.  This place is no exception.  They broil the steak so hard to control temperature.  My wife never learns, she orders the steak rare but the new York strip always comes out at least medium.  Service is nice.  My error in not notifying restaurant when making reservation that my 5 year old daughter was part of our group of 5.  They seated us at a high top table, probably staff should have recognized this pitfall. But my daughter is pretty experienced and did not have any issues.   Loud this evening, more than usual.  Group of middle aged mothers and their daughters were in table next to us.  Moms seemed to want to encourage daughters to be loud as they likely wanted to relive some youthful days. That was a bit annoying this evening but oh well.   Not my best experience this evening.  That was unfortunate as I took my friend from out of town to dinner for his birthday.  Have gone to this place at least 10 prior times when visiting Chicago. Likely just a variance, except the steak which is likely just an issue.
We had reservations, but weren't seated for 45 minutes.  During the wait, we were made to stand in a hallway to "make room" in the empty entrance.

I've been to Volare numerous times and I have never been disappointed with the food. Everything I've had here has always been delicious and left my stomach throughly pleased. While the location isn't the best for a downtown restaurant, the fact that they are always packed speaks volumes about the quality and taste of their food. The only reason why I'm not giving Volare 5 stars is because the space can be a little tight up in there. Food to definitely try: *Nodino Di Vitello Parmigiana- my favorite dish here. The veal is a must try. *Fusilloni al Ragu Di Vitello - another veal dish is definitely worth a try as well. *Rigatoni all'Arrabbiata - is really good, but indeed spicy.

Very good Italian food... Above average and I would absolutely go back... Not my first choice but a good option.... We had the Buratta with beets and that's was fabulous.. The pizza was just average. Nice wine list.

Came here three times in total the past two years. And they do not disappoint! We ordered 1) steak 2) sea food pasta.  Boy they were delicious. The service team is also very attentive and helpful. Highly recommended
Flavor! Good service, family friendly ambiance.. I tried the lamb with risotto... Fantastic!.. Good wine list..
We were in town for a work seminar.  We chose this location based off the reviews on Yelp. I'm so glad we ate here!  The food was authentic Italian with a real family atmosphere!

This is old-school Italian, not the type of modern, dainty Italian we Chicagoans have been introduced to with all the new Italian places popping up in the city. Portions are huge and flavors unapologetic, frantic action and loud dining rooms.  We started with the calamari, which was just mediocre - it was greasy, stringy and the coating struggled to stay on the calamari. The sauces that accompanied it were forgettable. For entrees we got the seafood pasta and bolognese with spinach linguini. Upon seeing the dishes we realized we should've all gotten appetizer portions as these were humongous. The flavors of the seafood pasta were decent, with a generous supply of crab meat in the sauce and shrimps & scallops. But it was so rich I had to finish it in 3 meals. Consider yourself warned.

I'm in love with this place. It's the BEST! I'm a big fan of Italian food and I'm also a big fan of old-school Italian restaurants that do things the right way. Volare checks all the boxes and scratches me, right where I itch! Their calamari is fantastic. Their house-made pastas are amazing, as are the sauces with which they're paired. The desserts are wonderful and they have an excellent selection of wines, beers and cocktails. The service is absolutely stellar. Everyone from the bartenders and waitstaff, to the cooks and bussers are helpful, friendly and work together like a well-oiled machine.  I make it a point to eat at Volare at least one time, every time I visit Chicago.

came here because I felt like some Italian and it's pretty close to my hotel.  it also had really good reviews so win win. we sat at the bar because the game was on.  I prefer the bar at restaurants anyways.  it makes me feel like a more relaxing setting instead of formal. - squid ink seafood - it came with shrimp and scallops.  the flavoring was good but the noodles were a little bit hard.  I wish they cooked it a bit more - linguini Alfredo with chicken - again, the noodles were a bit hard.  the Alfredo wasn't that great.  the chicken was good. * the fact that the noodles were a bit harder than it should be made both the dishes not good. - eggplant Parmesan - the only thing I liked here.  they wrapped the eggplant in some cheese and had marinara sauce and Parmesan poured over it. very good. highly recommended!  I liked the fact that they did half or full orders.  full orders are way too big and you won't be able to try different pastas unless you go in a huge group.   overall, this place was okay
Excellent!!!  The food was creative and fresh.  They prepared for me a olive oil sauce with square noodles and fresh veggies. I will be back. Our server was Shirley. And she was great

After a late morning stroll at the navy pier, my husband and I decided to treat ourselves to an Italian treat.  There were at least a dozen of lunch options I would had been more than happy to order. But squid ink pasta in seafood rose sauce? I couldn't resist!  Hands down the best authentic pasta probably of my life! My squid ink pasta was cooked to perfection. The rose sauce was folded with real crab meat. Loaded with giant scallop, shrimp, and squid! Portion was beyond generous! I couldn't believe this dish was only $15!  Meat Lasagna - Rich, decadent classic! Straight from the oven with layers of melted, gooey, yummy cheese. The tomato sauce added the perfect acidity. Another winning choice!  Overall - hands down one of the best classics ever. The reason I'm craving Italians all the time!

Nice affordable italian restaurant!  The accommodated me for my b-day, and I brought in a cake.... We had the calamari for an appetizer, which easily fed 5 people til dinner. There moscato is also very flavorful.  I had the filet mignon special on halloween, it came with a spinach souffle and a double baked potato, which was really rich.  The steak was superb, very tender and it was actually two 6 or 7 ounce pieces which I thought was great for the price.  My friend had a spaghetti dish which seems to be really popular, and I saw why, this dish was really good with thicker spaghetti noodles than usual.I can't wait to go back and try the other pasta dishes.

I personally would want to give this restaurant 3 stars, but I am adding on a star for two reasons: my friend really liked it and our server Blanche. This meal was less than ideal. There was a couple sitting behind us that was arguing non-stop (well, she was just demeaning him non-stop while he said nothing in return). While one part of me was into the drama, the other was disturbed and just wanted a quiet meal with my friend. Oh well, this is not the restaurant's fault by any means; I guess I am just adding some detail to the setting. We both got glasses of wine and started off with a half order of calamari, which was plenty for both of us. It didn't taste as good as it looked, but we will overlook that for now. I wanted to order the Papardelle, but since my friend was getting that, I opted for Fettuccine Bolognese instead. Not a great choice on my end, and after a couple of bites, I do something I hardly ever do, but I requested to exchange my meal for something else. Our server Blanche was extremely understanding. She asked why, offered a solution, but when she realized that I simply didn't like it, she took it back and brought a menu for me to mull the alternatives. Of course, to make matters worse, I spill an entire glass of water while looking at the menu. Blanche, without batting an eye, quickly offers us another table. I am embarrassed to cause such a hassle, but she says, "I want you to be comfortable." I opt for something basic that wasn't on the menu, and she makes it happen. We order dessert: I forget the name, but a sort of mini lemon pie. It had a strange aftertaste that I wasn't accustomed to, but my friend really liked it.  So, all in all, the experience was less than perfect, but a good portion was not the restaurant's fault. I still personally would not return simply because the food failed to impress me, but I cannot speak highly enough of Blanche. She is excellent at what she does, and she is the main reason I wanted to write this review.
Awesome food and service. Chicken parmesan with bolognese was incredible as was the ministroni soup. Will be back next time I'm in Chicago.

Hands down best Italian restaurant in the city. I'm confident in saying that because 1. I've been to the vast majority of Italian restaurants in the city 2. I'm Italian 3. I've been eating here since my family starting having dinners here starting over 15 years ago (and they only dine at less than a handful of places other than my Nonna's table). You won't go wrong in anything you order here. My personal favorites are the gnocchi (pillows of heaven in your mouth) and the grilled calamari!

Popped in on a whim based on all the four and five star reviews and was not disappointed! I had the seafood risotto which was AMAZING - full of fresh shellfish and very flavourful. My friend had the gnocchi, which was pillowy soft and almost as good. Prices were quite reasonable given the quality of the food. Thankfully we did not order an appetizer because the portions were large, and we definitely did not have room for dessert. Ambiance was old school and slightly stuffy, but service was great and I'd definitely go back for the food!
Been here twice and both times very good. Most recently had the veal Milanese which was tender and delicious with a perfect lemony sauce. Will return.

I came with a friend for lunch and it was a dimly lit, cozy atmosphere. The service was great! We got seated right away and the waiter was nice.  My friend ordered gnocchi with vodka sauce and I ordered the famous black spaghetti. I tried some of my friend's gnocchi and it was good, and the sauce was smooth and creamy! I didn't like the black spaghetti as much... There were only 2 pieces of shrimp, 2 pieces of scallop, and the crab meat was mixed in the sauce. The sauce was way too salty for me. It seemed like they dumped a cup of salt in mine. I was excited about the black spaghetti as it had many good reviews, but it was a bit disappointing that it was so salty. Maybe it was just too salty today?
They make the best gnocchi! Love this place!
Outstanding service and good food. Went twice on my recent visit, really enjoyed our server on both nights Raffe (sp).

Phenomenal! This is good Italian food. I could just tell from the pizza bread that it was going to be good. Bruschetta was perfect made. Gnocchi on point and my hubby got the risotto with 4 cheese sauce, both were so good. We will be back for sure. Can't wait to try more. Service was good too, even if it wasn't food would be deserving of a 5star review

My favorite lunch place in Chicago. Great value on the luncheon menu, black pasta with seafood, sausage and pasta, whitefish are all favorites. Decent wines by the glass list for lunch. Always knowledgeable wait staff, great value.

I'd give 2.5 stars if I could...somewhere between meh, I've had better and A-OK. Based on yelp reviews,  had high expectations, but they weren't met.  We had lasagna, chicken parm, meatballs, and volare salad. Meatballs had very nice flavor, and lasagna also had a nice flavor, although I have had better. Chicken parm was tender but underseasoned.  Red sauce accompanying all dishes was bland and somewhat flavorless. Salad was good, but the dressing lacked sufficient vinegar/seasoning.  Overall, just ok.  Food needs some kick. Suggest more garlic and italian seasonings, salt, red pepper etc. I don't think I'd go back as there are better options out there.
Excellent service. Made special dietary accommodations. Food was fresh and excellent.

First time here for food - went on sat for a restaurant week lunch with the wife, MIL and baby. Crowded, but service was fine, even responsive. Food portions were large, and the manager was very kind, taking the time to offer tastes of different wines were were considering and offered to correct a mistake (we just kept the wine that was first served).  In spite of the large crowd all the food came out promptly and was remarkably good.   Worth returning ...

Cool restaurant, very popular and very busy! Make reservations! The portions were generous and everything was good. The service is amazing! All the locals say this is the Italian restaurant you want to go to and they were right! We tried a lot of the dishes but the lasagna and the mezzi rigatoni were my favorites, although the risotto is the most popular dish at the restaurant. Excellent tiramisu for dessert!
Monica, our bartender/waitress was amazing.  She suggested the best food and was interesting to talk to.

We made reservations but after sitting at the bar and drinking a glass of wine we decided to stay there so we could watch all of the action. Wow, the place was busy. We had bread and oil with fresh Parmesan cheese while waiting for our shrimp appetizer. For our main course we had Chilean sea bass, and tiramisu for dessert. All of the food was awesome!  The bartender was very attentive and wait staff friendly and helpful. We loved this place. Food was awesome and staff were great. We will definitely be back.

Delicious excellent food! Love the black spaghetti, roasted beet salad & bruschetta. This is my second time here and a must when visiting Chicago. Highly recommend making reservations but still expect to spend a little time here. Worth the time and the money! Great service.

The lasagna was AMAZING. My friend and I each ordered a 1/2 portion and it was more than enough to fill up. The Italian Margarita was perfect. Tiramisu was creamy and a perfect ending to a perfect meal. The meal was well worth the 30 minute wait. Make reservations if you are in a hurry. From the hostess to the waitstaff everyone was very attentive and welcoming.

Simply the best. I haven't had Italian food this fantastic in a decade. The lasagna was incredible, they specialize in Veal and can prepare anyway you like (my wife requested the Veal Marsala which wasn't on the menu and it wasn't an issue at all). Prices are extremely reasonable, although their liquor prices were pretty steep (I am used to paying $8-10 for a midrange bourbon i.e. Basil Hayden, and it was $15).

Visited Volare in the summer. The atmosphere had a very high energy. The place was packed. The service was good, very efficient, quick and attentive. However, I've had great italian food in my life (including in Italy) and this just wasn't it. I had the special that day which was Sea Bass with a coconut cream. One of family members thought hers was good, so not sure if it was just mine that didn't come out good. But it was way overcooked, chewy like chicken, and not the melt in your mouth Sea Bass that you would expect from a fine establishment as this. Not sure if i would go back on my own, but would give another try if someone asked to go.

Great dining experience at Volare. Paul was our waiter and we highly recommend requesting him. He was friendly, knowledgeable and accommodating. The food was incredible. Appetizers included oysters, king crab legs and bruschetta - all delicious. The specials we ordered were chilean sea bass and beef tenderloin.  Can you say amazing? Service was great. Drinks were refilled instantly and the atmosphere and staff were so friendly. Thanks for a wonderful dinner.

My husband and I stopped in for a quick lunch today. The waiter was very nice and professional. The food was okay. I based myself on what seemed to be the most popular menu items. I ordered the gnocchi in vodka sauce and my husband had the black spaghetti. Neither were what we expected. It wasn't terrible but it wasn't great either.
Too much salt on pizza, but salt distribution on black spaghetti was perfect. Actually the black spaghetti was one of the best Italian dishes I've ever had.

The food was fantastic! I ate the seafood with spinach pasta and spicy red sauce, and my wife had the veal cannelloni special. Both were delicious. What really made the evening special though was the attention and kindness shown by the staff. I highly recommend Volare for a nice date night or with friends. And thank you Michael for such great service!
If you love Italian ,this is the place to visit!!!  Very busy so recommend reservations.  Staff very friendly.

Awesome service and friendly staff! Had a group of 10 of us and the waiter was so patient and friendly with us all. We started with bruschetta and calamari which were both good. I had the gnocchi alla vodka, it was okay but I thought with all the hype it would of been way better. My husband had the spaghetti neri al peace which was really good! We all tried all the desserts..the ones we all enjoyed were the praline, tiramisu and key lime pie. The mango martini is a must try, I loved it!
Well I thought it was gonna be great. But everything I wanted had a mixture of pork. That sucks. Meatballs with pork -  letta me tell ya how to do it better!!! No pork in the meatballs!!!!
Simply put: the best Italian food downtown. I know that's a big statement for Chicago but just go into this old school gem and try their Spaghetti Caprese. Then talk to me.

Ya know what makes this place special? Though it's my first time here I feel like I've been here a million times. Service is excellent. Food is impeccable. We made a reservation and it was honored promptly. We had a large group and the way they took care of us, you knew they were pros here. Just excellent experience all the way around. Highly recommend Food: 5/5 Service: 5/5 Venue: 5/5

Authentic Italian food! The food was extremely fresh, we had a party of 11 and they seated us immediately and the service was impeccable! Salvatore our server was great! Would definitely recommend this place and definitely going back!

Referred by the hotel and we got exactly what we expected; traditional family run Italian restaurant. Greeted warmly and seated promptly, staff was helpful and knew his menu and specials. The pasta and pizza dough made fresh in house. We were all pleased with very traditional selections. Deserts small but good.

Had to sit outside due to restaurant being overbooked by 15 reservations. Water glass had mark on it, was exchanged by waiter. Ordered a bottle of wine, took two sips from glass when bug fell in to the glass. Mentioned this more than once to the waiter, and was ignored. I went inside and asked the hostess if we could be moved inside due to there being a bug inside my wine glass, and well as by my sliverware and waterglass. Was flat out told no by the restaurant manager who was at the hostess stand, because he was overbooked. (How this was my problem, I don't know.) Went back outside and told the waiter to cancel my order, was not asked why, or offered anything at all. Not even a complementary dessert. I had to tell the waiter that I wasn't going to pay for wine that I didn't even drink.  At one point a hostess (I believe, she didn't say), asked if everything was okay. Told her no, and that I could at least get a glass of wine in place of my ruined one, and comp the inital bottle of wine for us. She had to "check with the owner first". A waiter who was not serving us, did say sorry for the issue, and said that if he was able to do something he would have. (Only person working there who aplogized, or even offered, without being told to.)  Wine bottle was taken off of bill, but staff was still petty enough to charge me $4.00 for the salad.  Horrible management, horrible staff, not that great food. (My friend did mention that to me.)  Will NEVER reccomend this place!  Zero Stars.

A little bit of Italy in streeterville.  This is a little bit off the main restaurant area but excellent food.  I have never had a dish I didn't like.  It does get extremely busy so you will want to call ahead and get your name on the list.  The last time we were there it took a while for the food to come out.

I found this place through Yelp, made a reservation, and brought my mom here. From the moment we walked in the door, we could see this place was hoppin! There were waiters running here and there with delicious looking dishes... We could tell they weren't messing around!  We were seated just a couple minutes after we showed up and served bread immediately. Our waitress had a large table near us and wasn't able to take our drink orders for almost 10 minutes, booo.  We each ordered and appetizer and shared a main course. It was more than enough food for the two of us. For our entree, we split one of the daily specials, the sea bass which we later found out was $39.... Wow!  We really enjoyed our food. The atmosphere was a bit loud, and the service was a tad spotty to begin with, but I am sure I will be back to try one of their signature pasta dishes in the future!

Came in for lunch one afternoon and the food was outstanding.  Had the caprese salad, omg...the mozzarella was super fresh, and the gnocchi (which I didn't antipate eating the whole thing) only because it was so good I couldn't stop

Another time of me wishing Yelp offered half stars as I would've given this one 3.5. First, the good. The staff was friendly, extensive wine list, lovely atmosphere and old school vibe. The menu offers a lot of variety at affordable prices. We started with a house salad (good, not great) and then took our waitress's recommendation on the risotto and the seafood black spaghetti. I am a huge risotto fan and was very disappointed when my dish arrived. It lacked character and richness and was, quite honestly, bland. The other dish was orders as a half order and when it came out I commented to the waitress that it seemed large for a half order. She then told us that we didn't order half... Although, our table heard it ordered as a half. She didn't offer to fix it and still charged us for the whole. Not surprisingly, half of it was left on the plate ;) I only had a few bites of my dining companion's dish, but I didn't care for it at all. Tasted way too fishy to me! He didn't care for it, either. After reading so many wonderful reviews, our expectations were set high. We walked away disappointed with our meals, but happy we gave it a shot. It's not likely somewhere we will return in the future.

This is the first but certainly not the last time we're coming here! Wow-we not only ordered 3 different things but every one was as outstanding as the other. The sommelier was honest, straightforward & led us to the perfect wine. The service was impeccable & the food-OMG!

Heated outdoor seating. Lovely food.  Friendly staff. Reasonable prices. You can't lose. Had the black spaghetti.  I don't know exactly what is in the sauce, but I would straight shot it - so much flavor!

Consistent and authentic Italian food. Friendly servers. Definitely try the grilled seafood, linguine vongole, and black seafood pasta. You will most probably find something on the menu that appeals to you. Complimentary bread. Very crowded during the evenings, so call ahead for reservation. Not as crowded during lunch hours.
Michael was terrific and mixed us up one of the best Bloody Mary's we've had in Chicago.

I'll start off by saying everything was delicous. We made a reservation the day of, arrived on time, waited for a few minutes, passed the time by watching the chefs at the open kitchen, and were lead to our seats. We shared two appetizers, with the Grigliata Mista a clear winner (in my opinion) . It consisted of sea scallops, octopus, and shrimp that was grilled in aged balsamic. Try it! I also got the Veal Zi Teresa with Tortino di Patate (veal smothered in spinach, mushroom, and cheese). The green beans that came alongside it were surprising good. They were of a vivid deep green, infused with flavor, and had a slight crunch still. Samples of two shared desserts later and I am very satisfied.

Omg. Old school. I mean, real Old school. And I don't just mean the restaurant. And the menu. I mean the patrons. And their money. Very old. OK, maybe some of it is new, but they make it look old. The Polo sweaters. The Hermes scarves. The well-coiffed heads (men & women). The grey hair (men and women). They don't make restaurants like this anymore. Why is this place packed early Wednesday evening? If they party midweek, what do they do on the weekend? (Go away, probably). Well, there's a place at the bar. I think I'll take it. And order a martini. A couple of shakes and it's mine. Not made with care, but can't ruin Ketel One, I say. Some may disagree. Bartender is very professional, not at all personable. That's OK, he's really busy. Get me my grub and I'm OK. And he does. Spaghetti in marinara sauce--simple and delicious. Veal medallions in lemon sauce--could not be better. Forgot to order tiramisu. Maybe next time. I could like this place. Except the bar area is stuffed to overflowing, and people want my seat. Not for themselves, for their dates. I can feel it. I pay my check and leave. Volare, oh oh  Cantare, oh oh oh oh  Let's fly way up to the clouds  Away from the maddening crowds...

This was the best meal I had in Chicago when visiting for the week.  Excellent customer service, great food, and great wine. I had the linguine with clams and wife had the seafood black spaghetti.  We also shared calamari, salad, and clam chowder.  Seafood black spaghetti was one of the best italian dishes I've ever had in my life, I would go back every week to eat this if I lived in Chicago.  Get it. Also, the manager/owner that seated us and checked in on us from time to time was awesome.

I was in Chicago for a conference and came here with a large group of my colleagues.  I love Italian food, and was curious about the black pasta dish.  OMG - it was soo good!!  It's just as good as everyone says it is.  The wait staff was very attentive, even with a big group likes ours.  By the time we left, the place was packed with a line out the door.  I'd definitely come back if I'm ever in Chicago again.

We loved it! We are traveling with 2 kids (8 and 10) and although they were the only children, the waitstaff was wonderfully accommodating. Pollo Arrosto, side of meatballs Polpete, house salad, wine, (kids split the penne), Spaghetti Neri al Pesce = all perfect! So happy we came here- highly recommend!!

Had my birthday dinner here and it was amazing. Each of the dishes we ordered were perfectly cooked and seasoned. Tasted like a homecooked Italian meal. Their wine list goes on and on and the waiter was eager to help us pick which ones would go best with our entrees.

1 star for noise level. 5 stars for food and service In spite of the place being packed, and not having a reservation, we were seated within 15 minutes. The food was excellent.    Service was great. But, the noise level was awful.  My wife and I had to shout across the small table to hear each other.  Hence 3 stars instead of 5. What is it with such restaurants?  It's not difficult to reduce noise levels.  Call an interior designer! I highly recommend going to Volare when it is not busy.

Nice neighborhood feel in the city on a Friday night at the bar. dinner Monday was full as well. the lasagna unique flavor grows on you and the sea food risotto was very tasty. salad was ho hum. desert looked good but I passed on it.

Good, traditional Italian-American. We had an early family dinner. Good service and accommodating to the kids. Watching them set up for dinner service showed attention to detail. The Volate salad was fresh, but the flavor was milder than I expected. Chicken Parm was well prepared (crispy under the cheese). Wife said she liked the ravioli.

3 stars for dessert...5 star for food! Outdoor heated seating is nice & romantic. Desserts range from $3.50-$5, not that great..i can get better tasting dessert at whole foods down the street.. Tirumisu ($6) - eh, i have had better tirumisu...i have made better tirumisu... Lemon tart ($3.50) - my friend had this and was not impressed.. Customer service was not great this time around.. I think it depends on who your waiter is... I would still go back here for pasta, but not for drinks & dessert!

A great experience. Started with a drink at the bar and then moved to our table. The waiter made recommendations and I went with Veal Parm. It was unbelievable. The side of spaghetti that came with it was amazing as well. The others joining me ordered the Black Spaghetti, Gnocchi and the Half Chicken. They all agreed that the food was amazing along with the entire experience.  I will visit this spot every time I am in Chicago.

Excellent place to get a great meal.  Sea Bass was really good.  My wife had the chicken Parmesan and was very pleased. This the second time we've eaten there and would recommend to anyone wanting a nice meal close to the miracle mile. It's close to the hop on hop off stop

Excellent choice for Italian food. They were running very behind the night we were there but they worked their tails off to move people and get them seated once the large party finally left.  We had the warm kale salad, sausages and peppers, the gnocchi and the black spaghetti with seafood. All Were well executed and tasty. Service was prompt and timely.

Bravo, Bravo, Bravo.  That is all I have to say!  As we were walking down the Magnificent Mile in Chicago I called Volare at 9:15pm on a Saturday night to see if I needed a reservation for a party of four. After 3 rings, the pleasant voice on the other end that answered said that she would reserve us a table for four at 9:45pm.  PERFECT!  We were a mere 7 minute walk so we headed that way. Upon arrival, a gentleman in a fine tailored grey suit with a pinky ring (the owner??) Greeted us at the front door and seated us IMMEDIATELY.  Here we go, off to a great start. Let me start by saying that the service was awesome.  Our server was on his game.  He was extremely professional with the right amount of personal touch.  The food was outstanding.  Started with calamari then we jumped into our entrees. The pasta was scrumptious and I ordered the "special" which was lobster stuffed ravioli. Excellent!  Can't wait to come back to Volare next time I'm in the windy city.  Oh, by the way...upon leaving the restaurant after a great meal, that same gentleman in the grey suit personally thanked us for coming.  Nice touch.  Bravo!

Had dinner at Volare, and it was really good!  Our server, Alex (Alexandra?) was excellent, very personable, greeted us quickly, checked on us at the appropriate times, and let us know about the specials and made good recommendations.  Even the sommelier was great, he visited the table not only at the beginning of the meal but also to see how we liked our wine(s).  We split a bottle of prosecco, and I had a glass of Montelpuciano (which I'd never had before), which was very good, I waited to have it with my pasta.  We started off with the warm kale salad, which was excellent!  It had little crispy pieces of pancetta, prosciutto, chick peas, and white beans, with some thin slices of gradano cheese and and excellent dressing, not too heavy at all, it was one of the better salads I've had.  And Alex even split it for us right at the table.  For our entrees, my wife had the spinach fettuccine bolognese, a half order (thank you for allowing half orders!), which was very good, and even the half order was plenty for her.  She  added a side of meatballs, and the meatballs were also sizable and very tasty, with a delicious red sauce.  Not too garlicky but very flavorful.  I had the pappardelle pomdoro, and the pasta was very fresh tasting and excellent, as was the sauce, which was just the right balance of salty and sweet (not too sweet at all), and sauced in just the right proportion.  The noodle held up really well to twisting it on my spoon.  Fresh, hot, delicious!  I added chicken to my entree, and it was also very good, had a nice char taste on the outside but was thinly sliced so as not to overwhelm the dish.  Really good.  And somehow I saved room for dessert, the tiramisu was excellent, as was the coffee.  Just an excellent meal overall.  I noticed all the staff were great, the manager stopped by our table to see how we were enjoying our dining experience, the other servers were also very personable.  And as if the food and service quality weren't enough of a positive, I was amazed at how reasonably priced the food and wine were.  What a great value for this high level of food and service!  We'll definitely return here when in Chicago.

The hostess quoted us an hour wait so we walked around the neighborhood for 30 minutes. When we came back to check on the status she told us she called us "a long time ago" so she took the name off the list.

Every time we go to Chicago we make sure to have a meal here. If the weather is nice when you make your reservation, ask for an outdoor table. This place is right off of Michigan Avenue, but the prices are not extravagant. In fact, for the area, I think they are very reasonable. Every meal we have had here has been delicious, and the manager, or perhaps he is the owner, greets you and lets you know that you are welcome. I highly recommend this place.

Now every time I am in Chicago, I have to go back to Volare. Amazingly delicious Italian food, and great service. Our party of 6 loved everything we had, including the wine that the sommelier recommended for us - a wine not on the wine list! If you want a good wine pairing, definitely ask for suggestions!

Been here 4 times. The one item that I keep ordering every single item is the Neri Al Pesce. The black pasta, scallops, crab, cheese and whatever else it, makes it amazing. Also tried the calamari (mmm yummy squid), bruschetta (good portions given for this). The Pollo Parmigiana is decent. Go for the Pollo Arrosto, it's good. The waiter might say that it takes 40min to make it, but trust me, everything here takes 30min to prepare (during dinner time). So might as well go for the good one. The drinks were brilliant. Got the Bloody Margarita: it's sweet with a good alcohol flavor, and the Esthymere Flower (forgot the name): this one has a "sweet odor" and with a strong alcohol whiff. The ambiance is nice. Their bread.. oh their bread... so warm and soft. They give you 2 types of bread: plain and tomato bread. I always end up getting 3 baskets each time and finish half a bottle of Olive Oil hah. Excellent Italian restaurant overall. Will be back for a 5th time!

Voooooooooolare! (Sorry I always sing it in my head when I think of the place.) Friendly and attentive staff? Check. Romantic and clean environment? Check. Great wine list? Check. I've been eating Volare for 3 years now and nothing comes close to their beef carpaccio and risotto. You know when you were younger and your mom used to cook you your favorite meal? You could eat it every day in mass amounts (if only she could cook that much)? This is what Volare is to me. It tastes like a delicious home cooked meal.  I often get take out too - and their quality is not compromised. Always fresh and same deliciousness.  Writing this post has got me hungry for Volare now....
Amazing Italian homemade pasta! You can order half orders to try different dishes! King crab is sweet and succulent! Very happy staff and great service!

Three words. A. Maz. Ing!! Hats off to Bennie & Johnny (and my long lost brother Jeff) !  The absolute best, friendliest staff ever! Word, of advice, just eat wheat ever they bring to the table, its ALL good! I had the specials and they were wonderful!!!!

Every time my husband and I visit the mainland we look for good Italian food (which we always hold to NY Italian standards). This place delivered and then some! We had two half orders of seafood appetizers- half orders are plenty big- and they were cooked and seasoned to perfection. I had the lemon veal medallions; they were tender and flavorful! For dessert I had the cannoli even though I was already pretty full, but it was very good, light and fluffy. Service was excellent as well. A++

Came here on a Thursday evening it was pretty busy but was seated shortly after ordering a drink at the bar. For appetizer order the Salsiccia e Pepperoni, Basically sausage and peppers and it was probably the best sausage I've ever tasted had such great flavor and the peppers gave it an extra kick.  Really enjoyed them. Main course I had a Ravioli di Ricotta and a side of meatballs. The ravioli weren't as filled with Ricotta as I would've liked but still had great flavor.  And the Meatballs were too die for.  The waiter was friendly ensured my drink was constantly refilled.  Will def come  again soon.
Great service and food!  Have been here several times and never disappoints.  The clams and linguine (white sauce) is fantastic.  Highly recommend - very authentic Italian food.
Excellent service!!  The food was awesome had the gnocchi in vodka sauce and the lamb was excellent as well!!
I ordered the roasted chicken. It took 30 minutes but it was worth it. I also ordered the minestrone soup. Everything was exquisite. Unlimited refills. Wasn't crowded and they seated us immediately.

The chief bus boy makes the entire evening! My friend and I stumbled upon Volare while seeking refuge from retail therapy. Adorable outdoor dining, impeccable service and a menu that inspires.  Make sure to order the salad with Brussels sprouts and butternut squash. Divine!! The homemade Tirimusu with cappuccino caused my eyes to water

Amazing cuisine, service, atmosphere. The baked clam appetizer was fresh and delicious! I ordered the "Relax" Riesling and it was the best tasting white wine I have ever had! My main entree was the Zupa di Mare complete with mussels, clams, octopus, squid, shrimp, and scallops. The risotto's texture was just as risotto should've been...sticky and packed full of all the flavors of the dish! To finish...I ordered their signature Tiramisu with a decaf cappuccino...Mouth watering!! My service at the bar was impeccable! Even the owner made conversation. The atmosphere was warm and inviting. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone in the future!

This was my first time at Volare and I must say everything was moto biene! The service was excellent and the food was great! They use very fresh ingredients and their portion sizes are big! The owner takes time to get to know every customer and he is an amazing man.

Great food as mentioned in other reviews black squid ink seafood pasta is stunning. The bolognese sauce was delicious and the gnocchi was so light!! Because it's made out of ricotta not potato. Great!! Panna cotta available for desert always a win win for me as it's hard to find. Reasonable valet allowed us to attend theatre nearby and retrieve car b4 11. Good friendly service from michael too

This is a hidden gem in the mist of the concrete jungle of downtown Chicago. This is one of the best...hands down. Our server, Blanch, made great suggestions and we loved them all...from the bottle of Verso Rosso, to the app, to dinner. It was my birthday and were running late to see a show (only because the food was so good, we were taking our time and lost track) so we had to rush out of there and Blanch was very sorry to see us leave so quickly as she had a dessert planned for me (we didn't tell, but she did notice the birthday bag that was hidden under the table). Very attentive and very sweet. Go here to eat, you will not be disappointed.

This was my first time going to Volare and I loved it! The food is Excellent! Good size Portions. The Staff are friendly and the Service is really good! And the prices are quit reasonable. Very authentic Italian cuisine. The owner Benny is very hands on and it was so nice to see an owner of a busy restaurant working as hard as his staff. I look forward to coming back here.
Excellent dinner and Raphael is the best server! Love the atmosphere and especially the patio!

Awesome food and great service. We came here based on some reviews on Yelp. The bread is amazing. The sandwiches are very nicely done. I wish I had the meatballs too, but I was full. The lunch portions are more than enough.

We went on a Tuesday night and that place was packed!! And for good reason! The food was fabulous.  I had the black spaghetti with seafood, calamari appetizer and tiramisu for dessert.  The tiramisu was only ok, a little too wet.  The coffee was great (very picky about coffee). My husband had salmon and there was a nice portion of if, done perfectly. Others at the table had the seafood special, which was linguini with shrimp and they enjoyed it. Very good wine list and the service was great.  The staff was friendly and attentive without overly so.  Would highly recommend.  The prices are decent for that area.  Will definitely return.

This is old-school Italian. The lasagna was fabulous.  Rissotto de Mare needed work.  The shrimp were dried out, the mussels were sandy, but the calamari were cooked properly.  Service was good, they have a nice wine list.  I will go back, but skip the seafood.

Very nice spot.  I've eaten here 3 times so far and every experience has been great.  Top class service, good food, nice surroundings.   It's more American than Italian IMO.  But couldn't complain about a single dish.  We may have been there off-peak, but we never waited to be seated.  I enjoyed it thoroughly.  The combination of decor, service and attentiveness made me feel like I was eating in a much more upscale restaurant than I paid for.

Wow... After a crazy day Volare was just what we needed. It was perfect. Incredible service. Delicious bread, pasta and seafood. We arrived during the dinner rush and was seated in 10 minutes. We were in and out in about an hour but never once felt rushed. Management came to our table to check in about our perfectly-portioned meals.  We got caught in a thunderstorm as we were leaving but Volare impressed us again. Hostesses were in and out of the rain calling cabs for their diners-- talk about going above and beyond! We're only in Chicago for a few days but I have a feeling we'll be visiting Volare once again!!!

Great food, service, people. Well worth the money. Don't waste money on a super trendy, uber expensive, bullshit fusion whatever restaurant. Go get a great meal from some people who make you believe they care about what they put in front of you. Only reason I didn't give five stars is because it took a little longer for our main course than I expected. Just gave me a little extra time to enjoy some of the great wines they have available.

The best service I've ever had! The food is noticeably fresh and they customize the order to make each customer satisfied completely. We made a reservation but still had to wait an extra half hour, and I think this was normal for most people because several others were also waiting at the bar for their tables with a reservation as well. But they take good care of you while you wait and the food is worth it. The olive oil at the table itself has a unique taste that is amazing! The Caesar salad I ordered had truffle infused Parmesan cheese that was heavenly. I ordered the vodka sauce gnocchi which was great! I would definitely come here again.

There was just something that I liked about this place, and it made my day. It was a restaurant we didn't plan to go to, but we "winged" it, and I'm glad we did.   My peer and I had just discussed that we prefer not to order pasta, but that we both appreciate an Italian menu with ample meat/fish selections. Voila, we were able to find that here.  In my experience,  it seems to be difficult to find both good food AND good service, simultaneously. Often, I am presented with one or the other. Yet, I was a happy camper during my lunch at Volare.  The hostess greeted us very warmly, with a smile. Also, our server (Nick), was very pleasant  and attentive. He approached us at appropriate times to take orders and to refill drinks. In addition, he was also very quick to acknowledge errors and correct them.  For instance, with a slight order mishap, he promptly and graciously offered complimentary wine for his mistake. It was also nice that he humored us and was willing to joke a little.  I appreciate that type of thing, so major brownie points for Nick. Food was good (we had veal and filet). Wine was good. Not such a fan of orange flavored things,  but otherwise I probably would have loved the cannoli. No complaints.  It was a comfortable little nook for lunch with a loved one.

Although we came during the busy dinner rush, the wait was minimal- maybe 3 minutes.  Our waiter greeted us promptly, and we were served fresh bread by our busser. Throughout the evening both our waiter and busser were very attentive and helpful. GREAT service.  The food here is delicious. We had the lasagna and the seafood risotto. Both were amazing- probably the best risotto I've had, and I am a pretty picky eater. The waiter also recommended and brought me a great wine. We ordered the lemon dessert. It was so good we ordered a second.  We were so happy we stopped who we thought was the manager to give our thanks. Turns out it was the owner, who was extremely kind and personable and brought us a drink on the house as a welcome to Chicago.  The atmosphere is really conducive to a great dinner night. Lots of people and conversation, inviting environment, great food and service.

First night in Chicago and all of us are feeling Italian food so we look whats close to our hotel and we found this. It was pretty empty so we got seated right away and waters came out as we sat down. Menus came as our waiters greated us ( so slow we had 2 waiters) they told us the speicals and soups of the day but instead we ordered a margarita pizza and chicken parm. They had complimentary bread with pil and vinger come to our table which was a little dry and hard for my liking. Once the food came out we dug in and wow i have to say this is the best chicken parm i have had in a while. Chicken was perfect the sauce was very tasty and they didnt over due it on the cheese which is a big plus. The pizza was also very great. Thin style pizza that kept all the cheese and sauce when you take a bite. The servers also where very down to earth. When they figured out we where visitors they told us all the places to go and try out. What the places we should aviod and what hole in the walls we should try.  Great food, great service and a great experience would forsure go back again.

The food was delicous!!! I ordered the grilled squid and octopus appetizer and the roasted chicken.  The seafood appetizer was my favorite, but the chicken was also so deliciously tender too!  No! don't make me choose.  I got to try the black ink pasta and that was super tasty as well.  It was a bit heavy, so I'm glad I only had a bite, but the flavors were still on point!  5 stars to top off the excellent service too!  I couldn't believe how friendly people here are, but then again everybody from chicago are friendly.

Called around 4pm on a Friday to try to get a reservation, they were able to get me and my wife in around 8:30! We stayed at the Sheraton on the canal downtown, which is only a few blocks from Volare, so we decided to hang out and have some drinks for a few hours and then walk over.   When we arrived, we were about 20 minutes early, but we were still seated after only 10 minutes.  Volare was completely full, but still had a relatively quiet and romantic atmosphere.  I ordered us a bottle of Moscato, and we looked over the menu. We decided on their Italian sausage appetizer, served in some sort of sausage broth with roasted peppers.  Super simple, but delicious.  Initially we were going to split a pasta for dinner, but we decided to each order our own pasta instead.  My wife had the ricotta stuffed gnocchi with a vodka sauce, and I went with their black spaghetti with shrimp, scallops, and crab.  The gnocchi a la vodka was very good, we both agreed.  My black spaghetti was awesome as well but my wife isn't a seafood person.   The service throughout dinner was great, we didn't have to ask for anything, plates were bussed quickly, and we were able to just enjoy a great meal and each others company.  Something you might expect from a restaurant like Volare, but the experience is always priceless.

Went in around lunchtime to just grab some tiramisu, which was a great combination of moist and fluffy. I also appreciated the really good service from my server, considering I was spending all of $6.50 on my meal. Based on this brief experience -recommended!

Always my go to Italian restaurant in Chicago. Food is consistently good along with some great hospitality from the staff. This trip I took my 7&9 year old boys and the staff treated them like kings and we had a great meal. Be sure to make reservations on the weekends because this place gets packed.

Really a 4.5. Dinner and service were excellent. At the table was ravioli, rigatoni, lasagne and risotto. All meals were excellent. Sommelier was fantastic and ensured each of us had a great glass of wine (or two). All agree we would return, similar to the table next to us.

Love this place because of the food.  The wait is a bit of a pain but it's worth it for the quality of the food. They have valet and I have met the owner a couple of times just a gentleman.  Great romantic dinner spot it's a little crowded because it's a small place but it has that New York Italian style feel to it. Recommend for even special occasions like birthdays and special weekends. Great wine list and service is decent.  It's a great destination spot if your driving in.

Not only is this my favorite restaurant in Chicago. This is the place I send all out of town guests for a taste of Chicago-style great neighborhood restaurants, great Italian food and super service. John and Paula and their host/greeter team make you feel special even when they are rolling out new tables to accomodate an overflow crowd. The wait staff is experienced, knowledgable, unfailingly nice and mos have been with Volare for years.  I loved when it was a best kept secret restaurant, thrilled for them that Streeterville residents and out-of-town conventioners alike know Volare is Amore.
Stopped in for lunch, the Margherita pizza was Disappointing the sauce was canned at best, should have ordered the sandwich.

Good wine section. Chicken and veal Parm are my benchmark for Italian restaurants and are extremely well done here. The only drawback is that I probably would try anything else here because the Parms are so good!

I've always had a hard time getting a res here.  But we succeeded on July 4 weekend.  Menu was varied and had a lot of old favorites.  Also two risottos, which I really like.  Had the 4 cheese and chicken risotto and it was outstanding.  My wife enjoyed the Veal Picatta.  Good wine list strong on Tuscan choices.  Very good Carpinetto Chianti at a reasonable price.  Excellent waiter.  Owner was buzzing around the place [which is pretty big] and stopped by to ask how we enjoyed the dinner.  Could not ask for more.  We will be back regularly.
Go for the food but order a Blood Orange Margarita! Unless you have a huge appetite, you could split an appetizer, entree, and dessert. Each portion is large.

Came here for a colłege reunion, we had a very large party of over 30, they were very accommodating and had excellent service and servers.  I had the mushroom pasta, yummy homemade with various mushrooms and a strong porcini flavor.  Salads are fresh and delicious - had the Caesar.  Friends had the special, fresh halibut in a lemon jus, fresh veg, very memorable.  A few of us stayed longer and enjoyed a bottle of Italian wine, they have an extensive and beautiful wine list, our server in the bar was very helpful and hospitable as was our table servers. Great ambiance and decor, what a great restaurant.
I have been to Volare before but must say the food quality has fallen apart. We shared a few dishes, all were poorly prepared and bland. Do not know what caused the drop off but I will never go back.

Wonderful atmosphere. So wonderful to hear Italian in an Italian place. Salmon wonderful perfectly cooked. Portion so large could not finish. Bread warm staff attentive but not obtrusive. Nice wine nice prices. As a visitor you never know what to expect. I definitely recommend this place!

We walked in and the hostess told us there would be an hour wait. We were walking out, and the owner stopped us and showed us what table immediately. He said, "don't worry. I own this restaurant". His kind gesture made the  evening.it  is easy to see how this is such a highly rated restaurant. The service was amazing. The food was perfect. I highly recommend this restaurant.

Our party of six had a wonderful dinner here. Our waiter, Rapheal was a pro! Sat at the bar while waiting for our table, bartender provided great service even though they were slammed . Calamari was divine.

One of the best Italian restaurants I have been to yet! Friendly staff, amazing service and beautiful atmosphere. Very traditional and wholesome Italian food  We got, and I recommend the gnocchi ala vodka or the filet mignon.
Went here for dinner with some friends, such fantastic food and service!  The lasagna was to die for, (I stole a bite, and another and another) but everything we had was fantastic! Go here!

Let's start of by saying my husband and myself had a date night all planed out. We've walked by this place a couple of times in downtown and we had been wanting to try it. We called and made reservations at 9 pm which is the earliest that they had available. The lady that took the reservation was so rude over the phone. I took at as they were extremely busy (I should've just taken the hint that they're service was horrible from the start). We ended up there 15 minutes early and it was packed just how I imagined. The lady told us to get comfortable, get a drink and they would call us as soon as our table was ready. 9 came around still nothing. We did see them sitting people but they weren't calling us. At 9:05 I told my husband to go and check. They told him to give them a couple more minutes..in the meantime we asked for the menu. We were busy looking at the menu and talking about how our day went. When we realized there was barely people in the waiting area. 9:10 rolls around, 9:15, still nothing. We saw a family and two couples come in. We asked again and all they said was that they would have a table ready for us in a few minutes. Another couple comes in, they get asked if they have reservations, they said no. We see the family and one of the couples get seated. We started getting frustrated. 9:25 an old guy comes and gets the couple that had just walked in and seated them right away. I got pissed as soon as I saw this. I asked the lady if the old man was the manager or if I could speak to whoever was in charge. She told me that he was the owner. Wow!! An owner handling his business like that. I told her I wanted to talk to him immediately. She disappeared and he appeared out of nowhere taking us to a table that had been empty for quite some time. I had lost my appetite by that point. All I wanted was to give him a piece of my mind. He then proceeded to apologize saying that we had just been skipped through the system. Really?! It's not like we didn't ask multiple times about our table. After finally seating us down we still waited for our waitress 10 whole minutes. The old man kept on checking up on us and apologizing. He ended up giving us our whole meal for free. For that I give him props how he handled his mistake. What I can't forgive is how rude and disrespectful they were. Now, putting all that aside the food was mediocre. Not real Italian by any means. We tried various dishes since they were sent to us from the owner. We talked to one of the waiters who saw everything that happened. All he said was he would've never waited to long for a table and that we should've just gone to a steakhouse down the street but that he gave us props for our patience.  1. If you like rude customer service  2. Your reservations not being honored  3. Like feeling discriminated 4. Mediocre food Then by all means this is the place for you! Thanks for ruining and wasting out night Volare!

This was some of the best Italian I have ever had.  We had to get it to go since we had a three year old with us who had had a very long day, but I was still amazed.  My mom got the pappardelle and I got the rigatoni arrabbiata.  Absolutely delicious!  The pasta tasted so fresh and was cooked the perfect al dente.

I've been here 30+ times in the last 2 years and count it as my favorite overall Italian restaurant in the city. The atmosphere, food, service, and consistency are the attributes which earn this distinction. There are places that have more pastas or specialize in steaks but all around Italian fare.... No other place can match. If you want a quiet dinner this is not your place, but the hustle and bustle is part of the experience. Their veal dishes are unmatched. I tell every visitor I meet to eat there when asked. I frequently entertain clients there as well. The doubling of space has made getting a table impromptu much more likely. I'd still call ahead when you can.

I wish Yelp allowed half stars because this warrants a solid 2.5 but anyhow, here it goes.  After a Yelp Elite event nearby, my friend and I wanted a full blown, let's get bloated and stuff our face with carbs type of meal. We chose Volare due to the great rating. When we approached the restaurant we saw two tables open on the outside patio. We walked inside and told the hostess we wanted an outside table. She said it would be a 15 minute wait for outside and an immediate sit down if we chose inside. My friend and I both looked around and then looked at each other in a confused dismay. There was no one waiting for a table. Dafaq? I told the hostess that and she said, "let me see what I can do". We were magically sat within a minute. I'm not sure why in the world she didn't want to sit us outside but her pushing inside tables on us was rude. As patrons, we want to sit where we want - understand that - and don't give us sh*t for our choices.  After being seated, it took us about 5 minutes to get menus and be greeted by our server - Rhonda. She noticed we were still wearing Yelp name tags and mentioned to me that she knows all about the app and the review system. I had forgotten to take off the name tag after the event so I did so immediately upon her telling me. Rhonda made recommendations accordingly.  We ordered bruschetta as an app which I most certainly recommend that you order. The bread was soft and fresh and the tomatoes were delicious.  For the main, I ordered the black squid pasta with seafood. My friend ordered the daily special of spinach and cheese stuffed ravioli. Both meals were amazing. Seriously, I've never been to Italy but I really do believe it may be as authentic as possible. The BEST Italian I've had in Chicago, hands down.  We ordered the tiramisu and pistachio gelato as well. Both were tasty as well but I'd choose the gelato over the tiramisu here which is weird for me.  Now, why the 2.5 stars, you ask? RHONDA, where in the world did you go? Frankly, the service here sucked! She disappeared throughout 90% of our meal, and it took 15 minutes for her to bring us the check. FIFTEEN minutes! She knew we were Yelpers and had even asked me at one point if we were going to review her! Is this how you earn a good rating, Rhonda? Showing your Houdini skills by disappearing for the duration of our meal (and desserts) isn't impressive at all, in fact, it's quite disappointing and infuriating! The food here is phenomenal. The people working here: not so much. I may go again one day but I will choose to sit at the bar to order where all eyes will be on me. But to sit at a table? NAH!  I'm torn with Volare. You be the judge.

What a spectacular experience. Recommended by front desk at the Hilton.   Food was delicious with a great attention to detail. The  staff was knowledgeable, accomadating and kind. John Marano the GM is the quintessential professional of customer service.

Friendly, exquisite, exceptional, service and food. You will not be disappointed with the menu or prices. Every table is treated like a rockstar! This is the place to eat in Streeterville. It was so nice we ate here twice. Try the Mango Martini one of the best kept secrets. Outstanding chicken parmigiana.

We very enjoy the food as well as the ambiance, very croudly at the begining, empty at the end we were the last one. The service is not to fast and not to slow. The only thing is that the tip was already add to the bill.
Among the best italian restaurants I have ever eaten in. This place is tucked away in an unsuspecting corner but the pizza is excellent and well worth the stop.

Amazing food, exceptional service. Stopped in for lunch with a friend and ordered the lunch special black spaghetti a la pesce (seafood). Served in a rose cream sauce, it doesn't look like a large portion but will definitely fill you up! The food is so fresh, staff are so friendly, will definitely be back to try more! Like dinner, you're supplied with a surplus of fresh baked Italian breads, olive oil-Parmesan dipping sauces, and offered fresh Italian coffee and cream. All of it was perfect. Combined with the soft Italian background music, dim lighting, and a historic downtown location, what more could you want?! Try some authentic Italian and you'll compare Olive Garden to the fast food version of Italian cuisine!
This place is great! Went here with my boyfriend and the staff was so attentive and helpful. Excellent food too. Awesome date place!!

Great Italian food. Family friendly. Casual with a classic vibe.  One of the gals in our party had a peanut allergy and they took it very seriously. She also had just returned from 3 weeks in Italy and was very pleased with her gnocchi in vodka sauce.  Lost a star for the appetizers The bruschetta was a bit heavy on garlic. Almost spicy with garlic. Not good for going out after. The calamari was nice, served with marinara and cocktail sauce, but it didn't melt in my mouth and the breading was a bit heavy for my liking.  Caprese salad was really good. The mozzarella was the creamiest I've ever experienced.  I shared the lasagna. It was incredible. Perfect portion for Sharing.

Volare is a good Italian restaurant with great service.  The grilled octopus, scallop, shrimp appetizer was delicious.  The pastas were average.  We had the black spaghetti with seafood, linguine with clams in white garlic sauce and lasagna.  Tarantino's has a much tastier spicy black spaghetti with seafood pasta which is my favorite in town.  The homemade lasagna was good, but overly salty.  Outdoor patio seating is available.  It's a good place for lunch/dinner if you're in the neighborhood.

Went to volare last week. Typically, had a reservation but still made to wait 30 minutes. Been here many times the last few years. Started with meatballs - bland and dry. Beet, prosciutto , burata, tomato app was quite good. Black pasta with seafood was only ok - pasta was over cooked not Al dente. Risotto was bland with no depth of flavor- suspect poor stock or water was used to prepare the rice. It's too bad because Volare looks like a place that you want to like and are expecting simple good food. It's the reason it's crowded. It's now a tourist Mecca. So we're done here. La madia , divante, piccolo sogno, nico osteria  all provide superior options close by.

Great place, my girlfriend and I both got the Gnocchi with vodka sauce and a bottle of wine both of which complimented each other nicely. The whole staff was very accommodating and we felt like regulars. I would highly recommend this place if you haven't been there or its your first time in Chicago.

Had a 7pm reservation on a Saturday night. Had to wait about 15 mins for seating. Service was friendly and knowledgeable. Ordered calamari app. Was a large order, fresh and yummy. Kind of skimpy on the sauces, sides of marinara and cocktail. BF said minestrone was nothing special. Ordered spaghetti caprese and enjoyed it. Fresh tasting, no frills. Dad ordered the black spaghetti with seafood. Says seafood was good but spaghetti to heavy/dense. Would not order again. BF ordered appetizer of Italian sausage with peppers with side of spaghetti with marinara. Portion size of sausage was disgustingly enormous. Enough sausage for party of 8. States salty but what sausage isn't. Describes as smothered in a dark salty sauce. Hypertensives beware. Passed on dessert. Be sure to have your antacids on standby.

We walked by Volare one day and it looked packed so I was glad we had reservations for two nights later. I was not let down! The ambiance was great, the food was delicious, the staff was engaging and extremely helpful. I was most impressed by how much the employees loved their jobs and the owner. It really shows in the service they provide their customers. I definitely recommend Volare!
Eat at the bar. Fast service. Delicious. Had the black spaghetti with seafood. Sauce was tasty with chunks of lobster. The place is very packed though. Recommend reservations.
Tasty dishes that door portion controlled so u can make room for dessert.  Black seafood pasta and risotto dishes were tasty. The grilled seafood appetizer was delic. Desserts were enjoyable too!

Reservation needed:) Good atmosphere and yummy food. Quality Italian at a reasonable price. The staff handled a rowdy table near us very well. Would eat there again definitely and recommend it. Easily one of the best options for Italian food near Magnificent Mile.

Amazing food!  Excellent service! Would highly recommend.  We met the owner and he could not have been any nicer.  Told us that he also owns Benny's Chophouse.  We will be trying that on our next trip!

Stopped here late on Thursday night, Volare was packed but they were able to seat us within 20 minutes or so. The wait staff is charming and enthusiastically explained the specials and service was quick. I ordered the veal ragu, it was well executed and a large portion size but the flavor was a bit to heavy for me. I would definitely go back and try a different dish.

We were a party of six and we all absolutely enjoyed the entire dinner experience. The atmosphere, ambiance and friendly staff are all top notch and very knowledgeable of the menu.  It had been awhile since we had dinner here but it is the same great experience I remember.   The grilled calamari, scallops & Shrimp appetizer was divine!   Bruschetta was fresh and delish!  I had the gnocchi in vodka sauce with meatballs - out of this world.  Best vodka sauce I ever had.  My husband raved about his veal parmesan .    Highly recommend this establishment.  When in town it's a must!

I've been to Chicago numerous times but this is my first time eating at Volare. The risotto was the best I've ever had. The servers were extremely knowledgable and willing to split any entree. The dining room has the noisy, welcoming atmosphere of a family run Italian restaurant.  If you don't take the time to visit Volare, you are missing the best Italian food Chicago has to offer.
Amazing food and service! Went twice in one weekend.
Phenomenal food with great service. Truly one of the best Italian dinners that our family has had in a while.

The atmosphere here is as fantastic as the food! You can't go wrong with this menu. I had black spaghetti for the first time today and loved it! The staff are warm and inviting, just beware of the floors.... Super slippery!

We came back last week for lunch. I had made a reservation and we were seated immediately. We started with a half order of the mixed grilled seafood of scallop, shrimp, calamari and the octopus with the aged balsamic and extra virgin olive oil. We also the half order of fried calamari. We shared the chicken parmigiana and spaghetti  & the grilled skirt steak with roasted potato. We had a coke and a diet coke. Very good Italian food.

Alright, so I had to really debate between three stars and four stars. I'm handsdown four stars, but my aunt and my sister have really high standards for pasta (they've traveled Europe so many times their taste buds arent the same!) Rotolini di Melanzane: ***Baked rolled eggplant stuffed with ricotta cheese fresh basil and served with pomodoro sauce Wasn't really my favorite, it seemed pretty plain to my tastebuds.  Warm Kale Salad:  ***Warm kale, crispy garbanzo, crispy prosciutto, pancetta, brussel sprout leaves, shaved grana padano, red onions, white beans, citronette I really liked the salad except for the pancetta. It was a little hard pieces, and I think it would have tasted better if it was sliced/shaved on the salad. It tasted good, but it was hard to chew.  Gnocchi alla Vodka: ***Ricotta dumplings in vodka sauce I really liked the gnocchi, it seemed light and fluffy, however my aunt and sister complained that it wasn't 'soft' enough for them. The sauce definitely tasted the same as the squid ink pasta as below, which was disappointing because we wanted to try different flavors of pasta Spaghetti Neri al Pesce:  ***Black spaghetti tossed with shrimp, lump crab and scallops and sage in a brandy and cream rose sauce Bit disappointed because it was the same flavor as the Gnocchi. It was a good pasta overall, I am a huge fan of the squid ink pasta.

I celebrated my birthday dinner at Volare last night and it was an awesome experience.  Be sure to make reservations if you plan on coming to Volare because this place is packed... there was quite a wait when we arrived and when we left an hour and a half later! The good news is with our reservation we didn't have to wait long at all for our table to be ready.  We were seated in the front dining room and I loved the ambiance. It's a touch crowded but in the best possible way, eating at Volare has that classic Italian restaurant feel where everyone around you seems to be laughing and having fun while enjoying their meal. In addition to the great ambiance I also enjoyed our server. She admitted she was new but if she hadn't said that we never would've known. She was attentive, helpful, and did a great job describing the specials.  They have a wide beer, wine, and cocktail selection here (but no draft beer). My boyfriend went with a Two Brothers and I had the delicious Tex Mex cocktail. If you're a tequila or vodka fan don't leave Volare without ordering one of those, they're to die for!  When it came to our meal we opted to share because the menu had so much to offer. We started with a half order of baked clams and I have to say they were the best I've ever had. The sauce was delicious and they were perfectly done. For entrees we split the special, a brown butter sage sauce over stuffed with ricotta and steak filled tortellini and the Rigatoni all' Arrabbiata. Both were delicious and filling. It's hard to say which one was better but I'd have to give it to the special, neither of us had ever tried anything like it before and loved every last bite!  Volare was an awesome dining experience and there were no complaints from us!

Came here while in Chicago for work. It was a Tuesday night but the place was very crowded. I lucked out and was able to eat at the bar with no wait. Ordered the spaghetti neri al pesce and a caesar salad. The salad wasn't anything special, but the pasta was quite good with a wonderful flavor and plenty of seafood. Definitely will be coming back. Good service and prices were as expected.
