I've been coming to Volare for 15 years.  It's my favorite restaurant in Chicago.  Benny and his staff serve up spectacular service and sensational Italian food.  Whether you are looking for Italian "comfort food" such as  great rissoto or linguine with clam sauce or one of their exquisite specials, you'll love it.  The Osso Buco is the best in the city.  Sea Bass is a dream. Thanks to Benny and staff for 15 years of friendship and great dinners!  Bravo!

One of the BEST restaurants that I've ever been to! Fresh, house-made ingredients (pasta, sausages, etc.) that are turned into amazing plates. Super friendly staff on top of it all. You can get half orders on pasta dishes which is great, especially for kids. The waitress was so knowledgable about the menu & the wine list. She had great suggestions for our table. The gnocchi dish was out of this world! It's a MUST if you go there. We are from NYC & food standards are high... This place was absolutely amazing. We will come back when we visit Chicago again.

This was the first family dinner we had in Chicago. Al in all, not a bad place. The family loved the bread before the meal. The dinner portions were huge. I had the black spaghetti Neri de Pesce and the kids had the half portions of the ricotta ravioli and spaghetti and meatballs (home made and delicious). The dessert was small and not that flavorful (we shared the tiramisu and the vanilla gelato).

After careful deliberations, we chose Volare as the restaurant to celebrate our 2nd wedding anniversary. I used to walk pass this place for over a year when I worked blocks away and was very excited to finally give it a try due to the yelp reviews. It was a Sunday night and the place was packed! We waited about 20 minutes for a table, however, when we were waiting, the man who brought the order to the table would walk by us and OH Man did he have body odor. Maybe that was a sign of the night to come. We started off with the very delicious foccacia bread with brushed tomato. Highlight of the meal. One thing I noticed was the lack of parmesan cheese to dip your bread with. Next, we ordered the salami pizza and caprese salad with buffala. Both came out within 15 minutes. So then the night started going down hill, we waited nearly 30-40 minutes before hubby could no longer take it and we had to call the manager to cancel our main courses. We had another couple sit next to us who sat down and ordered after us and were already on dessert while we still did not get out food.  We finally talked to the manager who was really apologetic, and we decided to cancel the meal because hubby was so mad he didnt want to stay. The manager was politely comp'd the appetizers we did order. But not exactly the best anniversary dinner...

Very good!! This was our first meal in Chicago and it did not disappoint.  I had the braised pork shank special over saffron risotto.  Excellent dish.  Pork was fall off the bone delicious... Risotto was ever so slightly salty for my taste but my dining companion did not think it was salty at all.  They had the gnocchi with a side of meatballs.  One of the best vodka sauces I've had to date!  Either dish on its own could have easily fed 2 hungry adults.  Finally, we finished with the goat cheese pannacotta with apricot glaze.  I don't think I'll ever be able to love the original pannacotta after having the goat cheese version!  This dessert is a must not miss.  Service was the only thing that was lacking a little for me.  Neighboring tables seemed to be having a better experience than us so don't let this be a deterrent.  Noms!
The only reason I can't give this place 5 stars is because we waited for 30-40 minutes even though we had a reservation. Other than the wait, the food was amazing and the service was spectacular.

I knew this place was going to be great when I saw at least 3 tables with lone diners; the fact that they were not embarrassed to be alone and clearly really wanted to eat here, that says something.  The food is wonderful, and there is an open kitchen so you can see what is going  on behind the scenes. The one meal we ordered was shrimp with black spaghetti. My dining partner was not into the black spaghetti so he asked to switch to plan linguine. Not a problem at all!  The wait staff were extremely well trained in customer service. If I got up to walk around everyone would just stand aside automatically to give you passing room.  I would suggest reservations if you are more than a party of 3. It was me and one other person on a Monday night. We sat right away but it was still very crowded.

Volare has a great bustling urban vibe mixed with the old world. The super busy kitchen pumps out high quality and delicious dishes. The grilled mixed seafood is light and the char is superb. The roasted chicken was juicy and wonderful. We also had an amazing Italian Syrah that was very affordable. Our server was friendly and truly understood the food.

This is a great Italian restaurant that has many mouth watering entrees and specials.  Benny Siddu's head chef Maximo continues to amaze us with new dishes.  He recently spent a month in Sadina working with the best chef there for a month exchanging and learning new entrees.
Delicious food made from scratch served with excellent bread. Service was prompt. We had an excellent server who explained the menu! Will definitely return.

Our group was going to be in Chicago for the annual Show. I booked the reservation in advance and then some of our group couldn't attend. The dining room manager and the GM were very helpful we went down form an 8 to a 4.  Overall the food was not very good.  It is surprising that this restaurant is always full, it looks great, but the food is not something I'd reccomend to any of my friends.

Volare is our favorite Italian restaurant in the city! The food is fantastic and they are always able to accommodate my vegan requests and my husband's dairy allergy. Great spot for a date night or taking family visiting town.

I booked dinner for two at Volare last minute on a Friday night, hoping that despite its proximity to Mag Mile, 4 stars and nearly 1000 reviews wouldn't let me down. Buuuut the only are Volare excelled was service, which our waiter carried with grace (and a hint of pretentiousness). Despite the somewhat boisterous crowd of businessmen, families, and couples, he acted like the maitre d' for a classy restaurant complete with hand flourishes (e.g. when delivering the giant menus). The complimentary bread basket consists of a soft French bread and what seemed to be cheesy focaccia brushed with tomato sauce. We were brought a dish of parmesan, on top of which the waiter drizzled olive oil for dipping. We barely touched the focaccia since it just wasn't... good, but the French roll was soft and tasty! Our appetizer, the Salsiccia e Peperoni, was recommended by the waiter. The bell peppers here were severely wilted, having given up the flavor battle to the black pepper in the sauce. The sausages themselves were good, especially when bathed judiciously in said sauce. And then maintaining true bourgeois fashion, a server came to take away our dirty plates/silverware and replace them with clean ones.  Things flopped when we received our (huge) entree plates. My Fusilloni al Ragu di Vitello was way way WAY too salty. So much that I had to put down my fork after three bites and chug my glass of water. (An observant server came promptly to refill my glass. Thanks!) We notified the waiter when he came to check in on us and he immediately apologized and whisked it away. Upon his return, he notified us that he told the chef and deducted the item from our check. The Spinach Fettucine special my boyfriend ordered was much more palatable, but not deserving of "MMMM" status.  The bathrooms require you to go down a few stairs to a hallway with several doors. I had to squint closely at each one to make out the faded Italian denominations on the doors - but ladies, yours is at the right end of the hallway.   At the end of the night, we ended up spending about the same amount on just the one entree and appetizer as we normally would for two people at other Chicago restaurants we visited. Definitely not worth the price, but it was nice to be doted on for a while.

We recently went here on vacation and celebrated our engagement here. The staff was amazing and accommodating to us. There was a slight wait past our reservation time, but everyone was very helpful to us. My fiance got the Gnocchi alla Vodka and still raves about it. I had the Chicken Parmifgiana and it was also very good. Our champagne glasses were always full and we had an outstanding time.

Excellent food. Very authentic Italian cuisine.  Service was good except for the server. She was was not polite. Made snide remarks and rolled her eyes. We did have a large party however the comments were unnecessary.  She stopped when the check came out and it was tip time. Will return again.

I was staying at the Loews and popped in by myself.  Sat at the bar and had a very nice glass of red wine and an absolutely delicious house salad.  The place was bustling and I still had excellent service from the bartender on a busy Thursday night.  Next time" I'll bring the family and have a big delicious Italian dinner.

Hit this place every time we're in Chicago. Solid. Classic Italian. friendly staff and a great location if you're staying on Magnificient Mile. We've been going here for 20 years and never had anything but really great meals.
Incredible food. Great service. Amazing prices for Chicago. The black spaghetti was the best dish we had.

In my week stay down town this was my favorite... This is real Italian food and they know there wine. Bartender recommend a Italian blend wine that went perfect with dinner. Make sure your hungry because they will give you large portions, you will want to eat all of it.

The service here is consistently top notch and the food is amazing.  I am a ten year Chicagoan and this restaurant ranks in my top three favorites in all of Chicago.  Most tourists would come and go and never hear of this place despite it's location just a block or two east of Michigan Avenue.   One of my closest friends and I just dined there last night (our third or fourth time to eat there together) and our server Rhonda made us feel like we were her only table and she made an already amazing meal even better.

This is the second time that we have eaten at Volare in Chicago.  We were going to try something different but were drawn back. First this is a crowded place.  Really small bar in front and tables are pretty packed.  But it is a good crowded.  There is something about the action of the people and the wait staff that make it feel more real and old school.  The service and food was great as usual. Shared a cheese and salame board as a starter.  Nice way to work through the first cocktail.  Then moved on to the roasted beet salad.  Love that they had yellow and red beets.  Not over dressed.  They actually let us split this order so it was a nice portion for two, too much for just one. We had a Chicken Parmigiana and a Black Ink pasta with scallops, shrimp and crab meat.  Both were healthy portions, served hot and at a nice pace.  I thought that the crab has a bit shredded but the flavor was spot on.  The pasta was al dente. Decent wine selection.  We had an Amarone for about $80 which is appropriate for the market.   The wait staff is enthusiastic and efficient.  This is not high brow over engineered Italian.  It is straight forward with good quality and mid-tier pricing.  We are glad we went back.

I went here with my boyfriend for our anniversary, and overall we had a really nice time. The service was good and the food was great. We had the butternut squash and brussels sprout salad, which we really loved. For the meal, he got the roast chicken and I got the gnocchi, both of which were really excellent. We did have to wait a long time for our table, which is why I'd give 4 stars and not 5- we made a reservation for Sunday night at 6:30 and called ahead that day to let them know that we were running late, and still waited about an hour after arriving for our table. The atmosphere is also very noisy, so while the restaurant is nice and I would definitely recommend trying it, there are more romantic spots out there.

Does best Italian near the Magnificent Mile equate to good Italian in Chicago?  With so many great Italian restaurants in Chicago, there are only two good reasons to go to Volare: (1) the proximity to Michigan Avenue and (2) the good prices -- you can get a good meal for $15 to $20.  Quattro Stagioni: 3.5/5 -- Pretty good pizza, but it was unfortunate that the toppings were not distributed evenly. The toppings (especially the prosciutto) were very flavorful. Fattoria: 3.5/5 -- Nothing extraordinarily special. Just good old risotti. Should have asked to take out the peas.  Gnocchi alla Vodka: 4/5 -- Probably the best dish of the night. Vodka sauce was excellent, and the ricotta dumplings were soft and delicious.  Pappardelle Ricotta a Pomodoro: 3/5 -- Only okay. Not too much flavor. Just the standard pasta with tomato sauce and cheese.  The meal was pleasant but nothing extraordinary. Nice atmosphere and decor.

I don't usually go to places like this because I don't have this kind of money. But I was on vacation in Chicago, so you know. The food was excellent. 5 out of 5 for the food. The servers were all so nice except for the one that served my table.

During our first night in Chicago, this restaurant was recommended to us by an Italian gentleman outside our hotel. There wasn't a wait despite it being a Friday night with no reservation and it seemed pretty busy. The staff was very friendly, knowledgable and attentive. The food was delicious!! I had the Gnocchi alla Vodka and my best friend had the Risotti di Mare. Both she and I enjoyed our meals very much. Plus the prices were very reasonable as well. Overall, it was the best Italian we had during our visit and I am sure we will return the next time we are in town!
Nice environment. Helpful staff. Food was good but I expected more based on the reviews, nothing special.

Excellent meals with generous portions and excellent service. I've taken clients here for mid week lunches and taken family here for weekend dinners and I've never been disappointed. I highly recommend Mom's Meatballs, Chicken Parmesan, Lasagne and Ravioli, honestly you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Looking for great Italian and a nice atmosphere for business or pleasure, well you found it! Your welcome! :-)
Really great atmosphere at Volare and authentic Italian experience. It's not cheap but it is good value for money, best tiramisu I've ever had!

Traveling alone so I ate at the bar.  Great old school Italian restaurant one block off the miracle mile.  Bartender Frankie is the best.  Conversation and made great food recommendations. Had the gnocchi with vodka sauce.  The gnocchi was light and fluffy the sauce tasteful.
The food is good, although somehow I feel like the waiters are quite snobbish. Maybe cuz I dressed up like a college kid. But not coming back for sure
Spectacular modern italian cuisine. Bold flavors and minor tweaks to traditional italian dishes. Delicious

Wonderful food and great old school atmosphere. Their black spaghetti is incredible. Have been here about eight times now and can't get myself to try anything else but my wife recently tried their salmon and said it was the best salmon she has ever tasted. Love, love, love this place.

This place is amazing! My husband and I found this place last year on vacation, and made sure to come back this year while on our honeymoon.  Italian food is my absolute favorite, and this is the best I've ever had!!  I started with the caprese salad (both times), which was fantastic.  Their gnocchi alla vodka was amazing - rich, creamy and perfectly cooked - it melts in your mouth.  The pappardelle ricotta with pomodoro sauce was also great - super fresh and perfectly cooked.  If you love italian, I would definitely recommend this as your first choice!

This place is exactly what I hope an Italian restaurant will be like - crowded, loud, good wine selection, house-made pasta, and excellent bread. Shoutout to Taylor F for her review about the Spaghetti Neri al Pesce. I decided I wanted to experience worm pasta for myself and I'm glad I did because it was truly delicious. Plus, I sat at the bar and the bartender Rhonda totally made my experience. Also, they use goat cheese in their panna cotta. Yes, please. Should have ordered 2.

Had a large dinner party here for work. Every. Single. Dish. Was delicious. For appetizers we ordered meatballs, ravioli, and a chef's special that included a platter of fresh mozzarella, prosciutto, and asparagus. It was devoured.   My house salad was meh (and huge) but the linguini with clams in a light red sauce was perfect (half portion was still too much). The full portions are huge.  The service was great.

Had dinner here. While I was expecting amazing pasta from reading previous reviews. I have to report it was just ok. I had the gnocchi with vodka sauce, my friend had the chicken parmigiana and another friend had pasta with Alfredo sauce. The pasta was not homemade and didn't taste outstanding or fresh. We started with prosciutto and burrata with tomatoes and beets. The burrata was ok had much better ones in NY or SF. Followed by a Ceasar salad which was very good. The good things about this restaurant are the bread, grated Parmesan cheese with fresh olive oil and service. But don't go here thinking you are going to treat yourself to fresh homemade pasta because you will be disappointed. The restaurant has very nice ambiance and the attention of the staff is very nice; for example your water glass gets plenty of refills and there was not a very long wait between dishes.

The raucous nature of the dining floor was amusing. Our adorable waitress exclaimed twice, "Oh! I forgot something!" and ran off. She was also loud enough that I just started giggling every time she gave the specials or showed off the desserts to the nearby tables.  Anyway, I came here to say that the Neri al Pesce, a black spaghetti tossed with shrimp, lump crab, scallops and sage in a brandy and cream rose sauce. is one of the best, most interesting pasta dishes I've ever had. Seriously, try it. And then the next day when you have leftovers, you can tell people you're eating worms.

Wow. Just...wow. I picked Volare off of Yelp because it was close to my hotel, and after a meal there, it felt like winning the restaurant lottery. It was absolutely packed at 8 p.m. on a Monday, but it was a good kind of noisy - like a happy Italian family. Every single staff person I encountered was sincerely friendly, and the owner himself swept me off to a seat at the bar and checked on me many times through my meal to offer wine suggestions and see how I liked the food.     And I *really* liked the food. I started with a minestrone soup to die for, then had spaghetti neri al pesce - black spaghetti with shrimp, crab, and scallops. Sweet Jesus it was good. I wish I had room for dessert, because frankly I just wanted to keep eating their food, but I had to tap out.    If you want a superb Italian meal, this restaurant is the real deal, from the friendly Italian owner down to the handmade pasta and seafood that is apparently flown in fresh every day. I just loved it.

I love this place. You can't order anything bad off the menu. I'm a regular and every time I bring in friends, family, business partners they roll out the red carpet. Love the service, food, and prices!

I'm still thinking about the wonderful meal I had at Volare this past Saturday night. Truly authentic Italian food with wonderful service. We started with the Grigliata Mista which was beyond amazing. The seafood was grilled to perfection, and had just the right amount of seasoning. For my entree I had a special seafood pasta with homemade pasta and tons and tons of seafood! The portion was huge and lasted me for 2 extra meals of leftovers. My friend had the veal medallions and loved her dish as well. All in all I would absolutely recommend this place to any visitors or locals who haven't yet been--you won't regret it!

We were only in Chicago for one night, so we wanted to try an Italian place we hadn't been to before. We got in around 8 on a Friday night, so we feared a long wait, but my wife called before we left the hotel and they said they's be able to seat us pretty quickly, so we decided to give it a shot. When we got there the place was bustling, so we feared a long wait, but the hostess was super friendly and got us a table within just a few minutes. The host was quite nice and got us a table right by the window,  Our waiter was also quite friendly and the service was very speedy, especially considering how busy they were. The menu had a great variety so it was difficult to make a choice.  I went with the homemade black spaghetti with crab, shrimp and scallops...it was delicious! The rest of the family also enjoyed their meals.  We were quite full, but somehow our charming waiter got us interested in dessert...and we're glad he did! I would definitely recommend this place for anyone looking for a charming  and authentic Italian dining experience in Chicago!
Best lunch ever... Food was beyond amazing, friendly staff, perfect location and affordable prices.... In one word PERFECTION

If I see that Nicole W. likes a place I'm going to blatantly copy her order. I suggest you do the same. I dined at the bar (full menu available) and even though I rolled up at 7pm on a Friday night I had no trouble finding a spot for dinner. If dining with a group I do suggest a reservation. Service was warm and attentive without being over the top. Listen to Nicole and get the eggplant rollups. There is a lot that sounds amazing on the menu but these are delicious. Their tomato sauce is made with love. I did a half portion of the gnocchi with vodka sauce and let me tell you half was plenty after kicking my meal off with a starter. The gnocchi were dreamy pillows that melted in my mouth. I didn't feel heavy after dinner but very very satisfied and content. This is Italian food that my New Yorker parents would be proud of.

Volare is easily one of my favorite Italian restaurants in the city. The Spaghetti Neri al Pesce alone is worth the trip (I've gotten it both times I've been here) but everything else I've tasted has been really good too. My dad, who never eats leftovers, actually took home his lasagna and raved that it was one of the best he's ever had. Service is great, portions are generous and the food is delicious. Basically, if you haven't been here, add it to your list of restaurants to try!
Awesome Italian restaurant! My friend and I got here at around 8:30 and there was no wait. I had house salad and Risotto Di Mare. Both dishes were amazing.

Based on the past few reviews,  I thought Volare would be a great experience, but I was wrong.  Came here for a friend's birthday on a Saturday night.  I ordered the pizza, but the crust was too soft in the center.  Each time I tried to lift a slice, everything fell off.  My friend had the chicken ravioli and it tasted like plastic.  I would give the place 1 star, but the server was very friendly and accommodating so that should count for something.

A true classic Italian restaurant - worthy of five stars and more. Great worldly wine selection. Best arrabiatta sauce I have had in years. Wife ordered the fattoria - she loved it it was perfect. Dessert - homemade tiramisu was heavenly. And ask about the lemoncello - made in house by the chef - it is so smooth you will want a bottle

This is a must do for every trip I take to Chicago but be warned..... Make a reservation. The specials go quickly which is why it's a 4. We were there at 7 last time and it was already gone.  But their food is always wonderful, the Waitstaff is friendly and knowledgeable. Definitely a must do.

Great energy and service at Volare. My chicken parm was incredible and the side of spaghetti was perfectly al dente - probably the best pasta I've eaten this year. The manager/owner greeted each table and made us all feel welcome. It was nice to have this personal touch at the end of our feast.

Top of my list for Italian food and great service. Last minute reservations with my family (small kids) and the staff made us feel at home.  Our server was great and the food was delicious. Can't wait to visit Chicago again and stop in to try some other dishes!
Excellent food the best customer service ...we come here each time we visit Chicago and it is the same excellent restaurant each time !

Great service from the minute we got there. We used the valet and it was quick and easy.  We were sat immediately.  The waiter helped us with the menu choices. The food was fantastic! The sauce to die for and homemade noodles. High quality food. The prices are very reasonable. Worth it!

We went to this restaurant before a concert at Chicago theatre. Overall the atomsphere and service was good. The food was good, but not memorable. Noone in our party was dissatisfied, but noone was raving either.

Everything was excellent. I came with 8 friends and they were able to seat us within 10 minutes without reservation even though the restaurant was very crowded. Fresh food, good prices, very nice staff. Would highly recommend.

I was in Chicago for work and happened up reviews for Volare. As gnocchi tends to be a favorite of mine and the gnocchi here was raved after, I tried the gnocchi. It was, no exaggeration, the best gnocchi I have eaten and I made sure the delicious sauce it came with was completely wiped up with the table bread. Beyond the food, what set this restaurant apart was the atmosphere. As I was alone, I sat at the bar and immediately felt like part of the Volare family. The bartender was able to recommend wines for me easily and all of us at the bar jested over Wisconsin and my NCAA bracket.  I quickly went from an expected lonely evening to great food and convos. I will always recommend this establishment for Italian in Chicago.
Classical Italian food. Decent environment. Dessert is a good choice after having classical cheese pasta and pizza.

I had a large party dinner here with a work group (about 14). The service was great for a big party. The waitress was right on the money with her suggestions and her quickness for wine reorders and tweaks to the dinners. The table shared some starters including the cheese board, the mozzarella (delicious), the calamari (not a stand out), and some salads. It came out quick along with bread that was fresh and warm. I had the salmon. It was ok, I can't say that I loved it. The salmon was cooked fine but the accompaniments did not wow me. In fact the entree was not that memorable. I also shared the ravioli with my friend and those were indeed, quite lovely. Pillowy and well made with the perfect amount of filling.  If I wasn't such a gluten freak, I would have had more. Wines were flowing and they have one of my faves, The Prisoner. I had a lovely Italian white that was good for my fish and the waitress had recommended it, so kudos to her. The space is pretty loud and we we were stuck near a leaky window (in 10 degree temps ouside). So my advice is don't be seated by a window!   I think in a town with so many Italian choices, how do you choose.  This is a good standby, old school Italian and a decent place to sip some wine and enjoy some pasta.

This place is hands down one of best upscale Italian restaurants in Chicago .. The food is great the service was even better.. I even got a chance to meet the owner Benny who is so sweet. I ordered the black ink pasta with shrimp ,scallops,crab,and clams it was delish.. My frowned ordered the steak and potatoes w/ grilled vegetables which she liked .. We also had the fried calamari it was so tender and crispy .. Yummers dessert was canoli and chocolate mousse

My husband and I are big Italian-food fans, prepare to try this spot for a long time and now here we are, after the St. Patrick parade. Relaxed atmosphere, friendly service, and wonderful foods exactly what other people said.   We started with the Grigliata Mista, I forced myself to not eat too much cause we still have the entrees but I just can't stop. Fortunately before I grabbed them all the beautiful Pollo alla Parmigiana's coming, so flavorful and tasty. My husband had the Costoline d' Agnello, juicy also tempting.

Stopped in for a late dinner with a girlfriend of mine. We loved the decor, the location, the food was great but unfortunately we were not too pleased with the service. Although our waiter was friendly, he didn't come around as he should've. The dining space was extremely tight, I felt as though, the clientele and wait staff were falling on top of each other. Not sure if I'll visit again which is a shame...like I said before, the food was good.

I was prepared to be underwhelmed by this place when we stumbled upon it between our hotel and Navy Pier. Thankfully we had a surprisingly wonderful meal and service throughout.  Our waiter explained the menu, offered suggestions, and talked about which substitutions were good. Once we decided, he was quick to take our order and offer more suggestions, but he wasn't pushy or trying to oversell. I expect he was used to tourists or folks not familiar with this type of Italian food because he wanted to make sure I knew rapini would be bitter, but he was gentle with it, not cocky or questioning.  While waiting, we appreciated the quick fills on water and generous bread to start -- especially since we had spent the whole day walking. The hostess and waitstaff worked well as a team throughout our time there. They were all pleasant and friendly.  The three of us ate our fill in pasta - ricotta ravioli, beautiful, fresh, and well-sauced; spaghetti with Alfredo sauce and Italian sausage; gnocchi with vodka sauce; and rapini. The pasta was fresh, homemade, and perfectly imperfect. The gnocchi were of the cut, not formed, style, but their flavor was excellent, and they were not too heavy. The tangy vodka sauce was a perfect complement. The spaghetti was cooked to just the right level of softness, and the Alfredo with it was rich without overpowering the thin pasta. The rapini was gorgeous and green with a lovely bite, mellowed out with garlic. It was a great companion to the richer pasta dishes.  We were sated with our delicious meals and thrilled at the total of the bill. I will definitely make a point to visit Volare again and explore their menu more.
Good food and great service. From the bartender to the bus boy to the server to the manager, the service at this restaurant was wonderful.

Cozy atmosphere with friendly staff. I had the Sea bass special and it was delicious. My husband has the baked chicken and he loved it. We even brought an order of marinara home for later.  It's a small place so everyone is on top of each other but it wasn't bad because they are all so nice.
I love this place! Service is great. The food is authentic Italian! Their seafood is always delicious! My husband loves the risotto. It can get crowded so make a reservation.

Excellent food, excellent service, excellent atmosphere.  Rafael, who served our table, did a fantastic job taking care of our group of 9.  I would actually give this restaurant 4.75 starts, with the very slight deduction being due to a delayed response to a request via the restaurant website for information on group dining.

I liked Volare, but it was a bit too crowded especially in the main front room. Gnocchi in vodka sauce was awesome as was the arrabbiata sauce! The pizza wasn't the best we've had, nor was the focaccia bread they bring out to the table. Service was top notch.

Hubby and I just got back to our hotel room after an awesome dinner.  The squid ink black pasta w seafood, the fresh oysters, the rolled eggplant appetizer, the carpaccio.  All delish - eggplant was our favorite  We sat at the bar it was amazing!  Wth you don't expect that.  Very prompt service fresh food  I asked the bartender to recommend a red - it was perfect and a good price - $11 for a glass  Reasonable prices and great service

Visiting Chicago from San Antonio, Texas and this place is absolutely incredible. It's rare that a restaurant has the atmosphere and great service for such low prices. Definitely a must if you're in downtown Chicago!

Let me tell you something about my husband and I. I have adopted the "European last minute planning" attitude around here because honestly, I don't have time to scrounge the internet and plan out dinner events now that we have a toddler.  It was my birthday and my husband booked us a room at the fabulous Swiss Hotel while the kiddo spent the weekend with the grandparents. We had no reservations for dinner though. And it was a Saturday. I know you are probably freaking out too now at this point. So as we walk around in the frigid weather this past December (loooong overdue review sorry) we stumbled upon Volare-yea! I have actually been wanting to check this place out and didn't even think to book a reservation here! Has it been that long for this mama?  So we give it a go and walk in and they said it will be like 45 minutes before we can be seated. That's fine, we deserve it for trying to be so spontaneous. But once we got seated it was worth the wait. The  owner is this old school Italian who will escort every woman to their table and hold their wine for them, how classy is that?  We started off with the house salad which was SO good, I could have eaten a huge plate of it. We then moved onto Fried Calamari which was great too and not heavily breaded.  I ended up getting the Lasagna for my main dish which was perfectly done and my husband had Sea Bass and he remarked it was good as well. The portions were reasonable and not over the top like CheeseCake Factory. The place was happening and there were also many other birthdays going on.  They sang happy birthday to me which was cool although I didn't expect them too. I ended the night with some tiramisu for dessert and topped the whole meal off with some good red wine.

Delicious place for excellent service and Classic Italian food served with precision.  We shared several half portions to experience more flavors in one trip. Busy restaurant--recommend reservations for dinner.

One of my favorite restaurants in the city, this hidden gem has great food and great service, and every visit has been superb. The dish I enjoy most is the ricotta gnocchi, just so rich and decadent.  This was the first food boner I experienced in Chicago (and the next one was the Tartufo RPM).  Other dishes I've enjoyed include the Carpaccio di Manzo, Pizza Rustica, Tiramisu, Spaghetti Caprese, Pollo Valdostana, Trancio di Samone. Volare participates in Restaurant Week and the Lunch deals (4 courses for $22) are an amazing deal.  Definitely worth a visit for that reason alone, but everything about Volare is excellent.  It can get busy around dinnertime, so be sure to have an appointment or you can wait up to an hour to get seated.

A good friend of mine lives right around the corner from Volare and I have been dying to try it! I'm sad I waited so long. I actually arrived at lunch time but didn't order until dinner. I can't comment on the lunch menu, but they seemed to have a really good special. I think a 3 course lunch for a decent price. It's worth looking into.  I had rigatoni in Alfredo sauce with peas and prosciutto. It was so rich but delicious. I'm thankful I stuck with the half order. The minestrone soup I ordered may have been the best I've ever had! Including my grandmas. The bread was delicious too! We ate 2 loaves of it!  We skipped dessert this time around but I regret not looking the menu over and taking something to go. I also ordered 2 pasta dishes to bring home for the BF. He ate more than usual and loved it!  We had several wines while we were there. I love that they offer a few different sizes of glasses. The wine list is decent. The prices are ok. It's not the cheapest meal you will have, but they are very fair.  I wish I had used the valet parking. I somehow managed to get stuck against a wall in the nightmare of a garage across the street (before dinner). So I would recommend the valet over the garage!
Excellent restaurant.  Had the bruschetta, Caesar salad, and pappardelle pasta - finished with lemon sorbet. Cannot go wrong.  Excellent, excellent meal. A true gem in Chicago.  Nice find!!!!  :-)

Dropped by for Restaurant Week lunch today...good food and a lot of it today, and while nothing was special, I can see why some of my Mag Mile office colleagues come here regularly for a nicer meal with clients. I tried the 7" Pizza Rustica, the risotto, the salmon and the bread pudding.  Nothing out of the ordinary; the risotto was the best thing I got, but still nothing that approaches the quality of the Italian at La Scarola or Piccolo Sogno.  Service was good, and save for a hiccup with the serving time of the hot prosciutto sammie that my wife got (it came a few minutes after the salmon dishes arrived for the rest of our party), my experience today was generally good.
This is my all time favorite restaurant. The food is outstanding and the staff are the nicest people you will ever find in a restaurant downtown. It can get crowded so I recommend reserving a table.

Probably the best hand made tortellini I have  ever had. I appreciate that the cook or sous chef delivered our food, ensuring it hot. I enjoy that level of pride.  Two specials drinks and salads ~$100.

I have eaten in as well as carried out from Volare, and I have never been disappointed. The food is so fresh and very good, regardless of whether you eat in or take out. Also, for such high quality fare, it is very decently priced. While Rosebud can break your bank, and isn't even worth it, Volare is worlds better tasting, and affordable.  One of my favorite dishes is the "Insalata di Cavoletti" which consists of roasted brussel sprouts, toasted pancetta, butternut squash, Pecorino cheese, and brown sugar mustard aioli.  Another go-to is the spinach fettuccine bolognese. The pasta is homemade and, again, so fresh, as is the sauce. I've also tried the chicken parm and the pizza Salsiccia, both of which are also great. The room itself is dark and, the night I was there, very loud. It does have a nice atmosphere nonetheless, and service was very quick and attentive.  Overall, I have only great things to say about Volare!

This is one of the best Italian restaurants I have ever eaten at.  The service is superb.  You need anything at all and they are right there.  The food is outstanding as well.  I had the pizza which was really good.  My husband had the spicy garlic rigatoni which he said was the best he ever had.  So if your ever in Chicago do give it a try.  Its just a little pricey...but if the food and service is good its worth it.

Great food. I had two visits. The first time the food was really good. The second time the pasta was undercooked a little. Overall the food was great. The wait was around an hour though. The atmosphere of this place is good.

I work close by to volare and am so mad at myself for waiting as long as I did to give it a try!  It was delicious!  Picked it for a dinner spot when I had family in town and everyone felt the same way. Service was excellent and the food even better. I ordered the artichoke soup and chicken risotto, and didn't regret my decision at all like I often do at other places. A great feature they have is the option to order some of their entrees in half portions, so no need to take home leftovers, waste food, or overeat.  Thumbs up!
We loved this place!! Great food and service... Will return for sure.
Staff is over attentive and super friendly. If they served pasta and butter they would make it sound amazing. The staff was exceptional the food superb. When in Chicago eat here.

I found this place to be a nice, quiet choice for a lingering lunch with friends. It's better than casual (white tablecloths) but not stuffy.  The service was excellent.  The food was typical American Italian with a good selection of pasta, salads, wood-fired chewy thin crust pizza and meat mains.  Prices are reasonable.  This will be on my solid choice list for lunch in this area.
Amazing food and service! Was able to meet the manager and he was very nice and accommodating. Huge proportions and everything was fresh. Will be back next time I'm in town.

I have been here twice. The first time I went after searching reviews online for good italian in the area. The second time a friend wanted to go. I had the spinach fetucinni with bolognase sauce both times. The sauce is really salty. I thought maybe it was a one time thing the first time, but no amount of pepper or Parmesan cheese could cut the salt factor the second time either. I left most of the sauce on the plate because of it. It is a bit pricey for what it is... But not bad. I also tried the margarita pizza which was average. Overall, it's an ok option in the area, but not a place I would go out of my way to visit.

Waitress convinced me to order the the lamb that was on special for the night. Two people in our party ended up ordering the special. Waitress came back and said it wasn't available - only one was left - and the two of us had to draw for it.  I ended up getting  the short stick. Expected more. Then again maybe I didn't because their wasn't one Italian person working in the kitchen.

Fantastic little gem hidden downtown!  We went there for lunch today.  We were quickly seated.  Our server, Roman, was a true professional who has mastered his craft.  Very friendly, attentive, and professional. The food was incredible!  I had the lasagna and my wife had the ravioli.  Being a bit over zealous, we also ordered a aside of grandmas meatballs.  Layers of flavors in each dish.  And quite affordable as well.  Don't let the dim lights fool you-it's a great, lively atmosphere as well. We are definitely working this restaurant into our rotation whenever we are in town!

Let me first say this- the food is amazing (whenever the chef doesn't have a fit - I once witnessed him come out from the kitchen and yell at a server for voiding a house salad) The owner Benny is quit charming, and he is personable, and he hustles alot, so my hat's off to him. However, the reason for my poor rating, is due to the management team and the way it's run, this is the 2nd time in my 3 visits with my husband, that I witness poor behavior from the GM (I was told he was GM) anyhow, we got to hear him talk and his sarcasm is over the top and he is disrespectful to his staff. While ordering, he interrupted our waiter with a meaningless remark, I was so embarrassed for him, I felt the need to overtip. I then watched this man do nothing but give instruction in a hitler-matter while making the staff set up tables last minute for a large party who apparently had a reservation ( let your team know so they are prepared) we got bumped twice while this happened. Then finally while waiting for the valet to pull up our car, one of the hostess urged us to wait outside but I insisted waiting up front since it was freezing  out, 3 minutes later, she suggested we wait by the door frame and said it was heated. For the money we spent, and the reputation this place has, I was hoping for a better quality of people. This place could use a fresh new staff.

Great place right of Michigan Mile. Frankie the bartender was super nice. We discussed football and Rottweilers. Order the Fusilli Ragu. California Cabernet was another great suggestion. New DT Chicago favorite

This is my favorite restaurant in Chicago. My coworkers and I go often for lunch. They have a very good Gluten free menu. The owner Benny is always there to help and makes his diners feel like family. My favorite dish is the Rosemary steak and the vodka gnocci.

This is traditional Italian food at it's very best!   There is a reason this is a very popular spot for lunch or dinner and it's always full - it is spectacular!   I do recommend making reservations, but don't let that stop you from just stopping by either.  I love the risotto, and many other pasta dishes.  I've had their fish special and everyone at the table were envious of me!    Nothing better than food envy ;-)   I've heard the pizza is great, so that just means we have to go again to give it a try!  Service is friendly, helpful and professional - you can't beat their service.

We stopped in here, not in our usual form (i.e.- Yelp searching). We just saw a little place and we said "hey, let's try that place". We were not disappointed. We ordered a glass of wine, some prosciutto and sopressata, enjoyed the bread they provided, and shared the rigatoni arrabbiata as our main dish. Everything was delicious, and the service was great!

Everything you'd expect in a successful downtown restaurant. Friendly reception, extraordinary service and great food. But more than that, they create the feeling that you've dined there many times before.  Our server was fantastic. Very patient, enthusiastic about everything on the menu and helped tremendously with the wine selection - she was spot on with the Malbec. My artichoke and leek soup was particularly memorable. The ravioli was very good as well.  Such a nice evening amongst friends.

Nice but not great. Wife's lasagna came out cold. They did make a whole new entree for her. I had the spaghetti, good. Wine selection is nice and they have half bottles. The little neck claims were great. Caesar salad dressing needed a little more flavor. Expectations match dining experience.

We were having trouble finding a table at a restaurant in the area and called them for availability.  They were able to seat our party of seven right away and gave us a comfortable round table in the corner of the restaurant.  The décor is cozy and charming.  The staff were friendly, welcoming and greeted us whether they were serving us or not. The dish most enjoyed was the Gnocchi alla Vodka.  The waiter said that the gnocchi were not made with potatoes, just ricotta and flour, making them light and fluffy.  I had the Lasagna al Forno and was disappointed.  The lasagna was very heavy-mostly ground beef, noodles and mozzarella cheese with a consistency similar to cheeseburger macaroni with melted cheese on top.  My husband had Rigatoni Bolognese and said that the Bolognese sauce was mostly ground beef and the sauce did not have much flavor.  Others had the Fettuccine Verdi alla Bolognese shared the same opinion. Our experience is that there is better pasta elsewhere.

Volare is GREAT.  We were in from Phoenix and we used to live in Chicago. We've only been to Volare on two other occasions, but they did not disappoint.   We showed up Friday after Christmas at 8 pm and had little to no wait.  Our waitress was outstanding and provided us great information on the specials and recommended a wonderful wine.  We each started with soup and shared the buffalo mozzarella and tomato salad.  The soups (minestrone for one, garbanzo bean for the other) were yummy! For dinner I ordered the Risotti Fattoria and my partner ordered the Ravioli di Ricotta.  They were huge portions, fresh and hot.  The ravioli was clearly handmade and fresh with a really nice sauce. The risotti is my favorite for sure.  Its a HUGE portion and really rich - so tasty.  I was reminded that next time I can order the half portion - so we can order dessert! I can't say enough how much I really enjoy the food and the staff.  Everyone was great and our waitress was just awesome.  They made the night wonderful for us.  We will be returning every time we make it back to Chicago!

For a restaurant that tries to be so high class with a wine guy, two hostesses who didn't seem to do anything and semi expensive meals, it really didn't have that atmosphere. the tables were packed extemely close together and it felt like you were in an olive garden. food was mediocre. overall probably wouldn't visit again. the staff was very welcoming though which somewhat made up for it.

Just ok, at best. We came at 3 for an early dinner and has extremely slow service even though it was pretty empty. The waitress recommended many things on the menu, which seemed great at first. When she took our order,  she became a little pushy, asking each of us over and over if we wanted the kale salad and truffles. We understand this was your recommendation,  but we will let you know if we want it!   The kale salad that the waitress recommended (weird, and not as awesome as she raved about) came quick, but everything else took about 1 hour after we ordered. My son's filet was over cooked and it took another 20 minutes to correct it. I would have expected for it to be removed from the bill,  but only a "Sorry, the kitchen normally gets it right",  was all he got.  We were all completely done when it finally came out. The filet was great when they got it right, but the rigatoni was undercooked and had bland Alfredo sauce. We have had much better Italian for the price!

good luck.  do not valet here.  we were told to pick up our car at 2am.  the bus server/manger who ever was left behind with his date.  was of no help to us.  he was aggressive and rude and taking photos of me through the window.  i'm sorry you're not doing your job.  but this was horrible.  we have no idea where our car is.

The place has expanded but the food and service are still amazing. The prices are still very reasonable, especially considering it's a two minute walk from the Magnificent Mile. Tip: Every time we have gone on the weekend it's been booked from 5:30pm-8:30pm, so you want to get your reservations in early.

I've had this place bookmarked for a while now, and finding myself in Downtown with my love we thought we should give it a try. Very cute interior (decorated for Christmas) and Italian music playing in the background.  Meh on the calamari, too soft and chewy.  But the rigatoni Alfredo and the gnocchi alla vodka was amazing. We got them with a side of grilled chicken and spinach.  Amazing food and nice atmosphere.

A traditional, and authentic Italian restaurant not far from Michigan Avenue. They do all the basics right with delicious, chicken parmesan, calamari, homemade pizzas, and gnocchi. Also reasonably priced and a fun atmosphere!

I was staying at the Hyatt downtown and a friend insisted that I go check this place out. I called beforehand (wanted to catch their lunch menu) and the woman said I can order if I come before 3pm. So I pretty much ran there and I'm glad I did! I got there at 2:55 but the manager still let me put in an order for lunch. I ordered the gnocchi alla vodka - hands down the best gnocchi I have ever tried!! Their bread is really good as well. 4 stars only because the waitress was a bit inattentive. However, for $10 lunch special in downtown Chicago I would go again!!

Good service. Great food. I HIGHLY recommend the gnocchi alla vodka! It was soooo good!! It's definitely worth going back there for. Atmosphere is where I have an issue giving the restaurant 5 stars. The atmosphere is very loud and the tables are just a little too close together. There seemed to be a lot of families & children there, which was main hang up about the place. If you're trying to have a romantic evening then you should probably pick a different Italian restaurant.

My wife and I have been expanding our field of Italian dining as of recent, and after experiencing Volare it has become a new ritual for us. The experience is casual and pleasant which provides for a relaxing dine out date night. Their food is absolutely on point, from their fresh Parmesan and olive oil mix, to their tart homemade tomato sauce. Their soups are always a treat, especially the minestrone loaded with vegetables and just the right amount of spices. My favorite entree is the Lasagna Bolognese (Al Forno); rich, creamy, delectable, this dish baked to cheesy perfection floors me every time I take my first bite. The restaurant tends to get busy, and a bit loud, which can be distracting while dining with a loved one. But the staff has always been very pleasant, and courteous about our length of stay, and has never rushed us away from our experience. A Chicago must try.

Just  there Monday night (12/8). We showed up at 5:30, our reservation time, and sat right down. By 6:00 it was full and by 6:30 people were standing waiting for a table. The seating was a little tight but not to bad. Our drinks and bread were brought right out. We asked our waiter a few questions about the menu and it was explained we pretty much could ask to have the dish changed to your liking - could pair up any sauce to any noodle etc. My wife asked for something that I don't think was on the menu - a half order of linguine noodles with olive oil, garlic, some chicken added, and whatever else they may have done - she loved it. I had the gnocchi in vodka sauce with a side order of meat balls (had a bite of meat with each small dumpling) - delicious. Since I had 3 beers, ate most of the bread along with a full size Caesar salad, I couldn't finish my full order of gnocchi. My wife had 3 glasses of wine, a little bread, a half house salad, and a half dinner order, was also stuffed. Dinner cost $85 plus tip. Since service was great and the food so good, it was worth it. You can tell the restaurant is ran really really well, and it was very friendly. Would go again.

We were in from out of town celebrating my Mother's birthday with a group of 5.  We had reservations and had to wait about 20 minutes to be sat.   This was the only downside.  The atmosphere is classy yet upbeat.  The service was good, although they were very busy.  We all enjoyed our meals and would definitely return!!  Great Italian food!
Love the calamari! Nice place and service, reasonable price, would come again. Very traditional Italian food, love it

Seemingly hidden location right in my neighborhood and right down the stairs from my office building offers five-star lunch service and a phenomenal "Bistecca di Manzo alla Griglia" (grilled marinated skirt steak with roasted potatoes and arugula) for $12. No, I am not dyslexic. Twelve U.S. dollars for a generous piece of delicious skirt steak. While I really want to try some of the seafood-based lunch dishes, this was just way too good of a deal and I'm not sure I could pass it up. Yum.
Epically delicious with very pleasant, professional waitstaff. The seafood pasta special was crucial. Mucho tasty.

Last night we had dinner at Volare. I had so many expectations based on the reviews. I ordered the Veal Medallions in a lemon sauce. The Lemon sauce was way too lemony. The potatoes were basic diced potatoes, browned. Very blah. I was given one stem of steamed broccoli. Blah. The Caesar salad was not crisp. It was kind of lukewarm. The only thing that was actually tasty was the croutons. The bread they served was not tasty bread. It was like white wonder bread cut in squares served with a saucer of olive oil and Parmesan cheese. I mean really? I honestly think I have received a better meal at Olive Garden. Over priced bland Italian food. Not worth a second visit. I was disappointed. I love a good Italian restaurant. This one is not.

Wow. Italian food done right. The portions were generous, price was fair and the service impeccable. The two brothers who I imagine are also owners were showing people to their seats and directing the insane traffic at their cozy restaurant on a Tuesday night. We ordered the black spaghetti with shrimp, scallops, and crab I believe, told them to make it spicy. It came out perfectly spiced with garlic and crushed peppers. Additionally had a stuffed pork chop which was cooked to perfection and the marsala sauce was delicious. Two kettle one dirty martinis with blue cheese stuffed olives....I've never had olives like that and they were delicious. The best part was at the end of the night one of the brothers/owners was out in the cold flagging down taxi's for, his guests leaving. Great ambience, great food, great staff.

Nice atmosphere but disappointing food. First dish was a red pepper soup that was OK, as it lacked salt. Second dish was a seafood risotto that was prepared well, however the shrimps and some of the mussels were not fresh and had a strong iodine taste. Not repeating this one!

We came here after a big day of shopping in the cold. We were a bit early so grabbed cocktails at the back bar. Prices are decent for the city. We were seated soon after. Almost rushed to our table that we were early for after they came to get us a second time. The place is packed, busy, bustling. We got some wine, a pizza and the veal parmesan bone-in that came recommended. The veal was excellent. The pizza was good. Service was a bit cold in the beginning but I think our waiter warmed up to us. It was good Italian but I wasn't blown away by it.

The eggplant appetizer with stuffed ricotta in marinara is AMAZING!!!! I absolutely would recommend this restaurant. I live in New Orleans but have a condo in Chicago not too far from this place and we go here all of the time and every time we go it has always been a Pleasure. They also deliver, and are open 365 days a year and close at 11pm which is nice for people like me who eat late at night!! Authentic Italian dishes and they have probably the best marinara EVER!!

The food was alright, nothing special though. The most off putting thing though was that mysoginistic manager or whatever he is(Benny). It's not good to see him talk down to employees. Not worth the money or time to go there.
I came here for lunch and my salmon was soo good. Lots of flavor and amazingly juicy.  Service was great. Nice and quiet lunch, very good for business meetings.

Delicious! Went here for dinner when on a business trip and had a great time. Food was great... Had penne in vodka sauce with peas and sausage. Very good! Wine started at about $33/bottle, so reasonably priced. The ambiance isn't so nice, but it wasn't loud which was good for a business dinner.
Returned to Volare in September with my husband and 4 friends. It was fabulous!  We loved the atmosphere, food and service!

Avoid this place. I don't know who is reviewing this place but avoid the hype. The service is uppidity and they lie to your face. We made a reservation, showed up and were told to take our party over to the bar for some drinks; they would seat us in 15-20 mins when a table became available. What's the point of making a reservation if you're going to end up waiting and have a fake, blond hostess write your name down on her existing list of walk-ins? They asked us 3 times the name on our reservation. The bar area is over-crowded and in the service path to the kitchen. Unless you're seated at one of the few bar stools you're getting bumped -- literally bumped -- by service staff while you balance your drink and coat, or by other patrons making their way to tables. Finally we got seated. The waiter was cold and seemingly impatient. He rushed us to place an order. Then we waited over 40 minutes for 4 pasta entrees and not a single peep from the waiter during that time. He didn't even circle back to see if we wanted cocktail refills or wine with our dinner. We started out with drinks from the bar so we initially turned down drinks when we placed our order. But after 40 minutes we wanted something other than water refills but the water was MIA. The pasta was fine. Nothing spectacular. The squid pasta was not good at all and should be avoided. The lasagna was ok but expected better given the rave reviews and the fuss of this place.

This is the most authentic Italian restaurant I have been to since visiting Florence, Tuscany, and Venice last year. It was delicious, and just like all of the food we enjoyed overseas. Granted, we did just order salads, soup, and pizza, so I can't vouch for the actual entrees. I look forward to returning to Volare to try more items.

This was our second time eating at Volare.  My nephew was in town so we thought we'd take everyone out to a nice Italian dinner.  Although there are many better rated Italian restaurants, we knew Volare and the first time was such a positive experience, we were looking forward to going back.    The first time we went was a Saturday afternoon, and it was very quiet.  We had excellent service.  The second time we went was a Saturday evening at 6:00 p.m. party of 6,  and it was really disappointing.  The food here is dependably good Italian food, more comfort food than interesting or exceptional.  But that's where the consistency ended.  The service was horrible.  The waiter kept hurrying us through our meal.  When I asked if anyone wanted a salad he said, why do you need salad when you have appetizers?  Then when it was time for dessert we asked to see a menu, instead he goes and plunks this desert tray down in front of my husband and asks what we would like.  My husband had to ask him to tell us what each one was!  Then I asked if I could get a bar menu for the digestif, and again, he runs and grabs one and throws it on the table in front of me.  All the drinks are Italian, and I ask him which one he recommends and he says maybe port (which is not even on the menu}.  I'm feeling very hurried, so I order some orange thing from the appertif menu and he says how do you want it?  What???? Isn't the point of an appertif or digestif to drink it straight?  I'm completely confused now, and a little flustered, so my husband say...she wants it neat.  It was pretty bad, tasted like drinking bitters.  A fitting end to our dinner.  Needless to say we won't be back.

I came here a couple weeks ago with a friend that was in town. I didn't realize at the time, but once I got there I realized I had also been there a few years back!  My husband and I shared a small order of the Insalta di Cavoletti (roasted brussles sprouts, butternut squash). First of all, the half order was HUGE and served about 4 people for an appetizer. That "salad" is not really a salad - it's almost like a pasta salad or something, so it is very rich and definitely not good for you. However, it was quite good. I'm not a huge fan of mustard, so that's the only thing I would have changed (besides a smaller portion). For dinner, we shared the Fusilloni al Ragu which was good but very salty. We had more than enough food for the two of us between the half order of salad and full order of pasta. Our friend had the Pappardelle Ricotta which was also delicious. I normally don't care for Ricotta but this dish was very good. The free bread was delicious - very well done! The service was on point. Overall, a great dining experience. Not quite 5 stars because the dishes weren't particularly unique and there were elements that I didn't enjoy in each of them, but overall a very solid 4 stars. TIP: they had more reservation availability when I called vs what was shown online. We were sat for our reservation right on time (on a Wednesday evening).

Nothing special. Not 'the most delicious Italian fare ever' I have had by any means. Yay for several varieties of homemade pasta, but the sauces were mostly just ok. Pomodoro, meh. Bolognese, meh. The three stars were earned by the gnocchi alla vodka (which all 4 in my party wish we had ordered) and the good service.

I come here every year with my husband for our anniversary & we absolutely love this place.  He orders the lasagna, and I order the gnocchi in vodka sauce. The gnocchi in vodka sauce is so heavenly. I order it every time, and finish the whole plate EVERY TIME.  We always receive wonderful, professional service every time we dine here.  If you make a reservation, it makes it super easy to never have to wait for a table. Even when we don't make a reservation, we are generally able to get seated very quickly.  The prices are reasonable, especially for the amount and quality of the food you get.  No complaints about this place, we will continue to come back.

DELICIOUS!!!!!   Several amazing dishes to choose from and reasonably priced if you want a splurge dinner.  Not to mention, they serve some of the dishes in half portions which are decently sized if you're visiting town and don't have a fridge like me.   The staff is super friendly and very knowledgable about the menu, which again, was quite incredible.  However, be sure to book a reservation in advance because it seems to be a very popular spot.

I really wanted to give this place 5 stars. Really. The food was great. I had the quattro pizza (good, basic Neapolitan-style pizza) and the brussels sprouts salad (very unique with cool textures). My friends had several of the pastas, which they all loved. In short, everything tasted delicious. The bread they serve is also quite delicious. I'm not a huge Italian person, but everything seemed really fresh and it was definitely worth the price (the half portions are fabulous!).  HOWEVER, our waiter, we'll just identify her by her first initial, C, was the worst. She kept calling us all "sweeties" and "love bugs" which might have been cute if we were 5, but was not so cute for a group of 20-something professionals. She also wouldn't even let us see the wine menu until she looked at our IDs, which seems really strange to me. There isn't really any harm in seeing a wine menu if you're under 21, since you have to show ID before you order anyway, right...? She also did a "drum roll" on the table behind us which was extremely obnoxious and annoying and it did not look like the people at the table enjoyed it either. Finally, and worstly, when the bill came, my friends and I split the check and wrote the totals for each card on the back of the receipt (mind you, we had ensured with a calculator that everything added up correctly). C took the check, walked two steps, and started doing the math in her head. She immediately came back and told us that we still owed her $5 because we were short. We told her that the math was correct, and she said we could do the math together. We did it again and she realized that our math actually was correct all along. I don't even think she apologized for accusing us of not paying the right amount. Hint to waitresses: maybe don't accuse customers of not paying when you've just quickly done the math yourself. OH AND when a friend asked to clarify the price on her wine after the bill came out, the waitress passive aggressively opened up the menu and pointed to the price of it, even though my friend had already said it was fine and that she believed C the first time she said the price. The entire ordeal was just extremely patronizing, and I do not have the time nor the patience for condescending waiters. The food also took a while to come out, but nothing worse than I was expecting given that it was an extremely busy Friday night. Lastly, I was a little annoyed with our table... I think they crammed the four of us into a table for two, and so when our food arrived, our waitress had to put two dishes worth of food on one plate because the plates wouldn't have all fit on our tiny table otherwise. I would come back again, but only because the food was so good. Maybe I'll just do takeout?

I usually don't write reviews but felt compelled to write about my experience here.  I was in town for a conference and looked on yelp to see what was close by my hotel. This place came up and had great reviews so I thought I'd try it out. I went by myself and ordered an Arnold Palmer and linguine with clams. The food was just OK, I thought that it was rather bland but at least they gave alot of clams. The worst part of the visit was the waiter. The guy had no respect in how he talked to me and was very unprofessional. He never came to check on me after I got my food and I had to ask two other workers for a refill on my drink. For some reason they couldn't help me and had to track him down. By this time I was done with his poor service and was very curt in how I talked to him. I'm the last person to be rude but the guy did not earn my respect. I just wanted to pay and get the heck out of there. I will not be back nor will I recommend this place to others.

Stopped by on the basis of the positive reviews. Nice atmosphere and friendly service but the food was outstandingly mediocre. Ordered the carbonara from the specials and it was just like eating plain spaghetti. There was only the merest hint of anything else, with almost no sauce at all. Such a basic dish being so poorly done makes me think they don't know what they are doing in the kitchen. As a further note, as it was a special and a simple dish, you'd expect it to be among the lower priced items. The server made no mention of the price but when the bill came it was actually one of the most expensive things I could have ordered - almost as much as the steak! Based on the other reviews, this seems like a regular ploy on the part of the restaurant to jack up the check and it feels very cheap. A very disappointing experience and I cannot recommend this place.

Nice dining hall!  I had the fresh pappardell pasta and the pasta was good. Portions are very small for all the dishes!  I saw the desert -- the small cup offered was most unappealing - thus we did not bothered to order.

Volare is like a pop quiz for indecisive people like me. Everything on the menu sounded like a good choice. Every special that the server named sounded like a good choice. Everything that was eventually brought to our table was a good choice. I opted for the mezzi rigatone with prosciutto and peas...delicious. It was satisfying without giving you that uncomfortably heavy feeling that occasionally happens with pasta dishes. I had a glass of pinot noir with my meal and it was incredibly smooth. No complaints about service, I feel like everyone was attentive and in good spirits. The lady telling us about the specials could have probably sold me the Brooklyn bridge! Water was refilled regularly and without having to ask. And the owner (I believe he was the owner) came around on more than one occasion to see how everything was. That level of customer service on such a busy night is admirable.  Would I come back? Well, I sort of have to. Because being the indecisive person I am, there are still dishes on the menu that I am kicking myself for not ordering.

Absolutely best italian food, wonderful service! I've eaten at some good italian restaurants from east to west coast, from upscale to old fashioned home style. Nothing beats this place. Had amazing seafood appetizer consisting of grilled squid, octopus, shrimp and scallops. Mussels in white wine sauce. Black spaghetti with seafood in brandy rose sauce. White fish with spinach (vegetables). Amazing!! Every piece and bite!! Had an older lady server who was so wonderful! Made so many great suggestions and had great service!! Fell in love with this place!

Note: I came here at the beginning of September.  Yum yum....you have to try Gnocchi alla vodka. I am a fan of this dish. It was rich, dense, and the potato Gnocchi feels light on the palate, unlike the other places I have tried which leave a heavy potato feel after you have eaten (RPM-Italian to name one that failed). This place is a must try for Italian food lovers ...authentic
First time and a pretty good judge of Italian food. Had the veal that was amazing followed up with the Tiramisu. The owner floats around greets everyone, the staff is very good. Don't miss this place

I love vodka sauce.  So when they had housemade gnocchi alla vodka, my order was basically a no-brainer.  This stuff was sooooo good... and yet so dense and rich and delicious I didn't manage to clear my plate. Well, maybe part of that is the glutton in my ordered some meatballs as a side.  I totally shared them.  But still, my eyes were bigger than my stomach.  And this stuff was so good.  That's the challenge for me when I travel, I can't take the food home with me to repurpose as a lunch or something. Volare was definitely YUM.  I'm not an expert in Italian, but this seemed pretty authentic for Americanized Italian for sure.  I'm salivating thinking of the bread and gnocchi right now... mmmm...
Get really excited for Volare night, the go tos for me are the alfredo pasta with peas and prosciutto ham and the margarita pizza.  A little pricey but we love it either way
We ordered pizza and it was delicious! The service was extreemly good. We also had a cup of dessert (chocolate one) and it totally made my day! Definately want to visit again.

WOW! Just a great big WOW!!! We loved it!! Tip: Make a reservation!!! We did just drop in and waited almost an hour without one. The food was incredible!!! I haven't had salmon like that since I was on my honeymoon in France. The food was worth the wait and I would suggest trying the specials.  They are unusual and worth the chance. The servers were so nice and very well informed on the menu with clear opinions on what they enjoy. I hate when you go somewhere and the servers say "Everything is good" which really means "I don't eat here." Our server gave great advice on what to try and what was worth the chance. I can't wait to go back and try something else!

A fairly solid meal, but I don't anticipate this becoming my new favorite Italian restaurant in Chicago. I started with the Insalata Volare. (Side note to the restaurant...if you describe the salad as a "chopped" salad in the menu, but it comes with big chunks of lettuce in it, then it's really just a "salad".) Excellent salad...I really liked the vinaigrette....nice and light, and a good complement to the ingredients in the salad. My friend and I then split the Fattoria Risotti and the Gnocchi alla Vodka for our main. The Risotti was very nice...cooked perfectly and the sauce was flavorful without being overpowering. The Gnocchi was a disappointment, after reading all the good comments about it in reviews beforehand. First, I asked the waiter if they could make the sauce spicy, and he responded that the sauce is already premade, so they can't adjust it. (That really should have been my sign to order something else.) When the Gnocchi arrived, the pasta itself was wonderful...light and fluffy...but the sauce was terribly bland. Quite a disappointment. If I were ever to return (doubtful), I would try the Gnocchi again, but with a different sauce...perhaps what they use on the Rigatoni all'Arrabbiata. Final comment...they are a bit pricy. As a comparison, using drinks, the Verdi Imperial Stout at what IS my favorite Italian restaurant in Chicago is $11...here it was $16. Ouch. But...all in all, a nice evening with friends...okay service.....nice atmosphere...decent food.

My fiancé and I had a 20 person dinner here after our engagement. The staff was very friendly and welcoming of our diverse party. The food was perfectly executed and we' ll have to return for a romantic follow up.

What a great, reasonably priced restaurant located right off of the magnificent mile. Recently went here with a family member who was in town for the weekend, and we had such a fabulous time! I got the chicken risotto and it was SO delicious! The peas in it were such a perfect addition, and it was so creamy and perfectly cooked. Great flavors.  The only downside is that this is a very busy restaurant. Even with a reservation, we had to wait an addition 30 minutes to get seated. But the entire staff was super friendly and helpful with suggestions, and overall it was a great evening!

Surprisingly affordable yet elegant restaurant relatively close to the Magnificent Mile in the downtown area.  They brought out lovely bread appetizers with Italian olive oil and then the quattro formaggio pizza I ordered.  I had assumed for some reason that all the pizza in Chicago would be deep dish so I was surprised by the thin slices, but this was my misunderstanding, not the restaurant's.  The service was great and the outdoor patio is a nice touch.  I would definitely return next time I'm in the Windy City. :)
The best fine Italian dining that I have had.  I recommend the Penne, but really you can't go wrong with anything. The service is great, ambiance is wonderful, and the food is out if this world.

This is a really great place on many levels. Service was efficient and friendly. Had an issue with a wrong order and it was taken care of timely. We visit Chicago 3-4 times a year and I will go back here every time. Good value. Had the "Fruits of the sea rissotto and it was to die for. I'll go back just for that.

Wonderful little Italian restaurant in the heart of downtown Chicago. Recently brought my parents here for a nice dinner to celebrate their anniversary. It was pretty packed on a Friday night and although we arrived promptly for our reservation, it took about 15 minutes for us to be seated. Unfortunately because of how busy it was, there was really no place for us to sit/stand while we waited for our table. We basically just stood near the bar/in a hallway and tried to stay out of people's ways.  Once seated, we had to wait a while for our server. It took us several minutes to even get menus and waters, which had me concerned. I was hoping to treat my parents to a nice time and was concerned about the slow service. However once we got our menus, the pace of the evening definitely picked up. We had very attentive service and a wonderful meal. We had two bottles of a wonderful red wine, and those in our party had salmon, gnocchi with vodka sauce, and chicken parmesan. The vodka sauce, as other yelpers have said, is to die for. We even made room for some of their desserts (I can't remember the name, but I loved the goat cheese custard dessert).

Pack your Patience! Had 7:15 reservations, upon arrival the hostess said it would be a few minutes, feel free to grab a glass of wine at either of the two bars! (Easier said then done) After waiting 30 minutes, and watching the crowd line up to wait, I sent my husband to the bar for a glass of wine. Finally at 8:00 we were seated! Why make reservations?

Friendly greeting upon arrival. Seated immediately in a clean well ran dining room. Our waiter was very professional and explained the specials very clearly. My wife started with a very good Caesar salad and I had a nicely presented shrimp cocktail. The whole experience was exceptional. Our entrées were fantastic. You will not be disappointed by this place.

Been here twice now and I can't WAIT till my next visit.  The food is back to basics Italian. Exactly what I love. Nothing over the top, nothing too crazy, just simple and delicious. One of the best Italian meals I've had in my life and I'm a total pasta-holic. The first time I came here I can with a big group of coworkers and I'm not kidding when I say we tried one of everything on the menu. And it was all incredible. The pizza. The baked stuffed eggplant, the meats and cheeses. Good grief. All so amazing. Even something as simple as the marinara with pappardelle noodles is fantastic. During my most recent visit last month I had the veal fusilli and it was incredible. My boyfriend ordered the special of the day which was a ravioli with marinara and I was jealous and sad I couldn't fit another plate of food in my mouth because I would have definitely ordered that if I did. For dessert I had a goat cheese panna cotta and it was heavenly.  The service here is no joke. Very friendly, very attentive.
