The manager (owner?) came over more than a few times to our table to make sure everything was going all right. And it sure was. You're treated like family here, for sure.  I am kicking myself so very hard for not trying this place when I lived in Chicago. But at least I now I have something to look forward to when I return!

I was there on Sept 3...week day night and the place was packed.  We sat on the patio and everything was great.  My friend and I split an unusual salad that only slightly appealed to me, but it turned out to be fantatstic.  It was roasted brussel sprouts and butternut squash, pancetta and cheese (what's not to love?)  it had a dressing of a mustard aioli...yum.  I had the lamb...it was cooked to perfection, beautiful medium rare.  The green beans were just crunchy...so good.  My friend had the seafood linguini special...again perfect.  The patio was full but the service was still excellent, almost anticpatory.  Just observing it is obvious that this is a restaurant that has standards for their employees...everyone seemed to work together so well.  Our waiter ( Raffi?) was excellent.  I really can't say enough nice things about our experience.  Volare was recommended to us and I would pass that recommendation on to anyone visiting Chicago.

One of my favorite restaurants in Chicago. I have been at least a dozen times and it's always a wonderful experience. Its busy like any good restaurant will be on date nights, but service is still pretty good even when it's packed. When it's not too busy you might even get a visit from the owner. A really charming guy who always makes you feel special. Try the specials. They are almost always unique and I've never had a bad one.

I remember Volare being so great!  I was there with a big group this weekend, an perhaps that is why the food was lackluster and the service lacking.  I had the Insalata Volare which was pretty good.  The bread was decent but the olive oil wasn't my favorite.  I had the roast chicken and it was drrrrryyyy.  Also, the wine wasn't great for the price point. I doubt I'll be back.  Womp womp.

After walking around the city with our daughter for her birthday, this was her choice of restaurant. Volare has a feel of a New York City Italian restaurant. The tables are close together, people are loud and seem to have a good time. They have a good menu with a variety of items - they have both homemade and dried pastas, which they clearly mark so you know what you are getting. They have a variety of chicken, steak and seafood entrees. But when the server read the specials, I was intrigued by the King Salmon on a bed of Spinach with oil and garlic. There were a number of appetizer and dinner specials, but this one really captured my attention.  They serve Fociaccia and crispy Italian breads with oll while you wait. Their oil has Parmesan and oregano in it. I prefer mine plain, so they brought me a separate plate of oil. I thought it was curious that they didn't have cruets of oil on the tables, but they did not when the basket of bread was empty or one of the plates of oil was dry so they brought more. The Salmon was a surprisingly large portion. It was, unfortunately, a little overcooked and underspiced. I don't recall the server saying it came with Steamed Muscles, but it did and they were marvelous. I asked about wine pairing. The server asked what I liked and I explained that Chardonnay was a little too dry for me, but I wanted something light and fruity but not sweet. She recommended something and, not knowing any better, I said I would try it. What she brought was quite sweet, more of a desert wine. If I could compare it to anything I would think it was a German Riesling. After dinner, when she brought the check came the final shock. Where the typical price for a menu item here was $$, the special was a high $$$. I should have asked ahead of time when she did not offer pricing when explaining the specials. Overall, not a bad experience, but a little disappointing. From the overcooked salmon to the sweeter than described wine, it was not what I expected. The spinach and the muscles were excellent, but didn't make up for the rest. Would I try this again? With the amount of good Italian restaurants in Chicago, I would most likely to try somewhere else next time.
Great food. My favorite is the grilled seafood appetizer (don't know the Italian name for it).

Avoid the Veal Ragu at all cost.  I'm not a picky eater and will eat just about anything, but my $18 bowl of ragu was so terrible I couldnt get in more than 3 bites. It was so salty!! I informed our waitress who apologized and took it off the bill right away. Others at the table ordered the Kale salad which was good but very salty as well.  The $35 special of the day was some kind of homemade tortellini and those that ordered it thought it was just ok and also on the salty side.  I would give 5 stars if it was just based on service alone. Our waitress and bus boy were on the money!

Sadly a disappointing experience. I have been coming here since 1999. Not a regular but this was always a great place when I was in Business School.  Up to now the experience has been great and on the off times it has not the staff has always made it right. This time however, they went out of their way to do nothing except the bus boy. I had reservations. We were seated and promptly waited far too long for service. The waitress insisted on speaking to us and a group next to us at the same time making it less than personal.  I order the same meal I have ordered for my date for more than 15yrs. Pasta with red sauce shrimps and sausage on the side.  I always get a fish. The waitress was really put off by the order saying things like "ooooh THATS special" degrading my dates order.  I ordered bruchetta and the sea salad. Only the latter arrived. However the waitress disappeared.  The food arrived and for the first time since 99 no visit from the manager and no visit from the waitress to check. The manager always makes rounds and for aome eeason we were excluded.  The food was wrong. The pasta and shrimp...and we were here last Feb....has always been pasta red sauce and five or six large shrimp and sausage on a side plate.  This time it was pasta red sauce and one small burnt like it was on a wood skewer shrimp and a sausage on the side so cold we thought it uncooked. The waitress comes back finally and lools at my date and says oooookkkkaaay guess you werent all that hungry and we went out of our way to make a special order.....and left. To be honest....if a customer doesnt eat the food you bring and you wait 45minutes to return to the table.....it is a good sign something about the meal is not right. The waitress was so intent on flattering herself and being rude to my date that she refused to see we didnt touch the cold sausage and we put the burnt shrimp on the end of the fork on top of the lemonade alongside the sausage seeing that its grotesque appearance was more suited as an art installation.......when customers make art with their food over 1hr of waiting ......IT IS A BAD SIGN. So for the first time in 15yrs. I left. No thank you for coming and no dessert.  To be honest though. The young bus boy with close cut hair was phenomenal and very polite.  I asked that a manager call me prior to leaving but was rebuffed by the woman managing reservations.  I guess after all this time it is a new management and new style of business. One I will never revisit.

Black pasta and gnocchi is what we ordered and boy of boy...we were stealing bites from each other left and right.  The mood is perfect (looks fancy but friendly)  we walked in at an odd time dressed in work out gear and we surprisingly didn't feel out of place.  The bread selection wasn't amazing but once we got our foods we definitely needed another serving to soak up the left over sauce.    Our last meal in Chicago...left us yearning for another trip back to visit this place one more time.

My friends and I were visiting from out of town over the Labor Day weekend.  We stumbled across this restaurant from  yelp.com .  We decided to give it a shot and so glad we did.  This was the last meal together before our vacation had to end the following day.  For appetizers, we had the caprese, calamari and grigliata mista (which was my fav).  Other orders included warm kale salad (best kale salad ever), pollo arrosto (my meal), risotti di mare, clam linguine, spaghetti neri al pesce.  Everything we ordered was delicious and everyone enjoyed their meals.  For dessert, we had chocolate, tiramisu and passion fruit.  The best part, the meals were available as half portions (except pollo arrosto) which were decent size and reasonably priced.  1 of the 2 places I would def recommend in Chicago.

This is one of those reviews I keep starting and then stopping because I keep getting distracted by reminiscing about what I ate and then I start drooling and then I come back to reality and have to make sure I did not drool on the laptop. The point is, Volare is indeed amazing enough to conjure up fond memories of the tasty dishes, not to mention the fabulous service and the inviting atmosphere. At the time of this writing, it looks like there are more than 860 other reviews that are more or less favorable, so I'm pretty sure there are a few hundred people out there who understand completely (drool notwithstanding). My parents and I were in town and we had 8:00 p.m. tickets to a show across town. With 5:45 p.m. reservations made, we walked over and prepared ourselves for what would be the definitive meal of our trip. The walk up to this place takes you past a covered patio that was already bustling with business at this hour. Servers and bussers were going back and forth to make sure customers were taken care of and as we walked into the dim entrance, we saw that same attentive quality extends to all other members of the staff, from the hostess who seated us to the manager who greeted us. But that was nothing compared to our waitress. Her name was Blanche and she was so accommodating and helpful that it was like she had known us for years. She knew the menu front to back, and while she was refreshingly honest about her menu recommendations, not once was she overbearing. We knew we were in good hands when she suggested an awesome bottle of wine to start the evening, and I knew I was in great hands later on when she pointed me toward a particular dessert that settled my stomach from the war I waged upon it over the prior 90 minutes. My Dad opted for the half of a kale salad to start with, while Mom and I plunged into the little neck clams. The salad was wonderful and, let's talk clams right quick: traditionally, these can be a lot of work for little payoff when it comes to culinary satisfaction. Not so with these clams. These were outstanding, and the sauce they came in was enough to make me consider ordering a shot of it, table manners or no table manners. Fortunately, cooler heads prevailed and it was time for the main course. Dad's pappardelle with meat sauce looked amazing. He's eaten this dish around the world and, for him, this one ranked as the best he's had. Mom went with the night's special, the lobster ravioli, and she loved every bite of it. She actually left me one pocket to taste but I couldn't because I just got done committing social suicide by somehow finishing the pan-fried breaded veal. This thing literally eclipses the plate it comes out on and obliterates your daily caloric intake. But, oh, is it worth it. While my parents enjoyed a lemon-like item and a duo of cannolis that you fill yourself (really cool, we all thought), I attempted to nurse my wounds with this Oreo-composed "digestive" dish that I somehow got a third of the way through. I guess what I'm saying is, come hungry and come with a party that will not be shy about finishing what you could not. A manager came by to make sure our meal was to our liking and what's not to like? The service was impeccable, the food was somehow even better, the staff were all engaging and it would be with great pleasure that we would all return. The only potential problem would be ordering something else on the menu because we were all unflinchingly satisfied with our meals this time around. There's a whole menu of delicacies to consider but I know that veal will be calling my name... which just means it will be a matter of mind over metabolism the next time here. Overall, it's an outstanding dining experience for families, business groups, dates and basically anyone who has ever once enjoyed Italian food. Just be ready to have those expectations for "good" Italian food shattered by Volare.
Delicious !!! One of the best servers we had- thanks Carolyn Pleasant little find close to our hotel. Everything made from scratch. Ambience was wonderful too

This is my go to Chicago Italian spot.  Great for business and not to casual dining.  Great service, the folks really know how to take care of you. If I am alone and hungry in the area, I head to Volare and grab a seat at the bar.  Gnocchi and a dry martini comes quick, and is perfect.  I haven't ventured much into the seafood menu, but everything else is great.  You must come here at least once in your life!

Love the food, the service, and the atmosphere :) The staff were friendly, the good came in a timely manner, we truly enjoyed the experience.  Salmon cooked to perfection, and moscato was sweet!  Quality restaurant that I will be sure to visit again!

I had been craving italian food while walking around michigan avenue and found this place. I probably just had a bad experience, but I wasn't a fan. Even though we were seated right away - the table was dirty with crumbs and wasn't set up at all. The waiter seemed a bit spaced and rushed. The food we ordered was disappointing. The sauce seemed runny and not so tasty. Once again - maybe it was a bad experience...I was hoping for something really good since there seem to be many good ratings...

We have never had a better meal from an Italian restaurant- and that's saying a lot since we are from NYC and eat Italian food a lot. We dined at Volare on a Saturday night after receiving a recommendation from the concierge desk at the Hilton. We were not disappointed and had some of the best Italian food of our lives. Definitely make a reservation or you will wait. We ate outside just as it was getting dark; I wish there had been more light/candles to actually see the phenomenal food. Our waitress was pleasant and very knowledgeable. We started off with some delicious crusty bread and olive oil and the Insalata di Mare which my boyfriend proclaimed to be the best seafood dish he's ever eaten. It was an excellently prepared dish- just the right amount of lemon and seasoning. For dinner we ordered the mezzaluna special and the spaghetti neri al pesce. The mezzaluna was filled with a delicious, tender, shredded beef and had this unbelievable, flavorful smooth tomato sauce. The spaghetti neri was out of this world- cooked and seasoned perfectly. I don't even like seafood and I thought it was wonderful! The portions were just the right size. We highly recommend this restaurant! I would give them 10 stars if I could.

Classic, old-school Italian place. Impeccable, friendly service. That rarest of restaurant wonders, quality seafood cooked perfectly. Great value. What's not to like? My girlfriend and I enjoyed Volare so much on our last visit to Chicago that we went back...twice. Even simple things like the chopped Volare salad seemed unusually flavorful, despite gigantic portions that must hurt their dessert sales (we definitely didn't have room).  The fettucini and gnocchi were texturally ideal, which along with the magnificent and plentiful scallops and shrimp made me feel like I'd stepped into an alternate universe where guys slamming out plate after plate on a Friday night actually take the time and care to get everything just right instead of the usual overcooked mess. I'd probably steer clear if I were looking for a light meal. You know the old wag about Italian food: two days later, you're hungry again. Otherwise, I couldn't find a damn thing to complain about.

Fantastic food, fantastic value, fantastic service. This was a wonderful dining experience all the way around. Beware of the veal Parmesan as it will cover your plate and have you taking a taxi back to wherever you came from.

Best italian restaurant I have been to in Chicago by far. It is original dishes with a fantastic price. There is outside seating which is perfect in the summer. I went for my birthday and they went above and beyond to cater to us. They found us a table outside when there was a long wait. Highly recommend the pasta with crab meat, shrimp, and scallops. I will be going back again soon and if you like italian food I highly recommend you try it out.

Although the food was ok and the price was reasonable, the service was awful, there was a large party next to us and the servers clearly neglected us.  We waited 40 minutes between apps and our entree and the excuse was that Chicken Parmesan toll longer than most meals,  The most disappointing part was when the server brought the bill she stated that she "was sorry although it wasn't her fault".  Overall not a great experience.

Being that I am from Italy, I am very picky about my Italian restaurants - especially pasta. I love Volare - literally the atmosphere is great, the staff is attentive and kind, but really - you go for the food. The risotto and the fettuccine bolognese are amazing, my favorite though is the spaghetti caprese.  I use the grubhub delivery when I am feeling not so great on Sunday afternoons after a long Saturday morning and it's still just as good as eating  in house. It's great for families and when the parents are in town. I would not go with a group of my girlfriends.

I loved Volare, I am a tough critic on Italian food and I would happily return. First, the service is wonderful. They are on top of everything and very knowledgable on the menu. I had the Gnocchi alla Vodka. This gnocchi is like nothing I've had before, the fold ricotta in making them light and airy. Not your typical heavy gnocchi. I couldn't stop eating it! My sister had the lasagna and it was fresh, homemade and amazing! I highly recommend both dishes. Then we had to try a meatball, this is always our test. They were not so flavorful. I love lots of garlic and they lacked the taste. However I do understand only Italians willingly eat cloves of sautéed garlic! My last comment, I live next door and walk by maybe 5 times a week, every night it is packed. I have never seen this place slow.

Stopped by here for lunch. The atmosphere was nice - casual but still a better restaurant. I got the lasagna. It was a smaller looking dish but let me tell you, it still filled me right up. It was delicious; I ate everything off that plate! Such good meat and cheese.

WOW. What a meal! Amazingly good food and the service was spectacular. If you get the opportunity, ask for Carolyn as your server. She knew more about the menu and what I wanted than any wait staff EVER.
Really fabulous Italian food with friendly service and a boisterous family-style atmosphere.

The only problem I had with Volare was that I couldn't get a reservation...and now I see why! Authentic Italian food a few blocks from my apartment! I was so antsy to try this place after I had walked by a few times and it did not disappoint. My boyfriend and I walked in around 7pm on a Saturday and got to seats at the bar (which are first come first serve). The atmosphere is great and the open kitchen gives a glimpse into all the delicious goodies they have to offer. I started with the Volare salad (refreshing) and my boyfriend had a 1/2 order of the calamari, which he said was delicious and done perfectly. For our entrees I had the grigliata mista (grilled seafood assortment) with a side of the Rapini (broccolini with garlic) and he had the Frutti de mare risotto (1/2 order was more than enough!). The veggies were slightly salty, but nonetheless delish. We will definitely be returning to Volare!

I was here with some girlfriends for an early dinner after a long day of sightseeing. We were seated immediately upon arrival and our waitress was wonderful: very attentive and offered fantastic recommendations. The kale salad is amazing! One of the best salads I have ever had. Everyone at our table had a pasta dish and each was delicious. We sat outside and though we worried about the street noise being too loud we were pleasantly surprised that it wasn't. The prices were reasonable, the drink list was good/acceptable and service was great. Overall we had a lovely time. I would definitely go back the next time I am in Chicago.

Under whelmed based on the other reviews. Wouldn't return. Ordered the Fettuccini Alfredo and Margarita pizza and they were just OK, not worth it for the price. Also service was pretty mediocre considering we went when it was practically empty.

I came here on a weekday for lunch during the summer, so I sat outside to enjoy the breeze and the outdoor view. They provide complimentary bread and refills, so try the focaccia bread which has a texture reminiscent of pillows. I ordered the gnocchi alla vodka and insalata volare all for under $20! Not bad. They also play Italian music and radio, and the waiters with Italian accents make you swoon (i.e. "what can I get you today, my special lady?"). Basically, you can get a nearly authentic Italian experience without leaving Chicago!

This place was awesome! A group of 10 of us showed up around 9 pm for dinner on a Friday night. The host staff was very accommodating to our large party and we were seated within a few minutes. They have a good wine selection and great food options. My fiance and I decided to share a pizza and the lasagna. While we weren't too impressed with the pizza, we fell in love with the lasagna - it was cheesy, meaty and it just melted in your mouth with each bite. Definitely try it out! Decently priced, good food, large portions and great vibe! This is a great place for a date. If I were to return to Chicago for another trip, I would stop by again!

Yum yum yum. Visited on business trip. Reservation is a must. Food is incredible. Bolognese is my gauge for Italian. few do it right. It's a simple dish, keep it that way. The spinach fettuccine was incredible.  Everything is made from scratch, pasta included. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars - sat at bar before dinner while waiting for a table, the guy didn't even look up at us. Once he acknowledged we were there he asked what we wanted and still didn't look at us. Rude. Our waiter wAs sweet and helpful though.

A very unexpected place to find decently priced Italian food with huge portions. My friend had the seafood pasta with mussels, clams, calamari, and shrimp whereas I went with the linguine with clams. Obviously, we're both seafood lovers and neither dishes were made to disappoint. Never have I had a linguine with clams in which the clams dominated most of the plate. There were clams found in their shells and there were loose pieces of clams buried within the noodles. The white wine sauce was also excellent in bringing out the flavors.   What's also ideal about the location is that it's only two blocks away from AMC. Sounds like the perfect spot for gatherings, date night, or girls night out.

I met some colleagues for a work dinner last night after reading through reviews for this place. The positive reviews did not disappoint! The atmosphere was casual but lively. It was a little loud, but what can you expect of true Italians?  We had a variety of dishes around the table. The brussels sprout salad is a must order (but be prepared...it is dense, so anticipate sharing or having a fairly full stomach before your entree). Myself and another colleague ordered the pasta with prosciutto and peas (I don't remember what it's called). It was incredible! I had to force myself to stop eating! The pasta was cooked perfectly al dente.  Another colleague ordered the sausage and seafood appetizers for her entrees. The portions were huge! We all sampled them as well. The scallops were the best! The service was great, which made a good experience even better. You should probably go there. Now.

The entree portions were large and everything was tasty - no complaints at all about the food. The service was pretty poor even though it wasn't busy at all at 6 on a Tuesday night. I might come back if I was in the mood for Italian.

The service was amazing, the food was was delicious, and the prices weren't any more expensive than Olive Garden. I don't know why anyone would go to Olive Garden when you can go to a place like this.

Came here after seeing the positive reviews on Yelp...I was disappointed. The food wasn't terrible, but I don't know how it got 4+ stars after over 700 reviews. I got the black spaghetti dish and it just didn't do it for me. I think the best part of the meal was the bread. The bread gets 4 stars.

We were here over the weekend for a pre-wedding dinner with friends.  The food was disappointing at best.  Service was good, but I felt that the food was very blah and underwhelming.  The bread and the wine was good, so that saved the review from being 2 stars.

Before I moved to Chicago, I thought the one food I wasn't crazy about was Italian.  Turns out the place where I used to live has excellent everything but horrible Italian.  Why do I bring this up now?  Because Volare's vodka sauce made my head explode!  Earth moved, animals started talking, Chicago parking-ticket people started only giving tickets to cars that deserved it.  Absolute magic. I've since been there alone, in groups, and for take-out.  Every experience, every dish has been excellent.  Meatballs, the fancy salads, the cocktails -- all excellent. Negatives  For a table of 4, they pour one little plate with olive oil and then take the oil with them.  Bread doesn't get refilled easily.  Food server can be unorganized with her drink replenishments. I would say these are significant issues.  But the food still so good that the 5th star remains

We went to Volare for lunch and had the gnocchi with vodka sauce added Italian sausage and the lamb panini.  The gnocchi was homemade, beautifully hand crafted pasta, so light and airy- absolutely delicious.  The panini was lovely as well, the bread was also homemade...very light.  The service was excellent, the waitress guided us to the best of the best at the restaurant - it is a must see in Chicago!

Our first time at Volare, and we were not disappointed. I had the black spaghetti with seafood, and it was amazing! My friend had the spaghetti and clams with white sauce, and my other friend had the chicken special. Both were winners! The only dishes that would not merit a 4 star are the lasagna and the cannoli dessert. However, the chocolate mousse is a 5 star dessert along with the black spaghetti.

Volare runs like a well-oiled machine.  My water glass never went lower than 3/4 of a glass and our waiter was constantly checking in without being annoying.  We made reservations ahead of time which was very helpful as we had a party of 9 and later we saw that the wait got a little long as the night went on.   There is fresh bread brought out to the table when you sit down.  Our waiter was very friendly, talking to us about his children and the general city of Chicago, even giving us tips on where to find a nice place for lunch the next day.  The food took a little while to come out but only because it was homemade with great care.  My cousin ordered a Vodka Pasta which was delicious.  I ordered the four cheese pizza but the waiter got my order wrong.  However, the error was corrected in less than 10 minutes which is incredible for such a busy place.  The pizza was some of the best I've ever had. All but 2 of the waiters there are fluent in Italian and I was also able to speak Spanish with some of them.  While the food is not exactly cheap, it's well worth the price.  The restaurant is in a nice area (right by Nordstrom) and there is something for everyone (My cousin is a vegetarian and my other two cousins are 6 years old).  A classy, beautiful place to bring the family for a fancy dinner.

We made a reservation and had to wait just a bit past it (even though we showed up early for it), but that is the only complaint I have. The service was perfect and the food was crave worthy. We started with the olives and two cheese selections. Usually when you order cheese at other places they serve a few hunks of each. Not here! They literally gave us about 6-7 pieces of each selection! It was great. My husband had the neri al pesce and said the scallops were cooked to perfection. I had the gnocchi a la vodka and the gnocchi were absolutely flawless. They were the exact right consistency (pillowy but not mushy). I you're in the area and craving fresh, authentic Italian food, stop by!
Simply amazing food! I had the black spaghetti. Simply amazing!  The service was also perfect. The waiter did not give us too little attention or too much.
Freindly staff and great service! We were in the waiting list for a couple of mins...although it was a weekday , it was still busy! Loved it...

I love the Spaghetti Neri al Piece (not sure about spelling)! It was black spaghetti with seafood sauce. It was super delicious! The side dish meatballs were ok but not outstanding. Dessert was simple and good. An interesting note. Their cannoli is not "done", it's two cones inserted in cream and you have to make your own cannoli! Not sure if someone would find it annoying, I actually think it's cute.
The best place ever awesome food great waiters Charlene is the best , best wine I will recommended for every one I will come back again for sure

Being new to the River North neighborhood, my husband and I are determined to try as many of the local restaurants as we possibly can! This place is incredible!  We went in for dinner 2 evenings ago and really enjoyed our experience. I ordered the Spaghetti Neri and talked about it for the rest of the night to my husband. That's how good it was! So nice to have authentic Italian food right in the neighborhood. Yay Volare!

Went to Volare last night after reading all the great reviews and the great, convincing pics. I had the signature house seafood salad, Grigllata Mista  (shrimp, calamari and Octopus), Quattro Stagioni pizza and a meatball app as my meal. We also ordered the appetizer of the night, a fig wrapped in prosciutto over fried polenta.  The figs were undercooked on the app and we did not finish - two hungry guys leaving food on the plate. The bread was great so we filled up on that waiting on the rest of the meal - which cane very quick. The food was good but not great and I was disappointed as I had high expectations. Service was very good and the overall experience was fine. BL is I don't think I'll be back as there is so much amazing food in Chicago I hate to waste a meal
Love Volare!  The food is consistently good and the service is great.  We eat there at least 5 to 6 times a month!

Italian food never does it for me. This place gets a lot of good reviews and it was packed when I went but I dont get it.  For some reason, I've never been wowed by an Italian restaurant.  They are all good but nothing I would crave later on.  We tried their two recommendations - Spaghetti Neri and Fusilloni al Ragu.  Both were good but not worth the wait or the rave reviews.  On a brighter note, the service was excellent, including the managers providing pizza samples for those who were waiting for a table!

I am thoroughly confused by the really high reviews.  I stayed downtown for a staycation this past weekend.  We ordered delivery from Volare based on the great reviews.  If we had only ordered pizzas, this place would be a solid 5-star restaurant. The crust was light, toppings were fresh, overall a great pie.  However, the downfall was the pasta. First, we requested utensils and napkins because we are in hotel.  It did not come with any.  How do we eat pasta with no utensils?  We improvised and used the coffee stirrers inside the hotel room as ad hoc chopsticks.  I kid you not.  When there are instructions to bring utensils, BRING UTENSILS! Anyway,  I ordered the Fusilloni Al Ragu Di Vitello which is described as "fusilloni with ragu of veal, porcini mushrooms, peas, pecorino and touch of cream."  It was basically a meat stroganoff with Campbell's cream of mushroom.  The veal was gamy, the sauce was overpowered by the mushrooms, and the pasta was hard and chewy (this was not al dente - it was just tough).  The good thing was that the portion was huge.  So if you actually liked this dish, there was plenty of it to go around.  Unfortunately for us, we had to toss 4/5 of it - everyone thought it was inedible. We might order again for the pizza, but definitely not the pasta.  Minus a star for the forgotten utensils and minus another star for the pasta dish.
I have frequented this establishment many times and have varying opinions each time. Great location and service is outstanding but the food is sometimes hit or miss.

Food was a little late coming out, but it was affordable and filling. Not to mention it was delicious. Had the Spaghetti Neri, Calamari, Sausage sandwich, and a side of Meatballs and Olives.  Great that they serve Peroni too! Establishment was really clean, including the bathrooms, which I always think it nice.
Great value and atmosphere.  The food was great but the service was even better!  The black ink seafood bowl was, for a lack of better words, incredible.  We will go back.

I've been going to Volare for years and years and not once has it disappointed me. Once again last night we had another great experience with friends who'd just moved to the area.  We loved the Fattoria Risotto and the Ricotta Gnocchi is the best in the city.  Our waitress let us take our time and we never felt rushed.

Excellent restaurant and great good! Try the New York strip, one of the best in the city and the capprese salad is made with great mozzarella cheese, better than Italy. I do however, need to say that one waitress at Volare gives a very bad name to this fine restaurant. The waitress name is Jessica and she is rude, unattentive,very slow to take your order, does not check on you, and when you ask for anything else she seems to be upset for you asking her to do her job, I hope the restaurant takes appropriate actions to correct the situation. See picture of my bill for reference, ask the restaurant to sit you in a table that is not served by Jessica. Enjoy volare!

Volare salad was lackluster BUT... The Spaghetti Neri with Arrabiatta (special request) and seafood (LOTS of crab) was phenomenal!  Will be going back! Wines by the glass/1/4/etc. were only OK, but that Spaghetti Neri!!!

Food is some of the best I have had including in Rome, Italy. Gnocchi, Spaghetti Neri al Pesce and Grigliata Misto were amazing. Although I really liked  our waiter (he spoke Italian, made good recommendations and was very nice) it seemed like he was handling the entire restaurant probably because it was 2 pm and there was 7 of us. So 1 star down due to slow service. I am definitely coming back with my wife for dinner.
Really good sauce and pasta. I don't remember the name of the dish I ordered, but it has very good shrimp and fresh scallop.

Loved it. The pizza came quick and it was delicious.. but nothing special i have to say. The variety of the bread basket was great. My favorite was the tomato bread! I ordered the full size Squid Ink pasta w/ seafood. The sauce was LOADED with crab meat. It was sooooo yummy and sweet like the sea. Unfortunately, I came here with others that are not experienced with real Italian food besides Olive Garden... they thought it was way expensive and did not have their 'usual'.  I would come back myself next time.

This is the first 5 star review I've given any restaurant.  Yes, it's that good.  Makes me wish I lived in Chicago.  Everything from the service to the atmosphere and of course the food was outstanding.  Come and enjoy!

Went to Volare with family last week.  Have been a few times, food very good as usual.  Service was best we've had and good.  I had the Veal Parm which is not on the menu but was excellent.  We had a few appetizers like the calamari which was excellent.  We also had the mussels in red sauce and they were very good.  Everyones dinners were also good the black pasta with seafood looked and was very good from the input I got from the family.  I thought he drink costs were well in line but thought the bottle wine prices were higher than normal.  Chiantis in the $50 to $65 range just seems high but that's were the money is.  We sat outside with 3 grand children and that worked out real well.  Overall I would recommend Volare to all if you want very good italian food.
I went to Volare with my friends for lunch. Great price and food! We thought it was a fancy and expensive place but it is only $10 for most of pastas and pizzas. Definitely come back soon!
Excellent place for a moderately priced Italian dinner! The service was impressive and the food was well prepared. This is a great restaurant for a relaxing but quality meal.

I've had really good experiences here and mediocre ones. The lasagna is pretty good, everything need was so so. Service was good, but not amazing. Wine selection was pretty good, but pricey compared to similar places. I'd probably go back, but just because the lasagna is good, and Sarah, the bartender, is a great conversation while waiting for the food.

Nothing to die for. I've had better Italian. Friendly hostess, but service was just okay. The chicken parmigiana was pretty good. Lasagna was not as good. The best thing we had was the side of meatballs. They were very soft and moist. Not impressed but not a bad choice if you're in the mood for Italian.

Nice place with a small outdoor seating area. Food was just o.k. The calamari app was very good but the entrees were just o.k. Pasta was bland and really couldnt tell if it was made fresh or frozen. My seafood risoto was good but, the calamari in it was very rubber like. I think I would try this place again but, steer clear of a seafood or pasta dish.

I got the salmon and it tasted amazing! Then for dessert was the tiramisu, which is the first time I have ever had it and after having it here I plan on eating it a lot more if another restaurant I go to has it on there dessert menu. My only complaint is that the place is crowded there are way too many tables so you feel like everyone is on top of one another.  I most likely will come back here many more times though. I would of sat outside but the rainy weather put that plan down. Sitting outside is less cramped compared to the inside seating arrangement

I came here for lunch on a Friday afternoon with a friend. We were looking for a restaurant in the area that we hadn't tried yet, and having walked by Volare many times before, I suggested that we finally try it. It was a beautiful day, so we were seated out on the patio, which was really great, given that it was shaded by an awning. We shared a Calamari appetizer which came with a spicy and mild sauce. I had the Lasagna al Forno, and he had the Bistecca di Manzo alla Griglia, which was basically a steak with some potatoes. The Calamari was good, especially with the spicy sauce. My lasagna was delicious! And also incredibly filling. I wasn't that hungry that afternoon, so I ended up taking part of it home with me. My friend said his steak was delicious as well, beyond what he would have expected from an italian restaurant. I also must add: the lunch menu was very reasonably priced for how good and how big the food portions were. I thought the service was perfect. Our waiter checked on us just the right amount - enough to keep our water glasses full but without be overly intrusive. Can't wait to go back!
Great food and atmosphere. The pizza margherita is the best I've had anywhere.

A friend recommended this to us when we were in Chicago so obviously being super foodies we had to go.  The waitress recommended the grigliata mista which is a seafood salad of sorts - comes with scallops, calamari, octopus and shrimp tossed with some vinaigrette. I loved how you could taste the grilled aspect of the dish and they certainly didn't skimp on the seafood. I ordered the fusilloni al ragu di vitello which was a cream sauce with mushrooms, veal and peas. You know how I can't resist mushrooms. The plate was massive. The cream sauce was perfectly seasoned. The mushrooms were expertly prepared and the pasta, even though it was "imported" and not made in-house, was exactly al dente. Like this is the kind of al dente that chefs dream about. We left stuffed. Verdict - there was a lot of delicious food and even though there was a bit of a wait even with a reservation Volare is definitely a solid restaurant choice.

My husband and I stoped in for a quick bit on our way to a White Sox game. Wish we would have known how good this place was.  I had a 1/2 order of pasta and sausage which was yummy and my husband enjoyed ravioli. The service was very good to. Hope we can go back before we leave.

Eat at Volare last night with some coworkers and it was average Italian at best.  Volare is a want-a-be high end Italian restaurant. Table ordered calamari that I sampled, any foodie knows that this is a great indicator of the place.  They came out quick with the typical marinara that chains give you and were ok...a bit too chewy for my liking. I ordered the house salad that came incredibly fast so guessing that these are pre-made in the back.  Again ok reminding me of a chain type salad. All four main courses came out ridiculously quick, once again the dishes are obviously not made to order.  My main course was a pasta dish with veal bolognese that was good but not wow I need to go back good. Overall, not a terrible place but not sure I would try some other places before considering going back.

My wife and I enjoyed an excellent meal and service at Volare while visiting Chicago. All the superlatives previously mentioned were true! In fact, we really enjoyed our server Elena, not just because she was so efficient, but also because she was both professional and friendly! We started with the pizza margherita, which was thin crust and not typical Chicago-style, but typical Italian! We actually wanted to share our meals, which Elena gladly split at the table. These included the Rigatoni Arrabiatta and the Filetto Manzo. Both were superbly prepared and portioned. She recommended a nice bottle of Carpineto Chianti Classico, which went well with our meals. Overall, we were pleasantly surprised, although we did have to wait. No problem for us since we planned on it being in a big city and wanting to sit outside, which seemed to be very popular. Overall, this was a very nice experience that was reasonably priced for Chicago!

"As good as it gets," Yelp? Try "No other restaurant could possibly achieve this level of awesomeness, so you should all probably stop now." Volare is, hands-down, the best Italian food I've ever had. I first went here in 2009 and fell smitten over a plate of gnocchi in vodka sauce. I'm a sucker for good pasta, and back then, you could pick and choose what type of pasta you wanted with different sauces. Little did I know that my little "creation" would become a staple on their menu years later after the renovation and menu remodel. That simple night in 2009 also almost made tears of joy run down my face after an impeccable slice of ricotta cheesecake was then placed before me. Or maybe it was the tears at the gym the next day trying to work off the previous night's caloric intake, but whatever. So worth it. I lost count of how many times I've been here, but it's upwards of double digits. I've brought family here, business associates, friends, and recommended it to strangers. Never have I been disappointed by the food. Not once. And boy do I miss this little gem below Michigan Ave.

I dined by myself with a raging headache but I still enjoyed my meal here.  I was quickly seated and the service was at fast-food speed, which I didn't care for.  I ordered half of the beat salad, which was very good.  After a few bites, a bread basket arrived and then my food!  It was ridiculous.  The waiter didn't deliver the food and he seemed to feel bad for the timing, but it was happening all around me! It was an hour before closing time and the dining room was less than half full.   I had my heart set on eggplant or gnocchi, but with a headache, I thought I would keep it light.  I had the Chilean Sea Bass special that was supposed to come with broccoli & polenta.  It didn't come with broccoli, but asparagus instead, which pleased me.  The polenta was excellent and sea bass was incredible.  I savored every delicious bite.

My absolute fave old-school Italian place in Chicago.  It was so great to return and take my boyfriend this time.  He loved the lasagna.  I got my usual...rigatoni arrabiata with extra sauce.  Their sauce is heavy on garlic but downright killer.  Attentive service.

The atmosphere was a little chaotic when we first arrived. It took 30 minutes to be seated, even though we had a reservation. We went to the bar while we waited and I noticed they were playing authentic Italian music, which I absolutely loved. Once we were seated and ordered our food took over an hour to get to the table. It was very busy, but tables that were sat after us received their meals before we did. I think this was more our servers fault than the restaurant itself.  The food was delicious. Being Italian I tend to compare everything to my grandmothers cooking and this place is the real deal! I ordered the lasagna and was very impressed.  My recommendation is to come here without having somewhere you need to be afterwards otherwise, plan accordingly. With an 8pm reservation we finally left at 10:15pm and we didn't order any dessert and only a salad appetizer. Enjoy yourself with a bottle of wine and no time retains and you'll be all set!
The lasagna was so hearty and filling. Awesome atmosphere and wine selection

While visiting Chicago for the first time this past weekend, our host brought us to this amazing Italian restaurant. The baked clams were amazing and so was the pizza. The sea bass was cooked to perfection. I will definitely be going back someday.

My two daughters (11 & 13) ate here tonight during our Chicago trip. Food was outstanding. I had the ravioli ala ricotta and my daughters both had the gnocchi with vodka sauce. Both were excellent.  The house salads were fresh and tasty and I truly enjoyed the soup of the day (butternut squash). The atmosphere was very nice and the staff was attentive. The only negative was the server's attitude. I couldn't tell you if our server was a man or a woman but since she was wearing women's earrings I'll call her a she.  She first greeted us by chastising my daughters for touching the wine glasses because now "they are dirty". Then after we ordered she said sarcastically 'that was fun'. They we very polite and ordered like any adult would. When my daughter's diet coke was empty she took the glass and never returned it. When I asked about it she questioned if I wanted her to have ANOTHER diet coke?  And said they won't refill kids drinks unless the parent says ok. Knowing that up front would be helpful. I watched this server with other customers and she was never rude to them as she was to us. Felt very shunned and probably would not recommend because of they was we we were treated. Or better yet, go and enjoy the great food.  But if you end up with a tall blond server ask for a different station.
Authentic Italian foods. Staff is very friendly. Many regulars go there. Well hidden secret. Looks shabby from the outside, but food is good on the inside!
This place always has consistently great food.  I especially like the veal chop parmigiano style

Would be 5 stars, except its a cramped, tight space. To be fair, it was a convention weekend and the Stanley Cup playoff was in action, so it may not always be that crowded. The food is amazing and the staff really know their stuff. I love a well prepared staff. The chef has the typical Italian standards, but offers many innovative twists to intrigue even the most severe foodie. Great wine selection. All this at a very reasonable price. Try it...you'll like it.

Went here with a group for dinner. Very professional wait staff.  Excellent food and service.  Nice atmosphere.  They're sensitive to special instructions and requests. They do get busy, so booking ahead is recommended.

Came here for lunch right as they opened. Service was fast and attentive. Complimentary bread with olive oil and parm cheese was yummy -- I was starving and ended up inhaling it. Started with the eggplant (yum) then the gnocchi with vodka sauce (yum but too heavy, I felt not so good after eating too much cream sauce and cheese but that was my own fault). The meatballs were also good (and huge). Overall would recommend!

Entree - Kept it simple. Pollo ala parmesana and linguine and clam sauce. Food was good, portions were generous prices were fairly average. Dessert - Sampled each of the desserts. All came in these little tiny glasses. Portions were small but all in all, they tasted ok. At $3.50 a piece I would probably save my money next time. I would have prefer a more traditional tiramisu.  Service - Service was decent. Walked in and was seated right away. Waitress was average, a little slow  but well versed in the menu. Bus service was like Johny on the spot. Fast and attentive. Prompt bread refill, water glasses never stayed below quarter full, and empty plates gone seconds after empty. Overall - Good experience, would like to go back and try the gnocci and vodka sauce or maybe the lasagna.
Vodka sauce gnocchi - 5 stars Italian meatballs - 5 stars Fried calamari - maybe 4.5 stars Overall, this place is phenomenal.

My wife and I were staying at the sheraton with our 14-month son. We asked the concierge for a place to eat dinner where we can bring our son and can order a small entree for him or has a kids menu. He recommended this place and made reservations for us.  It's only like a couple blocks from the hotel which was perfect for us.  The service was impeccable: hostess placed our stroller in the back, got a nice high chair, the waiter was great, great recommendations, the manager greeted us and checked up on us, every one that worked there seemed to enjoy our son as much as us, waitstaff was attentive to fill our cups continuously Food was great as well. My wife got the clam linguini (I think) and I had the lobster ravioli (that nights special). We could not have asked for a better meal. Our son had a half order of some pasta dish which turned out great.  Overall, a great place to dine and a great experience on our last night in chicago.

Had the black spaghetti with seafood. Was very good. Was seated promptly with a reservation. Like the fact that you can order 1/2 order of the pasta's.  Server wasn't very friendly, but possibly she was just having personal issues. Not a deal breaker.
Really good Penne Vodka.  Looking forward to trying the pizza next time.

Love this place!!!!! Was recommended to go here by a local who said it was his favorite Italian in downtown.  Have been multiple times and every time is wonderful!!!! Delicious pasta,  pizza,  salads all for reasonable price. Service is fantastic- was last served by Galin and it made the experience more enjoyable than could have imagined! Couldn't say enough good things about Volare!

Had a great experience here. Coming from NYC we were looking for some good Italian fare aside from Chicago Pizza. I came across Volare on Yelp and it seemed like a solid choice, and rightfully so, because our experience well exceeded expectations. Our waiter Rafael was extremely professional, attentive, and polite. The food was also delicious with everything we ate from appetizer to dessert being well prepared and flavorful but it was the service and overall experience that made this a 5/5 rating. I would come again next time I am in town.

Amore amore amore Volare!!! The first time we came here was in 2012 and we just had to come back for an unforgettable meal. The second time topped the first. How does that happen? First, I called last minute to move up our reservation time since my tummy was talking to me. Second, we were received with warm greetings from the staff. Seated promptly, we had immediate wait staff service. Ordered the small house salad and the capellini with chicken. BF had to get the fettuccini Alfredo with chicken. If he's going to go pasta, he's going all the way to Splurgeville. Yes!! Our meal made us do the Happy dance all night long (ode to Pharrel Williams). Stuffed, we couldn't even order the cannolis that were so delicious the first time. We are still dreaming of Volare and our next chance to visit Chi-town as an excuse to eat here!!

This is a big restaurant, but totally fills up after about 6:30pm. It has a nice classic Italian restaurant feel. They bring bread and olive oil loaded up with powdered parm, 2 different kinds of bread (a baguette and a softer, focaccia-type). I ordered the ricotta gnocchi because it was unusual, and I thought it was a good choice. It was really light and fresh, sort of like marshmallows. The vodka sauce didn't stand out, but was fine. The wine selection was extensive, but pretty pricy. The sausage app was pretty huge, with 2 or 3 sausages and a couple of big peppers. The ricotta ravioli was very ricotta-filled, which my friend who got that didn't love, but it wasn't the ricotta's fault. I'd go again, the food prices are reasonable, and the service is good. There's an unaffiliated, paid parking lot across the street.

Their customer service is horrible. I ordered a salad on my way to work and I what I got was some sort of vegan dish with beets and tomatoes. I work overnights at a hotel and it is often hard to find a good restaurant that delivers. Suffice it to say that I did not even eat that night! I called the manager the next day and he did absolutely nothing about it. He just took my number and said he had to look for the ticket in order to investigate.

Cute little place a little bit off the over-populated Michigan strip. It was a cold night and this place was a nice place to get warm, escape the snow and enjoy a quick meal. It was quiet but busy when we arrived. The hostess said it would be a few minutes and then a manager came to the front and promptly seated us. Always nice when management takes that extra step to make a guest experience a little nicer. The service was polite and quick. We were not all that hungry so we enjoyed some of the more simple dishes, ravioli and spaghetti caprese. The dishes were prompt, simple, fresh, and flavorful. Will go again and try some of their more creative dishes. With the simple dishes being as good as they were, I am sure there are some hidden gems here!

Good not great. We ate here on a fri night. Service was friendly enough considering the place was packed, definitely make a reservation if your thinking of coming here. the wine selection was great and we really liked the reds we tried.  Unfortunately the entrees didn't blow me away. The 1/2 roast chicken was dry and I didn't really enjoy the flavours. And the seafood pasta special had great flavour and the pasta was cooked perfectly but the crab was also overcooked and dry.

Amazing authentic food served in an true Chicago style. Raquel at the bar interpreted my drink order into food and wine in a perfect pairing....that's why I usually sit at the bar.  If the Beef Braciole is on the special list for the evening, order it!!!!  let Raquel know your palate she will interpret and please....she gets it.

This is a truly great authentic Italian restaurant . All staff is very friendly . Food is great! Pasta is great , we had eggplant small dish , was great. Black pasta with seafood really tasty. Price is reasonable. It great experience over all.
Waited 45+ mins for our reservation. Food portions generous, salmon overcooked, mussels not fresh, pasta was good. Great service although very loud atmosphere. Would not go out of my way to return.

what do u do when u go to chicago after you've had portillo's italian beef and uno's deep dish pizza? more italian food, of course. walked in for easter brunch special. 5 course gets you an appetizer, a prima, a second, a main, and dessert for $25. our server/waitress was amazing. sweet, kind, and took care of us the entire time. food was great - but i was glad i came for brunch.  we originally had reservations for saturday night but werent able to make it. had i gone saturday night, my review would have been a lot different. out of the 5 courses, the only thing i didnt enjoy was the squid ink seafood pasta. i LOVE squid ink pasta, but i was not impressed with what they had prepared here. EVERYTHING ELSE WAS AMAZING!!!!!

I loveee this place.  The food is so good, fresh and tasty.  The four cheese risotto is to die for.  I was at Volare with my nephew and niece to celebrate her 3rd birthday.  She is beyond 3. (::)  They treated her like a Princess.  The owner is very hands-on and personable.  Love it. Can't wait to return again and again.

I am from Rockford and a friend from Cali came to visit and was told we should go to this restaurant. Best advice ever!!! It was absolutely amazing!! We tried three different dishes and shared everything...it was so delicious that we wanted to try more but were too full. It may be a little costly, but it's worth every penny!

My husband and I usually never get to go out. Between our son and crazy work schedules, it's hard to find time. We did get a "night on the town" a few weeks ago. It has been such a long time since we had received such great customer service. When we got there, we had no reservation and the place was packed! We waited maybe 20 minutes for our table. The manager sat us and have us each a complimentary glass of wine and thanked us for our business and our patience. How nice was that!!! We then ordered and the food was absolutely wonderful!!!! I've never had such great gnocchi and vodka sauce! As we were sitting eating, I noticed that the manager who sat us (who was in a very nice suit) was bussing tables and helping staff get their good to the tables. Very rarely will you see anyone but the bus boys cleaning anything! It was all and all a great expirence. It was so nice to have a great meal and it was also great to see a manager That was so on top of his job! We will absolutely go back as soon as we have another opportunity!

Another great evening. Easter dinner with family, Italian sausage,  Caesar salad, Risotto Sardi, roasted chicken, pasta vodka sauce, veal, sea bass, and a great Gavi de Gavi.  The food was great, the staff wonderful, a special night with the family.

I can't believe it took us six months to walk across the street and try this place! And yes, believe every raving review you read! While the food is simply amazing, it's the service and hospitality that will win you over. Just remember to reserve in advance, or arrive early, preferably before 7:00pm, on any given weeknight. We were promptly seated for our 7:15pm reservations by the evening's hostess, Tiziana, who introduced us to our waiter for the evening, Michael - we started off with cocktails, simple well drinks of house bourbon and Coke at $8.50, featuring generous pours from the well.  Our waiter ran through the evening's specials, asked some questions about our likes and dislikes, and then made some great suggestions. Michael was very knowledgeable about the wine selection, asking us what we preferred - white or red?, heavy or light?- and ended up suggesting a moderately priced ($48) 2011 bottle of blended reds from the Seventy-Five Wine Company called "The Sum". Not the most expensive, not the cheapest, but he nailed the flavor profile with his earlier description. On first impression, the place is a tad loud, so probably not the uber-quiet, hand-holding spot you would select for a romantic dinner with your partner. Traffic constantly whizzes by inside as the wait staff delivers and clears plates, all while efficiently topping off table waters and baskets of bread. It's also a bit snug inside, with the dining room featuring a handful too many tables - in such proximity, conversations tend to drift from table to table, with the backs of chairs bouncing into each other during the meal. Our service was prompt, but not rushed, as the line continued to form just inside the door and out onto the sidewalk. There is some outdoor dining spots available, but on this early April evening, it was a bit cold, even with the gas heaters fired up.  Some folks saddled up to the small bar, which features only a few stools, and managed to choke traffic racing between the dining room and kitchen.  We started out with two apps; a half order of Grigliata Mista - a fire-grilled plate of perfectly cooked sea scallops, calamari and shrimp, all drizzled in a balsamic glaze and fruity olive oil. Our other selection, the Carpaccio di Manzo, featured ultra thin -practically see-thru slices- of beef filet, with a light sprinkling of artichoke hearts, arugula and shaved pecorino, all lightly dressed in a mustard aioli. Both were perfectly presented and portioned perfectly for a two-top. Just a reminder, the warm apps are all available as "half plates", same for many of the entrees. And while the entrée portions are HUGE, the appetizers aren't wanting for much either. After seeing the dinner plate-sized veal chop go by a half dozen times, I opted for the "parmigiana-style" version of the Nodino di Vitello ($34) - an amazing pan-fried, on-the-bone, perfectly pounded piece of veal, topped with the house tomato sauce and fresh mozzarella. With a nice side of fresh spaghetti, it was more than I could handle, so half of my portion ended up coming home with me. My wife ordered the Spaghetti Neri al Pesce, a huge portion of squid ink-colored pasta with perfectly seared shrimp, scallops and lump crab in a sage, brandy and rose' cream sauce. Absolutely amazing! The dessert offering consisted of small $3.50 servings of various Italian specialties like tiramisu, house-made gelatos, cannoli, flourless chocolate cake... Overall, one of our best dining experiences so far in Chicago - amazing Italian fare and top-notch service from a knowledgeable staff. Two plates of apps, two massive entrees, a $48 bottle of wine and a trio of sampler desserts was $155.00 - with enough left over for a meal at home the next evening.

My friends and I made a reservation for a party of 8 at 7:30PM on a Friday night and while we arrived just on time, we were made to wait for over half an hour outside in the cold. Their reason was that the previous guests have not left, but I feel like good restaurants would be able to remedy that kind of situation. The complimentary bread they served were pretty good, and I especially liked the cheese paired with the olive oil. I had the Grigliata Mista because it is highly recommended on yelp, and it was OK. Firstly, they cannot call it a salad because my plate probably consisted of four tiny pieces of lettuce, and secondly, while the shrimp and calamaris were pretty good, the scallop was not cooked right and left a really nasty after taste. I also ordered the black pasta, which had great scallops and some great sauce. The only problem was that I didn't expect the portions to be so large so I couldn't finish half of the pasta. My friend who also ordered the Grigliata Mista actually sent hers back to the kitchen because it tasted dramatically different than mine. Her salad had everything over-salted and her scallops were so overcooked that it was rubbery. Nevertheless, she ordered a couple appetizers and the rest were great. Overall the flavor would receive a 4-star, but the wait and the 3-dollar ATM machine really turned me off so I would say it's a 3-star.

This is our go-to place for close, quick, and tasty Italian food! Where to start? The service is amazing here...they are always friendly, prompt, and helpful! The focaccia bread to start is warm and delish.  The menu is vast and includes a sort of make-your-own pasta where you put together the pasta type, sauce, and proteins/add ons. My favorite by far is the orecchiete with vodka sauce while the hubz always goes with the penne with arabiatta. Either way, you can't go wrong! I had the risotto here once which I found too creamy and heavy, but for some people that is the way to go! Will be back soon!

Authentic italian cuisine for a very reasonable price. The restaurant has a nice feel to it, romantic and pleasant. The food was incredible, we had the carpaccio to start off, and a Cesar salad, both were excellent. For main course we tried a pasta dish with sea food goodness and a chicken Parmesan dish, amazing.. The sauces are so excellent and fresh, and the pasta was cooked to perfection. There's a nice selection of small deserts, and of course the coffee was great.. Service was good and prompt, but I did take one star off because of the service. Our waitress was somewhat apathetic, seemed like she just didn't want to be there, which spoiled the mood a bit. It never hurts to smile once in a while..

The food was amazing for the price.  We had the lobster bisque and it was very good.  For the main course we split the lasagna and it was fantastic as well.  The bread was also very good.  I would come back again for the price plus the food.

One of my favorite Italian restaurants in Chicago!  Staff is so attentive to fill your glass without telling them. The squid ink seafood pasta was so fresh. Price very reasonable. Owner stopped by the table seeing if everything is good.

Really great food!!  Service was amazing.  Went with family of 4 and  this is a family friendly restaurant.  I had the gnocchi alla vodka...really delicious.  Husband had the seafood pasta special and enjoyed it as well.  Kids had salads and pasta and really loved it.  Huge portions so go hungry!!

Wonderful! This is a bustling Italian restaurant in the heart of downtown. They take pride in their food, service and wine. All house made pastas. Mike guided us through a great meal and selections. We started with carpaccio and salad. Very fresh and tasty. We chose the specials including the Chilian sea bass and the seafood pasta with mussel, shrimp and other delights from the mar. We paired this with a beautiful Italian red per Mikes suggestion. Fantastic! Finishing with berries and house made lemonchello. This was a delightful dining experience. Great price point, service and extensive wine list both domestic and Italian. Thank you Tiziana for great direction of the floor this evening. You took good care of us too! I will certainly be back to my new favorite Italian restaurant in Chicago.

I order from here all the time, and I have  to say that there food is always consistently really good.  My favorites are the calamari and seafood risotto.  The seafood always tastes fresh, and I've never had a bad experience.

Great, authentic Italian food at a very reasonable price. Their pastas are well cooked and flavorful. I am not usually a fan of gnocchi, but Volare's is the best I've ever tried. Their vodka sauce is unreal. Wish I could buy a jar of it.  Don't be surprised if you have to wait to get seated even if you have a reservation. It has happened to me so many times that I've come to expect it now.

I ate here with my family when we visited Chicago. The food was excellent and our waitress was amazing! Very friendly and attentive service. We had a complicated order and it came out perfectly. The food was delicious! Perfect al dente pasta. Sausage tortellini special was wonderful.
I had the most amazing birthday dinner !! The food was just a delight and the white wine was a die for. Excellent service and so much fun. I am going to return again and again.

Went here last night with my boyfriend and it was fantastic. The service was amazing. The waitress checked in on us at the perfect times and the food came out extremely fast- almost too fast.  We started with the special appetizer which was scallops wrapped in speck and grilled shrimp drizzled with pesto. The scallops melted in your mouth they were amazing. Then we shared a Cesar salad. It came out after only 5 mins or so!  We then split the special pasta. It was home made tortellini stuffed with Italian sausage red peppers and ricotta cheese. It was so delicious!  I would definitely pay attention to the specials because the two that we tried were amazing. I will be coming back here the next time I'm in Chicago for sure!

Good food but poor service. It was a birthday celebration tonight and we got rushed throughout the meal. The worst part is that they put a 25% service fee on our bill without giving us a notice. Usually I understand that some restaurants put 18% for a party of 5 or more. But 25% for such a bad service without saying anything? I feel like being treated as an idiot. If you would like to go try their food, make sure to pay some more attention to the check.

The lunch price is indeed awesome . The food was delicious ! I would definitely come back . The black spaghetti was spectacular . The calamari appetizer was really good . The bruschetta was fine. The four cheese pizza , ravioli, and spaghetti caprese is good.  This restaurant is fantastic . Very good quality food. It lives up to the price .

Friends and I were wandering and were starving but the Purple Pig had a 2 hour wait time, we found Volare instead who was much more accommodating. Our party of 7 was seated quickly and despite being extremely crowded our experience was pretty1 good. I ordered the chicken risotto which was VERY good. I was a bit miffed because it had onions in it and in the description that was not listed at all. It was still really good (even for lunch the next day). Friends ordered the black and white spaghetti, some other corkscrew pasta which was really good and chicken parm.  They give you bread and olive oil but we were seated by the window and when it's 20 degrees outside there's a serious draft and it's freezing inside too. Also it was too cold inside so the olive oil's texture turned weird. They were generous with the bread but it was just meh. The food was excellent but the service was a bit stretched and it took a while to get everything and go. I did however was impressed by how many "managerial" looking people stopped by our table, chastised us for using our phones  during the meal, etc and asked about our experience. I would love to come back and be warmer, have more wine and enjoy.

First, let me say that I live in DC and my boyfriend lives in New Orleans and we both travel for work, and we LOVE food, so we've had our fair share of amazing meals, but HOLY AH MAZING! One of THE best meals we have had! The bar was great to sit and wait (make a reservation) and the wine list is superb. I agree with everyone else's review for this place. EVERYTHING is great, down to the bread and the EVOO its served with. We did salads, and half orders of the entrees, which was MORE than enough food for the both of us, and seriously, my mouth is watering thinking about it now. We shared the cannoli desert and it was great! Staff is friendly, place is charming, great location.  GO GO GO!
We have been to Volare twice. Both times the food was excellent and very affordable. I had a recommend this restaurant and will go back several more times.

Delicious! I would suggest coming for lunch because the prices are fairly steep. I love that they give you two different breads to start; one is a normal crunchy Italian and the other was a rosemary softer loaf. They serve it with olive oil and Parmesan cheese for dipping. They also make their own limoncello in house and offer a huge wine and cocktail menu. I was stuck between the ricotta ravioli and the ricotta gnocchi. I went with the gnocchi which is topped in a vodka sauce and was blown away. I can remember seeing vodka sauces on menus in the past but don't remember trying it. It tastes like a creamier marinara and is divine. If you are on the adventurous side, I recommend their black squid ink spaghetti with seafood. That dish got numerous rave reviews from our table as well. Wonderful food and a friendly attentive staff make this place a win in my book. It's even better in the spring when you can dine on the patio.

We loved our food! Last night we went to an expensive restaurant and hated our meal--this one could have been more for how good it was. We got a seafood pasta and it was better than most I've had. Not fishy tasting. They put a lot of crab meat in it. We also got a chef's starter with beets, tomato, prosciutto, mozzarella. Was pretty big size and tasty. The atmosphere was pretty cozy and all friendly wait staff. We would come back if we lived here.

Went to Volare Saturday evening at 6pm with 8 other women and we all LOVED everything we had from the amazing food to the outstanding customer service. I highly recommend this restaurant to everyone. Paul our server was outstanding and he had so much patience, was willing to help with substitutions as 2 of use had special food request. the manager or owner came over to make sure things were well. I was very impressed and cant wait till I am back. thank you Volare and thank you Paul for you patience. By the way Paul is very cute, make sure to ask for him.

Volare is AMAZING. The wonderful woman who waited on our table made this dining event an EXPERIENCE! Her name is Taren!!!All of her recommendations were such a treat and none of the decisions disappointed. This place is a gem and I highly recommend eating here. And the cherry on top is that they have bread pudding for dessert!!!

The food here is fairly authentic but the service...not so much.  During the handful of times I have visited family in Italy, never have I been rushed at a restaurant.  I couldn't help but feel as though our party of 8 was being rushed out the door.  That being said, our waitress was knowledgeable about the menu and attentive to our requests.  Check out the caprese pasta dish.

Let's start with.... the staff.  One of the best parts about this place.  Everyone was really helpful, cheerful, pleasant and polite.  Only bad thing I can say about the staff is that they kept refilling my wine.  That's really not a bad thing, but there were different bottles of wine on the table and they kept mixing my wine with different wines.  Not a huge deal, but strange.  One of the things I was really disappointed with was the bread.  It wasn't bad, but  it just should have been better, not to mention that there wasn't enough oil and cheese provided.  Calamari was good, short neck clams not bad, roasted peppers with sausage was a crowd pleaser, and the brochette was boring but good.  And I should probably mention I was with a larger table which is why there were so many appetizers orders.  I personally ordered the seafood paella.  Flavors weren't bad but someone forgot to clean the clams and what not.  My teeth kept catching sand kernels and really ruined the entire experience.  Tried my bros gnocchi and it was good, not great.  Basically all of the food was like that.  Nothing amazing or overly creative.  Blondie had the Chick Parm and wasn't too happy with it.  Overall when you're talking about this place, I think you can freely use the term 'garden variety' very liberally.

Dined on a Thursday evening at 6, surprisingly was only abut half full. Two adults, two kids ages 12 and 9.  Between us we ran the gamut of what the menu offered, Including a special antipasti of East Coast mussels, and dinner specials of braciole and sea bass. From the opening house bread to the desserts, all the offerings were delectable, no disappointments at all. My wife and I each had a single glass of wine, my wife was able samples of two to decide which to have. Wine list was fairly comprehensive, included roughly 10 whites and 10 reds by the glass and some half bottles. She also appreciated that virtually all of offerings could be ordered as half sizes, helping avoid the overstuffed feeling that can ruin a meal.  Our server was very attentive and knowledgeable about the menu, and Italian cuisine in general . The courses arrived quickly, but we did feel rushed at all. It was clear that all components were made in house, from the pasta to the bread crumbs.  To top it off we had four different desserts, all of which were hits.  The final bill including tax (but not tip) was $154, which was very reasonable given two glasses of wine ,appetizer, and desserts, as well as a cup of cappuccino. If you are looking for authentic Italian cuisine, we don't think you could go wrong at Volare.

This place a lovely. It came highly recommend by a work colleague.  The queue is long to get in but totally worth it, it smells superb inside the restaurant. We managed to snag some seats at the bar and eat there.  The food was delicious, the black squid ink pasta was unusual and just delightful. The wine selection was great also.  No 5th star as we were given a wine glass reccommendation which was the most expensive on the menu,thankfully we know our way around a wine list and chose a more reasonably price glass that was a much better fit for our food.

Very authentic Italian dining experience. Very busy and bustling on Valentine's Day when I found myself there, almost too busy, but it was Valentine's:) Food was good ;def worth trying if you live in Chicago and havent been.

Here is yet another ruing of the lack of the 1/2 star system. My visit at Volare was great and they would rank at 4.5* for me. The first thing that struck me was from the second you enter you feel like you're part of a bigger family. I know, insert Italian joke here, but it's the honest truth. My Italian wine group came here for one of our dinners back in November and while they were insanely busy, they made sure we were feeling more than welcome from the word go. So, we then naturally started ordering food like it was our last supper. Our group started off with the bruchestta and carpaccio. The bruchestta was absolutely killer and the carpaccio was sliced as thin as you would want. Naturally we had to do another round because one wasn't enough.  As a second starter, we also decided on doing some pizza. So, for the 6 of us, we got a margherita and Volare pizza. I just want to say straight up, the Volare pizza was just flat out amazing. It was really delicious stuff. That is not to say that the margherita pizza isn't really good (it is), it's just that if one had to choose, it would most certainly be the Volare pizza IMO.  Then it was onto the pasta course. Since there were 6 of us and we generally like treating every restaurant as a small plates restaurant, we went with the gnocchi and veal ragu. The gnocchi was exactly how you'd want it to be: light and fluffy with a slight bit of chew to it. The veal ragu was spot on perfect with the sagrantinos we were drinking. We knew we were going to need something with a bit more heft to it, and this delivered in spades.  While we had eaten a good amount already, there was no way that we weren't going to have some entrees as well. The group decided on the roasted half  chicken and the filet.
