Where do I begin with both of these dishes? We loved the half chicken so much that we had to order a second one, and naturally we couldn't finish it so we divvied it up and took it home. The filet, well, this was spectacular. This was one of those perfect wine and food marriages that just give you a grin from ear to ear.  My group has Volare high on our sights for another visit. We were treated so well the entire way through and I was fully impressed by how well run the staff was given how busy it was. While Volare is in a bit of a touristy area, don't hesitate to go there, you'll be treated like famiglia and enjoy yourself the entire way.

I first went to Volare about 4 years ago at the recommendation of a concierge at the Sheraton and was really impressed by the food and service (as was everyone in the group I was with). We were back in Chicago and had to try it again (some people had been craving it for years) and went last night. We had a 7pm reservation for a party of 4 and had to wait a few minutes to be seated. The food was as I remembered it and excellent. The arribiata penne pasta I had was delicious and had good spice and the caprese salad was terrific with a really flavorful buffalo mozzarella.  The spumoni ice cream was also very good (they call it gelato but it isn't) and they have a good array of desserts but the half mason jar presentation of each was a bit odd and looked unappetizing for some of the desserts and for this type of a restaurant. The service this time wasn't as good as I remembered. Good service to me should be attentive but not oppressive and Volare last night was into the latter. From the moment we were seated we felt as if we were being rushed to turn the table. We ordered an appetizers and our salads were brought at the same time. Our main courses were placed within 30 seconds of finishing the salad/appetizers without any break. I am not a slow eater but I was asked multiple times if I was finished because I set a fork down on my plate. We were seated in the middle of the restaurant near the bar and there always seemed to be someone there on top of us. I would recommend asking for a table or the side or deeper into the seating area in the future which may provide a more relaxed experience. All in all great food, service didn't live up to how I remembered it but I'll probably be back the next time I'm in Chicago. 3.5/5 this time previous trip was a 5/5.

Dined at Volare tonight. The food was great but the wait staff even better. Terry waited on our table and her visual presentation of the evening specials were the best ever. Had a hard time choosing which ones to order!
Tried this on my trip to Chicago. Have to say one of my all time favorites. I had the ravioli with their vodka sauce.  So YUMMY!!  Blanche is the BEST server ever!!  A must stop on your trip!!

Top 3 high/lowlights 1) great food 2) gluten free options available 3) excellent service Came with a group of seven on Saturday night during St. Pattys day weekend. We had a 930pm reservation that we made around 7pm that same day. When we got to the restaurant we were told our entire party had to be there to be seated and that they were running about 15 minutes behind on all reservations (understandable as the place was packed!). We were just going out after so we didn't mind grabbing a drink at the bar for a little bit but may have been issue had we needed to be somewhere right after.  We were seated about 20 minutes later. We had a big, round table which was great but just like a lot of restaurants in big cities there was very little room between the tables. Our server was great, and walked us all through the great specials that night. He was also really nice about walking me through the gluten free options. Gluten free penne is available and several of the dishes (including the 4 cheese risotto which sounded awesome!) can be modified to be gluten free. I had the "spaghetti caprese" with the gluten free penne and it was awesome! Everyone else at my table liked their meals as well (spinach pasta bolognese, ravioli, and chicken parmesan) were a few. Our meals ranged from about $16  to $24. The portion sizes were great, Not so small that you will leave hungry but my huge. Would definitely recommend for a "nice but not too fancy" Italian meal in downtown Chicago

Where to begin...DELICIOUS! My parents, boyfriend and I went here for dinner here on our last night in the city. So incredibly good. We started with the Calamari. I can't say that I have had a better calamari dish. It was so tender and cooked just right. We also true their made in house sausage (so cool) with peppers! They had great bread and great options on the menu. If you go though, you should request Blanche as your server! This lady knows her stuff. She practically read my mind and helped me order something off menu completely to my liking. I tried a lemon wine pasta, my dad had a delicious veal, my mom had ravioli and my boyfriend had their black spaghetti (squid ink makes it black and it is sooo good)! Everything here is fresh, well thought out, and delicious!

Came here to order food to go and I got the Spaghetti Neri Al Pesce. Service was great the short amount of time I was there. My pasta came with 2 types of bread. One was a great mix of garlicky and slightly cheesy(?) but the other was rock hard so I quickly moved on to the pasta. While the squid ink spaghetti was super tasty, it was just a touch too salty and rich for me. Loved the scallops and shrimp although the crab was hard to taste because the creamy rosé sauce was a bit too overpowering for it. Couldn't figure out if it was cheese or not at first. Still, I very much enjoyed my meal.

Came here for dinner with my wife while on vacation in Chicago.  We had 1/2 order of calamari for our appetizers which was more than enough food for the both of us. They were ok. We both ordered pastas, which I can't remember the specifics. I had a few glasses of wine that night. Overall our meal was good, the restaurant was fairly crowded, and the atmosphere was pleasant.
"James Duke Ballard" on Good Day Chicago, Fox 32 has no credibility by recommending "Volare" restaurant. I stopped listening to his valentine presentation after he opened with Volare.

Out of the seven days I was in Chicago (actually 45 minutes outside of Chicago near the airport), I went here twice for dinner.  That says a lot considering the travel time getting there and all of the great restaurants to choose from in Chicago.   Service was top notch.  The food was excellent and they had a good beer selection. The first time we went, I ordered the Spaghetti Neri Al Pesce which is basically black spaghetti with noodles made from squid ink giving it it's color.  On top of that was mixed seafood of shrimp, scallops, and crab meat mixed in creamy rose sauce.  GOTDAMN was this delicious.  I mentioned to my coworker that this might be the best spaghetti I've ever had in my life. Second time we went, I ordered the Ghocchi with a side of sausage.  This was also amazing.  But if I had to choose one winner out of the two dishes, I'd definitely choose the spaghetti hands down! For anyone visiting Chicago, this place is a must!  Tip: for parties of two, keep your eyes peeled for bar seating.  Regular seating could cost you 45+ minute wait time.

The food itself is unbelievably good.  I go there very very often and can honestly say I've never had a bad dish.  Simply delicious, every time. On the other hand, sometimes when I go to dine with a reservation they keep me waiting for copious amounts of time.  The place is big enough that I feel they should be  able to manage this better.  Get that running smoothly and it's 5 stars.

I've been going here for years and the food has been consistently awesome.  If you're in the mood for delivery these guys get it done fast but check out the new renovations to the back of the place if you're dining out.
Excellent Italian food!! The vodka sauce is absolutely amazing. It's in a busy location in the city so it can get a little busy but it's worth the wait for the great food.

I absolutely LOVE this place. Dont let the rustic outward appearance fool you, it is lovely inside with a warm, welcoming and quite rich interior. Great service, AMAZING food. Probably my fave Chicago restaurant.
I love this place the food was great the service was great it was exciting and fun and next time I go to Chicago I'm coming back
Food is wonderful-bruschetta and eggplant rollatini were fantastic!  Service was fine-not great but ok but food quality far outweighed any negatives.  Would definitely go back!

Went with my husband for restaurant week 2014. This was the best restaurant out of the six we visited this year. Server Taren was especially friendly and helpful. Lunch special included four courses and a glass of wine. Wedge salad, pizza margherita, spaghetti caprese, rosotto fattoria, salmone al Forno, pollo Valdostana, tiramisu and creme Brule all received A plus ratings for us.  We had driven by this place for years and never went in - it is very simple on the outside.  Want good authentic Italian food - we recommend it. We look forward to going back in the future. Seems family friendly too.

Very good casual italian neighborhood spot. Good southern Italian food. Nice size portions. Interesting specials. Very quick service, but they will slow down if you want to have a more relaxing meal. Nice wine list. Good for large groups. My kids love the Volare salad! mix of salad and meat and cheese. Risotto with chicken and cheese, great dish as is the gnocchi with vodka sauce.

This place is close to where my son lives so we decided to give it a shot.  It was absolutely fantastic, beyond all expectations! For appetizer we had the seafood salad and baked clams which were delicious. For dinner we had veal limone, black pasta with shrimp and veal Milanese. All the dinners were excellent.  The food was served piping hot, and portions were generous.   We had a glass of a recommended wine (La Valentina) which was very good and complemented all our dishes. It was early in the day so the place was quiet, don't know how it will be when packed, but the ambiance and service were very good. Overall, one of those really nice, unexpected surprises.   We will definitely go back.

This is my favorite Italian restaurant!  A friend and I went to dinner here a few days ago and the food was outstanding, as usual.  We ordered the caprese salad, fried calamari, ceasar salad and the black spaghetti with shrimp, scallops and crab - the spaghetti is absolutely delicious and my new go to dish. This place is always busy, especially on weekends, so reservations are a must!  We went on a Tuesday evening right after work (5:30PM) so we took a risk and didn't make reservations and got in right away, but it definitely got busier as the night progressed. Friendly staff.  Nice atmosphere. Great service.  Mouth-watering food. Just go to Volare now!

I ordered the Margherita  Pizza for dinner. I actually wanted the Sphagetti Caprese, but against better judgement, went for the pizza.  The pizza was pedestrian at best, but at 12-14 inches, was very filling.  I had a glass of Chianti to drink with Spumoni for dessert.  The Spumoni was very good. The total bill with tip came around to $31, which was not bad at all.  The service was awful. Granted, there were a lot of folks in the restaurant, but that's not an excuse to be treated as an afterthought.

Delicious food, had the ravioli w pomodoro sauce, excellent with a nice Montepulciano de Abruzzo by the glass. Bread was warm and crispy, service was attentive and efficient. A great spot for a nice meal, will definitely be back if I'm in Chi-town and in the area!

Eaten here many times, but lunch (half order) mostly as I think the dinner is over priced. However, I've been all over Italy, have a bachelor's in Italian, had grandma's version, and still think the gnocchi here is the best I have ever had. It is alla vodka which is yummy, but I would love a bolognese, just haven't asked as none of the staff is too chummy to where you feel comfortable making a special request. For example, once I asked for a spritz (a cocktail) it was a nice warm day outside a warm wine just wasnt as appetizing. The response was sorry we don't have that, something you usually wont hear from a bar as they just ask what is and make it or with today's technology google it. So I pointed out they have everything necessary at the bar and I would love to tell them how to make it. At this point they were very nice, listened, passed it on, and my drink arrived lovely but at a premium price.  Overall great atmosphere, actually plays modern Italian music and you don't have to hear Dean Martin, Nel blu dipinto di blu, and Frank Sinatra on replay like most places. Suggestion: **lunch **half order **sit outside

If I could give this place a 4.5 I would.  I think that it was almost perfect except for our waiter.  We had a large group (12 people) and they took our name down as a reservation when I called which was great because we didn't have to go in a sit there waiting for forever on a saturday night.  Our waiter immediately saw that we were a large group and therefore, I believe, tried to upsell us on appetizers and wine.  It was obvious that we were looking to have fun but we ended up having almost a bottle too much (of course we drank it, but thats not the point!) and waaayyyy too much Calamari. Other than that, everything was so bomb! I would take anyone here.  I got the Alfredo with prosciutto and extra peas-- soo tasty!   My boyfriend got the black fettuccine with a variety of seafood, he said it was delicious! I think the atmosphere was perfect for special occasion or a place to take the out-of-towers.

One of my absolute favorite Italian restaurants. Exceptional food quality at great prices. Also helps that they are located right by my building! Must haves (sorry if I butcher the name/spelling of the items...I'm going off of memory): -Squid ink spaghetti pasta with seafood. Tons of seafood, incredible.  -The oriechetti pasta with veal ragu and peas  The last time I went the gnocchi with vodka sauce wasn't as great as times before... the gnocchi were less pillowy and more chewy. Maybe order a half order of this and try it out? My last visit may have been on an 'off night'.  All of their pastas are available as half orders and are very generous portions. Get a bunch and try everything. Their pastas are so outstanding that I've actually never gotten an item from their secondi menu. Maybe next time...?
We ordered delivery from here. The delivery took much longer than expected, they forgot one of our dishes, and the shrimp tasted like cardboard. Will not order again.

This place used to be something spectacular, however they have really gone downhill since the remodel. Is it under new management?  Whatever they gained in space and style from the redesign, they have lost in food quality.  I have lived in the neighborhood for over 6 years, so have dined here many times. I keep trying it again, remembering how good it used to be. And, I keep getting disappointed - the dishes keep getting blander and blander.   The tipping point might have been tonight. I ordered a pasta dish (rigatoni with Alfredo, prosciutto, and peas).  Imagine my surprise when it arrived and the 'prosciutto' resembled something closer to diced Spam.  Sauce had zero flavor.  I've had better Alfredo pasta out of a pouch.  It's a shame because this was an excellent place for a reliably delicious meal. Not anymore.....
Delightful atmosphere, great food.  The waite staff is all over your convenience.  An easy choice if your in  the area.
Classic place.  Friendly staff and great food.
Good pasta dishes and warm atmosphere.  Some of their sauces need to be modified to make them go from good to great.

Speechless classy ownership and waitstaff. immediate greetings coming and going. I will always eat here on my visits to Chicago!  Food was an11 out of 10. Pork medallions !!' nuff said ! Great wine selection and appetizers priced reasonably in. safe location. Very clean restrooms !! Do it you owe it to yourself !

My boyfriend and I went to Volare last night after reading reviews on Yelp for romantic restaurants. We had an excellent experience. The restaurant has a vibrant charm with the soft music in the background, excellent service and food. Our waitress was extremely helpful and gave good suggestions. As I am a vegetarian,  we ordered Tortino Melanzane for the antipasto as suggested by the waitress. It was tasty and cooked to perfection.  I had read reviews about the Gnocchi and decided to order it and Spahagetti Caprese. Both were amazing and delicious. My boyfriend ordered pollo Arrosto which was half grilled chicken dish. He said it was very well cooked and had a good flavor. Next we ordered tiramisu as our dessert. Overall a really good experience!

Volare is phenomonal -ive been going here for over 10 years- had just about everthing on the menu and i have never been dissapointed- service is impeccable- Marco (GM) always makes sure that customers are always happy.  If you have never been , Go- good idea to make a reservation any day of the week-  if you are in the neighborhood they do deliver

College friends reuniting at this classic Italian restaurant on a Friday night. Definitely want to make a reservation if you go there on weekends otherwise you'll be waiting foreverrr. The ambiance is great and the staff are very friendly. Their restaurant manager walks around the restaurant making sure customers are having a good time.  I had a glass of pinot gregio and an entree of black spaghetti with shrimps, scallops and lump crabs. a lot of seafood! I have never had black sphagetti before and it reminded me of thick starch korean noodles. mixed with tons of lump crabs .. the texture was amazing! I also loved the scallops.. rich, thick and well flavored. I would highly recommend this dish! totally worth $23. I had trouble finishing the whole entree though so I had a second meal out of it. You could get it in half portion if you don't like having leftovers.

Had a great experience here! Made a reservation for 6 pm today (Saturday) and was seated very promptly. Waiter was very helpful and eager to answer any of our questions. At his recommendation, we ordered the warm kale salad, which was very good! It had prosciutto, white beans, brussel sprout greens, and garbanzo beans. My husband and I ordered the specials of the evening. I had a beef tortellini dish with red wine sauce. Very savory and the beef filling was delish! My husband had a pork dish with polenta. The portion was huge! Very tasty as well. Service was great overall and we enjoyed the food. Atmosphere was cozy and romantic, too! Would definitely come back!

We were here on New Year's Eve by a friend's recommendation. He wanted to see a "friend" who was playing jazz there that evening. We thought "Cool - a jazz band for dinner!" They were a duet, jammed into a tight corner and were mediocre at best. We had a 9:30 reservation and arrived on time. The hostess was friendly as she escorted us to the bar, telling us it would be a 10-15 minute wait for a table as the place was crowded. As this happens to be our anniversary, we were dressed for the occasion.  And even though it was New Year's Eve, we were way overdressed for the venue - which was strange because the place doesn't appear to be that casual. As we waited, the manager suggested on two occasions that he kept mistaking me for a waiter.  Funny once - sort of.  Our bartender was friendly and professional and the best part of the evening. Time passed, the hostess forgot about us.  We checked back with her on the 1/2 hour and she offered us a table all the way in back, far away from the music. We opted to wait.  Another 30 minutes went by. The hostess had either left for the evening or found something better to do as her station was now empty. We stopped the manager who was very accommodating and surprised that we were actually there for dinner.  Hmmm. Formally dressed people coming into your little 8 seat bar to celebrate NYE? I don't think so. So guess what?  Even though the front room had tables (not yet cleared) he sat us all the way in back, far away from the music. At this juncture it didn't matter anymore because my friend's "friend" had somewhere else to be and announced this would their last song for the evening (10:45PM) and we were starving. Suffice it say that the waiter recommended wine was remarkably inferior for the $60 price and surprisingly difficult to drink. My six, small ravioli took a full 30 minutes to arrive and were served to me "plain" even though I special ordered them with olive oil, lemon, butter and Parmesan. I ate them anyway as the waiter was gone for 10 minutes before checking back. Having now run so late, we were the only people left in back room as New Year's approached. We were stuck at Volare for the stroke of midnight. 3-2-1 Midnight! Nothing. Yeah Volare!  The other couple took this occasion to get into a heated discussion about who-knows-what?  We moved on to Jordan's Bar at the Intercontinental Hotel where, practically panting, the manager told us it was last call. Seriously?! Last Call?!  In Chicago at 12:30AM?! Unbelievable. Luckily, we're an adaptable couple and enjoy each other's company despite adversity. This was not our first poorly planned, poorly executed NYE - but with any luck it will be our last. All in all Volare was very disappointing and really not worth all the time, effort and money. I see that a lot of people love this place and its history. They can have it.  In retrospect, we should have gone to Buddy Guy's and drank dinner. We'd have had a much better time. We won't be back.

Service was great. Pizza dough was drench with oil and pizza sauce wasn't tasty. I was not impressed. I ordered the clams with linguini and couple of the clams were still closed. I asked for extra sauce and when it came, it still looked dry. I also ordered glass of red wine and it tasted as if it was couple days old. I hate providing bad reviews but I hope they make it better.

Ate here two nights in a row on a recent trip to Chicago, and was very happy with both the food and the table service each time. Not a big octopus fan, but thought the calamari and grilled octopus appetizer was excellent! My only complaint is that it was so busy on the 2nd night (Sat.) that they would not seat us until we confirmed that our entire party had arrived, so that even when there were 8 of us present they forced us to stand around and wait long past our reservation time until the final 4 (stuck in traffic) arrived. I suppose they were just trying to maximize their occupancy, but it was surprising and unpleasant.

Visited Chicago for a conference and stayed on Wacker. Volare is just a short stroll across the river and well worth it. Loved the vibe and energy of the place. Walked in and it was busy and bustling...a bit loud...and the food from the open kitchen smelled great. Wish I could have tried more, but I just stuck with pasta. Great portions and would definitely come back.

Restaurant review I recently had a chance to come back for lunch and I enjoyed my linguine alle vongole. The pasta's are always cooked perfectly, not over done and not too al dente. The only complaint I have is most of the food is a bit on the saltier side, but clearly that has not changed people's reviews. The focaccia bread that comes with your meal is a plus when dipped in olive. Our server was hands down super friendly and came to check on us throughout the meal. They didn't even mind that I had to push a giant stroller into their restaurant for my son. This is likely the best italian restaurant in streeterville.

Caught a movie yesterday and decided to stop for an appetizer and wine at Volare. The Grigliata Mista was delicious! The seafood was fresh and I woke up wanting to go back to try other dishes. EXCELLENT!!! I can't wait until their burger place opens in the next week,

Picture it:  It's two weekends until Christmas, and my parents were in town from the little town where I grew up.  My mother wanted to see the lights on Michigan Avenue, shop at Macy's and visit the Christkindlmarket.  My father, who I think genuinely hates Chicago, had one request:  dinner at Volare.  Rather than trying to talk him out of it and into one of the half dozen excellent Italian restaurants in the neighborhood where I live, I went with it.   I have to say I'm glad I did.  Imagine the mob scene at Christkindlmarket (it was like being in a human anthill) followed by Macy's, which seemed spacious and relaxed in comparison, followed by a dozen or so other stores on Michigan Avenue.  Dad was a sport through all of it, even though he hates crowds even more than I do.   Finally, we get to Volare in time for our 9:00 reservation, which was the middle of the night for my parents, frankly, but was the only time available on a busy Saturday night because their beloved son (me) waited until that day to make reservations.  Naturally, Volare was mobbed; however, the staff could not have been nicer or more accommodating.   My father had the gnocchi, which I think he had planned the whole day.  My mother had an amazing risotto.  Even the leftovers I ended up with after their departure were out of this world.  I had the lasagna, which melted in my mouth, and a couple of martinis to take the edge off of the day. The food was amazing and the service was impeccable, and there was only one thing that keeps from giving them five stars.  I'm pretty sure that they added tables to the dining room for the holidays to accommodate larger crowds, which led to my seat being a little less than a foot from the diner across the aisle from me.  It didn't leave the servers or diners much room to walk at all, and I ended up with a lot of derrieres in my face.  But, again, I'm pretty sure it was just for the holidays, and I'll definitely be back.

This has become an instant favorite. Went here in a group of 4 with a reservation at 6pm on a Friday. That turned out to be a great decision as when we walked out 2 hours later there was a line of about 5 tables. Everything we got was super delicious and in very generous portions with a reasonable price tag, especially considering its prime location. I love that you can get a half entree so that you don't need to waste any food (or if you don't like to take leftover with you) and more importantly so that you can have room for desserts. I got the di mare (seafood risotto). It's a little bit too moist for my taste but the red sauce was on point. I would have loved more spice/kick but it was still a delicious dish. I was pleasantly surprised with the amount of seafood in one dish. The scallops were very fresh and sweet. For the ingredients alone, I give this dish a thumbs up. My friends got the clams linguine and seafood spaghetti neri. Both looked divine. They also enjoyed two glasses of white that paired well with their dishes.  Ambiance-wise, it's semi intimate but overall very family friendly. They can accommodate a party up to 10 people. Service was attentive but not excessive. There was some miscommunication in my salad order but our waiter got me a new/correct salad right away and owned up the mistake. Kudos for that. It's super easy to snatch a reservation and one can always rely on walking off (some of) the calories on Michigan Avenue afterwards.

Price is excellent!! I got an appetizer, half order of pasta, and dessert for less than $35 with a 23% tip.  (I am picky about Italian food, because my Italian father owned a restaurant in New York).  The food was good, not great. I feel the server should always mention the seafood specials, and maybe because it was busy, the server just wanted me to order, but the seafood special which another table ordered looked spectacular. (Of course I saw this after I ordered) I got the calamari which was good, and the seafood in a brandy rose sauce, with crab, shrimp and scallop which was good.  The Tiramisu is just OK.
Between the great service, and food I'm just left speechless. Fantastic food, and amazing wine.

For this review I really struggled between 2 and 3 stars... the service was excellent... but the food was... well not the greatest overall. We came here for a family dinner - 10 of us crowded around a long table - but enough room for us.  My only complaint is that the staff could barely get by the table - which led to them knocking the coat off the back of my fiance's chair four times - they all immediately picked it up... but still - it was tight. Appetizers were simple, but pretty good - calamari and sausage and peppers.  I thought it strange that they didn't have many Italian wines on the list, but still found a New Zealand pleasing to share for the table...  I tried to order a Dark & Stormy to start, but they didn't have the ingredients!  My main course - seafood risotti - was pretty good, but the octopus was very overcooked - it was quite tough.  My real problem here was the main dish of my fiancee - he ordered a linguine with veggies and whitefish that was supposed to have a garlic and white wine sauce... the issue was that the dish, while well presented, was just tasteless - it was frankly terrible... It should not have been a special!   Desert wasn't bad at all, just not special or memorable - a creme bulee with berries and some coffee. Despite great service - the food was meh to bad and doesn't prompt me to come try again.

My husband and I went while out shopping this weekend for a late lunch. Nice people and attentive service. I had a salad that was just ok but he had a veal pasta dish with wine that was amazing!! I could barely stop myself from eating it, haha. We each got a dessert - tiramisu and the chocolate hazelnut. Tiramisu was ehhh I wouldn't get it again - it's very thick with very little lady finger and not much flavor but the chocolate hazelnut was DELISH. I will go back just for that and coffee. It's a block off the mile but so much less busy so it's definitely worth it (that's not to say it wasn't busy).
Excellent. Just excellent.  You can't go wrong with the Gnocchi alla Vodka. Its so good and melts in your mouth. Soooo goood.
Great food and service.  Paul was our server and very attentive.  We loved the margarita pizza.  The mini deserts are a must.

Classic Italian at it's best.  If you like the old stuff, it's in there and they move you in and out quick. We stopped here on the way to a show and slightly worried we'd get out in time--boy were we wrong!  Despite the long lines they run this place like a military operation.  They really work at turning over tables quickly.  Our server ran us right on the border of being efficient and rushing us.  I'm still not sure.  I didn't feel rushed per say but I would have liked a more leisurely pace to the meal.  At one point, when someone was picking at their food during the chat she actually cut his food trying to move him along!  It was bizarre and she asked permission, but it was to send the message "eat it or box it".  He boxed it. The place is incredibly large and noisy.  This isn't the place for a romantic meal.  Our server upsold most items and, this annoyed me, saying because I was a big guy I didn't order enough food.  I get she needs to upsell but I was quite satisfied with a half portion. Quality of the food was great, but everything was a bit heavy here which is classic red sauce style Italian.  Lots of cream or olive oil.  I'm not always accustomed to this as I prefer a lighter fare.  For the portions, pricing was reasonable but the portion sizes were quite large especially with bread service before.  If you want to get a half portion--get it. A nice experience and a great quick meal

Traditional Italian fare prepared well - but nothing radical. We enjoyed the arrabiatta sauce on penne and the clam sauce on angel hair. The place was packed - but we were seated promptly with a reservation. A fairly small room that is loud when crowded. Excellent service; they accommodated a number of special requests. Great for families - convenient to Near North hotels and businesses.

Came here for a holiday work dinner with a huge group.  Our server, Taren was extremely accommodating and attentive despite our large group.  She read the specials off with such enthusiasm and detail that she left our mouths watering!   Portions here are quite generous.  We had eggplant rollatinis stuffed with ricotta and a plate of fried calamari for our appetizers.  So much food that I couldn't even take a bite of the  linguine vongole.  Loved it as lunch the next day, plenty of juicy clams!

Great Italian Food. You can make customize your pasta entrees with your choice of sauce and noodle. Serves is great. The space was rather small and reservations were impossible, but they have expanded and now it is perfect. Say hello to Marco!!!

Long Overdue. This is my favorite restaurant in the city and has been since I moved to Chicago 8 years ago. The food, atmosphere, service, management, it's all the absolute best. I can't say enough about this restaurant. They also have the best vodka sauce in the city.

Volare is a beautiful and intimate place. If you sit at the tables, you get impeccable, kind, and attentive service. If you sit at the bar, you get a whole different experience: lively and fun, thanks to the happy bartenders.  The pasta here is some of the best i have ever had. I don't know how they make every pasta perfectly al-dente every single time. Its beautiful. The fried calamari?!?! Oh my goodness.  My mouth is watering just writing this review.
Food was excellent, good authentic italian. Drinks were good. Outstanding risotto.

Delicious! Best fried calamari I've had in a long time (very obviously fresh, not frozen). The ambiance is classy, but not ostentatious . Service was impeccable. My mother had the linguine with white clam sauce and that was divine (plenty of clams- both chopped and half shelled). My veal limone dish was excellent too. We will return again!

I've been a fan of Volare for over a decade.  It's crowded and inevitably some of the diners are going to make spectacles of themselves and disgust me, but the food is consistently good and the staff is on their game.  Some of the best lasagna I can get outside of my own kitchen.

This place is absolutely delicious!  I came here on a recent visit to Chicago while visiting friends and family. The original plan was to go to Rosebud on Rush but they were closed.  The solution was a Yelp search and it did not disappoint! The atmosphere is that of your typical nice Italian restaurant, maybe a bit more intimate.  Our waiter was very attentive and the prices weren't bad.   The food itself was primarily good.  I, along with three others in our party, ordered a penne pasta dish with eggplant.  It sounded great but none of us finished our plates.  Pass on it.  However, my wife ordered the pappardelle and it was absolutely top notch!  That and the caprese salad made this meal a real gem.
Grigliata Mista is awesome. Risotto is also nice but could be a little to sticky. Nice location Great restaurant and good service. Plus you can order half a dish--for those who come alone to enjoy.
Food and service was excellent. Tucked away but if you can find it I would recommend to anyone. Great wine list and knowledgable servers. I think the pasta was homemade!

Not a bad Italian restaurant, and they're willing to make things without cheese for the vegans. However, it's not very authentic and nobody speaks Italian here. I can't really fault the restaurant for that but... it's always disappointing to be in an Italian restaurant where nobody speaks the language.

Love this place. It's become a staple of mine since its so close to where I live and work.  Gnocchi in a vodka sauce is phenomenal. Thanks to a tip from a bartender I was able to add mushrooms and get a half portion and pair an excellent wine. Perfect meal! I've gotten other veg dishes there and none have been quite as good.

Amazing!! Get the caprese salad and lobster ravioli!! All their pasta is so fresh and delicious.  The vodka sauce is amazing.  This is one of my favorite places to dine when I'm in Chicago.   This place gets packed so come early!

If you want to celebrate a special event Volare isn't the place for you. I made a reservation with the special request that we were celebrating a birthday. When we arrived we waited and waited. Once seated the server was nice and the food was pretty good. When it came time for the singing no one came. Again we waited and waited. My sister got up and reminded the manager John Marano so expecting a server to come sing we waited and waited. We paid the bill and left. VOLARE never again! The manager offered a cake to go... Ridiculous.

One of the best Italian places I have ever been to. Get the bruschetta to start. It was the best damn bruschetta I've ever had! Seafood black spaghetti was soooo good. Also provides a great atmosphere with an excellent staff.

Excellent service and great food. I had a special, which was (if I remember correctly) was a pounded flank steak rolled with cheese and Italian sausage.  It was very easy to get in on a busy Thursday night with no wait. Good stuff all the way around!

Great service, great food, great ambience, great price! Seriously just had a fantastic lunch at Volare with my husband. The restaurant has such a warm feel and the food was really fresh and generous servings.

The food was delicious and the service was great. Our waitress was very familiar with all the wines, which made our selection of a bottle much easier. I was also very impressed with the management staff, there were multiple mangers hustling around making sure everything was running smoothly and that everyone was taken care of. Plus it was very well priced.

I took my boyfriend here for his birthday after reading the great reviews and I'm so glad we went. The atmosphere is really nice and the service was welcoming and friendly. Strong drinks is a plus too :) I ordered the Linguine Alle Vongole (clam linguini) and my boyfriend ordered the Spaghetti Neri Al Pesce (black spaghetti with crab meat, shrimp, and scallops). Oh man! My dish was so good. The clams were perfectly cooked and the sauce was light and delicious. My boyfriend loved his dish too even though it looked weird eating black spaghetti :) I'm coming back for the clam linguini!
The Clam Linguini and Lasagna are the best I've had!!  The service and atmosphere are top notch and very much enjoyed the evening crowd.

Delicious food! And the service was excellent! Our water glasses were always being filled, and whenever we got a little low on bread, they brought us more warm pieces, with a new plate of oil. I ordered the black spaghetti and it was absolutely delicious. It's colored with squid ink, which sounded odd, but tasted amazing, especially with the scallops and shrimp.

Old school Italian... Please and thank you!  Great atmosphere at Volare. It's very busy but not crazy loud, so you can enjoy your dinner date! The service is absolutely top notch too!  A nice wine list...our server recommended a nice bottle at a nice price point!  The food was authentic and wonderful! I can tell you the vodka sauce was heavenly! They will make it to your liking. Gnocchi is a little heavy for me, so I chose penne and added meatballs.  I will add this to my list as a regular place to stop! Oh... Highly recommend a reservation!

Food is wonderful...everyone raved about the gnocchi and vodka sauce so I gad to try it--deelish!!  Husband had the squid ink risotto, which wasn't on tonight's menu, but when we asked, we were able to have it.  It was a huge serving and delish as well.  Lots of people waiting when we left, good idea for reservations.  Cozy atmosphere.  Want to go again!

Volare...great food.  Really good staff...once you are seated. Would love to return.  But I won't. On last visit had 8:00 reservations for my wife, daughter, and me. Likely visit number 10 over past 2 or 3 years.  We waited. And waited. Watched as numerous customers came, customers who were familiar to Volare.  "Can you get us a table?"  No problem. Our 8:00 reservation finally found us seated at 9:30. Done with Volare.

Visiting Chicago for the day, stopped by for lunch. Had fusilli with a veal ragu and peas. Surprisingly cheap, but yummy. Been thinking about it each day since I had it last week. Cloth tablecloths with polished staff, working with hustle and prices of a diner. Offers half plates that are huge, and at a great price. Excellent lunch, although tight quarters might not be great for dinner.

This was a great experience of an Italian restaurant. There was a wait but the manager, who was very friendly, offered to sit us in the enclosed patio area which was more private anyway. We ordered the clams for appetizers which were very fresh, and I got the black seafood pasta dish with a blush sauce which was amazing. The service was great, but the food was a little slow.

I liked the location and the atmosphere was nice. We were seated outside, and luckily it was a heated area. I was never cold! :) The waiter was friendly, the only thing I didn't like was the dessert menu was all in Italian. So if you can't read Italian you have to ask. The food was good, not the best but decent. The prices were fair for being located in downtown Chicago. Not a far walk from most hotels, the Marriotts not too far from here so convenient if you don't feel like driving.
Amazing!! This has just become my all time favorite italian place in river north! Had their linguini with clams and white sauce....delectable!! Great service as well!

If you go on a Friday or Saturday night MAKE A RESERVATION! This place is crazy busy. Recommended to us by our hotel, we were in the mood for some authentic Italian food. Based on the food, I would give it 5 stars but, the awkward waiting area really sucked and it was super loud. Definitely not a place for a romantic date.  Food did come out fast, kitchen was on it! Super impressed since they were so busy. Each dish we ordered was truly delicious. Best Alfredo sauce we have ever had! The homemade meatballs melt in your mouth. As far as flavors go this chef gets an A++.  The manager was very friendly and really did a good job making each customer feel special amidst the chaos.  The owner was there.... Lol he had his 4 door porche parked out front all day and was mostly concerned about his friends visiting the restaurants which he clearly used all of his attention on.
Sterling service and outstanding food. What more could I ask for? So thankful we found this place while we were vacationing in Chicago.
Fairly priced, great service, good food, nice atmosphere. The sauces tasted a bit too fresh for my taste, preferring instead the slow all day cooked depth of flavor.

I think it's been established that the food is delicious here--amiright? So--I'll make this part quick:  - Gnocchi with vodka sauce = mmmyes. Skip the italian sausage, though. It's better without it. Otherwise, it's pillowy, indulgent, carby-food-sex on your plate.  - Rolled eggplant. Just do it. Yes-even if you don't like eggplant (like me.) Shove it in your face and then feel the rush of surprise as you realized you were so, so wrong about this delicious morsel.  - Sauce, all kinds of perfect.  - Rigatoni with Arrabiata sauce? Jeeee-ZUS. WHY on God's green earth this isn't talked about in ever.single.review I'm not sure of... It should be gloried in statue form. It should be part of my everyday life. I will carry its delicious perfection in my heart forevs.  Now--onto the really important stuff. Service. Dudes, I'm even kidding you. Our 10 person table felt like royalty. Yes, royalty that needed to be rolled out on conveyer belts because we were all so damn full, but still. We were a large group that needed to eat fast to catch our tour cruise. They gave us 5-star service in a short amount of time, PLUS brought us plate after plate of probably some of the best Italian noms I've had in my liiiiife. Not sure how anyone has had bad service here, but maybe we just hogged it all. Sorry we're not sorry.  Get. Here. Now.
Awesome food, awesome service. Came here twice during our weekend in Chicago. If you're a tourist, skip the deep dish pizza etc... and go to Volare's. Squid Ink Risotto - oh yeah.

If you're in the mood for old school Italian in the heart of downtown Chicago, there's a lot to like about Volare. From the cozy, familial dining rooms to the expertly mixed martinis and friendly, bustling wait staff, this restaurant aims to please. For the most part, it succeeds, and the majority of the diners at our table were very happy with their meals. Start with a large antipasti platter and some fried calamari to get things going. I especially liked the Prosciutto de Parma and the Taleggio cheese, accompanied by some mixed Italian olives and a crisp, dry Italian red wine. If you're hosting a business meeting, be aware the noise levels are quite high, so conversations may be difficult. If you're there for fun, though, sit back and enjoy the show! A special note for gluten sensitive diners - Volare has gluten free pasta, made from chickpea flour, and it is quite delicious. I can recommend the caprese sauce, fresh tomatoes, basil and mozzarella tossed with extra virgin olive oil. However, if you have Celiac disease, please keep in mind that Volare makes non-GF pasta in-house, so cross-contamination could be an issue. Be sure to let your servers know of any allergies prior to ordering. Alas, there are no GF desserts, but the artfully arranged grouping of dessert "jars" were a big hit. Table favorites were the cheesecake and the tiramisu.
A freat family owned restaurant.  Love to go there with my boyfriend for Spaghetti Neri Al Pesce with a glass of malbec. yummmm

I try to go here every time I'm in Chicago for business. If you don't want to wait, try to make a reservation. Sometimes we go and get lucky with a seat at the bar. We either enjoy a drink while waiting for a table (it's fun to people watch) or just eat at the bar.  Either way, the service has always been fantastic. I am starting to recognize many of the staff, which tells me many of them have worked there for a long time.  The Gnocchi is delicious as well as the black pasta dish (can't remember the name but there is seafood in it). You can order pasta as a half order and I would recommend this if you are also having an appetizer. Can't wait to go back for our next business trip!

So glad we decided to wait it out. As tourists, I forget....make reservations! So even though it was later in the evening on a Tuesday there was about a 45 minute wait. We waited outside at a table on a covered, heated patio. It was comfy and totally worth it.  When we sat down we were greeted by our waitress Taryn, who was awesome. She was super nice, super accommodating and her service was the best! Beyond that the food was fantastic. Hubbs and I both started with a basic salad. Really good, dressed perfectly. For entrees I had the black spaghetti with seafood and Hubbs had the special that evening, which was sea bass. Both were excellent. We topped it off with 4 mini desserts because we both have a giant sweet tooth. Limoncello cheesecake, chocolate creme de pots, cannoli, banana cream pie, all served in smalli little mason jars. It was perfect because we got our fill of four desserts! We left stuffed and happy.  It was honestly the best night of our entire trip, and the best meal we had, hands down. Just sorry that we discovered it on our third trip instead of our first. Can't wait to go back!!

Awful. Don't go. I had been wanting an Italian meal for a long time so, based on reviews, made reservations at Volare for four. My spinach fettuccini was full of the lousiest Bolognese sauce I've ever eaten: salty finely-ground beef with almost no tomato or other ingredients. A staff person sprinkled some dry Kraft-style shredded parmesan on my food. Large portion, most of which I left uneaten. My friends: one ate only about a fourth of his calamari/shrimp dish and did not have the leftovers boxed for take-home; one, when asked about her veal, said the cutlets were "thin" - no comment on the flavor; one ate his bland, unremarkable chicken but there wasn't anything Italian about it. Our waiter was polite and competent but there are runners, bussers and hosts galore clogging up this already cluttered restaurant.

I liked the vegetable soup and grounded veal pasta. They have the option of ordering half size pasta for lunch, which comes almost as the full size at some other places. The services and atmosphere are both very good. But their bread is kind of dry.

The service was really poor when I went with a friend.  First, we were moved after we had already sat down, ordered, and dipped into our drinks.  Then, when the waiter, he essentially completely ignored my friend.  Finally, we were supposed to be comped for dessert but they tried to get us out without us ordering a sweet thing, and ended up comping us only on one of two. We both ordered the squid ink pasta + scallops, which was delicious without being too heavy.  My friend still raves about the pasta we ordered to this day, 2 years later.  The desserts were OK--I would go elsewhere for your finisher if you're looking for something sweet.  In general, if you're looking for Italian, Volare will be a very solid meal.  However, the decor indoors is overly dark, and the service very meh.  I might be back--no guarantees!

We arrived at our reservation time and were informed we would have to wait, so we were guided to the bar. We waited about 10 minutes.  I asked the bartender for a Cabernet sauvignon and he said he had a few, and I picked one - then he told me that blend wasn't his preference so I should try something else, so he gave a sample without my prompting.  I didn't care for it. He sampled several more (again, with no prompting on my part) and I didn't care for those either. I told him so, and he said "well you've had like 10" (which wasn't even close to true) and out of exhaustion I just picked his favorite so he would stop. I didn't care for it. I tried 5 different cabs, and none were close to on-mark for a cab, all were strangely vinegary, and the lady sitting next to me who ordered the same agreed.  Well anyway, we were seated and the server was friendly. The quarters are very close, and the acoustics very very loud. Also, several families. Not quite the romantic environment promised. They also had pop/rock music playing, which really clashed with everything. This place would meet higher standards of class with a quieter environment and more room. We were given bread (but not refills).  I had the absolutely delicious gnocchi, soft pillows with slight chew in a creamy vodka tomato sauce. My companion had some sort of meat with blueberry sauce which he absolutely loved. Both excellent.  For dessert, they have little glass containers with different options. We shared a very small creme brulee. This was actually quite nice because you could order several to share for a fill dessert, or only one or two for a taste of dessert.  Overall the bill was far less than we anticipated. The gnocchi was great and thus worth the noise and cramped quarters.

I stopped by here a couple of Saturday nights ago with my fiance before dinner.  We arrived at the restaurant around 5:30 to find it mobbed with people as the Chicago Marathon was happening the next morning.  Even so we went into the restaurant in order to ask how long the wait would be and were surprised whenever we were told that there was a small table open near the street if we wanted it.  We quickly accepted that and were happy with the table that faced out onto the street as the people watching was fantastic.  However dueto that I never really saw the inside of the restaurant to give an accurate description of it. Within a short amount of time our waitress came over to give us the daily specials as well as to deliver us some bread and olive oil.  Our waitress ended up being a very pleasant lady and even though she spoke some broken english, I would enjoy her service throughout the meal.  For my entree I decided to order one of the specials of the day which was a green and yellow tagliatelle with sausage in a tomato sauce.  While waiting for the meal I decided to try some of the bread which was good, especially when paired with the parmesan and olive oil dipping sauce.  Whenever the pasta came out I have to admit that I was impressed with the portion size of it.  More importantly it tasted really good as the pasta was cooked nicely and I liked the taste of the sausage with the sauce.  While I do not remember what my fiance had, I do remember that she enjoyed it as well (she has informed it was a farfalle al salmon) and we left a happy couple. The bottom line for me is that I would head back here again in the future.  Everything about this place was enjoyablefor me including our seats on the street , the food and especially our waitress.
Excellent choice for Italian in Chicago.  Everything I've tried was great.  Pricey but worth it 100%

A friend and I ate here tonight and we had a excellently delicious, fresh, flavorful and refined meal.   We were seated within 10 minutes, even though the restaurant was quite busy for a Sunday evening. For our appetizers, we ordered the House Salad, the Rotolini de Melanzane (Baked Eggplant Rolls), and the Fritto di Calamari (crispy Calamari).  It was all delicious, especially the Eggplant Rolls.  Wow.  Freshly-made pomodoro (marinara) sauce over a delicate slice of baked eggplant rolled around ricotta cheese.  Very light and an extremely good combination of warm, tangy sauce with a comforting nubbly creamy cheese.  Excellent.  I had the Spaghetti Neri al Pesce (Black Spaghetti tossed with shrimp, lump crab, scallops and sage in a brandy and cream rosé sauce), and she had the Risotti Fattoria (Risotto with chicken, peas, and a four cheese sauce). I ordered this Spaghetti because it seemed different, and many previous Yelpers have reported they liked it.  According to our very courteous waitress, it is one of their more popular dishes.  I see why: it was extremely tasty.  Spaghetti infused with black squid ink is not something I eat every day, but our server explained the squid ink has no flavor (mostly for looks), but it is supposed to heighten the palate and bring out the flavors of other seafood it's served with.  The shrimp, lump crab and scallops all paired beautifully with the brandy sage rosé sauce which tasted slightly sweet from the brandy and cream base, as well tangy from the rosé, and earthy from the sage.  I wish by this point I had been hungrier so I could finish it. My friend's Risotti was extremely rich but the addition of the peas was a nice touch to lighten an otherwise on-the-heavy-side dish.  After all, it is a four-cheese risotto, so we shouldn't have been surprised. We had two desserts: the Oreo banana pudding with an oreo-cookie crust which I thought was good, but I wasn't overwhelmed.  And we also had the Limoncello cheesecake with a Pistachio biscotti crust.  Now this one was a triumph.  I don't mean to over-hype it: it's not the best Italian dessert I've ever had, but the limoncello cheesecake paired with the pistachio biscotti crust totally worked.  It came with diced strawberries on the top. This is certainly one of the best Chicago restaurants I've yet to eat at, and I would absolutely recommend it, and will be pleased to return when I can.  It seemed like they had a restaurant full of regulars.  A very lively enjoyable place.  We sat at the table talking for quite awhile after we were finished eating, and didn't once feel like they wanted us to leave so they could turn the table.

This is an old-school Italian restaurant.  Italian staff, regulars, great standard fare.  We wanted to grab a glass of wine so we sat at the bar and were pretty happy with the choices, pricing, and service.  The Tiramasu was great.  Can't wait to go back and have dinner.
The service was amazing. The food was pretty authentic Italian. They stuck us all the way in the back corner and the place was packed. Other than being on top of each other, Volare was great.

My boyfriend and I were searching for a place to eat dinner, everywhere had wait lists with a minimum of an hour. However we were sat down here in 10-15 minutes with a very hospitable welcoming. I ordered the Black Spaghetti with Seafood, and may I just say it was probably one of the best pastas I've ever had. I was apprehensive to order the black pasta at first, but it accompanied the seafood so well. There were large chunks of crab meat along with shrimp and scallops. For dessert, we had the banana pudding with Oreo cookie crust, perfect way to end the meal. Definitely would come back here again.

We split the Caesar salad and the black spaghetti with crab,shrimp, and scallops. The Caesar was very large and had a very good garlicky dressing . The spaghetti dish was very unique and tasty. It was not overly fishy. Our server was very friendly, but rushed. I don't know if they understaffed for the night or another server called in sick.  The pricing was very reasonable for a location one block off north Michigan Ave. I would return .

Utterly Fantastic!  Every bite was a celebration of perfection. All of the ingredients were fresh, all of the dishes were expertly prepared. The service was equally wonderful. Definitely a meal to remember. Be sure to make reservations - we called on the same day and were lucky enough to get a table in this cozy spot, but it was also for 6:30pm on a Wednesday in October. Don't expect to be so lucky during the holidays or on weekends. This is a great place to host a family party of 6 to 10 and equally fantastic for a table for two - like us.

I was staying in the magnificent mile area for business and was looking for a delicious place for dinner. Since I love Italian, Volare fit the bill, given its rave reviews and proximity to my hotel. I was dining alone, so was seated at the high tops in the front, but the place was packed. Volare is not much in terms of décor, but the food more than makes up for it. I am a sucker for gnocchi, and based on suggestions from other Yelpers, I gave it a shot. It was absolutely delicious. Each bit was like a fluffy pillow of goodness. And I've never had gnocchi in vodka sauce, but it was a great combination. The breadbasket included delicious, fresh focaccia that they bring with an olive oil and Parmesan cheese blend. I also tried the soup of the day, which was Puree of Asparagus. It was good. I don't think I'd get it again--it was a little bland, but it warmed me up on a cold night. The service was also outstanding. Next time I'm in Chicago, they'll probably see me again.

We made reservations here ahead of time when we decided to stay in the city.  My boyfriend raved of this place many times and he wanted me to try it badly... Him being 100% Italian, this was a place we had to visit!   It was a very cold Fall day and we were looking forward to popping a bottle of wine and having a romantic dinning experience.  As soon as we get there, they seat us smack dab at a tiny high-top table in the middle of the bar where people are standing around holding drinks and waiting to be seated.  There was a breeze from the entry way and nowhere to put my purse on this  little table.  We looked at each other and knew we had to speak up.  The manager walked by and my boyfriend asked if we could be moved to the dinning room.  Our request was granted instantly and no scene was made.  He walked right over to the host and let them know and she brought us straight back to a much more comfortable table without making it feel awkward. We started off by ordering an appetizer, followed by that we each had a Cesar salad.  As my main meal, I ordered the Spaghetti caprese which was delicious and cooked perfectly.  While my boyfriend ordered the Risotti Fattoria which was basically chicken and well cooked creamy rice.  It was his favorite from long ago, and he said it still taste the same as he had remembered it!  We also ordered a bottle of wine to top it off.  Food was great, our service was great, everything came out in a timely manner.  I would definitely go back again if he suggested it!

I must have walked/driven past this place a hundred times and had never tried it until now. From he service to the dessert I have nothing but praise. Upon seating we received fresh Italian bread served with olive oil and also slices of focaccia. Outstanding. Husband had squid ink pasta with a creamy tomato sauce and shellfish. He said it was wonderful. I can not get my head around black pasta so I did not sample. I will take his word for it! Daughter had gnocchi with tomato sauce with crumbled sausage. That was delicious. I ordered the fresh fish which was Sea Bass, cooked to perfection with a lemon butter caper sauce that was out of this  world.it  came with real garlic mashed potatoes, very good. Their desserts are unique. They offer small jars of different soft offerings. Husband got the chocolate mousse, good. Daughter, creme brûlée, also terrific. I had a lemon cheesecake with a pistachio crust that was memorable. Service was perfect with everything explained perfectly. Friendly, down to earth.two different mangers came by to make sure we were well taken care of. I would recommend this restaurant to everyone. The menu could please anyone, and it is fabulous!! I will be making this one of my regular haunts!

Here on a business trip to Chicago and stayed in a hotel one block away.  The menu wasn't overwhelming, featuring a decent selection of pasta, meats, and seafood.  Not all the pasta was homemade.  I chose tomatoes & mozzarella (excellent) for an appetizer and short ribs (a little fatty) over risotto (also excellent) as a main course.  The atmosphere is nice, with indoor and sidewalk dining.  Inside is a bit loud, so conversations are limited to guests seated next to you rather than across the table. (We were a party of 6 and were seated at a round table.) The service was generally very good:  we were seated quickly; orders taken and served correctly; wine & water glasses refilled appropriately; wait staff was always courteous.  In our case, both the appetizer and main courses were partially delivered; half our group waited a few moments for the rest of the plates to arrive.  Volare has enough servers to do better in this one area.

I came here with friends and we shared an appetizer - grilled seafood. It was just average, something you could make at home. I ordered spaghetti for dinner because I'm a big fan of fresh mozzarella. I expected an Italian restaurant to have this basic dish down. It was just noodles, sauce, and cheese. I make better spaghetti at home for a fraction of the price. I was disappointed considering how high the reviews are. The single room bathrooms are wheelchair accessible, but you need to take the elevator to get to them.  Also, the restaurant had a funny smell.

Bellisima. Molto bene. Delizioso. And I wish I could speak more Italian because Volare is legit. Super fantastic classic Italian with impeccable service. Modern but rustic. Homey but spacious. Delicious but...no buts. Just delicious.  A group of 10 of us dined here with a cocktail of difficulty: large party + expedited time line + love of all things food and drink. And I gotta hand it to Volare, they treated us like family. Well, maybe nice in laws, as in my Italian family we get a little obnoxious to each other. Blanche, in particular, was one of the best servers I've had in a long time. She was quick, gregarious, and completely educated in all things served at Volare. Whether she was suggesting a glass of pinot to accompany one of my dining partner's pasta dish or describing the daily specials with the greatest of adjectievs, she was a gem. Standouts included: pizza (perfect sauce), grilled calamari (perfection), eggplant rolls (I WANT THESE EVERY DAY), gnocchi (wow. just wow).  If I haven't convinced you to drop by Volare, you should go back and re-read. Mangia!

i came to this place with my wife on a saturday night, i tried to make a reservation at 9:30 but 10 was the only available. even though i made it to the restaurant before 9:30 and we waited for a couple of mins then they seated us in a nice outdoor table. we ordered the grilled calamary and octupus and scallop which was really good. and for main course i ordered the shrimp and scallop spaghetti which was very good at the beginning then i started to get bored of the taste lol, which was kinda weird, my wife ordered the veal fussiloni which was not that great, it tasted just fine, we did not enjoy eating it actually. i came here over my friends recommendation. i would consider coming to this place again as it has a nice ambiance and its food is considerably good

I came here with a group of coworkers in a bit of a rush prior to a Wendella Boat Cruise. Let's just say dining here was a magical beginning to an unforgettable evening. Coming here was probably the most authentic Italian dining experience since my actual days vacationing in Italy.  The minute I walked through the doors, I felt like I stepped right into someone's home. Greeted with kindness, I made my way to the bar while our table was getting set up. Once seated we notified the restaurant that we were in a bit of a time crunch, and they hustled us in and out in no time at all. Blanche (sp?) our server was amazing and the owner (or manager...I'm not sure) came by to thank us for choosing his restaurant to dine at. The appetizers and wine began to flow. I tried the thin crust pizza, calamari, and the beyond amazing spread of cheese and salami. I'm a cheese freak, so I couldn't have been happier that they placed that platter right in front of me. Oh yeah!! Super stuffed from all the appetizer options, I made room for the Gnocchi Alla Vodka dish. The noodles were soft, plump and a delight to pop into my mouth. The sauce was exactly what I expected, a bit sweet and tangy creamy mix. Delicious wine combined with a traditional and authentic atmosphere and food selection. I can't wait to come back. And, I'd probably order the exact same dish, because it was extremely memorable and I'm getting hungry thinking about it right now. Ciao Bella!

Wow, if you love Italian food this is the place to go. They make the best sauces and have a big menu to choose from. I had the lasagna, it was delicious.  This restaurant is great for a casual dinner.

Old school Italian, but popular place! There's a nice outdoor seating area as well which is on the St Clair street side of the restaurant, pretty quiet for those looking to sit outdoors in river north. There was a wait for 2 on a Tuesday night which was fine bc we could sit at the bar and have a glass of wine. The very attentive hostess carried my wine to the table.  Waitress was also attentive and we were never waiting on her to order or receive our next glass of wine. They serve parmesan/olive oil with warm bread to start. Food was classic and Italian, delicious! Bonus: I couldn't decide on what to have between the gnocchi alla vodka and the fattoria risotti and she let me order a half order of each which was not only incredibly delicious and convenient, but I have more than enough leftovers for lunch today!

Simply terrific & wonderful Italian food. The real deal. Great staff. One warning, order the half portions. Rarely does great food come in large portions- but this place is the exception. A lot of Italian speaking customers is more evidence of the quality of the food. The insalate de Mediterranean - grilled seafood- is ridiculously awesome.

Sickness swept through the family on our most recent trip and we needed something local for takeout.  Found Volare and it did not disappoint.  Had the order ready in about 20 minutes (and the restaurant was packed when I got there)!   Solid italian fare based on our dishes and they even packed some warm bread to boot!

Order take out here often! Huge portions and is ready between 15-20 minutes! When you open it at home, pasta is still piping hot and smells delicious! Definitely love the black spaghetti with scallops and shrimp! Flavor is fantastic and it's never too salty. Their pizza isn't anything to rave about though. The house salad is huge! And satisfying for only $4! Not too sure about the restaurant ambiance.. But every time I've gone to pick up food, the place has been full!

(4.5 Stars) This is an old school Italian restaurant that just knows how to serve up delicious food. It's as simple as that. We ordered the Gnocchi alla Vodka and the Pizza Volare. The gnocchi was perfectly cooked, and that vodka sauce is renowned on Yelp for a reason. The sauce had the perfect consistency and made for a well-balanced dish. The gnocchi is heavy so I don't think there's any need to add a meat to it (you have that option). It's already good on its own so there's no need to mess with it! The Pizza Volare (insert Homer Simpson drool here) was delicious! This pizza comes with prosciutto, ricotta, artichokes, and tomatoes. It was crispy yet had enough body to hold up all the delicious toppings. Man, I wish I had one right now.  If you can, try to come in for the lunch specials. We just missed lunch a few minutes before 3 PM so it looks like they switch over to dinner before the advertised time. It doesn't matter though - lunch, dinner, breakfast, brunch, late night meal, pre-game snack, after-workout meal - Volare is good for all! (But seriously though, Volare only serves lunch and dinner.)
excellent attention, reasonable prices, tasty food  i prefered to sit outside because inside was very noisy guillermo

one of my favorite places for past in the WORLD. yea. i said it. world. vodka sauce or bolognese are sure bets. seafood is fresh so i would recommend any of those as well. i come here every time i'm in chi-town... makes me wanna book a flight right now.

Just moved to the city, and we've decided that when we crave mouth-watering Italian food,  Volare is our spot!  My Mother was from Calabria and Italian food is something we know!  We're within walking distance of the restaurant, and we couldn't be happier. The staff is very friendly and helpful, the service moves quickly, but not so quick that you ever feel rushed.  We've taken our granddaughter her a few times, and it's always nice to have the waiters and other staff pay attention to her. There aren't too many things on the menu we haven't tried and loved. So glad we moved so close!!

Awesome Italian food. Many entrees available as half orders. Surprisingly good seafood too. One of the best wine lists. lots of Brunellos. The only problem with this joint is that the service is horrendously slow! So annoying.
Had the lasagna - nope. Had no taste or spices what so ever. Service was attentive, kind of loud but they were very busy. Waitress knew the menu; wine was expensive

Good italian food that you can find around. Dishs are a little too big. Never had a chance to finish all. Good pasta but sometimes there mightbe too much souce ( which some people might like). Overall it s a place that you should visit. - tourist

Stumbled in here Labor Day weekend for an 8pm dinner. Not surprising they were booked until 930 so we opted to dine in the bar. What a great choice. The bartender gave great recommendations, was polite, and we did not feel rushed. The fact that you can order pastas as half dishes was awesome!  Two of us shared: Grigliata Mista - grilled clamari, octopus, shrimp, and sea scallops ($15), Gnocchi alla Vodka ($17), Fettucinne Verdi alla Bolognese ($16), Tiramisu and Banana Panacotta. An appetizer, 2 half pastas, 2 desserts, and 1 glass of wine came out to $43 dollars.  The grilled seafood was light and refreshing for a warm summer day. The pastas we chose were simple but done so well - fresh pasta with a bite. The dishes were packed with flavor without being heavily salted. Dessert was perfectly petite in size and a great end to dinner. Both were fluffy, decadent, and not too sweet. 4 stars for the food and overall experience and the 5th star for Karl the bartender who was honest in telling us 3 half orders of pasta would be too much food and the overall pleasant company.

I went to Volare two nights ago ... my first time!  I was really excited, but unfortunately the experience was disappointing.   Our first impression was great.  The valet parking was $10 (not bad) and very well managed. We went to the bar to wait for the rest of our party and ordered two glasses of merlot, the HOUSE merlot.  Bill = $25!!!   What?  That is ridiculously expensive for a very average glass of wine. Then we notice the noise.  The restaurant must have terrible acoustics, the conversations seem to echo ... and echo ... and echo.  (Hint - If you want a moment of silence go down the stairs to the basement ... that's where the bathroom and ATM is.  You will need to visit the ATM, maybe twice if you are drinking house wine.) For dinner, we tried the calamari (good), the Insalate Volare (average maybe), the vodka gnocchi (good, but not as good as everyone here on yelp keeps claiming), and the lamb chops (average).    The group we were with ordered a few bottles of wine ... but nothing exceptional, just house white, house red, etc., and the alcohol bill alone was $415!  There was a huge argument about this ... one guy showed the waiter the bottle, a $9 bottle of wine that we were charged $80 for. I felt like this place is in the business of scamming tourists.  Unfortunately, with great reviews and a decent location, they are going to keep doing it. My advice ... if you must eat here, go for lunch, order half size pasta, and drink water.  (But first ask to see how much the water costs ... )

We decided to try Volare's after looking it up on Yelp since the wait at The Purple Pig would be over an hour. We came in and were told to wait for about 10 minutes. Everything seemed to be going pretty well, the bread was good  and things seemed alright. The two of us ordered some grilled seafood and three half portions of pasta. When the grilled seafood came on it looked relatively normal and the shrimp tasted fine, the calamari was slightly overdone, but the scallops left a toxic bitter taste in your mouth so naturally I complained and said quite clearly that "I'd like to look at the menu for something else." The waiter started to protest with "but that's ju...." and simply took the dish away. After waiting with no attention whatsoever for 20 minutes, the SAME DISH was brought back to us, slightly less burnt and with the sauce on the side instead of poured over the dish. Not to mention that I wanted to change the appetizer, I had also told the waiter to simply serve whichever dish came up first since we had a movie to catch but it took a full 40 minutes to serve the pasta. To make matters worse, the menu said that all pastas are available as a half order but didn't specify that the half order was at 70% of the price of a full order. After this appetite ruining experience we at a bit of the pasta, packed it up, and went on our way. Simply put, never, ever again. I don't think I've had such negligent service at a restaurant anywhere ever before.

I took a chance with the black spaghetti and seafood. It was delicious. Too much pasta though, and the pasta is not served with any sort of sauce. You just get the sauce on the seafood, which is great. The seafood isn't a huge amount, but hey, what do you expect? It's an italian place with a seafood dish. It was great.  My friend got the chicken parm and neither of us finished our dishes, the portions were a good size.  Service was fabulous, although everyone runs around scared to stand up for more than 5 seconds at a time and the hustle and bustle can get to you.  Decor was nice on the side, although the place looks a little "eh" on the outside.  It's in a good location, close to the Navy Pier so you can walk right over to walk off some of the food you just had.

I have loved Volare from day one.  Small and cozy but they just remodeled and it didn't lose any of it's ambiance.  I always say, if it's Italian and the red sauce isn't tops, "fo get a bout it!"  That is not a problem at Volare...their sauce is fabulous and I LOVE their Bolognese and go there just to get that!  I recently brought a friend there from NYC who works in the restaurant biz... he said this is the best hidden gem outside out Taylor street and I couldn't agree with him more.  Great food, great atmosphere and the service is top notch too.

After the remodel and menu change this place has sold out to be like every other Italian joint. This was a favorite of mine and now I won't even give them my business, should never forget what got you to the dance! Sell out

Amazing. Have been here at least 15 times in the last 5 years and have been very pleased every single time. Lunch specials come with a soup or salad and an ample portion of pasta. If dining for dinner make a reservation! Gnocchi alla vodka is delicious, but quite rich. Go half and half with someone so you try two entrees!  Decent wine and full bar for cocktail hour.

We had a great meal at Volare. The lasagna was excellent (and you can get a half order). Good wine, good salads, good service. Being Italian and from New Orleans, I can be picky about Italian food but this place was really good.

Stopped by for Friday lunch early on our way to Ohio St Beach.  The terrace was great if typically noisy with the city construction noise and we really enjoyed eating outside. Our service was absolutely excellent, couldn't have been more friendly or attentive. Caprese salad was routine not best not worst but refreshing.  Paparadelle was very good with outstanding sauce. Hubby had fusilli with meat/pea sauce that he very much enjoyed and scraped up. Tiramisu and creme brûlée were good not the absolute.  We came back here for quick lunch on way out of town. Everything seemed more generic somehow. Pasta was blah. Go to Quartino instead for great Italian.

We stopped in lunch and sat on the patio.  Service was a little slow but the food was delicious.  I had the Negri spaghetti and my husband had ravioli. They have lunch portions but our waitress failed to ask us what size we wanted and just assumed the larger portion.  I wasn't real happy about that because it was a ton of food and we had no way to keep our leftovers.  So make sure you specify!  We also had calamari that was excellent.  It was cooked perfectly.  The food made up for the less than stellar service but I would have been nice to have a more attentive waitress.

I had the gnocchi with the vodka sauce and it was amazing! The waitress suggested adding sausage which was a great suggestion. I ate about half of the half pasta so I would say half size is fine. I'd also suggest sharing Caesar salad as it was very large. Calamari was ok...but wouldn't order again.

With kids in tow, we needed kid-friendly meals and this place definitely delivered! The pastas were sooo good! The ambience is really loud though, perfect for us but maybe not for couples or elderly. We got a caprese salad, house salad, 2 spaghetti bolognese, a mushroom pasta dish (delish!), and a spicy rigatoni sausage dish (also delish).
Haven't had good pasta in awhile. Vodka sauce gnocci and clam fettucini are sooooo good. I think their fried calamari is the best I have ever had
