Food was excellent.   I got the ravioli which was good and my husband got the gnocchi which was amazing. Best we have ever had, so creamy, just melts in your mouth.  We are definitely coming back here next time we are in town.
Foods were a little salty but delicious! Service were worm and quick. I really recommend this restaurant.

Great Italian food.  I've been to Volare a few times now and always left very satisfied. This most recent time I started with the minestrone which was just ok, wouldn't avoid it, but probably wouldn't recommend it either. Other people at the table had some salads that looked decent but nothing special. The entrees were top notch. I had a salmon pasta in a tomato creme sauce which was superb. The salmon was fresh and the tomato sauce was not thick or overly tomatoey like a number of sauces can be. The sauce wasn't heavy either which made for some great pasta. Got the full order which was enough for two full meals so in that regard its good value - because I had two meals for the price of one. A number of the other dishes were rather overpriced. Multiple people at the table got the salmon filet which looked well done but was nothing unique and rather expensive in my opinion. Same for their chicken breast dish. Bottom line, I was very happy with my meal and will definitely return when in the area.

Volare's is not very accommodating for birthday parties that are booked way in advance.  I had a reservation for 14 people for my girlfriend's birthday party and we waited 45 minutes to sit.  And they had the nerve to say we were half an hour late for our reservation so they gave up our table.  We were right on time.   Then the hostess promises us complimentary appetizers only for it to be vetoed by the manager.  "Our hostesses do not have the power to promise free appetizers."   Take your big parties and special occasions elsewhere people.

Our party of 4 happened upon this old fashion Italian neigborhood restaurant a couple off  blocks Michigan avenue.  We ordered capresse salad( very fresh, homemade mozzarella) calamari (delicious) fettuccine and white clam sauce, very thin crust pizza. We were seated by a very elegant gentleman wearing coat and tie ( even though the place is very casual)  The only dish which we did not like was a risotto swimming in red sauce.  The staff was attentive and pleasant. My husband went back twice while we were in Chicago.
Old school Italian place.  Walking distance from W.  Friendly service.

This place was perfect. Great plates and great seafood. Lobster with Risotto, Crab Soup, grilled fish, mixed seafood appetizer was really great, grilled perfectly! Sat outside on the patio, nice and chill.

Volare is not afraid to link their site directly to Yelp, so bravo for that.  They don't need to be afraid though, because as you can see their Yelp Rep is pretty solid.  Very nice overall.  Just knocked off a star for a rather small portion of the spinach ravioli special and a pretty short pour of the wine.  Other than that, the waiter was lovely and the food was very good.  We can't recommend enough the appetizer "salmone afumicato" with burrata which was wonderful.  I got the spinach ravioli, hubby got salmon with farfalle in cream sauce and our son got some kind of steak (?)  Everyone was well pleased with their dinner.  Ambiance is romantic, although we only got a glance at the inside and chose to sit outside.  Prices are very reasonable for a location like this and the care that clearly goes into the dishes.  Recommended.

Had a reservation and still had to wait 15 minutes. In fact- the manager was walking by and noticed us and sat us while the hostesses sat behind the counter. The food was not good. I had to wait forever on refills. Saw the waitress like... never. Just a bad experience. It is a nice place with a nice ambiance but no thanks.

Been here several times and the food was always good. Stopped in late last night and ordered cork screw pasta w veal w a side of spinach. The spinach was full of grit. I spoke w the manger who told me everything is washed when it comes in the door. This was not and I am surprised at the mgrs attitude. I'm not looking for a free plate of pasta. I just don't want to eat dirt.

I felt compelled to write a review because the service and ambiance were just too memorable. The wait staff was so attentive, but in a very comfortable way, and not annoying. We felt like we were guests in someone's home, as they checked in on us and joked with each other as they served the patrons. More than anything, we felt that we had a true italian experience, that is so rare nowadays in the bigger cities.  Big smiles to the manager that was working that night, that could have passed for "Johnny Sack" from the Sopranos. The only reason I didn't give them 4 stars was because the food was good, but not necessarily out of this world.

Been here several times and the food was always good. Stopped in late last night and ordered cork screw pasta w veal and a side of spinach. The spinach was full of grit. I spoke w the manger who told me everything is washed when it comes in the door. End of story. This spinach was full of grit so it was not washed. I am surprised at the mgrs attitude. I'm not looking for a free plate of pasta. I just don't want to eat dirt.
Food was outstanding! Order half portions of pasta and share. It is plenty of food. Service was great! We sat outside and had a wonderful night.  Very reasonably priced.  We will definitely be back!!

Went for my 3 year wedding anniversary...all I can say is that I am blown away by the quality of food and by the staff...Authentic Italian server...Manager walked by a few times to see if we needed anything and just to chat, which is a big plus in my book...hostess (Linda) was so super kind on the phone and didn't make us wait even for a second...Our server was super awesome...and the food was superb...parking isn't that great around the area, but that's Chicago...Valet is only $10 I think, but I found that out after I already parked...the food was not expensive at all...even after 2 glasses of wine, appetizers, sodas, 2 special entrees and cannolis for desert, we only paid roughly $80...thats exceptional...5 stars for sure...

I always passed by this place whenever I go to work. It seemed so abandoned and quiet. I decided to try this place bc I looove Italian food. I came here for dinner and the ambiance was very nice.I went around 5pm and it was quiet but got packed quickly. They started us off with bread (of course, just like all other Italian restaurants). My sister and I ordered a half order of the calamari for appetizers which was absolutely perfect. I really liked it BC the breading was not too much , it came with two type of sauces (marinara and cocktail ) I ordered the half order of square noodles with tomato sauce , basil and ricotta. The noodles were perfect, not over or under done. My sister ordered the spaghetti neri all pesce which was the black noodle with shrimp and scallops -so good!perfectly cooked. We also got a dessert presentation from our awesome waiter, Manny. The service was great! One of the best service experience I've had from a restaurant. The dinner menu is pricier than the lunch menu , but I will be coming back during my lunch breaks for half dishes which is more than enough to fill me up !

I went there with a friend on Wednesday night.  Very busy, but despite that we didn't wait long to be seated.  Great seating outside, great service.   I ordered the lamb special.  It was lamb loin with a balsamic rosemary reduction and risotto. The risotto was really nicely done.  However, the lamb was so overcooked it was dry and difficult to eat. The waitress told me that lamb loin had to be cooked that way. ?? Um, no. A shame and disappointing to say the least.  She was happy to switch it out for something else, so I got the gnocchi with vodka sauce.  Yes, it was tasty, but I was so wanting the lamb, it just didn't do it for me.

Rewarded myself here after a productive week at a customer site with steak stuffed with italian sausage. It was one of their specials that evening. It looked so good I even took a picture of it. It was good, but a tad too salty for my tastes. I was far too stuffed to try the desserts which looked amazing. I don't think the hostess was too happy to seat a one-top on a busy Thursday night, but I ate quickly.

**MAMA MIA! STICK TO THE PASTAS!** Good place for an authentic Italiano lunch. AMBIANCE ========= Old school; just the way I like it. Not too many people during lunch, so ideal spot for conversations and mob hits. FOOD ===== FUSILLONI AL RAGU DI VITELLO - $8 (half serving) Fusilloni with ragu of veal, porcini peas, pecorino and cream was truly Italian. They ran out of the fusilloni pasta and replaced it with penne. It was fine. It was all about that awesome sauce! RATING: 5/5 I should have stuck to the pasta, but I HAD to order a panini. PROSCIUTTO E MOZZARELLA ($9) Parma ham, mozzarella, olive oil, and tomatoes sounded simple enough. But it was not my version of a panini. It came out like a regular sandwich with top grilled marks, but not FLAT. Too thick. Not memorable, bland flavors. Not impressed. RATING: 3/5 SERVICE ======== Good and efficient. OVERALL ========= It's all about the PASTAS. RECOMMEND for lunch.
Fantastic Italian place. Great for a classy dinner with some wine and a bunch of sauce soaked deliciousness.

As tourists on our first trip to Chicago, we tried Volare based on Yelp reviews. Wow! Did we make the right choice. My 16 year old said it was the best meal of her life, and she's been fortunate enough to have tried meals at some amazing restaurants all over the world. My 11 year old, wife, and I also loved our dishes. It seems you can't wrong, the food is delicious, the service outstanding, and the location is a walking distance from anywhere on Chicago's Lake Shore Drive. Based on another Yelp! review, we ended the meal with the double dark chocolate sorbet and highly recommend you do the same. If you live in or are visiting Chicago, be sure to indulge yourself with a meal at Volare. This informal corner Italian restaurant will not disappoint.

Was visiting on July 4th and happened upon this place as we were walking around. We were sure happy once our food arrived. We had a nice spot outside to sit and we had some sopressa and roasted peppers and also caprese di bufalo. Delicious!! We each had a pasta dish and the pasta was cooked al dente and full of flavor. We saved room for desert which was also delicious!! Will definitely return whenever in the area. Great Italian espresso too.

great restaurant! the service and staff were friendly and efficient. we got our food very quickly and it was great. i got the spaghetti caprese and my girlfriend got the mezzi rigatoni alle and we both loved it. the only thing was that the attire says casual on the yelp information but it was definitely a semi-formal atmosphere.

Visited Volare for a surprise birthday celebration on a week night. We made reservations for our larger party of 8 but definitely recommend making one... since they were pretty busy for a week night - can't imagine what it's like during the weekend. LOCATION Very convenient and quiet location tucked a block away from the bustle of Michigan Ave.  AMBIENCE Borders family-oriented and upscale. Two full bars and very spacious interior seating area. The wait staff and servers were very helpful and professional. They went out of their way to entertain and service our group... even the manager stopped by to make sure we're having an enjoyable experience.  FOOD Bruschetta: 4 fresh slices of bread with tomato and basil. Nothing special. ** fun fact... it's pronounced broo-sket-tah... not broo-shed-ah. Calamari: THIS IS A MUST ORDER! Unlike some of the standard, heavy breaded, rubbery calamari we've had at other places, this giant portion of glorious seafood is prepared to perfection - extremely moist, just enough breading, and helpful serving of marinara sauce. Gnocchi alla Vodka: wow... gnocchi at its best. extremely fluffy, light and creamy. We ordered the full size portion... but noticed that there was barely any difference in portion size with the half order... other than the price. I recommend adding a protein - sausage, chicken, etc. - to this dish to add another dimension. Fusilloni al Ragu di Vitello: I still dream about this. The dish was HUGE! It was so creamy... but not so heavy that you want to stop eating. The ragu with veal was just delicious... peas served as little bursts of freshness throughout the dish... and a little bit of parmesan on top.  Our other guests enjoyed their meals as well. A friend ordered lasagna... he quickly fell into food coma and died from cheese overdose. Some of the ladies tried the Risotta di Mare... they said it was good but couldn't really get a good read from their facial expressions.  If you're going there tomorrow, or this week... take me with you... please.

Love this place! Been here numerous times and have never been disappointed.  If you are new to the area and would like to venture off Michigan Ave this is the place to go. If not, enjoy the chain places like the Cheesecake Factory that do not represent Chicago in the slightest.

Nothing exceptional , very average food and a bad location . I wonder why would anyone go there for Italian food ???? very average pasta with veal ragu and mushroom sauce, very average pizza and TERRIBLE and ANNOYING waitress who tried so hard  to make us believe she is Italian (and then we found out she is from Romania) as if we care !!!!! i will never come back again.

Used the mobile app on my droid to find this place... In town for the blues festival and in the mood for italian. It was less than 2 blocks from where I stood- so I thought I would walk over and give it a try- Very crowded but somehow there was one table available in the back corner! Went in and sat down...  Based on the YELP Reviews- I had to try the Calamari (largest half order I have ever seen) it was very good. Shared the special salad for the night- it was average. Dinner was the

Great service. Great staff. Great food.  I had two kids and an elderly Grandma exhausted from a day of traveling.  We arrived, they squeezed us in, and we had a delicious brick oven pizza and ravioli. I'm sure it wasn't their biggest check of the night, but we loved it! I walked out, ran into a friend, and recommended the place!

What a great place! Volare's was recommended by my hotel as a less pricy, slightly casual place to find a good meal and they were right!  I was able to walk in and be seated immediately on a weekday night which was really nice. The clientele I saw ranged from businesspeople to families with their toddlers in shorts & flip-flops and even better, no one looked out of place.  I'll admit, I saw 'salmon' on the menu and that was the end of my decision making process. The farfalle salmone was amazing! Salmon with a red sauce is not something I've tried before but this was easily some of the best salmon I've had. Melt-in-your mouth tender and not at all overpowered by the sauce.  The wait staff was wonderful and my food was on the table in about half the time I expected it to take.
Great service and atmosphere Try the Caprese con Bufala and Gnocchi alla Vodka.
delicious - we had the lasagna and gnocchi. must try. Half orders are just that. I would order 2 half orders if you want to mix and try.

This place is exceptional. I ate here on my second trip to Chicago and felt like Volare made a great showing for the city.  I took the advice of many of the yelp tips that I had read and ordered the gnocchi with vodka sauce and also took our server's recommendation to add sausage to the dish. The gnocchi are made with ___ cheese so they come out very light and fluffy and really are the best gnocchi I've ever eaten. The sauce was also very good - a perfect balance of tomatoes and cream and had a great taste. The service was also very very good. I tend to have strong misgivings about servers who can't, or won't, provide recommendations on dishes and our server said that he was new at the restaurant and hadn't tried many of the dishes. Despite this initial disappointment, he made up for this during the rest of the meal - he was appropriately attentive, very polite, and always around when we needed him. Altogether, a great dining experience and I would recommend Volare to anyone visiting or living in Chicago.
Good food, but the server kind of push us to get out of door soon (dish serves so fast, clean table right away, keep asking if check is signed etc.). so crowd...

This is a great place for a night out as a couple and for families.  We were here for a family trip and noticed we were slightly underdressed in jeans and t shirts, but we were served very graciously.  Half orders of pasta are available, and servers will split orders without complaint as well.  The server also refilled my daughter's cranberry juice without charging, which is unusual.  Great food, great atmosphere for a reasonable price - what more can you ask for!

Amazingly Great Food, Service and Value! My wife and I enjoy our trips to Italy... eating at Volare transports us back there in just a few bites.  Don't worry about them rushing you to turn the table. Take your time with your wine and a broad selection of antipasti  Pizza - thin crusts made with fresh dough and authentic options like, prosciutto and artichokes; the way you'll find them in restaurants in Italy... not heavy, overloaded with cheese. Want  some hearty, comfort food? There is a rich, meaty lasagna that is by far the best I've had. Or, try the Ragu di Vitello... ground veal, pea and pecorino with a bit of cream served over fusilloni; our favorite. Keep it simple with clams in white wine and garlic over a bed of homemade linguini.  If seafood is your preference; don't miss the risotto with scallops, clams, mussels, shrimp and calamari. The flavor of each is retained giving every bite the individual character you'd hope for. We enjoy the food so much that we have it delivered when we don't have time to stop in... AND, it is just as good as if served table side! They always offer seasonal and daily specials, so you'll never tire of your options. One day I was hungry for something not on the menu... I was told, "no problem, our kitchen will be happy to prepare that for you."  OK, I'm more then a fan, I'm officially prejudiced... but, Volare earned it with every bite they've served me. Give them a try... you'll understand and make Volare your "go to" for Italian. Salute!

This is the standard that the other Italian restaurants in the city need to be held to. Shocking considering its uber touristy location. But, I have been here time and time again and the food and service are always 10/10. The only food that is comparable to this is that of of my Italian family.  For some reason, I still continue to try other Italian restaurants in the city in search of the next best thing, a one up if you will. I always come up empty.  I will never cheat on you again Volare.
Holy cow this place was good and surprisingly affordable! Incredibly hospitable even when they were slam packed. Beyond impressed!!

What can i say about this place. Well let us start by saying that i absolutely love this place, that atmosphere, the service, and most importantly the food. My wife and I stay at the Ronald McDonald House, which is more or less connected to the building that Volare is held. this prompted us to try it out and we were more than pleasantly surprised. just outstanding and i am sort of disappointed in myself for only finding this place out not after living in Chicago for the last 5 years. I am however giving this place four stars simply because wine selection is a tad limited and you have a choice of stupendous wines or the cheap stuff and prices are a bit high for a glass of the Freemark Abbey. $24 for a "large" pour, i am a little meh about that.

Los Angeles, why don't you have as many Italian restaurants as Chicago? Went to Volare on a suggestion by coworkers, and they weren't wrong.   On a Friday night it was packed, so we grabbed wine at the bar.  Had a glass, and then we were promptly seated.   The complimentary focaccia bread with the dipping sauce (seemed to be olive oil and Parmesan cheese) was pretty tasty.  A few people at the table ordered ravioli, gnocchi, and salads.  They raved about their dishes, and licked the plate. I may be biased, but I think my entree was the star.  I ordered the black spaghetti with scallops, shrimp, and some other seafood (i think).  It was SO GOOD.  I usually can't eat that much pasta in one sitting, but I cleared my plate.  The pasta was perfectly al dente. Nice outdoor seating to people watch.

Came here for dinner tonight for the first time with my family. I thought the food was overall excellent - starting with the warm crusty bread and some type of foccacia they served along with it...YUM!  I ordered a half order of the spaghetti caprese and thought that the sauce was outstanding. I also tried a bit of the gnocchi that my mom and aunt ordered. The sauce was very rich but I found that to be good as well (I think it may have been a bit on the rich side for them). I tried both the margherita and five cheese pizzas that my cousins ordered and thought that they had a good crust and very fresh tasting cheese. They were both a bit turned off by the strong smell of one of the cheeses that they used. It does have a bit of a strong smell, but it is delicious! We ordered dessert as well - I thought it was interesting that they only served "mini" sized desserts (almost, quick frankly, too mini - maybe you get four bites from each). I personally prefer sharing larger desserts among the table instead of the mini dessert concept, but I think it is a good idea if everyone wants something different. They were tasty as well. For three glasses of wine, one diet Coke, a house salad, a half order of the fried calamari, a five cheese pizza, a margherita pizza, a half order of the spaghetti caprese, two orders of gnocchi, an order of ravioli, and five mini desserts, the total came out to $177 - not cheap, but not unlike anything you would pay in the area.  The service wasn't anything to write home about which is why I subtracted one star - but I think I would come here again! The patio also looked great for a warmer evening.

Must have - the gnocchi al a vodka!  My friends and I had dinner here yesterday before the Glow in the Dark 5k.  We split the gnocchi, the volare salad, and the quattro formaggio.  It was a great meal though word to the wise, we were definitely underdressed since we had on our running gear, but thankfully we sat out on the patio so we were at least out of the way a bit. I'll have to come back when A) I'm dressed a little nicer :)  and B) Can really let loose and not have to run a 5K in the next few hours.  But I WILL be back!
Very affordable, food was delicious.  You can order half portions on pasta and appetizers which is plenty and leaves more room for dessert!  Great service and patio seating was so relaxing.

DIVERTIMENTO. This is a lively restaurant! Dinner hour was packed with customers and the servers match the noise level with their energetic service. Everything on the menu sounds delicious and the food I saw and ate was amazing. Can't wait to go back! Highlights: Spaghetti Neri al Pesce Insalata Volare Brussel Sprouts Volare = Indulge

Thank you Yelp for saving my Mother's Day Brunch. We ended up traveling on Mother's Day this year and after arriving at our hotel realized it was going to be a trick to find a place that wasn't charging an arm and a leg for a meal. We went to Volare based on the hotel's recommendation and fellow Yelpers comments. Volare is great. We had our two year old with us and the servers were kind and attentive (even on a VERY busy day). Our food came out quickly and it was delicious! They even made a pizza for our little one. For Mother's Day they did a pre-set menu, but it was not over priced and you got to select your entree.  After our Mother's Day experience we decided to head back for a lunch later in the week. Once again the food was awesome and the service kind and surprisingly kid friendly. The consistency was comforting and I would go back in heartbeat.

One of my favorite places in Chicago. After enjoying previous visits, the real test was when I took my boss there for dinner. He actually enjoyed and he told me "good choice". The food is great and the service is attentive however the interior is cramped, crowded and loud. Try to get a sidewalk table if you can.

We walked in without a reservation and were lucky enough to snag a table in the bar section. The seating was a little cramped (people kept bumping our table as they walked by), but I guess that's what we get for not having a reservation.  :)  The food was delicious. I had gnocchi with vodka sauce and would definitely recommend it.

Volare was recommended by the staff at the nearby Marriott. I wasn't sure what to expect. We walked in on a Thursday night without a reservation. The place was packed and I came to understand why. We did not wait long for our table of 4. We were seated right in the middle of the dinning room and it was loud and full of energy (like an Italian restaurant should be). We had 2 servers, Russ who was being trained by Joshua. As I was perusing the wine list Joshua approached. He was so knowledgeable I assumed he was the Sommelier. He knew the wine list and menu inside out (as it should be). He had some great suggestions. We finally decided on a nice 2009 Cab. Guess what-When the bottle was presented it was the 2010 version (not as good). This has happened to us over and over in many fine establishments (read my other reviews). Our server apologized and Immediately brought over the 2009. He said a new case came in and it is a 2010. Do yourself a favor and check the vintage every time you order a bottle (no matter where you are). Joshua's service was outstanding. It is all about the customer for Joshua. I couldn't decide between the risotto and the sea bass special. When Joshua heard this he said he would be able to give me the sea bass and risotto on the same plate as one main. Fantastic that he would do that and both were very good. My wife wanted the rigatoni Al Arrabiata but it had pancetta in it which she did not want. When Joshua heard this he told her he would have the chef make a similar sauce just for her without the pancetta. She loved it. Our 2 young boys just wanted plain buttered pasta and that was made to order for them as well. All of the dishes had extremely fresh ingredients. Side note-there is an "open kitchen" so when they were making our dishes I was able to bring my sons over to watch the chef's in action. There were several awesome choices for dessert and we asked which ones were nut free for one of our sons. We all chose the pot 'o creme. When it came out it was served by one of the assistant managers (our waiters were very busy with many tables). The manager said "enjoy the pot o' creme with Frangelico whipped cream." We stopped our son from taking it and asked him to clarify. He said the whipped cream on it was made from Frangelico (hazelnut liquer) but that the "nuts" are cooked out. We were confused and didn't want our son to partake. The manager apologized and brought one over without whipped cream. The wait staff also told us there was nothing to worry about and the Frangelico whipped cream no longer has nut residue. I'm still confused but they did mean well. By the way- the pot 'o creme was wonderful. Overall the food is a 4 but Joshua's service brought it up to a 5 star experience.

I would like to give this restaurant four stars based on the food alone, but unfortunately the service didn't stack up. I used to get food from here to go for late night working sessions and maybe that's where I should have left it. Went here on a Saturday night...made a 7:30 PM reservation. When we arrived, we didn't get seated for at least 20 minutes. Couples who were walking in without a reservation got seated at the same time as us...so whats the point of the reservation? We also noticed  people around us wondering the same thing. We then got sat and when we ordered drinks our waitress informed us that we looked to be 16, and being that we are both almost 30 it was more so an insult. Maybe I should have told her she looked to be about 50 and see what reply I got?? After our food came, we were pretty much disregarded. Sure, our water was filled umpteen times, and our plates were taken away but even with those clues, our waitress refused to see if we needed dessert or the check even after passing our table multiple times. We originally wanted dessert, but after she downright ignored us, we took our 'dessert business' to Baskin Robbins instead (where the woman who scooped was quite helpful and cheery might I add).  I would say this place is great if you are going at a down/early time where they can give you the deserved attention but this place clearly cannot handle busy nights. Even the managers looked to be a bit frazzled like they were new (they aren't, I saw them there 5 years ago). For the money there are places in Chicago that are equally as good, if not better, and can be much more accommodating.
OUTSTANDING! The braised short rib was magnificent, the Chilean sea bass was the best I've ever tasted. The service was impeccable. They definitely know what they're doing.
This place was so close to my best friend's apartment. We went for a lunch. And I still remember their risotto, it was really nice.
I really wanted to like this place since it was close to my apartment, but couldn't bring myself to.  The food was good I guess, but overpriced.  Better off going to Taylor Street or Halsted.
Great food, service and prices. I will go back again when I'm in the mood for Italian food.

I Yelped the reviews and could not resist eating here ... So as my other Yelp reviewer buddies have stated...make a reservation if you are attempting dinner or be prepared to wait a while. I, on the other hand...came for lunch...yes I read and I acted on the tips - how about that! So, service was awesome right from the start - greeted warmly and treated very kindly. The restaurant itself is warm and inviting, easy on the eyes décor - I did feel like I was doing the twist as I was navigating through the tables to get to my table though. Although it was lunch, they were busy and most tables were being used. The food was excellent - salad, appetizer, and main dish - all great and main dish was more then I can eat. I had the "pollo something pasta" ... it was good. The pricing was very fair and again, they are more then generous with portion size. Good wine and beer selections... Listen, if you are in Chicago and you have an opportunity to eat here, you will not be disappointed. I will be back to try the other very tasty looking menu items soon.

Killed the Italian dinner experience for the date. It was like being at a pizza joint in Manhattan. Tables were right next to each other, and place was so loud I was screaming across the 1 foot table just to be heard.  Food is not great, service is okay to bad, and you literally need to turned sideways tfor someone to pass you.  Not impressed. Won't be back. Don't bring a date here- too loud, verrrry crowded.

It's more like 4.5 stars, but not quite '5' star material. I had 2 half dishes of pasta - a linguine vongole in wine/garlic sauce. the clams were fresh, but the pasta was a bit over cooked and soft.. the sauce was very well seasoned. The other was a amatriciana with rigatoni. one of my favorite italian dishes from Rome (ate it just about every day when i'm there).  delicious.. wonderful flavor, perfectly cooked. Sat at the bar, and the bar tender was very nice. got a glass of tasty wine. Good service, tasty food, nothing to complain about except for the pasta being a bit over cooked, so really 4.5 stars, but for an italian place to overcook pasta, i would say round down instead of up.  nonetheless, go try the place it's well worth it.

This place was awesome. The bartender was attentive and was giving us samples of different wines to try. Our waitress Elena was amazing. She kept checking on us and made sure we were taken care of.  We had the meatball appetizer special and it was pretty good. On had 3 small meat balls and some mushrooms. I didn't eat them but my partner did not like them. Said they tastes like they were pickled. We both had the Gnocchi with the vodka sauce and it was really good. Had it based on the reviews on here and they were not wrong. Recommend it along with Elena as your waitress.

Can I start by saying I LOVE Volare??? It's one of my favorite Italian restaurants in Chicago. It's different from the Davanti, which is more modern style with more interesting ingredients such as sea urchin. Volare, on the other hand, is old school Italian--traditional style, big portions, traditional flavors/ingredients. We had the calamari, linguini with clams, and seafood spaghetti. Calamari is very fresh, and unlike a lot of other places, this one is not doughy at all. I love how lightly calamari is coated.  My seafood spaghetti is unbelievable--very flavorful, with a lot of crab meat, perfectly cooked scallops, and shrimps. My husband's  linguini has A LOT of clams. They definitely aren't shy on the seafood OR the portion. We both had a lot to take home and it's the perfect dinner! One note though, Volare is ot busy at all for lunch. BUT at least twice we attempted to eat dinner here without a reservation and it was too busy. So if you want to have dinner here, better call ahead and reserve your spot.

Terrific food and April at the bar offered amazing service as she was very knowledgeable about the various dishes and all of wines and offered solid recommendations on which pair together the best.  I ordered the following 1/2 dishes: Insalata Volare - nice presentation this salad has plenty of small cubed pieces of provolone within it Grigliata Mista - my favorite dish of the night.  The slightly charred seafood coated with the balsamic and olive oil is a perfect combination Fettuccine Verdi Alla Bolognese - a 1/2 order was plenty.   Very good flavor and plenty of sauce

GREAT Italian in Chi Town!  Blanch our waitress was wonderful.  She led us down the perfect path for what we were craving.  Wine was fantastic.  Definitely would recommend a visit if you are in the area!

The service was good. Very dark lighting, making it hard to read the menu even at 2 in the afternoon. It is walking distance from Navy Pier. The Spaghetti Neri al Pesce was magnificent. Both my boyfriend and I got a half a serving each which was the perfect amount with the bread they bring you but trust me...you may crave more. It was my favorite meal I had while in Chicago and the best pasta I have had in the United States.   If you need to go to the bathroom ask because you will get lost...it is up the stairs through an area then down the stairs.

I love Volare. I've gone here for romantic dinners or with out-of-town family and it's always a great experience. The gnocchi in vodka sauce is so delicious, I crave it regularly. The service is also very friendly, although sometimes the reservation system doesn't work well. The last time my fiance and I went for our anniversary and we had to wait for 15 minutes past our reservation time. We decided to sit at the bar because we had a show to go to, and it actually worked out well. The bartender suggested a wine that was exactly what I wanted and she was just the right amount of friendly (always there when we wanted her but otherwise not noticeable). The price is commensurate with the quality of food and the atmosphere is exactly what you'd want from a nice Italian restaurant.

An awesome, authentic Italian restaurant in downtown Chicago! Got there around 8:15pm on a Friday evening and waited 45 minutes - it was definitely worth the time! Gnocchi in vodka cream sauce was the best I've had, and my date had squid-ink-infused pasta with shrimp.  The shrimp was grilled perfectly and the pasta had a unique smoky flavor ... we would order it again in a heartbeat. So many desserts to choose from ... selected the tiramisu (heavenly!) Attentive, friendly, and personal service. Incredibly reasonable prices, too. Can't wait to go back to sample the rest of the menu

Wow! What a wonderful restaurant. From the atmosphere to the food, I was very pleased. I am normally not a big fan of Italian, but they really mastered it here. Even the bread was good. Served warm with olive oil and parmesan, and they refresh the basket. I ordered the Volare salad in a half portion to start and was very pleased. The dressing and combination of toppings was wonderful and flavorful. I had the pasta with clams and selected the red sauce option and was very, very pleased. The spices used to flavor the dish were excellent. I am also glad they offer half portions of all pastas. Even as a half, I still had more than enough food! I had two friends order the black spaghetti seafood pasta which was so unique and delicious! I don't think you could go wrong with this menu. The service was also good, attentive but not overbearing. The atmosphere was very nice. It was an excellent location to catch up with friends and enjoy a good meal. They have round tables for larger groups which is always nice. The wine selecion was also excellent.

Meh. The food was your average Italian food. There wasn't anything unique about it. It tasted fine, like most other Italian restaurants in the city. I would eat there again if I was in the neighborhood but it wouldn't be in my top choices for Italian in the city. The decor is also a bit outdated but otherwise the staff is friendly and service was only ok (they were fairly slow in refilling our water even though the place was almost empty at lunch time on a weekend). Pricing wasalso good for downtown.
Very nice. Warm and inviting staff. Lots of staff running around. Felt very authentic. Got there at 530 at got seated immediately, left at 7 and people coming in at that time had 45-60 minute wait!

No thanks! I don't know how this place gets such great reviews. I had the worst lasagna of my life at this place last week. The date ordered the chicken parmesan and it was just OK, definitely not good. I've had better Italian food at chain restaurants. This place was a major disappointment.

Went to Volare for the first time with the family. The place is great! Food, ambience and service were all top notch! Will definitely go again. Only reason why it did not get 5 stars is I have two great experiences and then will reward the 5 stars

Wow. My bf and I were in town visiting with a mean hankering for Italian. Not willing to rely on lackadaisical recommendations from the concierge we took matters into our own hands. After consulting with yelp we agreed to try Volare. Great decision: great food, attentive, friendly service and a cozy ambiance. We split the sausage pizza and one of the special pasta dishes of the evening featuring a unique square tube shaped pasta. Both were absolutely delicious and the portions were very generous so come with your appetite! If I lived in Chicago I would definitely throw this gem into my rotation. Be forewarned, the wait is rumored to be pretty long without a reservation so plan ahead and enjoy a great Italian feast. :)

Food is 6 and service is 8.  I went back last night and again had a nice experience.  The bartender (I eat at the bar when I am on my own) was fantastic and I felt right at home there.  I shamelessly overtipped her.  What can I say?  I was a bartender once.  I ordered a seafood pasta since they would not let me order off menu for a vegan option.  It was pretty good.  The company at the bar was fun, as usual.
"Great food, atmosphere and service. Both the bartender and our server were very gracious. The owner, Benny, even bought us a round."
Best Italian in the city, the remodel only classed up the joint times 100!  Try the gnochi vodka!!!!
Pretty good if a little pricey Italian place.  Great roast chicken.  But, their sausage and peppers are very very good.  Been here more than once.

carbs carbs carbs and carbs. if you love carbs, then volare will become your belly's soft spot. all i have to say is i should of ordered the full size of the gnocci.  this place knows italian. will be back! :)
Disappointing.  The smell of the food and the line to get into the place had us hopeful.  It was average, at best.  Assorted meats and cheese appetizer was very good but the entrees were just ok.

Delicious Italian fare in a pleasant, if a little crowded, restaurant space. Excellent kitchen works in view as you enter, with a great textured wall and counter. Menu features a variety of appetizers and entrees for every taste: pizzas (gas oven), pastas, seafood, meats, etc. They have a great, mild iced tea that went along very well with an order of grilled seafood as our starter, and then my black ink pasta with seafood. Delicious. Finished off my meal with a dark chocolate pudding topped with real, homemade whipped cream. Exactly how a chocolate dessert should taste, delicious! I would definitely be back in a heartbeat. Our waitress was charming and very professional--as were everyone who came to refill or take things away for us. The staff really makes this restaurant. The front desk staff changes: during this visit they were charming, during our last visit they couldn't have cared less about us or finding us a seat. Lots of large groups enjoyed seating in one of the large, centrally located round tables. There's high tables near the bar. Beware, the restrooms are located one floor below the main dining room after taking a longish staircase down, take a left and then a right. During my visit to the ladies' room, two women who seemed to have enjoyed their vino a little too much decided to turn off the ladies' restroom lights while all the stalls were occupied. Then turned the lights back on several minutes later. Not sure what that was about. NOTE: if you are making reservations using OpenTable, they DO NOT have the Chicago location, only the Oak Brook location. Be warned. Call the Chicago location directly for all your reservation needs.

In town and decided to try it out and glad we did. We went Sunday night and it was quite busy. However we were able to get seats by the bar 5min after arriving. Service was great and not pushy or quick to try to get you out. The food was great! We ordered sausage appetizers, side of meatballs and 2 entrees: lasagna and breaded chicken. The waiter immediately told us that the sausage normally takes 25min but that night would take 30-35..and suggested we have the meatballs to start, which turned out to be a great idea. The sausages were great and plenty as an appetizer. The sauce was so great that we didn't let them take the plate away and had them give us more bread. The entrees were also very good and good portion for the size. Overall a great place to eat at your own pace and enjoy the food!

Was recommended by concierge that this restaurant is the best Italian in town.  Now being Italian myself, most restaurants I would hardly rate high .  This is the exception.  You can tell from the olive oil dip for bread this is going to be top notch.  The olive oil dip is high quality.  The pizzas (proscuitto and burrata cheese) and 4 cheese pizza are amazing.  THe arribata rigatoni is superb.  Went with group of 30, and most agreed this was the best Italian they ever had. Owner is constantly monitoring the floor, great service, great food.  A must go to restaurant in Chicago.  All of this is also at a great price as well.

Wow.  This place is everything people say it is and more.  Dont expect big portions, just normal size dinners of great ingreidients if you looking for bottomless bread sticks and salads try Taylor street.  Best Italian in Chicago.  I said it.

I never turn down an opportunitity to try a different Italian restaurant. I am oh so glad that I tried Volare. My boyfriend and I came here on the Saturday after Valentine's Day, so it was especially packed. We got seated about 20 minutes after our reservation time, but it was well worth the wait. I ordered an apple martini, but the bartender recommended a carmel apple martini. Thank you, bartender. It was amazing. From the bread to the gnocchi alla vodka, which I ordered, everything was phenomenal, and the prices were reasonable. It can get a little cozy with the people you're seated next to, and it can get a little loud, but that's pretty common at Italian places like this (i.e., La Scarola). We will definitely return.
Love Volare.  Food is reasonably priced and very good.  Service is great too.  Benny and Marco make you feel like you are at their homes....Highly recommend.

We truly enjoyed Volare. The food was very authentic and abundant. I had the Insalata Di Rape' and it was fantastic! My husband had the house salad and it was delicious as well. I ordered their rolled beef special and could only eat half of it. Would recommend this restaurant!

SERVICE: 5 FOOD: 3.5 ATMOSPHERE: 4.5 Friendly staff from the time we entered the restaurant through our exit. We were greeted and seated promptly at 5pm on a Sunday. Our waitress was great, explained the specials and flexibility in menu and quickly provided us with a bread and oil/cheese refill when we were out. She provided our check, collected payment within 2 min...that's why I rate service as a 5. We had a custom dish, rigatoni ala vodka with chicken. It came out hot, presentation was clean and portion was a pretty large size. The vodka sauce was a little creamier than what I'm used to but the pasta and grilled chicken was cooked to perfection! Ambiance was upscale and staff presented themselves in a professional manner. Dress of patrons was everywhere from business casual to tourist shiek to Adidas track suits.
Thanks god I'm only visiting Chicago because if I lived here I'd be eating here once a week. I had the gnocchi in vodka cream sauce and it was amazing. Next time I visit I'm coming for the ravioli.

One of the best Italian Restaurants in Chicago. It's not as well known as some of the other Italian places which is why I like it.  Great place to take a date.  I will definitely go back.  A lot of celebrities like to dine here if they want privacy.

Phenomenal food. We've had a few different things at this restaurant and it's always amazing. Great sauce, perfectly cooked meat and pasta. Our kid thought the pizza was perfect. Solid service and a great value for the money.  This place is well known and fills up fast... get there early and enjoy.

A group of 20 went there last night for a 6 course dinner and every dish was sublime. The risotto was creamy and literally melted in your mouth. The buffalo mozzarella caprese salad was fresh and pleasing to the palate. The gnocchi in vodka sauce was the best I have ever had. Most notably though was the service. We had three people with different allergies and they made special dishes for them. They were gracious, attentive, and some of the best servers anywhere. What a memorable night we had- can't say enough about this restaurant. I will definitely go back when I am in Chicago again.
nice place. definitely a good feel of Italian. had the special for the night. seafood with spicy marinara on linguine. service was great. ambience was great. would definitely go back again.

Solid Italian but I was not wowed!  I had gnocchi with Vodka sauce, and a side of sausage.   It was good, but even Maggiano's was better. My wife had a tasty lasagna, but again we have had better.   In fact, the lasagna was a tad bit dry.    The wine selection was solid.   They bring you bread and olive oil/parm cheese to dip.   Half the bread was warm, while the other half was so cold it came right out of their fridge.   Service wise, the wait staff, managers, and bussers were outstanding.

Note: This review is only based on 2 menu items. I was disappointed with [ lack of ] service as well as the food.  We came here for lunch on a Wednesday.  Not sure how busy it normally is, but I was here on business, and the conference I was attending was only a few blocks away.  So when the fiance and I were here... it was busy. Upon entering Volare, we weren't greeted by anyone, but had to approach the hostess who said we'd be seated shortly.  In a few minutes, we were seated at a table by, I believe, the restaurant manager or GM (maybe an owner, not quite sure).  We had to flag down a server a number of times before someone was finally able to take our order.  Grigliata Mista to start and the Pizza Special to share. The Grigliata Mista is described as: Sea scallops, calamari, octopus, and shrimp fire grilled, laced with aged balsamic and frantoio olive oil.  SOUNDS delicious, but most of it came completely charred.  We don't normally send back anything unless it's steak that's terribly under/overdone.  But this... we would have were we not scared it would take forever.  We were famished and just wanted to eat.  So, after eating what we could, about half of this appetizer was still left on the plate.  Such a shame this tasted awful, considering the portion was generous.  I made sure to flip all the seafood charred side up so that the server and/or a manager would notice, but it didn't happen.  And FYI the charred sides were pure black, no exaggeration (I will post photos soon).  The pizza (I forgot the description our server said) was topped with pepperoni & sausage and was actually quite delicious.  Definitely deserving of 4 stars, at least.  The crust was a little soggy, but this pizza was so tasty the crust didn't  even matter.  I know, what a waste! I am in Chicago often on business, but there are so many amazing places to eat that I'm not sure if I would choose to come back to Volare.

To be honest, I feel like the service and atmosphere were better than the actual food itself, which is the only reason why this might be 4 instead of 5 stars. First, the good stuff: the staff were pretty tolerant of us bunch of college kids bumbling around in the hallway and so on, having just come back from watching a film. Waitress was friendly, bread was refilled promptly [this is so important to me, you have no idea. BREADDDD. They didn't give another plate of the parmesan-olive oil though, now that I think about it.]  On the other hand, most of the food [with the exception of the vodka sauce gnocchi--quite good, as the reviews say] was relatively meh. The seafood risotto was actually disappointing, and not creamy at all; the whitefish was average. Spaghetti on the chicken parm was a little harder than I like. Tiramisu was okay, bread pudding was definitely not worth it.  Mwerhhhh. Now that I think about it more, service/atmosphere probably made it 4 stars instead of 3 from counting food alone. Isn't it odd, how analysis changes impressions?
Great food and  friendly, happy service. Also, watch the kitchen by the back bar.  They are a phenomenal show!  I had the Volare salad, eggplant mini dish, gnocchi and meatballs....all delicious.

Came here for lunch with a group of coworkers after a meeting. The place was just as described in some of the reviews. Pretty cozy and Italian-like. I was a bit surprised that the sitting area was smaller than expected while the open kitchen area looked huge. But it was fine for us since it was lunch and the place was not filled. We had reservations and was seated immediately. The waitress was nice and attentive...maybe almost too attentive as she interupted a number of conversations we were having which was a little annoying.  The food was very good. We each ordered a half salad and was expecting small sized portions. But let me tell you that the half order of the Mediterranean seafood salad was like a full entre size. I'd be worried about finishing a full size order even for dinner! The salad came with grilled calamari, shrimp, octopus, and scallops which were all tasty and cooked to perfection.  For the price, I was very impressed with how much seafood was in it. However, the chopped greens it was sitting on was drowned in too much dressing which made it salty and soggy. Ah well, that was ok though. Who would've had room for lettuce after all that calamari! The entre's came a little slower than we would have liked. I think we were starting to get a bit restless especially when we saw that only half the restaurant was full. How could food be served so slowly? But it was worth the wait. I ended up getting the half size lasagna and i am in heaven! The pasta was cooked to perfection. the meat mixture in between was smooth, light (if meat can be light!) and creamy and the sauce was not overwhelming or salty as many other places would have it.. I was full from the salad already, but managed to finish the entre too. Yum! Another person who also had the same dish was also delighted with the taste. My other coworkers had a risotto and a pannini. The risotto ended up to be a bit rich, but my boss exclaimed that the humungous panini was surprisingly good.  Overall recommend especially for lunch when there may be less of a wait!

Delicious! My sister made dinner reservations here for my bachelorette party. We were a large group of about 18, and they had a long table prepared for us and provided excellent service. We had several appetizers, bottles of wine, and individual entrees. Everything was wonderful. I had the Spaghetti Neri al Pesce, and it was really phenomenal. I will definitely return for more meals here. I was very impressed.

Love the environment, round table and its wine list. Entrée has fair portion and tastes exquisite. I had the clam linguine with garlic - juicy seafood and flavored just about right. Def recommended to family, friends, dates and party of 2-6.

Amazing service, phenomenal food. The atmosphere is definitely on the casual side for such a pricey place!  But a great Christmas Eve dinner. We ordered the grilled calamari appetizer and prosciutto, both of which were delicious.  My sisters are both prosciutto-crazy people and I barely had the chance to grab a piece when it reached the table because it was GOBBLED UP SO FAST!! Entrees: the lamb and filet mignon were both on the expensive side ($36 and $32 respectively) but were worth every penny!!  Everything was cooked to perfection, juicy, and packed with flavor.  EVERY BITE was a DELIGHT! Desserts: The chocolate cake and tiramisu were both delicious, but I do believe that this is the BEST tiramisu that I've ever had.  It's so creamy and light, you MUST leave room in your stomachs for these sweet treats! MAKE A RESERVATION at least 24 HOURS in advance and you'll be seated immediately!
Very very yummy spaghetti ; best in the city and theres tons of choice in walking distance but I choose Volare

My favorite Italian restaurant in the city.  Delizioso!!!  I have eaten here many times and never had a disappointing experience.  The ambiance / atmosphere is warm and cozy, the servers knowledgeable and attentive, wine list excellent, and most importantly ....the FOOD......absolute perfection.  Looking at these photos is making my mouth water just thinking about it.  Hope to get back soon.

Food: good. That's where the goodness stops. I will make this quick as possible: (1) Don't bother making reservations. Useless. Relatedly, snobby hostesses who waved me off when, 20 minutes later, when I asked what was going on.  (2) Our table wasn't wiped off. Disgusting. (3) All our water glasses were dirty and there were black flecks in the water. (4) We were brought the wrong order.  (5) One of the chefs wiped his nose with his fingers and continued cooking. I saw this as we were by the bar, having waited 45 minutes for our table. (6)  The server recommended a $100 bottle of wine which, maybe was our fault for not noticing, but still. Insult to injury at this point as we ordered it desperate to get our food and drinks. (7) The tables are so close together that our waiter (a big guy) was knocking into the other waiters and actually made another guy drop a tray full of water glasses.  (8) Douchebag city. I think we would have gotten better service had I been wearing a see through black dress with a Gucci purse. Overall, terrible. There are too many other good restaurants to drop $180 on abysmal service.

Thankfully we read the reviews to know that a reservation was merely a place holder.  Upon arrival, 10 min before our reservation, we were asked to sit in the bar and to wait for our table.  The reservation was for 7 and we were sat at 7:45 pm.   I had eaten take out before and loved my meal.  Perhaps this time, we ordered wrong.  We had a an escarole soup that had a ton of flavor but was very salty.  As an entree we had a whole wheat pasta with eggplant.  The pasta, like the soup was very salty and hard to eat.  The best part of the meal was the Volare pizza.  I believe we ordered wrong and will give Volare another try.

A friend and dined at Volare last night and it was outstanding.  It was our first time dinning at there and it will definitely not be our last.  I had the squid Ink spaghetti with seafood.  The seafood was cooked to perfection and the sauce was tasty and not too garlicky.  My friend ordered the gnocchi with vodka sauce, which was also amazing. I can't wait to return! The only issue was our reservation was for 8:30 and we were not seated till almost 10:00.
Simple, american version of an Italian restaurant. Too large portions, too many televisions...

YAY! Found an Italian place I really really like in Chicago!  Went here because my roommate recommended it as a good dinner place after going to see a movie at AMC River East.  It was about 9pm when my friend and I went.  It was still really crowded, but we lucked out with a high-top table at the bar.  The bread basket is tasty and the olive oil they provide is really flavorful.  The olive oil comes with Parmesan cheese already in it (which I can't eat), so I requested another dish of olive oil.  It took a long while for the waitress to get the new dish of olive oil and in general service was a little slow, hence 4 rather than 5 stars.   In terms of entree I got the Linguine Alle Vongole ($21).  This was really great, seriously.  It was linguine with a white wine sauce and clams which I requested nondairy.  It wasn't over salty like how I find a lot of these kinds of sauces to be.  The pasta was al dente and delicious.  The portion size was just perfect too such that I ate the whole thing but didn't feel overly stuffed or under fed.   Appetizers at other tables looked really good, so I look forward to returning and trying out some of those as well as eating more yummy pasta.

One of the best meals - of any cuisine - I can remember. Great service and a solid wine list are bonuses.  Volare is a must-stop for me on any Chicago visit.  The complaint I have is that Volare is a victim of its quality. Waits of over an hour are apparently not uncommon, even on Monday. I can attest that on my Monday visit, I'd waited for an hour for a table, and finally (just barely) nabbed a seat at the back bar.  On that, one more annoyance: the bars are a great place to eat, but for the fact that they can quickly get packed at least two people deep, and there is absolutely no system for prioritizing bar seating. I lost a back bar seat to a passer by simply because I chose to check for seating at the front bar at the wrong time.  In short, be prepared to wait and be prepared to be blown away by your meal. To the owners, please try and bring a little method to the madness of bar seating. Volare is a stone's throw from multiple hotels, so you'll have a lot of tired, solo biz travelers who could use a break finding a seat.

A solid addition to the many Italian restaurants in Chicago.  The wait can be long.  Do yourself a favor and make a reservation beforehand.  The food is very good.  As many others did, we ordered the fried calamari appetizer.  Nice flavor - not the best I've had but still quite good.  The portions are generous.  If there are two of you, you should probably go for the half-portion size. We had the day's specials which was a pork shank.  For those who might not know, this is the lower leg (i.e., the calf).  It was huge!  Very good.  We also had the seared sea bass, which was also cooked to perfection.  Awesome.  My compliments to the chef. Price was decent (at least by Chicago standards). The service is excellent.  Friendly and you will rarely go without a prompt drink refill.

Volare looks like a classic Italian restaurant mixed with a dark romantic date spot and open kitchen grill. There was a super long wait at 8 pm on a Wednesday night, so I'm assuming there is always a long wait. Make a reservation. Our "twenty minute wait" turned into a half an hour. Then fourth five minutes. Then a man in a suit, who I'm assuming was a manager or something, seized us from out of nowhere and took us to a magically empty table in the back of a very crowded room. It was amazing. The service was very quick and super attentive. Our water glasses were always filled. You really cannot complain about the service; it is everything you could expect in a restaurant and more. I ordered the lasagna and adored. It is possible for lasagna to be light? Because mine was. My parents weren't really feeling the squid ink pasta. But overall, we had a very pleasant experience!

I went there on a Sunday evening for a quick bite because the reviews were promising and it was close to my hotel. What a nice experience! The restaurant was packed but since I was all by myself I could find a seat at the bar where you can order from the full menu. The bartender, Diana, was awesome. Man, she knows her trade. She was super busy but still engaging but not in an intrusive way. I kept my self entertained watching her interact with the other patrons. I think she genuinely cares about good food and drinks and appeared to be very knowledgeable. And she succeeds into 'upping' your order... But I mean this in a good way. The guy next to me said he would hire her on the spot as a salesperson for his business.  The food was great, too. I had the insalata volare which was refreshing and really good. The ravioli di ricotta were delightful. The food arrived promptly despite the fact that the restaurant was buzzing. I will definitely go back.

A friend of mine and I decided to dine here before seeing a movie on a Friday night. I am very  happy that we made reservations though since the place was packed and seemed to  have an hour plus wait. No worries though because they have two bars and plenty of drinks to go around. I would try to get there a bit early for your reservation because even with ours, it took about 30 minutes to be seated. Thought they did say they had a couple large parties dining there that evening. I won't count it against them. We ordered the calamari appetizer. Nothing special here but definite tasty calamari. I had one of their daily specials. A three cheese and prosciutto ravioli which was simply delicious. Pasta and cream sauce always has my name on it! My friend had the Gniocchi. I won't lie, I took several bites because he was "full" and couldn't eat anymore. This place is a great Italian spot in the city and I would recommend it anytime.

I have eaten at this restaurant several times over the years - always a great experience.  Unfortunately, I've seen this restaurant decline and the service this past time warrants this review. Let me first say that generally speaking, the food here is good.  Its not a great as it used to be, but its ok. The wait staff is friendly enough, but they are always super busy. This may make you feel neglected or that they are rude.  Trust me, they are not.  Just nice people being forced to work under ridiculously busy conditions with very little support and help from the management. Granted, we showed up about 30 minutes early for our reservation.  YES, we had a reservation. Unfortunately, we still waited nearly 2 hours for our table. Ridiculous. There are much better places in the city with better food, better service, and better control of the wait times than this place.   I won't be back any time soon.

I love this place, especially the patio. The service is great, the patio is beautiful, and the portions are huge and hearty. I mean even the bread and olive oil with cheese is excellent! I love anything in vodka sauce, especially gnocchi. The calamari is excellent as an appetizer, you really can't go wrong. They also offer valet service that is on par with other places in the area. I do know that there can be long lines even with a reservation but I have never experienced that. I've never had any wine here but I did like what I saw on the list.

I was very pleasantly surprised with the food here! The atmosphere was great, and I'm glad we beat the crowd because even though we got a table right when we arrived, we had to fight the waiting crowds just to get out the door.   Our waiter was wonderful. He patiently explained the ingredients we werent' familiar with, was honest about a salad I asked about (told me that it was the only thing on the menu he wouldn't recommend) and had great timing. The tables are a bit close together; I could follow the conversation of the couple seated next to us, and I"m sure they could hear ours, too.  I started with the Insalata di Rape; I thought I'd pick out the beets but I loved them (and I've never, ever said that before). The combo of the cheese, the egg, the beets and the tiny slivers of apple were just wonderful. My boyfriend started with the Salumeria. I can't tell you exactly what he chose, but I can tell you that it was yummy. For entrees I ordered the Gnocchi alla Vodka and WOW. I've never had gnocchi like that before; it was light and billowy and rich all at the same time. Really amazing. And the sauce was spot-on. My boyfriend ordered the ravioli and said it was very good as well. I'll return again next time I'm in the city.

After my flight back to Orange County was cancelled, we had an extra night to spend.  We had already done Shaw's, Gino's Pizza and Smith & Wollensky.  We chose Italian and consulted yelp.  Volare had the bast ratings and was less than a block from the hotel.  We were shocked to find some of my workmates already at a table after getting sent here by the hotel concierge (I never trust the concierge....long story...) Anyway, the staff was able to fit us in to their table and we quickly got caught up on drinks.  We had the bread, a plate of shaved prosciutto, parmesan and warm olives.  Delicious.  The minestrone was fabulous as well.  The osso buco over risotto was an incredible hit.  One of the best meals....EVER.  Seriously, it was that good. Impeccable service, the manager kept floating around and grab handing the guests (suit and pinky ring, too...classic...) and we had an amazing time in a classic Chicago Italian joint.
Best Osso Buco over Risotto and Tiramisu I will return here when I come to Chi-town

The food was okay, but nothing to write home about. The prices were average compared to similar establishments in the area. What bothered me was how we were rushed through everything. Our food was made in less than 15 minutes, which is nice, but makes me worried that they may have taken some short cuts, also we had no time to eat our appetizers before the main course arrived.  Someone came by every few minutes asking if we were done and tried to take some dish or another away. Somehow, they got us in and out in less than 40 minutes, which really didn't make it a very meal-like experience.

bread basket was disappointing, below average quality. salads were just average. however, the margherita pizza was excellent, and the lasagna was the best my wife and i had ever had anywhere, we will be back for the lasagna and to try other entrees. desserts looked nice and homemade went on a mon night at 800 and it was jam packed
Had the soup of the day (cauliflower), and it was ok. The gnocchi was awesome, one of the best I have had. Very fluffy, and in a wonderful sauce. Wife ordered eggplant penne, which was just ok...

This is BY FAR the best italian food we have had anywhere except Italy!!!  AND it runs a very close 2nd to that.  We have been enjoying dinner at Volares for years and have NEVER been disappointed.  They recently redecorated and added on and it's more beautiful than ever and the food is better than ever.   Marco always makes my husband & I feel very special no matter how long it's been since we've been there.  My favorites are the Gnocchi and Vodka sauce and the Clams & Linguine in white sauce but every single bite of anything ordered there has been a joy!   Service, food, wine always outstanding!!! When we come to Chicago...Volares is a MUST EAT!!!

As a New Yorker I hold Italian food dear to my heart. Volare can rival any NY Italian restaurant. Great food, old school atmosphere and nice size portions. We visit Volare EVERY time we visit the city. Love this place!

Great homemade Italian food, especially the pasta!  A group of us came on a pouring Sunday evening and the place was packed and we were seated almost immediately.  We started w/ this amazing grilled seafood platter.  It was charred and it consisted of shrimp, scallops, octopus, and squid.  It was yummy!  The bruschetta was also good and garlicky.  We shared 2 amazing restaurant made pasta - Gnocchi in a vodka cream sauce and a Pappardelle pasta.  We also each ordered an entree, I had a bite of the veal and it was amazing.  I ordered the Fettuccine w/ Bolognese - WOW!  I had stuffed my face from all the other stuff I couldn't finish it.  So my friend decided to finish it off because it was that good!  Obvi huge fan of pasta so this non touristy restaurant was just up my alley.  Thanks for the recommendation Nick Ballard!

Service was miserable. The waiter started off promising but I think he had some friends visiting him at the bar that took precedence over our table, getting our food, and you know... Doing his job. The salads came out immediately which was fantastic because we were Starving!!! An hour later or so, we got our main dishes... By that point we'd made due with the bread basket and anything else not nailed down to the table. AND he got one of the orders wrong which was disappointing (honestly, there's a big difference between a caprese salad and spaghetti caprese.) I was very pleased with my Spaghetti Neri al Pesce with crab and all other manner of happiness. A few of the girls commented that the lasagna had a "strange spice" flavor in it that ruined it for them.  I would have truly loved to love this place... But the service was so slow and awkward that it ruined the night.

My husband and I are still talking about our experience at Volare weeks later. Everything was perfection. My husband had the vodka gnocci. I had the half portion of the spicy marinara pasta with a side of meatballs. Our entire table raved over the calamari and I loved my caprese salad. Delicious!
They have remodeled and improve their decor but they have also changed their menu and that is certainly a downgrade.  We went there only once after the change and decided not to go back.

Great decor and great Italian food.  I have been numerous times and never had a bad meal...or bad anything.  The appetizers, entrees, and desserts are all good.  I like their homemade pastas the best.  The recent expansion looks great (mirror of old space) and I look forward to trying the few menu changes.

fried calamari & gnocci w/ vodka sauce - Absolutly the best since I left NJ 30 years ago. will I come back - hell yea. for dinner tonight. that was just lunch. exactly what I was looking for on my birthday weekend (#55) in Chicago. Italian comfort food Mmm good

Fantastic food.  From the warm olives and grana pedano cheese  to the caesar salad oh yah and the pizza.....  Service was outstanding-Taryn took excellent care of us.  We look forward to coming back next time we are in Chicago.

Best Italian food in the city, hands down. The bread was baked with care, I couldn't get enough of the olive oil and cheese, the wine was crisp, the three very different dishes (a beef, a veal plus spinach fettucini and a shrimp plus pasta) my guests and I got were all flavorful in different ways. Eating dinner here was an exciting experience. But the atmosphere was a different experience. Overcrowded, cramped, noisy. Then they turned the music up to 11 at about 6:30pm. Our server, Luca, was sweet and patient and great, but the servers buzzing around the floor like drones are really inconsiderate! They squeezed past us, banged into us, sailed platters over our heads, kept speedily on their course whether you were walking there or not, etc., etc.  Just totally unpleasant. It's like the chefs consider you a special guest in their homes, yet the servers are programmed robots, efficient to the quick but completely lacking an empathetic bone in their bodies.

Volare holds special - romantic - meaning for two of my friends; hearing them rave about the food and service for years made it an obvious choice for a most unromantic celebration - tax dinner.* Volare recently remodeled, expanding to what I believe is almost double their original size. What's interesting about the remodel is that the new portion is virtually a mirror image of the old. A wall separates them, so each side remains lively, but cozy. In the warmer months, they also have a decent sized outdoor patio. When I arrived at 7:30 on a Wednesday evening, I was a little surprised to see the place packed. So packed, I didn't even notice my friends tucked in at the small bar; I highly recommend reservations. As soon as I arrived, we were ushered to our table; the tables are a bit close together, which makes for an intimate dinner, if not a loud one. To start, I had a solid greyhound - made with real grapefruit juice and not stingy with the vodka - and split a cheese plate, Grigliata Mista, and mussels in white wine sauce. The cheese plate options could use some tweaking. Maybe offer a variety plate or use some garnish to jazz up the plate; our peccorino was good, but the thin white cheese delivered on a white plate looked boring and sad. I didn't care for the Grigliata Mista, a favorite of my friends. Normally a big fan of seafood, something didn't jive for me. I'm not sure if it was the pairing of seafood and a balsamic glaze or if possibly the seafood was over-grilled, either way I wasn't loving it. The mussels were good; large and prepared traditionally, they were solid, but not what I'd consider a destination dish. The wine list is pretty lengthy; my one friend and I opted to split a bottle of pinot grigio with our dinner. For my main, I ordered the Spaghetti Neri Al Pesce**, or squid ink spaghetti with shrimp, scallops and lump crab in a pink sauce. My friends went with their favorites, the meat lasagna and rigatoni alfredo with prosciutto and peas. I see it stated on the menu, but our server gave us the option of a full or half order for our entrees. Personally, having a great meal twice is a treat, so I went with a full order. My meal was excellent; they did not skimp one bit on the seafood, the pasta tasted homemade, and the overall pairing of the ingredients was perfectly decadent.  Volare has earned itself another fan; I can't wait to eat up more of the menu! * I do tax returns for friends in exchange for dinner. I think more services should be available via barter; a good meal and great company is the perfect payment. ** The menu on their website differs from the one you'll see on site. Personally, I think the online one is harder to read and you're better served viewing the MenuPages one.

Great restaurant with excellent and friendly service. My husband and I went there for a nice dinner after being at Lollapolooza all day. We started with the Insalata de Rape, the grilled egg and mix was a great start. We then had the roasted chicken and the steak. Both were very good quality and full of flavor. The drawback was that neither had pasta as a side and I can only imagine that the pasta would have been a treat. We finished our meal with a pastry, creme and peaches concoction that was just right sweet and light to end a pleasant dinner outing on their open air patio.  I was pleased all around and if I lived in Chicago then I'd have to come back in the near future to try the gnocchi that others spoke highly about and sample the pastas so to know what I've missed this evening.

If you are craving Italian, this is the place to dine!!! Came here in a Monday night and walked into a robust dinner crowd. On a Monday. Make a reservation regardless of when you plan to eat.....just in case. Our waitress was fantastic, she recommended excellent wine for us to try and happily offered her suggestions for dinner. For an app you must try, under Frutta y Verdura, the grilled eggplant. It is sliced and grilled served with grilled tomatoes, pesto, and A MAZ ING has to be house-made ricotta cheese! There is nothing more I can say......just taste it and see for yourself I choose the sea bass special for my entree and was not disappointed. Cooked perfectly, seasoned delicately, and served with a small (YAY) twice baked potato and brusell sprouts. The boyfriend chose a pasta dish with cream sauce, prosciutto, and peas. He was impressed and had nothing but positive things to say...... Me not so much because I don't like the cream sauce ( she said with an Italian accent to be a dork). Affordable, delicious, excellent ambiance! My new official go to whenever I crave Italian.

Love this place. Went there this past weekend to carb load before the Soldier Field 10 Mile race and it did the job. Our waitress was awesome...wish I could remember her name...she really "sold" everything! Would definitely go back again if in the area. I recommend making reservations since the place was packed.

Went to Volare's on a Friday night after reading the reviews on Yelp.  We got there early (6:30 PM) and got seated right away and we were immediately greeted by our server.   Fresh bread and olive oil were brought right out to our table.  Bread was great and fresh. The menu had a wide variety of choices and the waiter offered house specials for the day.  We created our own anti-pasta platter for an appetizer - had choices of several meats, cheeses and olives.  It was an enjoyable way to start the dinner.  I also ordered the Volare Salad - a mixture of greens, cheeses and meats tossed in the house dressing.  It was very  good. For dinner, my wife ordered the Lasagna and I got the Gnocchi in the vodka sauce.  Both were excellent - my wife could not make it through half the lasagna since it was a large portion.  By the time we finished dinner, the place was packed inside and out in the patio area.  It got a bit loud but its expected when its that crowded. The prices were very reasonable and we left there very satisfied with Volare's

Tried out Volare last night for dinner, with a reservation at 7:30 for 4 of us.  Initially, we were seated at a table in the middle of the dining room - but much too close to the table next to us.  We were bumping elbows with the table next door, and were practically sitting in the aisle way that all the servers and patrons were using.  I knew I'd get frustrated if this was going to be my 'dining experience', so after a few minutes, asked one of the hostesses if we could move to another table.  They were happy to shuffle us over, and the experience got much better from there.
