Dinner was delicious.  My hubby and I split a Gnocchi alla Vodka and the Pollo Parmigiano.  Like everyone says - the gnocchi is pretty amazing, and the chicken had  great flavor as well.  My friend got the oysters, followed by the swordfish - and he raved about both.   A little pricey, but not awful.  It was about what you expect for a nice dinner out in downtown Chicago. Great food, and lovely dining experience as long as you find a table with enough space. :)
The gnocchi with alfredo sauce is incredible. Out of this world. Do not miss this restaurant. Kind of pricey, but worth it!

The gnocchi vodka was incredible, but unfortunately the waiter was really slow. The food turned out really well. I am not sure if was because we were sat right by the bar since we didn't have any reservations. Make sure you make reservations, and don't think that it is going to be less busy during the weekdays.

The gnocchi is a little overrated, but we still had a very pleasant dinner here sitting on the patio. The staff was very friendly. My wife had a delicious white pasta dish (don't recall name but was penne with peas and pancetta) and my daughter was pleased with her chicken parmesan. We also enjoyed a nice half bottle of Pinot Grigio.

What a great place! My mom and I were here over 4th of July for the National Irish Dance Championships and went here the night we flew in.  Very classy and nice decor.  Our waiter was very friendly and helpful on recommendations.  The beef carpaccio was quite nice and the oysters were huge but very mild in flavor.  We shared a pasta bowl which wasn't small but wasn't huge either; it was the perfect size.  Not a pricey place which made it even better. I would definitely return if we're ever back in Chicago!!

I love Yelp and use it often, so I decided to start adding some reviews... so bear with me, it's my first time! Went to Volare after reading a favorable review in Crain's Chicago business. The only thing I have to complain about is the bread - so I will start there and end on the good stuff.  There were two types of bread, regular baguette style slices and an onion focaccia.  The problem was that both styles of bread were incredibly dry and I felt as though it was disintegrating into flour in my mouth.  The olive oil for dipping was not the most flavorful either in my opinion.  But that's enough with the critiques, now for the good things! Sitting outside was incredibly nice.  They have a big enough sidewalk where you don't feel crammed against the other tables and waiters trying to walk around you.  And our waitress was friendly, knowledgeable and really enthusiastic about the menu.  All of the staff was polite and welcoming. To start, my mom and I shared a salad - The insalada "rapi or rape" (sorry, not on the online menu so I forgot the name) was incredible.  It was spinach leaves, crispy onions, apples, gorgonzola, roasted beets, with a roasted onion vinaigrette.  The best part about that salad, however, was the parmesan crusted poached egg on top.  I don't usually love eggs, but this was amazing! My mom ordered the braciola, which is a special on Thursdays and the waitress said a lot of people come in exclusively for this dish.  It was really good, the noodles were al dente, the meat was tender, the sauce had a great rosemary taste to it.  The sauce is actually a pork neck bone sauce, and it was very flavorful.  The one thing I didn't love about it was that it was stuffed with egg (like I said, I don't love eggs) but I would definitely order it again. I got a fusilloni with veal ragu, mushrooms, peas in a cream sauce.  Like you would expect, it was very rich - but SO good.  It was almost like the Italian version of a Stroganoff, if you could imagine that.  I was full from the salad, so I took about 3/4 of it home - and I think if I add more pasta and peas, I could make at least three more meals out of it!  (now I just sound like Carl Weathers). We did not try dessert because we were stuffed! OK, first Yelp review, check!  I hope it helps!

Went there for a late lunch mid-week. Not particularly crowded but service was still only so-so. Waiter did not ask if we were interested in any drinks and was unenthusiastic in making recommendations. I had lasagna (half order) which was both ample and good but not quite hot enough (temperature wise).  I have been here before and the food and service  on that occasion was much better. I will attribute my latest experience to a lull after the main lunch hour. I will give it another try, but it needs to be better than this the next time around or it is off my list. Too many good Italian places to try.

So like a lot of reviews said, try the Vodka Gnocci and it was delcious. I am not giving 5 stars because I've had better cheese goncci before, but this was damn good. The service was a little off at times, but still you get a good value for your price. I'd come back if in the area.

Great atmosphere, energy, and service. The place was packed and running behind on a Friday night, which is to be expected, and the staff handled it well. While i loved the salad, the pasta was just okay. I would do drinks here, but not dinner again.
The first time I went here I tried gnocchi for the first time, it was amazing. Since then I have been trying gnocchi all over city and nothing compares.. At all. So delicious

I've been to this place before the renovation and the experience was way more pleasant. We went there this weekend at about 4 pm (before the rush hour, so maybe that has smth to do with it..)  - the bread wasn't fresh, we didnt have any olive oil/vinegar/parmesan on the table - the food was way overpriced. dont get me wrong, it was OK dish but i wouldnt pay $16 for a OK plate of lasagna.. Probably wouldnt go back there. Sadly cause my first time was way better..

Everything that could go wrong, did go wrong.  I made a reservation ten days in advance because my husband and I were entertaining close out of town friends.  We arrived promptly at 7:30 p.m. and were told we had to wait.  And wait we did.  After 20 minutes I was about to walk out when miraculously our table was ready. We were escorted to a table for four with about 12" of clearance between the edge of our table and the back of the chair of another patron.  Every time a waiter or busboy or customer walked by, they hit our table and knocked my husband.   The restaurant was busy so we tried to make due with our location.  I ordered the eggplant appetizer.  When the appetizers arrived the waiter brought me calamari. (In hindsight I should have kept the calamari.)  After explaining the mix up, my second appetizer arrived about ten minutes later.  It consisted of three silver dollars slices of eggplant which were basically breaded but raw and uncooked.  I'm guessing that because the kitchen was trying to get the eggplant out quickly, they thought they could save time by not cooking it.  When the waiter asked how my appetizer was I told him very clearly that I should have kept the calamari.  He did not offer to take it back, he did not offer to get me something else, he basically ignored my response. At this point one of the managers noticed how our table was constantly being bumped by every passerby and offered to move us to the rear of the restaurant.  We were shown to an empty table without napkins, silverware or water.  And there we remained for five minutes without anything. Suddenly our entrees arrived but we couldn't eat them because of the lack of utensils.  So we asked for silverware.  Eventually we got silverware, but no napkins or water.  So we asked for napkins.  And eventually we got napkins, but no water.  So we asked for water and eventually we got that too.  By this time my chicken parm was cold , lifeless and extremely disappointing.  My meal tasted more like was a Stouffer's frozen dinner than a restaurant prepared entree. I could go on but what's the point.  I had been to Volare several times before it closed for remodeling and enjoyed it very much.  It should have stayed closed.  Chicago has many excellent Italian restaurants.  This is not one of them.

Really nice authentic italian food with fresh grated parmesan offered.  I came here with my research group and we got seated on two huge tables. The servers were very attentive and friendly at explaining items on the menu. They serve complimentary bread with olive oil, which was nice (the bread was cold though... but whatever, bread is bread). I got the gnocchi in vodka sauce and it was absolutely delicious. The gnocchi was soft with just the right amount of bite and the sauce was amazingly good with the right amount of sweetness.  We didn't wait that long for our food at all, or maybe we just didn't notice the time.  Ambience is very nice and the food is reasonably priced; would like to come here on a date or something next time :)

So I read a ton of reviews on restaurants in the area. This one struck me to be a great little treasure, and I thought it would be a great place to bring my grandmother from out of town. Hmm... WRONG!  We first called to see if we could make a reservation and they told us they weren't taking any more reservations for the evening. So we asked how long the wait would be if we came in and waited... They told us up to 30 minutes. Okay, we can do that. So we went in, gave them our name, and they quoted us the 30 minutes like on the phone. GREAT! Then 30 minutes went by, and no one called our names, my dad went up to ask when our table would be ready, and they quoted us ANOTHER 30 minutes... well, if you promise it will be ready in 30 minutes (an hour after we first gave you our name) then we'll wait. Hmm... no one has seated us yet... FINALLY, they came up to us and said our table was ready.  Sure enough, we had a great little table in the front, perfect! Then about 10 minutes later our server finally greets us. She gives us the specials, and we fall in love with one of the appetizer specials. And she doesn't come back for, literally, another 20 minutes! By this time, they have joined three tables behind us, and pushed the chairs just inches away from the backs of our chairs (one of which my grandmother was sitting). So now we're crammed in AND hungry. When our waitress finally comes back, she asks if we were ready (geeze, I don't know, if you give us another HOUR without coming and checking on us, maybe we will be... DUH!). As she is about to take our appetizer order (the special) she is distracted by about three other employees who are asking her questions while she is supposed to be taking our order. We finally give her our appetizer order when she tells us they JUST SOLD OUT! Wow lady, if you would have come around sooner, like maybe 15 minutes ago when we were ready, maybe we could have had our appetizer....  This wasn't the last of it. It went on and on, our food was late, and it didn't come out together... or relatively close together I should say. Sure, it was a Monday, and I guess that was the excuse the staff used on us... "Well, it is Monday" what the heck kind of a reason is that for being under attentive and making us wait around for three hours... Probably never going here again... Two Stars: The food was good, service was the worst! And the experience to me means more than the quality of the food... sorry!

I got the gnocchi in vodka sauce since it was well received on here, and it hit the spot. Soft pillowy gnocchi and the sauce was like velvet.  There was a bit longer than expected wait for the food, but nothing crazy. No beers on tap, so I had Dirty Blonde by recommendation by the very friendly bar tender.  My wife's raviolis were also delicious. All around great experience.

I love this place! I was looking for somewhere nice to go for my anniversary and saw this place on Yelp.  I am so glad we decided to give it a try! It is in the price-y-er range so for us this is a special occasion restaurant. The food is a-mazing! I got the linguine carbonara and my boyfriend got some delicious salmon red sauce on his pasta. Heaven. The waitstaff is quick, friendly and efficient. Seating is limited and the good food draws crowds, so I would suggest making a reservation just to avoid the hassle of lines at the door. Portions are huge, so no one will leave hungry. We came again for Valentine's Day and I can't wait until my sister comes to visit so I have an excuse to eat here again. Hands down, this is my favorite place to eat in Chicago.

My friend and I was looking for a good place to eat Italian food in Chicago.  We stumbled around after shopping and yelped Volare.   We didn't have reservations on a Friday night and luckily found two spots on the bar.  Extremely lucky!  The bar tender was great although it was so busy!   My friend and i got the Carpaccio di Manzo to share.  It was amazing especially the arugula and Parmesan chips!  Next for the pasta.... forget the no-carb diet for Chicago's fine dining!  My friend got the  veggie whole wheat rigatoni... Amazing!  I got the imported black spaghetti with seafood in a spicy tomato sauce.  I don't know the name AHH.. but it was soo good, they had shredded crab mixed into the sauce with lots of shrimps and scallops.  We both couldn't finish our pasta's since they give so much.  It made some great late night snacks! Definitely will come back when i visit Chicago again. The atmosphere is loud and jam packed but if you happen to get a corner spot or a booth i would recommend it for a date spot.

Order the seafood cold salad- it was gorgeous and even  better tasting. We ate here for our first lunch in a series of a 3- day trip. It was the perfect start to a great trip. Sat outside on a quiet dead-end street so away from the hustle & bustle. The homemade pasta - Bolognese sauce was fabulous as well. The service was also top-notch. put it on your list!

Dropped in for a quick solo business lunch, this place is in a side street off the Mag Mile, discovered it via Yelp. On recommendations I chose the Vodka gnocchi, very tasty and piping hot. I washed it down with a generous pour house white wine. I sat outside as it was such a beautiful day, so I can't speak to what the interior looks like. Very friendly attentive wait staff.

This restaurant was our first stop on the Chicago trip,and it was absolutely phenomenal! The place was jam packed, which is a good sign. After being ushered to the bar to wait for our table, the GM came to find us to seat us and was very gracious!  For starters we had the Grigliata Mista salad, which was a blend of seafood and soft greens. All the seafood was grilled to perfection, and didn't weigh down the greens at all!  I had the Caprese Spaghetti for my meal,which was AMAZING! Very good, rich sauce, and fresh pasta!  The whole meal was great, the ambiance was perfect, and the experience was awesome! Thanks Volare!

Italian is one of my personal favorites when I just land in a new city.  The pasta is always a remedy to my upset fliers tummy! Volare was a last second reservation after looking up restaurants near our hotel on Yelp. Old school Italian restaurant that seemed very authentic (I even think that our waitress Helena was Italian which is usually a good sign...) Booked the reservation at 9 and was pleasantly surprised to get a table at 9 on the dot outside.  Munched on bread with olive oil and fresh parmesan while perusing the menu.  It was pretty standard Italian fare so we went with the calamari app, gnocchi and ravioli.  Calamari wasn't really anything to write home about, but the famed gnocchi definitely lived up to its hype.  Texture wasn't dense or gummy and the sauce was the perfect accompaniment.  We opted also for two deserts.  The ice cream quad and a white chocolate cheesecake.  Both were good.   The overall atmosphere of the restaurant was pleasant, service was superb but I am leaving off one star since neither the app or the deserts were all that memorable.  Gnocchi is a homerun though so get that!

Vodka sauce. That's all I want to write for this review, but I have to give a little more.  You could probably put the vodka sauce on a shoe and have a great dinner.  I'm just sayin' it was THAT good. I had the raviolis and the hubby had gnocchi.  O. M. G.  One of our best meals in Chicago.  The ravs were delish.  The gnocchi was so light and dreamy - best we've ever had anywhere.  Now, add that frickin' sauce.  The end. When we arrived, it was still early, and just a few tables were taken.  By the time our dinner was delivered to our table the place was FULL.  That's always a good sign to me.  Service was great, too. ........................vodka sauce............................................

I came here with some friends, and was pretty much impressed by the entire experience.  Since this was my first time, I have no way of comparing it to the old Volare, but I can't imagine how the old incarnation could have been better than the present one. The space itself is great; classy, intimate, good noise level, tasteful decor.  Better than that, though, is everything else.  The service?  Our waiter was incredibly knowledgeable of the menu and specials, personable, and prompt without being pushy.  The prices?  Not too shabby; not cheap eats, but you get plenty of food and I felt like, for the quality and quantity, I was getting a good deal. And the food.  The food is excellent; good traditional Italian fare with all the right extra touches to elevate the experience from just some good pasta to a really excellent dining experience.  We had a few appetizers; the arancini were the day's special, and they were the best ones I'd ever had.  Perfect blend of creamy center and crisp exterior.  The bruschetta was also excellent (if a tad pricey for the portion size), and the ensalata caprese was well done.  Entree-wise, I went with the spaghetti neri al pesche...homemade black pasta (it's the squid ink) in a creamy tomato sauce with shrimp, crab, and scallops.  YES.  Everything on my plate worked amazingly well.  My friends seemed pretty happy with their dishes...a chestnut gnocchi that was the day's pasta special, and spinach fettuccine in a bolognese sauce.   This is totally a place I plan to come back to again and again when need an Italian fix.  Classy environment, great service, amazing food, and decent prizes...what else do you need? Can't wait to take my querida there!

Found myself here on business.  Absolutely fantastic Italian.  As many others have said - old school Italian feel with great service and wonderful food.   Calamari - outstanding.  Some of the best calamari I have ever had.  Flavorful, not rubbery - just perfect. Salsiccia e Peperoni (mild pork sausage in roasted pepper and wine sauce).  I really was not expecting to like this as much as I did.  It is a must try! Gnocchi in vodka sauce - It does not get better than this.  I could have bathed in this.  Can't wait for another reason to go back to Chicago.  Well done Volare, well done.
Incredible food, great service and atmosphere.  Delivery was slow and cold.

I hadn't been to Volare in a few months, and it turns out I couldn't have gone since they were remodeling. What a nice upgrade! The place now has more than twice the former capacity, having acquired the space formerly occupied by CND Gyros. New wood and tile upgrades and an all-new visible kitchen area are very slick-looking, and there are now two large dining areas and two bars.The menu is slightly different--somewhat streamlined--but all my favorites are still there, especially the Vitello alla Parmigiana! There are a lot of new staffers, but service is prompt, friendly and quite attentive. If you like La Scarola down the street a couple miles on Grand, you HAVE to try Volare!

Ordered Gnocchi with Bolognese sauce. Gnocchi were ginormous (about an inch in length or so) compared to what I've had before, but were delicious and cooked well throughout. Bolognese sauce was a great addition to hearty up the light and delicate, but filling, gnocchi. Hefty serving of bread, butter and Parmigiano cheese were included on the side for the to-go order.  Based on my one time, one meal experience - I would definitely stop by there again when in town and have more time for a meal.

Great traditional italian food! I usually dont like traditional italian food...but this place really does it! They make their own pasta and everything! Great place to take ur family out to dinner. It isnt very expensive for what u get (portions r large this is def not tapas style!) ;)

The food here is okay but the customer service is so bad that I'd like to give it a NO stars.  Working downtown our office orders out a lot.  First of all, the menu on their website doesnt have prices.  And the last time we ordered they told us it wasn't accurate anymore... said they were out of salmon but at the end of the order they suddenly had it again but were out of steak.  To top it off they delivered the order incomplete.  We called once to let them know and they said that we were wrong.  We checked everything and asked the doorman and so called back to assure them we hadnt received it and the lady said "okay, its on its way."  It never showed up, shocker, and we were charged with it.  The service was so preposterous no one wanted to call back.  I was a server for five years, mistakes happen.  And maybe it was one bad day and one employee, etc.  But it was enough to lose our whole office as customers.

Because of traffic, we were very late for our reservation, but the staff could not have been more accommodating and gracious.  We had very little time to make our show, and they rushed through our order for us; nothing was a bother.  I can't think of where I have had better service in a restaurant, and on top of it, the food was delicious. We had the ravioli, which was excellent. We plan to return and would highly recommend this restaurant to friends.

Fun local place. Attentive staff who treats you like family. And good, not fantastic Italian. And the guys who sat in the corner gave the place a feel so authentic, I was kind of afraid to sit next to the windows.

Been living in the neighborhood for over 15 years and have been going to Volare almost as long.  Had high hopes for the renovation although one of the waiters tipped us off right before they started saying the menu was changing.   WHY oh WHY do my favorites always get taken off menus!?!?! Well, for those who love the Squid Ink Rosotto......SORRY, no mas. Choose your own pasta...choose your own sauce......SORRY.   No more olive oil on the table, instead you have to keep requesting another plate and they keep throwing away your bread and giving you new bread again.  What a waste! The only good thing is that there is more room...the front dining room has barely changed, but there is now another side of the restaurant which mirrors the set up.  But the place is still just as loud and just as packed.   Beyond having more room, I was incredibly disappointed with this last visit.  I'll give it another try b/c I live next door, but I"m likely only going to go for the gnocchi and vodka sauce, at least they kept that.

My father has been a fixture of this restaurant for years and I've been here countless times with him and the rest of my family. They just re-opened after a massive renovation and the results are beautiful. Double the dining space and a great bar opened on both sides. With such a big change you hope the food remains intact and it has.  If you were a fan of the original menu style- you're in for an adjustment. They have removed the "choose your pasta then sauce" elements and changed it to more concrete entrees. Our waitress was new to the restaurant and needed a little push to bring out the standard dishes my father usually orders (including the rigatoni alla vodka sauce... which should be on there regardless). He is really not happy about their addition of pizzas but thankfully they brought a complimentary order otherwise he never would have realized it is great pizza!  They've added more cured meats & cheeses to start with and some other small apps. Although the nostalgia will make you want to dislike what they've done inside, take it by the reigns and dig in- Volare 2.0 is filled with new and delicious surprises.

It's re-opened, hurray!  My favorite little Italian restaurant - only reasons for 4 stars instead of 5 is the lack of waiting room near the bar - or anywhere for that matter! On my last visit it was my sister's birthday and we came with a party of 16.  Seriously, 16 people in this tiny restaurant.  But they made it work!The food is phenomenal...the squid ink risotto is better than any risotto I had in Italy, hands down.  Another standout was the pesto gnocchi - again, probably one of the best gnocchi dishes to-date.  Jumbo shrimp was incredibly good as well...The only thing that was not quite up to snuff was the house salad - measly ingredients and pretty lame iceberg lettuce :(  Yuck.  Last, the wine prices seemed pretty darn reasonable and we got a few of the same white and red bottles to share with the table.  When the bill came, everyone was shocked at how low it was!  We all left full and happy. So glad you're not permanently closed Volare!

Not actually closed, just being remodeled. Best Italian restaurant in the U.S. Always packed, you must have a reservation unless you want to sit at the bar. Basically food is amazing, place has a bustling atmosphere, and is a staple for me when I come to Chicago.

Very solid Italian place East of Michigan Ave.  My go to dish is the Vongole al Vino Bianco o al Pomodoro (clams in white wine and garlic) over linguini.  This restaurant was the first place I tried osso bucco so I am no expert but I found the meat to be very tender and delicious.  The risotto... I've had better.  Nonetheless, for how bustling this restaurant is, the service is very attentive.  I've been here where they appear to overbook reservations so that is a demerit.  Nonetheless, the prices at this restaurant are very reasonable and is one of my go to Italian places in Chicago.

Disappointment. Ambiance is romantic, small..dim, old school ambiance. During busy times, they really squeeze people in here. They're doing some construction so curious as to the expansion/whats happening there. Service is great! I've always found italian restaurants to have fantastic service and people to be passionate about the food and Volare is no different. The food is meh. I had the Risotto Volare (squid ink seafood risotto) which was amazing! Flavors were wonderful and it was cooked perfectly. But the man had a tortellini sausage dish and it was quite the opposite - bland, overcooked. So conflicting, since it's quite a staple and easy to cook dish, I was surprised. The price isn't too bad, and everything else was great! But for a restaurant to get something simple wrong always rubs me the wrong way and disappointed me. If you do go, go for the risotto, since it's what they can get right.

Cozy, quaint, and not too stuffy. Their food is amazing and the Volare Risotto is to die for! I keep coming back wanting to try something new, but always end up getting the Volare Risotto because it is absolutely fantastic. You must try it!

Old school Italian restaurant, solid food, very friendly, efficient service. Had Grigliata Mista as starter, delicious grilled calamari, scallops, shrimp and octopus in a citrusy balsamic reduction. The calamari and octopus were extremely tender, excellent grilling.  Ossobuco special for entree, fall off the bone tender. Flavor was standard, a little heavy and salty on the sauce, and the bed of risotto was a tad too rich and creamy. On the whole dish was too heavy, could've used something to cut the flavor.

This is a great place for lunch!  For just a bit more than you would pay for a salad and sandwich at Panera or Corner Bakery, you get a small side salad and a big plate of pasta. The bread is also great and unlimited.  Admittedly, I have only had the gnocchi because it is so good that I don't want to try anything else.  Service is very nice and though it is small, it never feels claustrophobic.

Straight out of the Sopranos? Italian restaurant, crowded, dim lighting, old school ambiance, and food that is off the charts amazing!  *Calamari - Crispy, non chewy, deliciousness... Comes with lemon, cocktatil sauce, and horseradish on the side so that you can add it to your liking. * Gnocchi with Vodka Sauce - Tender Gnocchi with  bomb.com  sauce. (if i could put that sauce over every pasta i so would) *Squid Ink Risoto! To Die For! - nuff said! (i want some right now!) *Seafood linguine with a garlic and white wine sauce - Not the best thing that night, but still quite good! Service was okay...extreme opposites (we felt from "where is our waiter" to "omg, would he just leave and let us eat!") haha... Food is amazing, surpassed all the other negatives i could thing of...

Really good italian food.  Location is a little less than desired and very loud but the food and service are really good.  Like it more at lunch with the chicken parm and in summer.  try in outside in summer
Amazing food, service, and ambiance! Always makes our list for any trip to Chicago. Recommended by two Chicago residents.
GET THE VODKA SAUCE. Oh man, that stuff is like crack. Get it. Devour it. You'll be happy.

I'm so torn.. I hate giving this place three stars, but .. averaging the food and service, that's what it comes down to. Starting with the good: *Service was A++. Our waiter was possibly the best we have ever had. I mean that, out of thousands of restaurants. He was so enthusiastic and passionate about serving, cooking, Italian food, Mexican food... just a joy! *Everyone else in the restaurant was equally friendly *My dog really loved the bone from the pork shank The bad: *Food... lacked. Ingredients were missing and replaced (we were informed of this before they were brought out, at least). My chicken would render someone with dentures helpless. *Drinks -- I was thrilled to discover they made Bloody Mary's with real tomato juice, but the taste was awful. I couldn't quite put my finger on it, but it almost tasted like plastic. Really bizarre. *Wait. The restaurant was EMPTY. We were literally the only people there, yet our food took ages. *Calamari sauce -- this may just be me, but I enjoy calamari only with marinara sauce. I absolutely loathe the red shrimp cocktail sauce... and that's what they came with here. :(

Go! A mid-size restaurant that was packed... a good sign. Very friendly staff from the hostess, waitress, and bus staff. They worked in cramped and crowded conditions all evening and always have a smile and patience. Now the food... devine. Had the salmon special appetizer -- grilled salmon on arugala; super! Minestrone soup, also great.  Entrees -- squid  ink risotto with seafood, and sea bass with shellfish. Both superb and more than we could possibly eat in one sitting. A winning combo... friendly atmosphere and great food!  It's not a quiet, intimate environment, but there were plenty of couples that seemed to be enjoying the experience. Prices were reasonable given quality and quantity of food.

if you can't trust the patrons/punters then avoid ! It started great on Friday Jan 13th - friendly staff, exciting atmosphere, tasty food. a little too noisy for conversation (because of the curved ceiling I think)   -  but it was all great until we discovered back @ our hotel that my wife had left her bag behind on her seat. Called next morning and left a VM ...no response - after 2 more attempts we made contact and they had the bag....great...we picked up - but then discovered that while all credit cards were untouched  - the $200 cash that we had for the weekend had been stolen from the purse in the bag. don't know if it was staff or clientele - perhaps manager can respond on who found what ??? - either way  - never again !

Volare was recommend by a friend who would take his Italian (FOB) father here when he would visit. So when my girlfriends birthday came around we decided to give it a try.  I called to make a reservation on a Tuesday at 7:00pm. I asked if they had a booth and the hostess said they didn't have any. Oh well, no big deal. When we arrived it was jam packed - a good sign on a Tuesday. NOTE - It is not a very large place and is very noisy! There were some high-top tables in the front of restaurant that looked very awkward to dine in with all the traffic coming right by you. After waiting and waiting for 20 minutes past our reservation we finally got seated at a table in main room. Pretty tight squeeze, they really pack you in there. There was no coat check either so everyone's coats just compounds the problem. If your a big person, you might feel little a claustrophobic at some of these tables. Our server, Nikola, was very good. He helped us pick a Pomino Rosso which was just outstanding. The dinner menu is very extensive and everything looked good to me. He recommend the squid ink risotto, which was just amazing. There were very large flavorful pieces of squid, clams and shrimp in the dish. My girlfriend had the Pollo alla Cacciatora. She enjoyed everything but the small tomatoes, which had way to much seasoning on them. The dishes are enormous, I am a big eater and could not finish the entire thing. You could almost split one dish for to people. Desert is obligatory for birthdays so we had the chocolate mousse which was very good It's definitely not a romantic atmosphere and very crowded, but if you can get over that the food is definitely worth the stop.

On a trip to Chicago a couple years ago we had a craving for some italian food, following a tip from a local we gave Volare a try. We arrived early so there was no wait, while seated though we did notice the restaurant fill up rather quickly so I could see there being a wait.  The wait staff was great and very attentive, they were also great offering suggestions on the menu. I elected to try their homemade cheese ravioli and let me tell you it was one of the best homemade pastas I've had outside of Italy (I've become somewhat picky about pizza and pasta). I am planning another trip back to Chicago this year and am excited to make another visit to Volare's to have some yummy italian food. Second visit May 2012 One of the best Italian restaurants in Chi-town. This was my second time eating here, first since they've expanded the place. They've given the place a bit of a face lift and expanded to add more seating. They have a nice bar area just as you enter and the kitchen is open so that it may be seen on both sides. Thankfully the food is still quite tasty. We made a reservation for 830pm since we knew it would be busy (which I highly recommend if you're going after 6 unless you don't mind waiting). Just a note that with the added seating and expansion it can get rather noisy when busy so it isn't the easiest to have a conversation but also not impossible.  Service this time around could've been a little better but only minor things. We ordered the lasagna, fettuccini verdi alla bolognese and spaghetti caprese. Note portions are generous so unless you plan to share or can put away a ton of food order the half size for pasta dishes. I definitely recommend the fettuccine as the meat sauce is yummy. They start you off with some bread and olive oil with parmaggiano reggiano so don't stuff yourself on bread or you won't make it through the meal. Overall I would definitely recommend the spinach fettuccini or lasagna. I definitely will be back on my next trip to Chicago as this is a great place to go for tasty Italian food.

I visited the first time after a class downtown with a friend who lived down the street but hadn't been here. They gave us more bread when we asked and it was really good bread. We both got gnocchi with marinara sauce. It was so amazing that I made my husband come back with me. We ordered the gnocchi again with the bolognese sauce and he got the arrabiatta sauce. The sauce wasn't as good as the first time, but the gnocchi was to die for. Again. My husband still talks about it months later. It is delicious!
Gnocchi was excellent. Probably my favorite italian place in the city thus far!

I use to live downtown for about 4 years and when I did this place was a weekly staple for me.  Anyone who thinks that pasta is just pasta obviously has never dined here.  I have not had a dish here that wasn't exactly what I was hoping for.  There might be something too about the hustle of the servers as they seamlessly edge around the packed house or the conversation and laughter that you get when you open the door.  Needless to say I miss this place, it might have been the only part about living downtown that I actually miss.  If you haven't tried it yet check it out, you will not be sorry.

On a recent business trip to Chicago, my team unanimously cried out for Italian.  Although I was having a hankering for steak (hey, we *were* in Chicago, after all), I did my job and researched a place to satisfy they group's urges.  Not only was Volare consistently well reviewed, it was only a few blocks away. It says something about the quality of a restaurant when the place is packed at 7:30 on a Sunday evening.  We were warmly greeted and shown to the bar while waiting for our table.  The menu is impressive in terms of options.  Consider this: there are 9 different pasta types and 11 sauces.  That's 99 mind boggling options!  Not to mention fresh made ravioli, tortellini and gnocchi.  The latter, which I enjoyed with the prosciutto, peas and Parmesan cream sauce that had me swooning.  It was, in fact, the best gnocchi I've ever had. The warm, inviting atmosphere of the dining room was only heightened by the impeccable service we received. Just another outstanding dining experience in my favorite food city in the US.

Very good Italian food!  We had four adults and three kids for a 5:30pm reservation.  We got our table very quickly but there were over 40 people waiting for tables by 6:30pm.  This place seems to be quite popular. Had the homemade gnocchi with vodka sauce which was fantastic.  I would go back for this dish alone.  Four adults shared the gnocchi dish, the veal limone, the veal pizzola and the pasta special with their pesto sauce.  We took the extras home.  They made buttered pasta for my kids and were very accomodating with our special requests.  I would definitely go back!

Wow, I loved Volare. I went here a few weeks ago with a friend based on recommendations from a number of people. I had a salad (can't remember which) and a risotto. It was very tasty. I really enjoyed the atmosphere as well. It reminded me of my time spent in Italy. Definitely worth checking out but make sure to make a reservation. It was crowded on multiple weeknights when I walked in.

Visiting from Kansas City, saw the great reviews from this site and that it was walking distance from our hotel, so we tried it. So glad we did!   atmosphere was great, fun, lively, and intimate. The service was impeccable! From the manager, to the water guys, to the guys bussing the tables and our wonderful waitress Blanche. The staff makes you feel like a millionaire in a high priced restaurant. The food was wonderful, and it was busy and our food came out quickly. The amount of food you get for the price is pleasing. Almost everyone takes home a doggy bag. I over heard that this restaurant bought room next door and is renovating And expanding. Great idea! I love Chicago for the great food, wonderful shopping and kind midwest people! I will be back to check out the new restaurant some day!

Ordered the linguine fra diavolo con gamberi on an initial visit. Returned and ordered it again. Returned a third time and it was quite evident that the dish has fuelled an addiction. The shrimp practically bursts with flavour and the linguine prepared al dente in a spicy tomato sauce was a classic case of perfection. One thing to note is that Volare tends to fill up quickly. With outstanding food, it is quite easy to see why. If you go during the summer, opt to sit inside. The smell of all things awful makes outdoor dining a bit unpleasant. Such tasty food should not be disrupted by vapours from the alley. And, oh, may I suggest the  linguine fra diavolo con gamberi? You will not be disappointed and that is a guarantee.

Just one thing. OUTSTANDING.  Service is personable, polite, and knowledgeable.  The food ,  New York strip medium rare,  melts in your mouth, flavor full,  the calamari appetizer rocked.  Get there before 7pm and head out for a movie after ward.

Average food and poor service. I took coworkers out to lunch for an EOY celebration, what a mistake.  Here's the details:  Place was empty at 11:30, hostess was busy on a call and pointed us to a table.  Waitress seemed rushed and didn't want to answer any questions.  Calamari was ok and the house salads were like an episode of candid camera.  One salad contained AT LEAST 30 chickpeas next to a cucumber and small amount of lettuce.  My coworkers got a kick out of it when the waitress explained rudely "that's the ratio we use".  I had thoughts of making humus but decided to try the lunch entree instead.  The vodka sauce is bland, the lasagna is a messy lump, the bolognese sauce tasted microwaved and the meatballs were awful.  The tables for 4 are too crowded for 4 people, no room for entree/drinks/elbows.  Coworkers rated this 4/10 but had a good time with the chickpea episode.  Far from authentic Italian food.

At this location only, you can get the Grigliata Mista, a grilled seafood warm antipasto for lunch, and you SHOULD (if you aren't of course allergic to seafood): you will get delightfully chargrilled squid, octopus, shrimp, scallops tossed in a light balsamic vinaigrette with a side salad.

Oh baby! It's not usually my style to give 4 stars to a place that made me wait without access to the bar but the gnocchi here is that good. No really, it is. I swear it. I stopped in with a colleague on the first night of business trip to Chicago and immediately realized we probably either should have called ahead or brought a cast member from the Sopranos with us. While the wait was made better by the people watching I do think it would be nice if there was more room to sit while waiting but no biggie.  We were seated by the window with a great view of the packed dining room and proceeded to order right away. Warm bread followed but I am glad I left plenty of room in my belly for the gnocchi with vodka sauce and sausage that I ordered at the recommendation of my waiter. It was truly splendid. Just an explosion of flavors and really well prepared. I sincerely wish my hotel had had fridges in the room because I would have ate the leftovers cold for breakfast. Le sigh.
Food was perfectly cooked. Service was great, especially considering they accommodated a party of 9 on a Friday night!

The food, service and atmosphere we perfect.  The specials of the day were great pics, as well as the standard spaghetti bolognese and meatballs.  Great wine list as well.  This is a classic big-city italian joint, a must for your visit to Chicago.

Another close dining option to the Intercontinental.  The vibe is old-school Chicago but the interior was festive with holiday lights and decorations. The portions at Volare are huge and the prices are very reasonable.  Pastas, salads, entrees.  All large.  Pretty good overall but nothing blew me away.   Bread with marinara sauce is served but it's cold.

***BEST HANDMADE GNOCCI*** I just tried it last night for the first time and I am already craving it again.   If you are looking for truly authentic, delicious Italian food, then Volare is the place to go.  One of the things I love about this place is they allow you to pair your favorite pasta with one of their homemade sauces.  I orded the gnocci with pesto and was very impressed.  I'd come back to Chicago just to visit Volare again. The prices are incredibly reasonable as well!!  My date and I each had an entree (he had the Veal medallions which he said were delicious), we shared a salad and had a glass of wine and the bill was under $70.  The service was fantastic.  Marcos (the GM) is very friendly and welcoming.  He greets everyone as if they've been friends forever.   Overall, a remarkable dining experience.

Fantastic food, great service, heck, even the coffee was great. Had veal chop w/ prosciutto and Marsala reduction - one of the best veal chops I ever had. Carmel cheesecake to finish up. super good and our waiter was awesome. If you are in Chicago and want a great meal this is the place!

This place gets crazy busy during dinner hours and really loud! I read a lot of good reviews on their veal chops but I was in a mood for seafood... and something I haven't tried before.  Lo and behold, risotto volare, squid ink risotto.  It came out a rich dark thick sauce over rice with tomatoes and meaty seafood. I'm not sure how to describe the squid ink other than to say it was very seafood-y. It hits the palate with a very full seafood-y sensation. Not fishy, but ... (dang it I can't think of another word for this) just seafood-y. The rice really absorbed the ink. So much that even though the meal was delicious, I couldn't finish it because it was just too much seafood-y flavor.  One of my friends had their pumpkin ravioli. That was excellent as well and the portions are huge.

This food was wonderful!  I traveled to Italy earlier this year and I have to say that the food at Volare was just as good as the food we  ate in Italy.  For starters we had the brushcetta appetizer. I had the porgy piccata and my husband had the mushroom manicotti.  Both were absolutely delicious.  If I ever come back to Chicago, I will definitely return to Volare.

In town on business. Stopped in for lunch at Volare after wandering around for awhile. Immediate water and bread service. Our water was refilled consistently throughout the meal and our server (Ramiro) was very attentive and knowledgeable of the menu. I wish servers in select restaurants back home could take a lesson in customer service from this guy - he was AMAZING. The warm bread was great: the top was schmeared with a thin layer of tomato paste (?) before being sprinkled with parmesan. Incredible flavor with the olive oil for dipping (note to self: replicate at home). My dining partner ordered the chicken caesar salad and she appeared to enjoy it. I ordered the Gnocchi al Pomodoro Fresco, which was by far one of the best gnocchi's I've had. In my life. Firm yet chewy, and I opted to add a side of meatballs (2 baseball sized-meatballs). They were very well seasoned and I could tell that celery, onion, and spinach had been added at minimum.  Even if the food had been less than what it was, I would come back on a future trip to Chicago. A++ service goes a really long way in my book!

2.5 stars I am an Italian food lover and so I was excited to try this place based on the reviews. We had a friend in town and her only request was Italian food. We had the Caprese salad: the mozzarella was not top quality and they do not use beef steak tomatoes and supply barely any balsalmic vinagarette. Moving onto the veal picatta in white wine sauce: white whine sauce did not have enough lemon or lemon zest in it. I have made better at home. My husband then ordered tiraimasu for desert and he loves it so that's at least a good ending. Overall, I think if you want good Italian food in this city you need to go to Little Italy (Tufano's is a good start).
Wow.  Great prices at a wide variety for each of the types of meals.  Perfectly cooked, seasoned and very attentive waiter with lots of helpful suggestions.
good service~good environment~and the food is good.but the price is a little bit...haha

I love, love, LOVE Volare. I live in the Southwest suburbs and don't get to the city very often, but the 3 times I've been to Volare it has been fa-bu-lous!!  Let me just start with YES this place is expensive, but its totally worth it, I had risotto the first time and it was amazing, the wine is superb and the service is very good for the amount of people I have seen in there.  Just a few tips: MAKE A RESERVATION at night, again of the 3 times I've been there it's been packed. Make sure you have enough time to eat and enjoy, this is not a place to go to if you are in a rush...take the time and ENJOY the atmosphere.  If the owners read this please keep doing what you're doing...my only suggestion is to move the bathrooms! Its intimidating to dodge past servers and kitchen staff to get to the facilities.

Came here after my conference starving and stepped into old itallian charm amidst corporate greed.  The warm bread with Parmesan-olive oil-salt was a great starter on this cold Chicago day.  Had a the grilled seafood app which was delicious. Its a great app for two. For my entree, I had the chicken parm. The plate of food was as scrumptious as it was enormous.   Unfortunately, I had too much to eat and left no room for dessert. Can't wait to go back.

What an amazing place!  I came to Chicago with a friend on vacation and her doctor recommended Volare to us. On our last day in the city we decided we would check it out. Of all the restaurants we had visited on that trip, this place was by far the best! Wow! It's small, warm, the waitstaff is friendly and the food is amazing. I got the a soup and salad. Both great! My friend go the lasagna. She described it as velvety. I wasn't sure what she meant until I tried it. It was so soft and tasty!  I highly recommend this place. It's great and very decently priced!

5 stars for good, basic Italian restaurant with romantic atmosphere, good service and very good food.  We had egg plant and mixed anti-pastis and moved onto pasta entrees, one with vodka sauce, the other with seafood and peas.  Silly me, not realizing that servings would be enormous, ordered meatballs as well.  My favorites were the eggplant and the vodka sauce.  They offer choices of several pastas, many homemade, and several different sauces.  In addition to pasta, they had a variety of other choices.  We had a great meal with wine, all delicious.  We'll go back next time we're in town, but when we visit again, we'll save room for desert.

Warning: Volare is not for the stuffy or faint of heart. It's loud, crowded, and you probably will have to wait a bit for your reservation on a Saturday night. It's not the place for a quiet, romantic dinner, nor a good place for a pre-theatre dinner. That's not necessarily a bad thing, though -- in my mind, anyway. Volare is authentic and delicious old school Italian food for extremely reasonable prices. The restaurant is loud and always packed, but it has a lively vibe that I find really fun and energizing. Loud laugher fills the air, and the staff treat you like family. It's like the kitchen of the Italian grandmother that you wish you had. Waiting for my reservation doesn't bother me much... I just drink a glass of wine at the bar and people watch. Portions are huge (one entree is three meals for me), and the homemade pastas are excellent. Nice wine list as well. I drive up from Indy at least once a year, and I always stop here for dinner. It doesn't look like much from the outside, but if you're up for a fun night and don't have a strict schedule, I highly recommend that you check it out.

I have never written a review on Yelp before, and just signed up for an account today because of this restaurant!  Price points are extremely low given the quality of food and service.  Today during lunch I left my cell phone on the table. I called the restaurant frantic and they asked me where I worked and sent someone to drop it off. Now THAT is customer service.  I will recommend this restaurant to anyone who enjoys fine Italian food (who doesn't) great service (which is difficult to find), and an ambiance that is perfect for downtown Chicago.

Wow. Talk about having that Italy feeling. This place was just great. The food, wine and service was just great. I have only been there once but this place deserved for me to jump on Yelp and give it 5 stars. Something I hardly ever do. The pasta was delicious and our waitress had a heart of gold. Make sure you reserve on the weekends.

This used to be my solid restaurant recommendation.  The owner, Benny, almost never comes by any more, and it shows.  I took 3 friends there recently, and I never plan to go back.  This is from a customer of over a decade.  Service was awful, with cold food that took forever to come (an Italian meal that takes 3 hours?!).  As always, they list specials when you are at the table and fail to mention the prices, which are inflated 3 times above normal entrees.  The food is no longer good: Premade lobster ravioli, farm raised fatty salmon, and nuked eggplant rolls.  I will no longer recommend this restaurant to anyone I know, except as one to avoid.  Benny, you really screwed up.

After waiting for over an hour to be seated at another restaurant, my party and I walked around the block to find Volare and ended up being seated within ten minutes. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating.  Our waitress was fabulous, the wine selection was wonderful, and the menu was to-die-for.  We ordered a risotto with sausage, peas, and mushrooms and a tortellini in a spicy tomato sauce--both of which totally hit the spot. It was a great meal with wonderful service but it is LOUD LOUD LOUD in that restaurant.  If you're looking to have a romantic dinner or to be able to hear the people at your table this probably isn't the best place to go.  Other than the noise I would give it a 5 star rating :)

This is a great place--it's slightly off the beaten path (aka Michigan Avenue) so it has a more "local" feel and it's not a chain! Food is a little pricey if you'rve having drinks, but delicious--home made pastas, sauces, etc. The decor is fantastically kitsch old school Italian-American. Gorgeous patio for outdoor, summertime dining.

We came to Volare on a Monday night. It was good that I've made reservation otherwise the wait time was about 30 minutes. Being that busy on a Monday night is always a good sign. We started with Mussels in a white wine sauce. It was absolutely delicious. Probably one of the best mussels appetizer I've had. As our entre I had risotto with sausage. It was good but it wasn't great. My wife had Veal medallions. It was also OK.  The service was slow. We had to wait a long time between our appetizer and entres.  It is crazy loud inside. It is definitely not the type of restaurant if you are looking for a quite, romantic place.  The food is reasonably priced. Portions are huge. Consider sharing an entre if you want to have space for a dessert.

I had an awesome lunch at Volare for less than 20 bucks!   I started out with the Soup of the day, a beautifully made soup with sausage and spinach.   I followed it up with a most incredible Bolognese dish with what was clearly handmade pasta.    I haven't had such great handmade Italian food in quite a while.   Everything was beautifully prepared and I got an awesome value for my money.    Service, too, was impeccable!   Va bene!

I don't love writing bad reviews. But I had a really bad dinner here. We show up and I'm pumped. 4 stars on yelp. Lots of reviews. I'm in the mood for some Italian food. Let's do this. I tell the waiter that I'm looking for pasta and ask whether there are any dishes he recommends. His reply was honest and impressive: "The ravioli is good. The penne ala vodka is good. Everything else is 'meh' (shrugs his shoulders)." There were 10 pastas on the menu. He doesn't like 80% of them. Again, love the honesty. I order the penne ala vodka. Turns out to be a really bad idea. Tastes like sauce from a jar. Sadly, I have to say it was the worst pasta I've ever had at a nice Italian restaurant.  Ordered dessert on the hope that I could leave on a good note. We order a chocolate mousse over meringue. Sounds delicious.  Unfortunately, a dense chocolate cake arrives. I tell our waiter that there's been a mistake. He says "this is the mousse." I look confused enough that he goes and checks with the kitchen. He comes back and says, "you're right. This is chocolate cake. We replaced the mousse with this."  I smile and thank him -  my thoughts turning to how quickly I can leave.
One of the best Italian restaurants I've ever been to! Some of my favorites include the Risotto Volare, Seabass, Salmon and Tiramisu for dessert. You won't regret it!

My husband & I went here this past Sunday after the marathon.  I ordered the gnocchi with arrabiata sauce and he got the linguine with white clam sauce.  I loved my gnocchi and the linguine was good as well!

Great Italian food.  A visiting friend of mine who's an Italian food connoisseur rated Volare as equivalent to the finest restaurants around his hometown (Cleveland, OH).  Definitely try their homemade pasta options, though you really can't go wrong with anything on their menu. Entree prices generally hover around $15-20, and portions are very large. Reservations are needed for dinner, as it tends to be very busy.

I went for lunch on a busy Thursday afternoon and it was some of the best service I've had in a long time. We were in and out with a great meal and inexpensive bill in under 45 min. We only ordered a half order of calarmi and the portion was huge. The pizza was only 7 bucks but you get what you pay for with it.

Very good food.  Date had gnocchi and I had seafood risotto.  However, come hungry because you will get tons of food!  No need to order an appetizer here if you are getting a pasta entree.  Also pretty loud when they pack patrons in on a Friday night.

If you're looking for reasonably-priced authentic italian, Volare is definitely the place to go. I went a few Saturdays ago when my family was in town, and their lasagna hit the spot. It came out bubbling, but it wasn't drowning in cheese as can sometimes be the case. I also had the Volare salad to start with, which came topped with artichokes and was a great spin on a standard house salad.  My only negatives for this place was that it was JAMMED on a Saturday night. I realize this is how most restaurants downtown are during the weekend, but literally the tables are so packed together it's really difficult to get in and out. If not for the insane number of people crammed in the restaurant, it really does feel like a classy little trattoria, and I'd definitely go again (though probably on a weeknight instead).

My colleague and I picked this restaurant based on Yelp reviews and were not disapointed.  I was surprised by the wide range of pastas and sauces to choose from.  The gnocchi was some of the best I've ever had; I paired this with the vodka sauce and requested some melted mozzarella on top.  The restaurant was incredibly busy so book in advance or sit at the bar as we did.  The service and food were still wonderful and we had the opportunity to meet some new people.  I highly recommend this restaurant!

Awesome penne vodka, and prices are very reasonable. I will warn you though, this is not a quiet restaurant. So if you are bothered by a noisy atmosphere then this might not be the place for you. As for me, the food was so great that the noise didn't really make an impact for me!

Went here based upon the other reviews, and I'm glad we did! The vodka sauce with ricotta ravioli and the arriabata with meatballs and gnocchi were both excellent. Make reservations, it fills up fast!

**sigh** I really wanted to like this place. Really, I did. I've always seen it filled with people and the people I work with LOVE this place. I've gone three times. I didn't like it the first time but I thought "maybe, they are having a bad day." So I gave it another shot. Second time I thought "well, I didn't like the people I was with so that's probably why I didn't care for the place." **sigh** So in I go for a third time and nope, I'm not crazy. The food's bad. It has no taste AT ALL and it was mushy. I had the shrimp risotto. I ate the four shrimps and those were good. But I ended up throwing away the full plate of risotto. I tried adding some salt and pepper but it wasn't working for me.

I would give this place 10 stars if I could.  We came here on a Monday night after a company event with a few coworkers.. the place was packed! Thankfully we were able to get seated quickly.. and on to the best part.. The wine was flowing.. reds and whites surrounded the table.. we started off with two salads, one was the Cesar and the other was an Italian garden - both super fresh. As we are a close team, we all decided to order something different and share.. my was the best..  The seafood risotto with blackened rice, scallops, shrimp, mussels and clams and squid was to die for. I still crave it weeks later! If you love seafood you MUST try this!  Also had the veal medallions with potatoes and steamed veggies, very tasty. The lemon vodka sauce really made that dish spark.  Unfortunately there was no room left for dessert, so I will just have to come back!
The gnocchi with vodka sauce was as good as everyone said. The cannolis for dessert were as good as the one I had at Mikes in the north end of Boston.

I would swim around in the risotto if I could. It was so good. Unfortunately, I only got to sample a small portion since I ordered the Gnocchi instead. I came with a big group and got to sample a little bit of everyone's dish and I must say that the Risotto definitely wins. The Gnocchi was A-OK, the Ravioli was a bit salty, the lasagna was way too meaty, the chicken, spaghetti and sausage was whatever but I can't stop thinking about the Risotto!!!

Yelp wins again!  This out-of-towner found a very good Italian near where he stayed. The Risotto is excellent.  The rice is blacked with squid ink and cooked just right.  The sea foods were plentiful and delicious: scallop, shrimp, mussels, clams, and, of course, squid.  Portion was generous for two, and we were glad that we shared.  Since the dessert, Tiramisu is authentic and good. It is a busy restaurant.  Make a reservation or be prepared to sit and the bar area that we did.  The service was prompt and courteous. Excellent.

Had the veal Teresa, substituted gnocchi with vodka sauce for the potatoes. The veal was good, gnocchi was okay. I also ordered an espresso, demitasse cup wasn't even half full. $4 for 1-2 tablespoons of espresso?!? On the plus side: Great atmosphere, nice bar, decent service. Offset by: Over-priced, merely adequate food.

Worked nearby for quite some time and never had the opportunity to dine at one of the few Italian restaurants nearby.  I was told by co-workers that is was overpriced and not flavorful.  I kept negating their ratings and finally ventured in for carry out.  I must say I was terribly disappointed.  I order the Pollo a Limon and the bruschetta.  Both were lame in taste.  The Pollo a Limon was a cheap piece of chicken in some flour based limon sauce.  The consistency was too thick and lacked of flavor.  The brushchetta was NOT accompanied by mozzarella but rather had cucumbers in the mix.  That was definitely not a taste I was looking for. Volare most certainly does not hold a candle to ANY of the Mia Francesca restaurants nor Tufanos.

Since we live so close, my husband and I have been dying to come to this restaurant for a long time. Surprisingly on Labor day weekend, they didn't have the lines that I've seen outside their door We were seated outside where they have heating lamps and it's a relaxing laid back atmosphere. I'd heard the inside restaurant might be a bit noisy but outside is great! We started with the riceballs appetizer which were very tasty but also very filling. They are fried on the outside and almost like a toasty meaty cheese risotto on the inside. Served plenty in an excellent fresh tomato sauce.  The remainder of our experience was just ok but mainly because we opted out of the traditional italian multiple courses which would have given us a more balanced meal. If we'd planned to go all out, it would have been a more balanced meal to order a salad in addition to our appetizer and main.  Instead, we just had the tasty but heavy rice balls, and our pasta dishes. Our pasta was literally just pasta and sauce with nothing else in it or on the side.  So i left my meal feeling very heavy.  i had ordered the gnocchi and vodka sauce while my husband ordered the homemade egg noodles and vodka sauce, and it was literally just a cream sauce with pasta, for 15-$17 each!! For an extra 3.50 we could have ordered a meat on our pasta, i guess. Also, I'm not a huge gnocchi fan but the waiter strongly recommended it, and while it was very good, it just isn't my cup of tea. The vodka sauce was good but honestly my mind wasn't like "OH WOW" like i was with pasta I've had at Coco Pazzo. I really wish i got a salad - the couple next to me ordered what looked like a mixed green salad and it look amazing!  Hoping my next experience is better at this place! Definitely want to come back to try more dishes!

I should have rethought going to Volare when the hostess was rude to me on the phone. After the horrible service from our waiter, never once came back to the table, almost hit my dining companion in the head with the menu, didn't offer dessert or coffee, threw the check down on the table, was extremely rude because 2 diners didn't care for cocktails & had an overall bad attitude. He actually chased out out to the sidewalk to yell "You forgot your change"!!! We had left a little less than 10% because that was how we felt the service provided was worth. I have NEVER been treated with such disrespect and certainly never been followed out of a restaurant by the server to complain to my face for a bad tip that was deserved. Shame on you Volare!

I cannot say enough about how much I enjoy this restaurant. My boyfriend and I first came here a few years ago while in vacation in the City.  When we decided to move to the area and scope out places to live, we wanted to make sure we came back to Volare. We returned on our most recent trip to Chicago before moving and the dishes were as delightful as ever. The wait on a Saturday night was probably about an hour, but worth the wait. We really didn't mind! I highly recommend the orecchiette (little ear) pasta with panna prosciutto e piselli sauce. It was worth every bite and every savory calorie! My boyfriend's order of penne with vodka sauce and chicken was also delish! I wish I had remembered the name of our waiter as she was fantastic - very friendly and knowledgeable. She let us enjoy our meal at a leisurely pace but was quick to respond to anything we needed.  I can't wait to live in the City and go back! I know my friends and family that visit will also fall in love with this great Italian locale!

I love this place. I  have been here two times now, both were great.  The ambiance is fantastic, small but not too small.  The food is also great, I especially like how you can pick your pasta and the sauce.  The service is also great.  This past time I was there I had Stephanie for a server and she was fantastic-very patient and friendly.  Great Italian spot in Chicago!
any veal dish is really good and you can amend it to get any of their homemade pastas! their Salmon capriccio appetiser special is also really good! Amazing service as well!!
good~not only the food but the service~ the price is a little bit high, but I will apreciate  the quality of the food and friendly waiter there~

Where to even begin! I just are here for the first time tonight and was astonished! My girlfriend and were sat right away at a table by a friendly hostess. Almost immediately after being seated our server took our drink orders. Our server was polite and friendly and helped us decide on an appetizer. Our drinks came out promptly, as did our appetizer soon after. The real star of the night was our main course. Their pasta is unbelievable and delicious. Their vodka sauce is out of this world. I can't wait to bring more people to this gem of a restaurant. I have an appointment with a client tomorrow and I know were we are going to lunch!

On a recent trip to Chicago, I was able to try Volare and I have it say it was some pretty good Italian food. I had my fav pesto pasta and it was delicious. The portions are a bit to large for me but definitely worth the price. Next time I'm in town I will come back!

There's a lot of buzz around certain famous or celebrity run restaurants in Chicago but I hadn't yet heard about Volare. We stumbled upon it while yelping restaurants in the lakefront area and we were pleasantly surprised. It was the best meal we've had in Chicago yet! It was a golden combination of fresh ingredients, delicious food and excellent service.  From the hostess, to the server and even down to the bus boy, everyone was pleasant, cheerful and FAST. The environment was loud and cheery--as you'd imagine of any authentic italian restaurant. Fresh focaccia with olive oil, delicious grilled seafood (calamari, shrimp, scallops) in basalmic vinegar, lobster raviolis were tasty but I found a tiny remnant of a shell in mine which you could take as a positive--they use real lobster meat. The linguine with clams was slightly too salty for my taste but had both fresh clams in their shell and a lot of different types of clams in the wine sauce. I only caught sand twice throughout the whole meal, which is pretty impressive.  We also had the brazillian sea bass, which they paired nicely with a light lemon butter sauce that did not overpower its freshness. They filleted the fish right at our table. Though not a perfect job (a few bones still left) it was definitely a nice touch for such a bustling restaurant.

My boyfriend and I read great reviews for this place so we decided to swing by and check it out on a Sunday night (it was a holiday weekend) and the wait was two hours-TWO HOURS on a Sunday night? That's insane, I know the next day was a holiday-but come on! So we passed and opted to go another time when we had reservations. So the next weekend, we had a group of 10 people with an 8:30 p.m. reservation my boyfriend had made the night before. Half of us arrived on time and they wouldn't seat us until we had our entire party, which is very common, but still not a best practice in mind (especially when we had a reservation). But when every one did show up, we were seated right away (which shows the table was ready). The restaurant is TIGHT. The table itself comfortably sat our party, but it was squished among the other tables, pressing our chairs up against the people behind us. Our waiter was there right away to take our drink orders and left us plenty of time to look over the menu. Most of us ordered a form of pasta with sauce (I had the gnocchi with pesto-which was amazing!). When the food came out-it all came out at once so no one was sitting there waiting for food while others had theirs. Everyone's dish was hot, so it was timed perfectly...something that doesn't usually happen for a large group. You're able to split the check a maximum of five ways, which is nice and not typical to find in the city. We opted to have one person pay and the rest would pay him back  as the majority of the people at the table worked together and it would be easy to give money. Overall the food was delicious and the drinks were decent (not too strong but not weaksauce either). The inside is tight and loud and we weren't seated until our party was there even though we had a reservation and our table was clearly ready. I would recommend this for a small or large party-but either way you better have a reservation!

This place is LOUD. So if you are expecting an opportunity to have a serious conversation, this is NOT the place. If my son would have a meltdown, no one would notice. It was kind of hard to have a conversation but overall the place is fun.  We shared the rice balls (I could have had the whole plate to myself) and I split the rigatoni with vodka sauce with my son. Our friends ordered the fried calamari which my son loved as well. My gin martini was done perfect! Loved that too! Everybody seemed to enjoy their selection including the dessert.  Parking was easy to find (before 7pm) on Grand Ave.

Good service and atmosphere. The food was disappointing. The meatball was dry, the antipasto plate was bland and boring (only two pieces of cheese and three small olives), and the clam plate was tiny. Thought I was getting something good with the broiled fish, but it was bland and had a few bones in it, which of course is notably bad. Gnocchi was decent, as was the vodka sauce. Chicago's a big city, and I'm sure you can find better Italian.

Took a friend here the other day on a lunch date for her birthday. We were very impressed with the service and the fact that the most of the guys working there were eye candy definitely helped!  I must admit we almost turned around and walked out because we stood at the hostess stand for several minutes before being acknowledged. Other than that everything was superb. The risotto was delicioso and the portions were GINORMOUS! We didnt even have room to finish. My friend was super impressed with her bday lunch and I didnt have to break my kids' piggy bank..SCORE!

The food itself was neither disgusting nor appetizing.  Got the seafood risotto.  Definitely have never seen black risotto before.  Taste-wise, just felt like seasoned with salt and seafood, nothing amazing, and kind of overcooked. Left Volare feeling pretty disappointed after hearing about how their risotto is suppose to be amazing.  The calamari was just okay as well. Was seated outside during early spring where there is "heating" but it's not very insulated that there are BIG lofty drafts of cold air.  NOT COOL, but cold -_-

This is a great place for a date.  The food is solid, and is not fussy, it is the Italian classics you want to find on an Italian menu.  It is a little loud, and was quite crowded.  You definitely need to make a reservation (maybe even a week in advance if there are more than 2 of you). I started with a half order of Ceasar salad.  I don't understand how so much salad only cost $4.  You would have to be nuts to get a full order.  My fiance ordered the oysters.  He said the first time he was at Volare he decided against ordering oysters because he though that for $9 they would not be good.  Then he saw someone else order them and realized he was wrong.  So he did end up ordering oysters this time around and loved them. I ordered tortelinni with vodka sauce as my main course.  The pasta was fresh, and the sauce was great.  The menu has build your own pasta dishes.  There is a list of several different pastas that you can match with whatever sauce you like.  Any classic Italian sauce and pasta are on the list, so there is something for everyone. My fiance ordered the four cheese risotto.  It was fantastic.  I liked what I ordered, but he definitely made the better choice.  The portions are huge, so he didnt complain when I ate half of his meal.  A four cheese risotto might sound heavy, but it wasn't.  It also had tender bites of chicken and peas (that were cooked perfectly - not mushy!). I ordered porfiteroles for dessert.  Unlike other variations, these had custard inside, and a scoop of vanilla gelato on top. I definitely recommend Volare.  The service was quick and friendly.  The food was excellent, and I am looking forward to going back!

I am from DeSoto county of north Mississippi. My husbands work requires that he spend a lot of time in Chicago. I go with him several times a year. I found Volare about seven years ago. We eat there at least twice on a two day trip and more during longer stays. I have lunch there by myself on days my husband is busy with work and I feel very at ease doing so. The food is the only thing that is better than the service at this wonderful place.

I think it is one of the best italian places I have eaten at in the city (granted I've only eaten at probably 20 of them). Their vodka sauce is incredible and so is the gnocchi. Only downfall is it is a little pricey, but so is most italian. I also love the atmosphere here, some-what mafia-ish and also like eating dinner at home with the entire family.
I had Dinner here Monday evening .This is my 2nd trip to Volare. I was not disappointed.The Lasagna was to die for.I love this restaurant.

What a great authentic Italian restaurant. If you love olive garden then beware of this place because you will not know anything about this kind of quality. On a warm day you can sit outside and enjoy a generous helping of deliciously fresh and creamy asparagus and shrimp risotto. Yummmm!!
Authentic Italian- high volume place, great "gravy", terrific aggressive service staff without a note pad in sight. Range of fare is outstanding but bring your "A" game- wallflower wimps not invited.

It gets really crowded, what made me assume it was outstanding. My experience was another. I ordered tortellinis on pesto with shrimp, and they were a bit too salty. The service was kind of slow because they messed up my order at first. What made the experience enjoyable was the barista. Besides gorgeous, she is fun.

This place is an a+.  I can't believe how good the food is at this place.  You can't go wrong eating here.   The owner and staff are top notch.  I would eat here every night if I could.  The best Italian food around.

We went to Volare last night, sat on the patio, had some wine, enjoyed our experience!  This is about the 4th time we have been to Volare and we have really enjoyed it each time.  The Squid Ink Risotto is amazing!  I had their fish special last night and it was quite wonderful as well!  The hostess was very nice and was able to find us a table on the patio which was unexpected but very appreciated.  That being said, the only reason why Volare gets a 4 is because of the noise in the restaurant (which we are thankful for having been seated outside).  We stood inside for about 15 minutes getting a glass of wine before dinner while we waited for our dinner and it was so loud we had to lean in to speak directly in each others ears.  Fortunately we were able to step outside and finish our wine on the patio where it wasn't so loud.  Thank you Volare!  We will be back!

We were here the week of the NRA show (National Restaurant Association) Mid May, 2011. There were six of us in the group. Again with recommendations from Yelp, we thought this would be a great place to go. Not so much. BUT, this places was packed! So much so, you could not get in and out of your seat, as you were stuck up against another diner. And the tables to the front of the place - had no walk way access at all!! Truly a problem if there was a fire. Just as I was thinking about a fire situation one of the other ladies mentioned how scary the thought of a fire would be, so it was on others minds as well. So now on to the food. One had the Risotto Volare (seafood of all kinds) She enjoyed it. Two had the fish special - and said it was just ok. I had Penne with the Arrabbiata sauce. The sauce was very good. You could tell it was homemade.  The food was ok good.  The palce was packed and crowded and very loud.  And for those reasons I don't see us returning, next time we are in Chicago.  Seriously the fire dept, should be taking a look at the place.  (But it is Chicago. lol)

We attempted to have lunch today, approximately 1:30ish, we were seated right away.  The dining room was not busy for that time of the day.
