Key Yelp: A great alternative to RoSals (i.e. old school southern Italian) in a more user friendly 'hood. Garlic, garlic, garlic!  Review: I needed to find a place to take a close friend for dinner who was in-town for a medical conference. The challenge was a last-minute reservation on a Sunday night. Voila, Volare to the rescue.  They put me in at my preference time of 8:30 pm, and the hostess even met my preference of putting us on the patio, now ensconced in plastic wrapping as prophylaxis from the harsh Chi-town winter. The smell of garlic hits as soon as you step foot at the corner of Grand and St. Clair. Yes, a very good sign.  Paul (or Paulee) was our waiter. VERY ATTENTIVE. Great service, made suggestions for wine and food. We shared some calamari which to me was the least compelling preparation other than the half portion we ordered, which was very big. The calamari rings were cut thicker than I like so the effect was a tad rubbery. The sauce was plain red, with a curious island of horseradish, floating off to the side. I generally eat horseradish with gefilte fish, not calamari, but OK.  The rest of the meal was very, very good with significant portions. I ordered a half a pasta as a primi piatti (clams w/white sauce). It was very very good. Comfort food for anyone who loves pasta, clams and garlic. Best dish of the night. I had a twist on saltimbocca, veal ala Teresa (I believe) essentially veal, spinach and mozzarella, in a sage like sauce. Very delicious, thin veal, again a lot of food, and some nice sides to compliment the veal.  My friend had a veal parm, which came with pasta which he commented was very very good. He lived in Providence RI for years so he knows good southern Italian. We shared a half bottle of a delicious Italian pinot and the total bill was $113 and change, before tip. Very reasonable for a city dining experience and the quantity of food.  Not a first date place (not that I date anymore), but great for friends, a loved one and fun-bonding. I like RoSals on Taylor very much. This place does not have the same vibe and the food at RoSals is better, based on this one experience. But the service here was great, it did not take up a whole evening like dinner at RoSals can do because of the tiny kitchen and when you finish up, you walk outside and you are in the city. I'm going back, mos def.

Great food, gets very crowded for lunch but service is still good. Bread is yum, vodka sauce is excellent, great with drink refills and always have asked if they could get our table more bread. I had delivery of their food once, and would not do that again, as everything was lukewarm and overcooked, but I can't expect much else with delivery from a third party delivery service, I am sure it sat awhile!
This place has wonderful Itlaina food. The vodka sauce is amazing, people are very nice, and the service is great.

Great food, slow and inattentive service, 3 stars because of that. Nice outdoor seating, but we did dine at 2PM...so the traffic was slow-ish.  No reservation needed at that time, but I see how it could be busy during prime dining hours.  Calamari and zucchini appetizer was great (and the zucchini made it feel "healthy" although it was fried  :)  ).  The bread brought to the table was warm and two choices- Italian loaf and a tomato bruschette topped yummy thing.  Had the gnocchi with the vodka sauce (and cheers to the fellow yelpers who recommended that), and my fellow diner had the same sauce with the rigatoni.  Seriously, share an entree or get the 1/2 portion.  Unless you're a sumo wrestler, you'll be in a world of hurt.  I had no room for the highly recommended tiramisu, and that makes me angry.

I can always count on Volare for reliably tasty Italian in satisfyingly large portions, at a very reasonable price. And yes, it has a ginormous wine list. I probably would have given it 5 stars if service hasn't been PAINFULLY slow during my last 2 visits. Very disappointing since I had such a great experience my first couple of times there :(

This is a place where you have to know what to order.  Luckily, when you go there with a group, you can sample a lot of dishes. First off, if you are a vegetarian, your choices will be limited.  Also, a lot of dishes are so-so (lasagna, I'm looking at you).  But both the vodka sauce and all'arrabbiata are great, and worth getting again and again.  They also let you choose your pasta and your sauce, which both liberates you and invites failure (really, certain pastas do go with certain sauces). It's definitely not Italy, and it's not even NY/NJ/Philly, but it's worth a shot.  Just be sure to make a reservation.

great service and pasta dishes. I have had the Salomnata and the alfredo, risotto, and sampled some chicken parm all of it was delish. sevice is great but the atmosphere needs work so it can match the food. Weird thing: they ran out of wine glasses when i was there.... and the onion soup was a little icky... but all and all great food!!!!

I'm writing this review on the heels of a meal which lasted nearly three hours and involved quite a few glasses of wine.  This may or may not be some kind of disclaimer.   I headed here with a group of 8 for a work dinner to celebrate the birthday of one of my gallery's artists.  Conversation ran the gamut of the human experience covering everything from key parties, to internet porn, to veganism, to the danger of owning too many electronics, to the relevance of Jeff Koons in contemporary art.   Back on topic, the range of our  food was similarly diverse.    We began with an antipasti platter including some lovely bruschetta, tomatoes with fresh mozzrella, a variety of meats and olives.  We also had a huge platter of fried calamari which was light and crisp, though I wish it had been served with marinara instead of cocktail sauce.  My boss' husband chose a great chianti classico of which we managed to down 3 bottles, though our choice of white had to be sent back.  My entree, a grouper special, was absolutely delicious and perfectly sized portion wise.  Another dining companion had orecchiete with a cream sauce that was perfect and not too heavy.  We enjoyed a variety of desserts including the birthday boy's amazing tiramisu and I finished off my meal with with the housemade limoncello which impressed even the one of us who had lived in Italy.   Service was attentive but not oppressive, and the atmosphere was lively if a bit cramped.  The menu offers something for a variety of tastes and price ranges.  I'm shocked and embarrassed that I'd never been here before, but I'll certainly make another visit.

I'm giving it a middle of the road review b/c the service was good but I probably ordered the wrong thing.  Started with a half-order of the calamari, which comes with a cocktail sace and is as large as a full order at most other restaurants.  Bland batter.  The fried rice balls with meat inside and some marinara were nothing special to me. The ossa bucco over risotto special the waiter described sounded good, but I think I thought ossa bucco was something else.  It was just some cooked shank meat with some diced veggies over rice and a little gravy.  The ravioli in vodka sauce was not bad.  I'd be willing to go back for the attentive service and try some pesto gnocchi.

Volare for great authentic Italian Volare serves some of the best authentic Italian food in the city. I can't recall a better lasagna Bolognese, even thought it was a calorie splurge. The portions of the pasta dishes can be behemoth. The trick with Volare is to know when to go. You can wait hours for a table if you don't have a reservation [or go somewhere else], or arrive on a Tuesday at 5:30 and get a table right away. The room feels subterranean as it sits under Michigan Avenue making it feel dark and dank rather than moody and warm. The tables are crammed in tight too and on a busy night you're likely to be rubbing elbows with your neighbor, which isn't necessarily a bad thing, it really depends on your neighbor and how s/he feels about it. Don't skip the pasta course, especially if you're going with an entree [secondi] that doesn't have pasta. You can choose from about 12 different pastas and 6 different sauces to create your favorite. Entrees are classic, from Chicken Parmesan to Veal Scaloppini and one of my favorite vegetables to get when it is in season is the rapini. You don't see a lot of rapini on Chicago menus. It's a nice treat. I'm not big on restaurant desserts, but it's hard to resist cannoli with real fresh whipped cream or crème caramel [my favorite]. A friend of mine swears the tiramisu is the best in town. Get thee to Volare!

I was expecting to be wowed because of all the awesome reviews. It was just ok to me bu maybe it's because of what I ordered. I tried the calamari which was just ok and the risotto (the 4 cheese risotto) was not impressive at all. It really didn't taste authentic. But, I'll give it another try...

Stopped here late one night for dinner around 10:30PM while visiting Chicago and was pleasantly surprised. We only waited a few minutes at the bar for a table and the service was great. We ordered 2 out of the 3 specials for that night, gnocchi and veal on the bone, and both were amazing. This was some of the best Italian we've had, and we've both been to Boston's North End a lot, living nearby. If I'm in Chicago again, I'll hit up Volare for sure.

As Borat would say, "Very nice, wanna sexy?" Indeed, that is what Volare offers in its fabulous Italian dishes - great and wonderful tasting food.  Top that fresh pasta and lightly coated calamari with a bottle of red wine and you have a gift from both Romulus and Remis (the mythic founders of Rome, FTWDNK*). You can just sit outside, have your meal and enjoy the pedestrian and light city activity in front of the restaurant. Although, Volare is in the heart of downtown Chicago, its far enough from the bustling and hyperactive shopping districts of downtown Chicago, to dine in urban peace. FTWDNK - "For Those Who Do Not Know" - if you didn't catch that acronym. You wont find that in Urban Dictionary!
Having lived in the North End of Boston for 10-years, I know Italian. This place is the real deal. The staff is very friendly and genuine and the food is so good.  Go there. Now.

Simply one of the best Italian restaurants in the city. A cut above the rest, Volare is quaint in it's footprint to the east of Michigan avenue. I suggest to anyone who is looking for a dining experience not too "touristy." A very laid-back experience, Volare has a standard Italian menu and daily chef specials (which take creativity to another level). I couldn't recommend one thing..so I say "try it all." You'll receive huge portions, and an excellent wine pairing.  The only disappointing part of an experience I had on one of my visits was that we were celebrating a birthday (on the actual birthday) and they didn't seem to care. No free dessert or anything.

Quick drink and a nosh after work with a girlfriend. The waiter could NOT have been more charming, as he flirtatiously told us the specials - even though we only stopped for wine and a snack. Excellent waiter, really on his game. Our seafood salad was fresh n' fine - perfect appetizer for two, and the Pinot Grigio was crisp and chilled. Service was prompt and unobtrusive without being neglectful. I was only there for a brief respite, but it was enough to recommend, and come back. Far enough off Michigan Avenue to avoid traffic noise, but close enough to still have that irresistible city bustle. Oh, and the guys that sent over drinks to our table? You're cute, but we noticed your wedding bands. No thanks, darlings.

Just came here for a work lunch. I will definitely come back on a lunch break or with out of town guests. It is conveniently right off Michigan for those visitors wanting to do a day of shopping. The staff here is so friendly and fun! They were really trying to drive it home with some limoncello, but I'm pretty sure none of us would've gotten work done if we ended our meal with it.  I got the eggplant parmesan--portion was great for leftovers and it really hit the spot. My coworkers dishes also looked really great and I'm tempted to try the shrimp risotto next time. Lots of "pesce" dishes for seafood fans!

I had heard so much about this place and how great their food and their service was and so I was excited to learn that my brother's girlfriend was going to celebrate her birthday dinner here.  The reservations were made almost 2 weeks in advance, but they didn't end up seating us until about an hour and a half after we were all there. On top of that, they gave our seats to this other party because someone in the other party knew someone at the restaurant.  We finally got a seat outside and I thought that maybe it would be better from here on out. But no, we didn't get service right away and I had to actually go get our menus. We ordered appetizers and then ordered wine. The wine was not chilled at all. The appetizers (fried calamari and something else I can't remember) was not that great. I've had better calamari at Goose Island.  I liked the fact that I could order any type of noodle and mix it with any sauce, so I ordered the pappardelle with an arrabiata sauce (a spicy tomato sauce with garlic and four cheese), and my wive ordered the pollo vesuvio. I figured, whatever, if the food is as good as everyone says it is, then it was worth it. Again, I was hugely disappointed. My pasta was on the salty side and the sauce tasted like marinara sauce because I couldn't taste the spice or the garlic. My wife's order was also a bit too salty.  All in all, I was disappointed with this place, especially with all the reviews that I have read here. The place obviously gets a lot of business because it was packed and I'm not sure whether that contributed to the whole experience I had or not. But what I do know is that I will not be returning here anytime soon.

Everything was wonderful from start to finish! We were greeted warmly and attended to well. The Insalate Volare was interesting and delicious. Then we tried one of the specials: lobster filled ravioli. I cannot remember having eaten better ravioli in my 51 years of life! Can't wait to go back!

I'll keep it simple. This place is the best. They offer a variety of noodles that you can pair with your choice of sauce. They have spectacular soups, so delicious that I will order their soup despite the 90 degree weather. They offer great specials and seasonal seafood. The staff are some of the best in Chicago dining. I think it is safe to say that their marinara is the best I have ever had.  Order the penne with marinara and add some sliced italian sausage, you won't regret it.  Here's a tip, go early. The place is on the small side with the exception of the added outdoor seating in the summer. It fills up fast and the bar/high table dining area can get a bit cramped. Still worth the wait though. Bravo.

This place is a great lunch spot for something slightly more formal/upscale without breaking the bank or waiting forever for a table. The service is always efficient and there is never a long wait for a table. They have very pleasant waiters who are very knowledgeable about their menu. I usually get one of their salads and I am never disappointed. The pasta is great too -- but SO filling you have to beware of falling asleep at your desk after lunch! :)

Looking for a place to eat that was close to our hotel on a rainy night, we found Volare.  It was totally hopping and we were thankful to be seated without waiting.  They seated us at one of the taller tables near the door.  That area of the restaurant had an extremely hectic feeling about it that didn't make for the most relaxing of meals.  The service was great, but the pace of the place was just a bit much.  There was also an unsavory smell in the place, like an aroma of a wet mop that has been sitting around too long.   The food was good, but not spectacular.  It didn't seem to me to warrant the crowd that was there.  It wasn't bad, just not anything I would run and tell all my friends that they must try immediately.  I will say that it's a good place for vegetarians though.  The mix and match pasta & sauce menu allows for many choices.  Often vegetarians only have one or two choices, so it's always nice to have a variety.

I cannot believe I have not yet reviewed Volare. Thank you, Yelp. I found Volare and its amazing reviews last year, and I've taken my mom out here every time she visits. For the location and the deliciousness, this is definitely an amazing deal.  We always get the mussels to start, with a white wine sauce. It's delicious and delightfully well prepared. Last time I was here, mom got the lobster ravioli with lobster sauce - it was a special and absolutely fantastic. I got the spaghetti with jumbo shrimp. Now, a lot of restaurants use fancy words to describe their food, and lots of exaggeration, so when my shrimp came out - and they were really JUMBO - I was surprised in a good way. And it was delightful. Dessert was also great as I remember, but by then we were finishing off a bottle of wine. Oh yeah, the wine list is amazing... pages and pages long, and pretty interesting. Yet, there are so many reasonably priced ($35-45) wines that you don't have to feel like you're breaking the bank to have a little red to accompany your meal. Such a delight! And the service is perfect... nothing short of that.  The only thing I would say is make a reservation and be on time for it! The place is packed on weekends, and walking-in is not recommended!!
They've lost a star because they've changed their perfect recipe for Rigatoni alla vodka and it's just not as good....what a shame.

I normally don't go out for Italian food because pasta is pasta to me and I honestly can't tell the difference between $20 spaghetti and spaghetti in a box. This place put me to shame and made me realize, "Hey, it doesn't just have to taste like tomatoes." The ambiance is super intimate, and I recommend it for a first date or anniversary. Or, it's also nice for a smaller group. The lighting is low, there's candles on the tables and the waitstaff are friendly and very courteous. Make reservations, and request something away from the bar as it gets quite noisy.  The location is a bit odd (tucked away off lower Grand Ave.), but the atmosphere and the wonderful food more than make up for it!

I normally don't go out for Italian food because pasta is pasta to me and I honestly can't tell the difference between $20 spaghetti and spaghetti in a box. This place put me to shame and made me realize, Hey, it doesn't just have to taste like tomatoes.  The ambiance is super intimate, and I recommend it for a first date or anniversary. Or, it's also nice for a smaller group. The lighting is low, there's candles on the tables and the waitstaff are friendly and very courteous. Make reservations, and request something away from the bar as it gets quite noisy.  The location is a bit odd (tucked away off lower Grand Ave.), but the atmosphere and the wonderful food more than make up for it!
Had a touristy feel. Thought the service as sub-par, and the food over or under cooked. It was obvious that it had been siting out before it was served. I won't be going back.

I have to say that all the good reviews were right of Volare...the service is great, and the food is excellent.  We chose to eat here after looking at the good reviews for this restaurant and we weren't disappointed.  Fiance had the linguine with white clam sauce, excellent, and I had the gnocchi with ham & peas in a light cream sauce, excellent as well.  This is a definite try if you're looking for good Italian food.
I adored the service, I adored the focaccia, my gnocci was little balls of heaven in an angel-tear broth. We enjoyed a late lunch here and I recommend you do the same.

Great food. Great service. Good prices. Large portions. Not skimpy on the meat/seafood either. Try the linguine with salmon or the shrimp white wine marinara spaghetti. If you want to order salad, get dressing on the side, our caesar was a little over-dressed.

Truly some of the best Italian I've had in my life. Really simple dishes that are outstanding. Husband had the veal scallopini, and I had the shrimp with wine marinara over spaghetti. Sounds pedestrian, but the shrimp were huge, and grilled with a smoky flavor. All the ingredients were amazing. This place gets insane, so we did have to wait almost a half hour even though we had a reservation, but there's a bar to get your drink on at, so I was all good. The only setback was that its a kind of stressful place to eat - its small, so everything is kind of loud and crazy. But its totally worth it. I dont even have anything witty or snide to say! I wish I lived in Chicago if only for this restaurant.

Best gnocchi with alfredo sauce that I have ever had at a restaurant.  It melted in my mouth.  If I lived there, I think I'd be a regular. A little small and cramped inside the dining room for a Monday night, but still great service and the food was well worth it.

This is the only Italian restaurant that I really like!  I was really surprised with the food and I had a great time with my friends.  We came on a early Saturday night and it was PACKED!  I was really surprised because I thought the location was random.   We were seated immediately and had great service all night.  My friends and I ordered 3 entrees and they were good sizes and very tasty.  I loved the seafood risotto the most.  The seafood was spicy (but not too spicy) and the rice was really fluffy.   I highly recommend this restaurant for any occasion because it's kinda fancy but can be casual too.  You will definitely love the food!

Volare is a true find and the fact that it is packed every night should tell you that something special awaits at this family owned gem on the SE corner of Grand and St. Clair. When I first moved to town, my wife and I decided to try out Volare on a Tuesday night but could not get a table it was so crowded.  Thinking it was a fluke, we tried again the next night with the same result -- far too long of a wait without a reservation.  The hostess made us a reservation for the following night and predicted that "you're going to love our food".  The third try was the charm and she was absolutely correct -- it was love at first bite.   Since then I've been there dozens of times with friends, family and business colleagues and it never disappoints.  I have been to other highly regarded Italian restaurants in the city and while many are quite good (Orso's, La Scarola, Il Mulino, Mia Francesca), I haven't found one that beats Volare for the amazing food, outstanding and professional service and reasonable prices.   Be sure to make a reservation because it is crowded every night of the week.  But, even if you have to wait, it is well worth it.  Have some had a bad experience?  It seems so, but after 10 plus years I'm sure Volare would admit they can't hit a home run with every customer (hey, even Jordan had his "off nights").   But go there just a few times and you'll see why it's so good.  You'll also notice the owners, servers and managers walking around greeting familiar faces with hugs and kisses on any given night -- they've created one of the best Italian restaurants around and have a devoted following of customers to show for it.  Count me as one of them.

I've been to this Streeterville location twice now and will definitely say the first time was far superior than the second.   This restaurant is only good to go on a slow, weekday night.  After my experience on Sunday night of Memorial Day weekend it was decided they can't handle a large crowd. We had no wait and sat outside the first time we went (a Thursday night in August). We ordered bruschetta to start, the Ravioli with Marinara as my course and my bf had the Scaloppine di Vitello al Limone.  All I can say is YUM!   The second time, not so much.  We asked to sit outside as it was too nice of a night not to and were told 30 minutes.  Well 45 minutes went by and then we were told a specific time they would sit us and that was not for another 20-25 minutes.  Not happy.  They instead seated us right away inside.  Our waitress - all I can say is she must have smoked something strong before showing up to work because she was in LALA land.  We ordered salads to start and about 20 minutes after we were finished with them our waitress informed us that she told the kitchen we were "ready" for our meal.  An HOUR and FIFTEEN minutes after ordering, we were served our cappelini marinara, chicken parmesan, and chicken vesuvio - yes, no filets - it took that long for pasta and chicken! The manager was nice enough to give us a "dessert tray" on the house which consisted of a piece of tiramisu (which I got horribly sick off of), some tasteless cookies, and a few pieces of day old fruit. I'm not sure I will be making another appearance here....
This is the only place that I bring leftovers home and actually eat them! Homemade egg noodles and bolognese sauce is delicious!  I've never had room for dessert, so I can't comment on that.

I'd been wanting to try this place forever, but it's always really crowded.  We finally managed to go on a week night (I'd highly recommend Volare for a dinner/movie date night; the AMC is a few blocks away). The staff was friendly and seemed genuinely glad we were there.  I really liked the pick-your-own sauce and pasta option, so I ordered pappardelle with arrabiatta sauce.  I will say that there were about ten other things on the menu, not including the four specials the waiter suggested, that I also could have eaten.  The pasta was fresh and delicious and there was a ton of it.  Best leftovers ever!  My boyfriend raved about the Caesar salad, which featured a giant anchovy plopped on top.  If you like that kind of thing. I have to go back a few more times before I bestow upon Volare my "favorite Italian" award (which currently resides comfortably with Sapori Trattoria on Halsted), but it's definitely up there.

Thank you fellow yelpers for this recommendation!  We had lunch here after my annual mammogram.  Basically not an activity I like, so I decided to do something fun afterwards.  This defintely fit the bill. We (me, hubby and my son who is 4), got here at 11:30 and we were the only ones in the restaurant!  Kind of weird, but it didn't keep me from ordering some wine.  There were tons of waitstaff just standing around talking, so I was kind of disappointed that they weren't more attentive. As far as the food goes, everything was great.  We got some calamari, a Volare salad, some risotto and a chicken panini (for the little man).  We enjoyed it all.  More people arrived closer to 12, so the creepy factor disappeared. This really isn't a place for kids.  There is no kid menu and there's no where for them to wander.  That was ok with us since we had the one mellow kid with us.  He had a great time!

After hearing nothing but great reviews for Volare. I decided to give this place a shot. BIG MISTAKE. I think the only reason why Volare got such high reviews is because most of the the reviewers are tourists and do not know GOOD Italian food. First, I had the Calamari . Which was medicore at best. It was very chewy, bland, and felt like I put a wad of juicy fruit in my mouth. Second, I had some Bruschetta. HINT: TOMATOES ARE SUPPOSE TO BE MARINATED IN BALSAMIC VINAGAR AND OLIVE OIL. THIS  bruschetta was served on STALE Italian  bread, and topped with tastless tomatoes and Kraft cheese. The Olive Garden has more Italian cooking skills then Volare. Last, I had the Chicken Parmesan. What a waste of 16 dollars. The chicken was about 5 inches thick, topped with nasty store-bought sauce, and again Kraft cheese. This place is a joke. For real Italian cusine. Save yourself the trip and the hefty check, and go to Sabatino's 20 minutes away from Volare on the north side. And try some real Italian food. Volare, "fly" yourself back to whereever you came from, because your sureley not from Italia.

I am in the windy city and I exited to see what they have to offer, Bewildered and amazed by all the Beautiful buildings and friendly people, I wander through the streets of Chicago. I must say that we got great service from our Romanian waiter, friendly, fast and efficient. For starters I got a mixed seafood grill, Grigliata Mista, with Shrimp, Scallops and squid that was just OK, Squid was unnecessarily chewy. But then came the Gnocchi with Peas and ham in a cream sauce, I am a big fan of very little sauce, but I can deal with a fair amount of sauce. But this is like soup......soup? What is with this town? Pizza is like soup, pasta is like soup, this whole town smells like soup! This is crap and I can't eat it, I am grumpy. My bosses Scaloppa di Vitello zii Teresa, a veal scallop with spinach and cheese was not as terrible as fingernail torture. I was not going to risk dessert. Bummer

Really, really yummy. Took my friend here when she came to visit in September...were able to sit outside and people watch, which was fun. The food is delicious; I think we both had the gnocchi with the vodka tomato cream sauce, and I still think about it sometimes, the sauce was so rich and mouth-watering. Didn't go inside so don't know what it's like in there, but really try this place out if you want some tasty italian food!

I love, love, love this place. In three visits, I have not tried one thing that I have been disappointed in. The calamari (both styles) are the best I've found. The wine is great. The outdoor seating is great. I've always had attentive waiters. Last visit I had plain angel hair with aglio-olio and it still made me ridiculously happy because it was so delicious. My sister-in-law felt that her martini was not made with the correct vodka, but she still drank it. Some people have mentioned that they waited beyond their reserved time, which I haven't experienced but I would totally wait. I can't wait for my next visit and I was just there yesterday!

We order this so much for work, that I kinda just take this place for granted. I forget that they are a quality Italian restaurant with a nice dining room. Their delivery is super quick, under 30 min. Granted the are right next door to us. The food is always great. The lasagna is a monster. But my recent favorite is the seafood salad appetizer. The bruschetta was good, went downhill, but now is back again. The grilled salmon is awesome. And the house salad is ridiculously well priced. Last time I went to pick up, and wish I could have stayed to eat in the dining room. A classy place.

You will be surprised when you see how crowded this place gets even on a weeknight, because it's true the building is kind of sketchy.  I made reservations the day before, and when got seated right away. Our waiter was very friendly and helpful.  My friend and I started of with a string bean salad - the sweet balsamic was very memorable. Then we shared the "daily special" seafood pasta. Delicious. Then we ordered the tiramisu which was pretty tasty as well.  I think the prices are pretty standard.  I can't wait to go back and try their famous gnocchi and vodka sauce pasta.

I went with a few of my girlfriends the night before the Shamrock Shuffle to get our carb fix.   Overall, it was an excellent experience.  Service was right on par, and the food was good.  We started with the fried calamari, not the best I've ever had, but it was good.  They put a little horseradish in the cocktail sauce.  Yummy! Then the 4 of us ordered 3 entrees to share, the seafood risotto, gnocchi in cream sauce with proscuitto and peas, and rigatoni in bolognese (sp?) sauce.  The risotto was made with black rice and wasn't creamy, but more acidic with the red sauce that came on top.  It was OK, but I like the creamy risottos better.  The pastas were also good.   The tiramisu was my favorite part of the meal - even though I had to be a little persistent to order it.  Thanks girls!!!  :) I loved the atmosphere, and I think we fit right (or I like to think so because we were being loud, as usual), and the host said bye to us many times.  So friendly!!!  I hope to be back!!!

We went on a Monday night before a movie, so we didn't have problems with waiting for a table like other Yelpers, although we did have reservations anyhow.  I thought that the service was AMAZING, our waiter was great and was happy to make suggestions off of the menu.  The food- I liked it... I think i spent the entire time comparing it to Sapori Trattoria in Lakeview which is my favorite. If i was in the area again i think that i would definitely go back.  I had a pasta with vodka sauce and Chicken. It was tasty, nothing outstanding.  My friend had the special which was Gnocchi with Italian sausage and she said it was really yummy. I was impressed with the Caprese salad that we split, and there was something great about the balsamic.  Overall i think it was good, i would go back.

This place is fantastic. The food makes up for the wait and semi unfriendly service. Seriously...the food is FANTASTIC! With a reservation, you can plan on waiting about 30 minutes...past the reservation time. Without a reservation, you can plan on waiting an hour or more. If you can tough out the wait though, the food is truly worth it.

Don't let the facade of the building fool you, this place is good.  Really.  The vodka sauce is really tasty over capellini.  We also got the clams as a appetizer, and for $8.00 you get 6 half clams (stuffed), which translates to 3 whole clams - in other words, I thought that was a bit of a rip off.  The clams were good, but extremely pricey.

We had reservations, but we still had to wait 30+ minutes, which really didn't bother me. The place was a mad house when we walked in. The staff was top notch. I ordered the gnocci with pesto sauce, which was awesome. Ordered tiramisu  for dessert which was one of the best I've ever had though I could have done without the white chocolate drizzle. Looking forward to going back to try something else on the menu.

This is my favorite Italian restaurant in Chicago.  Eating at Volare is like eating in Italy.  It's so yummy!  It's also always hopping, so make sure to make a reservation before you go.  My favorite items to order are the Insalata Volare (you can ask for a half portion of the salad if you're not looking to share) and I love to get the spaghetti with marinara.  I know it sounds so boring, but the sauce has Parmesan cheese in it and it makes it almost creamy.  The great thing about Volare is you can order all the traditional dishes, or you can mix and match your noodles and sauces (my husband loves the gnocchi a la vodka sauce).  Plus they always have great specials.  It can be pretty close quarters when the restaurant gets busy and a bit noisy, but the food is well worth it.  The service is always speedy and no nonsense.  I recommend going in the summer when you can sit outside at their sidewalk cafe.  If you're looking for a delicious Italian meal, Volare will not disappoint.

One of my favorite Italian restaurants anywhere. This is a great place to go with anyone - friends, boyfriends, parents, etc. The food is classic Italian and well cooked. I usually go for the fettuccine alfredo or the angel hair pasta with white wine clam sauce. One time I splurged on the veal special - always risky when they never tell you the price! don't you hate that? - ha ha it was more than my pasta but excellent.  Volare lets you mix and match pastas and sauce, and it's not just tomato and alfredo. They have a great salmon sauce as well. The portions are very generous and such a great deal. I love it here - the atmosphere and food make you feel like you're dining at a old-school Italian place where Tony Soprano could sit down next to you. Fabulous. Note: Absolutely make reservations. Sometimes you'll wait even with reservations, but it is so worth it.

went here with my friend Danielle a couple of weeks ago totally expecting no line and a nice quiet restaurant where we could chat and catch up.  wrong!  this place was hopping with the after work crew, from the twenty somethings, to the oldies.  definitely a place to sip on some vino eat a delectable meal, and do some quality people watching!   i had vodka sauce with the rigatoni (you order the vodka sauce as the meal and then pick the pasta).  i guess this place is known for it, and I can taste why!  hands down, bestttt vodka sauce i've ever had in my life.  so rich, so tasty, the perfect savory combination.  danielle ordered chicken parm and got a side of the penne with vodka sauce. delic!   danielle's favorite restaurant was rosebud, now i think there is definitely some competition. the only reason i couldnt give it five stars is the 20 minute wait we had to get a table.  not only did we have a reservation, but they make you stand in the most inconvenient place for the whole restaurant, and it just makes you feel in the way and uncomfortable. still, ill for sure be back soon!

one of my favorite italian places in the city (and i'm a tough critic since all of the cooks in my family are straight from italy). the host has always been accommodating and nice to me and my boyf and although it's tight in there and always busy, he seems to have the place under control. (just don't go there for a quick lunch - i second Brett D. on this one, since it's very busy then and you might wait long for a table). in the summer, they have outdoor seating, which is all i look for when dining in the warm months.  i love love LOVE the grilled (not fried) calamari that is grilled in balsamic, what a nice touch - and you can get this on a salad if you would like.  volare always delivers a good meal and good service. mangia!

This restaurant is an average, at best, chicago italian place.  However it comes at a very high price. Basically, I think this place stays in business because of tourists.   There are very good places available for 1/2 the cost.

Our hotel recommended Volare to us and it should have tipped us off that it would be touristy when they gave us pre-printed directions but we decided to go anyways. We were starving. We started out with the calamari which was overfried and kind of shriveled. It was served with plain mayo and cocktail sauce. Blech. The main entrees were much better. One thing I really liked was the menu set up: you could mix and match the type of pasta and sauce you wanted. If you picked something that might not go well together (i.e. a cheese pasta with a seafood sauce), the waiter would suggest another combination. I ended up having the ravioli di ricotta with vodka and my friend had the linguine with vino bianco. Both were pretty good. Overall I would say the food is between 2 and 3 stars. Service was nice and efficient. Our waiter looked like Tag, Rachel's boy toy from "Friends" so that provided a few laughs.

My boyfriend took me here last sunday night for a celebratory dinner and we were both very excited with all the wonderful reviews...but we were disappointed. Our server was very unfriendly and frequently walked away from our table while my boyfriend was still talking to her. The other servers seemed much more friendly, but ours reminded me of  those angry at life 4 am diner waitresses.  We ordered the calamari appetizer that we read yelpers rave about and it was pretty good (the full order was very large) until we found a black hair  (and we are both blond) winding its way through the calamari.  We told our waitress and she promptly  removed it and offered another batch, but we passed.  My boyfriend ordered one of the specials, osso bucco ($27) and I ordered linguine with clams in white sauce($17 i think). Both were very good, but really nothing to write home about. But maybe we were a little jaded from our server and the hair. We have decided we do want to go back and try different things, hopefully i will have to update this review with much better things to say!

I've always noticed that Volare gets some pretty amazing Yelp reviews. The reason I've never been there (before last night) is that I just love my La Scarola so if I'm going for Italian food I'm all about La Scarola. But last night we were looking for a good restaurant near the movie theater and figured it was time I gave Volare a fair chance. And I"m still all about La Scarola, but have to admit that the food and atmosphere at Volare isn't far behind. This place is absolutely packed so don't expect to be seated right away- even with a reservation.  We had 7:45 reservations and enjoyed a glass of wine at the bar before getting seated at 8:15. But once seated the waiter did a really great job of moving things along so there wasn't any worry about missing our movie. I was absolutely famished so I was excited to see the warm bread basket they placed on our table.  Bread so warm and soft that it's impossible to eat just 1 piece!  For an appetizer we got our usual grilled calamari, but at Volare it also comes with shrimps and scallops. The sauce has a bbq tang to it and tastes exactly like the grilled calamari at La Scarola, but Volare scores an extra star for adding shrimp and scallops to theirs! YUM! As far as our entrees I tried to pick the healthiest option (new years resolution) and went with the pollo vesuvio.  This chicken was extremely tasty and the peas were a nice touch- the potatoes that came with it probably weren't so healthy, but still good!  As far as what my fiance ordered... I have this new plan where I encourage him to get something that I'd want if I wasn't on a diet just so I can have a little taste.  When the waiter mentioned the pesto pasta served with shrimps and scallops I nodded very encouragingly and made it clear how delicious that sounded.  The fiance took the bait and ordered it.  However, my plan backfired when this entree was so delicious that I ate half of it- so much for that little taste! No dessert for us since I basically had 2 entrees, but I'm sure it's wonderful.  My loyalty remains with La Scarola, but I'll definitely pay Volare another visit soon!

Best lobster bisque I've ever had, yo. We went there for dinner for a friend's birthday and it was very nice. The waitress was great and she answered all of our question. Back to lobster bisque, the texture is so seriously right, the taste is dope and a bit of lobster in every bite.  Mmmmm. I can taste it now. The tiramisu was pretty good. I liked, not loved it.

The place was GREAT! I found this place after the awesome reviews on Yelp (Thanks!!), and it was even better than I expected. But before I get into how good it was... there was one downside.... The place is EXTREMELY crowded. If you prefer an intimate dinner with your loved one... look elsewhere! The service wasn't perfect, but it was pretty good. We had a big group (10+ people) and they were very accommodating. While I am very picky with my Italian food, the food was definitely excellent. They have a decent wine list as well, which is a plus for those of you that expect a authentic Italian dining experience. Throw in lots of people, a loud room, red wine, some spaghetti and meatballs the way mamma made it in the old country, and an affordable check at the end of the meal.... this is your new home!

Went here for my graduation party with 13 people. They did a great job of cramming us all into a really small packed place. The food was a amazing. I love love love gnocchi, and this was AMAZING! It is definitely worth the price.

My husband and I felt like we were on the set of "The Sopranos" when we walked into Volare. Great old school Italian atmosphere. It was a bit crowded and loud. It's probably better for families and large groups than couples. But if you're there for the food, not romance, it's great. The minestrone soup was hearty. And the gnocchis with marinara were delicious. I think it was the marinara sauce, though, that made me melt. The portions are very generous. Decent wine list. Very friendly and attentive staff. Make reservations on OpenTable, cause there were lot of folks out on the street waiting for a table.

I guess not getting the rissoto was bad luck. Went here for my birthday and unfortunately there was a Christmas party going on as well. This group was insanely loud and rude due to over consumption of the booze, and I was quite suprised the manager or owner did not ask them to quiet down. Several tables took their food to go after sitting down. Not to mention a lady whipping out her boob to feed her child at the table next to us.  I thought it would be classier. I guess it was just a bad night. The food... was very good.

Don't get me wrong, there are some things that you wouldn't find in Italy on that menu (Alfredo Sauce, Chicken Vesuvio-which I always order) but  Volare caters to customers wants and needs and consistently delivers a great product.  The servers who aren't friendly, professional and savvy don't really make it here. Volare is always bursting at the seams and lively and they treat everyone the same, regardless if you are in the biz or if you are at the Embassy Suites or the Drake.  It is a warm hospitable place with decently spaced tables and really fair prices and generous portions.    The bread basket is a mixed bag of the best and the vodka sauce is my nirvana.  The Stella & Mosca  La Cala Vermentino is one of my favorites and this was the first place I ever had hit despite having been to Sardinia a million times.   What they do at Volare is the very basis of the hospitality industry, they provide a warm and lively environment, outstanding service  and a great meal.  Not a place to go and chill because the room is abuzz with energy and there is always a special occasion in your vicinity but I always feel so welcomed there and know I will have a great meal and that big warm hug we all like to feel when we drop our hard earned cash on a meal.  I don't mean 5 stars Charlie Trotteresqe, I mean 5 stars for those of us who enjoy simple food with classic ingredients, well prepared, not too complex and not crazy expensive.  Even the sweet valet guy gets props from me!  Always spot on, well run and accommodating!

We probably arrived 15 minutes before the usual dinner rush started on a weeknight and were promptly seated.  Even on a weeknight, I would advise reservations.  Great atmosphere (felt like members of the Mafia would be eating here...), yummy food, decent prices for the area.

I've been to so many fancy pants Italian places over the last few years that I forgot what top quality old school Italian tasted like. Volare slapped me in the face and woke me out of my yuppified stupor. Food was excellent. Portions were huge. Prices were reasonable.

Tiny little Italian restaurant - sort of a hidden gem.  I could have done with some more table room though and I'm a short girl.  We were sort of cramped in the corner. My meal, gnocchi with vodka sauce, was cheesy, rich and good.  I actually didn't feel like I had a rock in my stomach after the meal (which I often do after gnocchi - that's some heavy pasta). I'd return, try something else or stick with the vodka sauce.  I think I'd go during the week/not during tourist season though.  This is a step off of Michigan Ave. and was jammed on Friday night.

Ok. I don't mean to pull down the average here...but c'mon! I came here on my birthday for a nice lunch w/ my parents. First off: the food was VERY good! That's the only saving grace of this review. I had the lamb and it was very tasty and came on this bed of veggies and rice which was almost better than the lamb itself.  However, they really dropped the ball w/ the service on this one. We couldn't get them to refill our water glasses for anything. We had to ask 3 people before someone finally came. As the bus boy was taking the plates I told him I wanted my leftovers boxed so he picks up the plate and proceeds to rest all of the dirty dishes/bread basket dangerously close to my food. I'm watching this to see if it is in fact touching when our actual waiter turns around from busing a neighboring table and plops a dirty plate right on top of my food. No big deal right? We gasp and tell him that we wanted to keep that. He nods and rushes off to the back. Only to return w/ the very meal that he had just squashed w/ someone else's dirty plate. Really?! Really! Of course we complained and said we weren't going to eat that now so he offers to remake the order and box up another one. He was polite about it, but I feel like that's right up there with taking a forkful, shoving it into your mouth right in front of us and go "oh you wanted to save that? I'll box up the rest for ya!"   g r o s s It seemed like they were all rushed and maybe the busboy was new, and the way he was handling my leftovers certainly made it look like it was table waste...but still. For a nicer place like this I'd expect a little more. Due to all the good reviews I'd be ok with trying it again...but I feel like I'm going to have to be really wow'd into adding back those extra 2 stars. 28/52

I was sort of dreading a business lunch, especially because my companion wanted me to choose the restaurant, but wanted it to be close to her office (um, hi, YOU work there, and I work from home, so how the hell should I know where we should go?).  Sigh.  But once again, Yelp came to the rescue.  I picked Volare because of the rave reviews. Mmmm...the gnocchi!  Light and pillowy, so delicious!  And the giant glass of wine to go with it helped ease the pain of talking shop.  I will absolutely come back here.     The bonus?  The staff couldn't have been nicer.  I was early (on time) and waited at the bar.  Three gentlemen asked if I wanted a beverage within thirty seconds.  I told them I would need the wine to get through lunch in one piece.  When my dining companion arrived I got a wink and a smile from the waiter.  Made my day.

These people aren't kidding...this place is great. I've been here many times over a period of 8 years and I've always left incredibly full and happy. The risotto is the best I've ever had. I also love how on a Sunday night the place fills up with families...big, extended Italian happy families.  That's a great sign for sure.  You feel like you walked into a place that's not some chain restaurant knock-off.   Volare is the real deal, man.

People were not kidding about the risotto - it was amazing! I'll have a hard time not ordering it again when I go back. (Oh yes, I will definitely go back.) This place is small and it gets packed, so you definitely need a reservation. I went on the early side (6:00 PM) and within a half hour all of the tables were filled, as well as the bar area. By the time we left, there was barely standing room left, and this was on a Monday night. Even though it gets crowded, the tables are nicely spaced so you don't feel suffocated. The waiter service was excellent, not too pushy yet very attentive. The food was well timed and served hot. I had the chicken & pea risotto and my partner had handmade ravioli with bolognese sauce. Both were excellent. The menu is heavy on the veal, but there were plenty of other options for us non-baby-cow eaters. We also had bruschetta, which was very fresh, and chocolate marjolaine for dessert, which was somehow creamy and light at the same time. There seemed to be a lot of regulars hanging around - not your typical downtown tourist trap. Volare is definitely worth fighting the crowd for!

This is a place for delicious, honest, Italian food.  It seems like a spot that caters more to locals than tourists, but as out-of-towners, we felt welcomed and were very well fed.  In good weather, you can eat outside.  But inside it's  a small, intimate, loud, delicious restaurant.

I went to Volare for a first date two years ago. It was perfect. The host was a cute old Italian man who pronounced my name with an Italian accent. My date bought a bottle of chianti for the evening which was great. The pasta dishes were cooked to perfection. Not too much sauce (like those Americans do it!) and very good. My date and I have been together since then, and we go here every once in a while for special occasions. I'd suggest to others to venture out and try the other Italian dishes and not just  the pasta! This is probably the best authentic Italian food I've had in the city.

I've never eaten in the restaurant have only had it ordered at work. Every time I am very happy with what I get. They are also super quick which is nice, especially when some of the places the deliver for lunch take over an hour. I would recommend the Sea Food Risotto.

This place looked like a lot of fun, and it is definitely popular. I love Italian and heard this place was great, so I came here my first night in Chicago. I saw the line to get in and since I was still feeling the after-effects of being in an airport for about 5 hours (long story), I chose to get my food to go. The let me order right away, and the food took about 20 minutes to arrive. I hung out at a nearby 7-Eleven in the meantime (where I learned you can buy alcohol at convenience stores here! That's effing crazy, mofos!) and then grabbed my food to go. The hostess was very helpful. My chicken parm was very good, but I have to say not the best, or even probably the top 5 chicken parms I've ever had (I'm somewhat of a connoisseur, you see). Just a note if you go here to eat -- come early, and expect the atmosphere to be good but kind of loud.

Volare is the cutest restaurant ever.  It definitely made it into my top 5 favorite places to eat in Chicago.  Even though we were 20 minutes late for our reservation, we had no problem being seated right away.  It's cramped quarters, that's for sure, but the coziness only adds to the atmosphere of the place.  The food was outstanding - I highly recommend the Grigliatta Mista - best grilled calamari, octopus and scallops I've ever had.  I also had the Gamberoni alla Casalinga - shrimp over spaghetti noodles - and it was out of this world.  My stomach was so full I was uncomfortable for the rest of the evening, but it was well worth it.  I can't wait to go back!

No downsides here, as far as I can tell, except that I didn't get to try dessert.  Because I was so full from the ample and delicious portion of pasta. I had rigatoni alla vodka, because that's the ultimate test of an Italian-American place for me, and it was great.  Very garlicky and different from the other vodka sauces I've had in Chicago.  I really liked it, and would go back in a heartbeat and eat it.  I also had a house salad, and the dressing was perfect.  Light and expertly seasoned. I will be back.

I like to eat at Volare with a good group of friends.  It is a cozy atmosphere, perfect for a date on the week nights, but jam packed on the weekends. The service never dies in this place.  Great quality from the host to the bussers.  Always very polite and willing to please. The food is outstanding.  This is one place that actually can compete with my mother's pasta sauce and meatballs.  The risotto is superb and the gnocchi in vodka sauce is one of my absolute favorite dishes. Try some wine while you're there.  They've got a great selection.

You have to try the Insalata di Mare if you are a seafood lover.  No fillers at all.  If you get a seafood salad anywhere else, there's lots of onions, celery, peppers, and whatever they can use to try to not use as much expensive seafood.  Volare's seafood salad is FULL of tender juicy and flavorful squid, octopus, and whatever else they put in there.  My friend swears by their chicken caccitore.  I enjoyed my chicken parmasean.  I can never finish their food - I take half to go so I can leave some room for their wonderful desserts.  It does get really crowded so reservations are a must!

I had made reservations for 7:15 for 2 of us; we arrived on time and waited about 10 minutes to be seated.  There really isn't much room to stand around so we stood down the side walk a little bit.  The host made sure we could hear him call our name.  They put us at a high top table and at first I was a little uncomfortable, we were smack dab in the middle of everything!  The wait staffs running right by us and we were literally right next to the bar.  I was not happy at first but then reminded myself it is a small Italian restaurant so I just tried to ignore the surroundings and focused on my cute date.   Ok, first A+++ for service!!!  The staffs really know what they are doing!  I was so so so impressed.  Order was taken promptly, water was refilled frequently and the wait staff was friendly and courteous.  My boyfriend also noticed that when the waiter cleared our plates he reached across the middle of the table rather of right in front of us as it is usually done.  That is huge, you can tell the owners/management make sure the service stays top notch! On to the food... plenty of options, this was great.  I ended up getting the risotto and crab special.  LOVED the risotto!  The crab is another story, just no flavor at all, there was supposed to be shrimp sauce on top... nothing... did not care for at all.  I wish I stuck with my original chicken parm but I thought I would be adventurous. My boyfriend loved his pasta dish with sausage, well done to perfection as requested! The berry dessert was soooo delicious!!  That made the whole meal for me ha ha ha! Wine was great as well!  Plenty of options for wines by the glass! So if I had liked my meal a little more I would have given 5 stars... on service alone I would give 5 stars!!! I will go back next time I visit the Windy City!

Thanks to my fellow Yelpers suggestion I tried Volare for a client lunch today...  It was delicious!! Kudos to you my outspoken reviewers - this is my new favorite lunch spot. Despite the abundance of really great choices on the menu I went with a basic chopped salad with prosciutto. It was good but didn't smell nearly as amazing as my clients risotto with chicken and peas. I couldn't help myself and politely asked to steal a bite - soooo not PC of me I know, but whatever, it smelled like heaven.... and tasted just as good. My Oh My, it was toe-curling!!!!  We sat outside on their patio which was nice but noisy due to all of the construction in the area (totally not Volare's fault though). I went inside to take a peek and looks like a great intimate evening place. I want to go back for some date night romance and to try the baked cavatelli!!!!!!  fyi... We had a 20 minute wait to get a table for lunch so this is not your place if you're on the lunch rush.

Best risotto I've ever had my whole life! (When you're gastrically orgasmic, you're allowed to exagerrate!) The salmon was fresh-tasting and wasn't overpowered by the creaminess of the risotto. I would've wanted to try more stuff but I couldn't even finish what I got - and I eat a lot, so that tells you how much their serving sizes are!  Hearty servings and flavorful dishes - my kind of place definitely, and apparently, so it is for a million others too. The waiting queue was just long (we went dinnertime), and the place just wasn't big enough. In fact, we had to put in a reservation and return after having cocktails at Bandera. When we were finally seated, I realized just how cramped it was. One waiter tripping with dishes on hand and you'll have a dozen poor customers who will be washing pasta sauces off themselves.

I came here with a friend and had some truly amazing food!  We arrived a bit early, hoping that we might be able to get seated sooner.  The place was packed!  The lights were up and not too much music was playing.  We eventually were seated and ordered the Scampi Volare as an appetizer.  I don't think I've had shrimp that was so perfectly cooked and seasoned!  Being the seafood lover that I am, I had the salmon as an entree, while my friend ordered the special.  This plate was HUGE!  It was a fettuccine with mussels, fish, lobster, etc.  I swear, it must have been a 3-4lb plate of food.  A funny note, half way through our meal, the lights dimmed, and I think the wine started to hit me b/c I began singing Volare by the Gypsy Kings to myself when what came on over the speakers?  Volare!  I think that truly made the meal perfect.  Corny, I know...

I met some out of town friends here. Great local downtown spot without any touristy feel.  Very fun, friendly vibe. It was perfect. We housed our meals.  I love that they let you select your favorite pasta and sauce! Yeah....let ME decide what kind of macaroni I want.  What if I don't WANT fusili with marinara or spaghetti bolognese? Maybe I want to rock some rigatoni with vodka sauce (which was delicious). Grazie Volare!  Valet is only $8.  Not bad for downtown. My valet guy was super nice and helped fix my window...so mad props to him.

I want  to break into an old Dean Martin song every time I hear the name of this place  "Volare . . .oh, oh . .Cantare ,oh, oh . . "  Anyway, I digress. An acquaintance suggested this place to me and I finally had a chance to give it a try last night and I was not disappointed. All I can say is great Italian food in a great place.  We got there around 10 on a Saturday night and the place was packed!  All the outside tables were filled as was the interior.  They told us it would be about a 25 minute wait so we took a seat at the bar and ordered some appetizers.   The good news?  We had barely gotten our drinks when we were told our table was ready and we were escorted to a table in the corner- perfect! We had the grilled calamari and beef carpaccio as appetizers.  Both were delicious- the calamari coming with a balsamic sauce that was good on everything and the carpaccio was covered in strips of shaved parmigiano. As for entrees- after asking the server for suggestions- I went with her  recco of one of the risottos- 4 cheese, chicken and peas.  It was absolutely delicious!  My dining partner had a steak- done perfectly and served with mashed potatoes. Friendly service, great ambiance and food that reminds me of Italy?  As Dean Martin sang "No wonder my happy heart sings"! UPDATE: 5/24/08 I have been here several times since my first review and it always shines so I hope that our experience last night was an anomaly.  Still on a Saturday, still around 10, still was told a 20 minute wait and we waited all of 10 minutes.  But where it differed this time was in the service.  It was slow- there was a problem with one of our entrees and it took 3 tries to get it right. At that point I expected to hear something from the manager or at least have the entree comped but no.  What we got was ignored- like they were afraid we were going to complain some more.  It was a one time incident- but it did make me take away one star from what is usually a perfect experience.

I went to Volare last Thursday night with my family for dinner. Despite the fact that we had a reservation, we had to wait nearly 30 minutes past our reservation time for a table. Finally, we were lead through a jam packed room to our table where I would soon experience one of the best pasta dinners I have ever had. I had the rigatoni bolognese, and it was fabulous. My family had the veal special, the ravioli with vodka sauce and the spaghetti marinara, and there was not a single complaint at the table. The server was friendly and the service was good. The restaurant itself gets a bit noisy and you will wait for table (even if you have a reservation), but it is worth it for the food. The prices are very reasonable as well.

Totally loved this place. Again, sat at the bar but wasn't alone for long. Bartender was great and fun, lively crowd at the bar who all seem to know each other! Clearly a locals place with an owner who knows everyone. I had penne with a vodka sauce spiked with yummy marscapone - and could only eat about 1/3 of it!! Good stuff...give it a try. Pretty affordable too.  Make a reservation as Monday night was PACKED at 8pm. Bravo Volare!

Love it. Sure it's downtown and all, but we make special effort to come here. The food is tops, great waitstaff, and it's boisterous.  You WILL wait for a table unless you're a VIP, so be prepared.  Not an issue, as the bartender mixes a helluva martini.   Get the Fettuccini Alfredo.  Seriously. Go now.

Before I lived here, this was a must for every visit to Chicago.  The food is amazing.  It's always crowded, so call ahead!  Everything I've had there is delicious, and everyone we've taken there wants to go back.  The only reason I didn't give it 5 is because you often have to wait- seemingly forever- even if you have a reservation...but I suppose that's true of most of the great restaurants in the city.

Heading in to this popular establishment, I wondered if it was worth all the hype.  After all, I had driven past it hundreds of times and never bothered to stop in until my cousin recommended that we try it out for lunch. I am an idiot...We should have been eating here regularly the entire time I have lived in Chicago.  I have spent 2 years here, living 5 blocks from this place, eating across the street a Blackie's the whole time.   Everything was great from the service to the bread to the main entrees.  Starting off with their bread, they have this focaccia bread that seems to be baked with a little tomato sauce and cheese on it.  The only way I can think to describe it is like a dry pizza, but with an excellent taste.  I ate every piece they brought, my cousin was out of luck there... I also tried a bowl of the Minestrone soup...excellent, I usually don't even eat Minestrone, but this will definitely be sitting in front of me the next time I go back! As my entree, I dined upon the Rigatoni alla Vodka, which was absolutely delightful, with it's rich vodka sauce flavoring, coupled with a cheese which I believe Jason S. referred to as a Marscapone.  It really popped and tied the dish together.  I requested that a breast of chicken be served with it, to tie the meal together, and I have no regrets about that. Above all else, the service was outstanding, the manager and the host even walk around and refill your beverage.  No one on the staff seems "above" any duty that may be required in the house.  It is very obvious that they are there to give you a high quality level of service and make sure you depart satisfied in every way possible when it comes to a dining experience. I rate this a must visit!  Lunch or Dinner!

I have been here a number of times the past few years.  Aside from the ubiquitous snooty maitre' d , this is a great Italian restaurant.   The food has always been great, the wine list is adequate, the crowd tends to be the 45 and older set, so I am always looking over my shoulder to see if I recognize someone from Good Fellas . This is very nice for a business meeting, probably not so much for a romantic dinner.  Wait staff has always been knowledgeable and honest about what is good, and as importantly, what is probably not so good.

If I were starving and moneyless, I would hang outside this restaurant for the leftovers!  I am so not PC!  This place is exceptional.  The food is excellent and the prices are reasonable.  The drinks are stiff too!  The vodka sauce with marscapone cheese is phenomenal.  The pasta is al-dente.  The meatballs are great!  I could go on and on.  The only negative is that this place is pretty small so it can get a little cramped.  This is place is for sure on my list of Chicago favorites!

Even though this place gets insanely packed on the weekends, it never disappoints.  The food and service are tremendous; there is absolutely nothing like authentic italian food served to you by an authentic italian.

My favorite Italian restaurant in Chi-town.  Authentic food. Pasta is al-dente. Especially when we go out with our friend Domenico, old-school Italian, we have a blast because he knows exactly what to order. Things like: - Gnocchette Marinara (not on the menu) - Zabaglione (not on the menu) Other good dishes: - Fritto di Calamari - Any of the Pasta dishes I have yet to have a bad meal or experience there. Prices are reasonable. It gets croweded. Valet parking. Highly recommended.

Went to Volare for the first time this past Saturday night. We had reservations for a group of 6 and once our party arrived, we only had to wait about 5 minutes (despite the place being packed). I had the fettucine with vodka sauce which was delicious. They have some good italian wines that are decently priced too. The only bad part of the experience was the Caprese Salad was a little bit of a disappointment as the mozarella wasn't all that fresh. I guess that's what happens when you come back from Italy and try to eat it here.

This place was awesome.  Everything from the service to the decor to the wine list.  It couldn't have been better if it were located in downtown Florence.  Volare has a wonderful ambiance about it that is very genuine and true.  (I pictured the ghosts of Franky Sinatra and Momo Giancano in the kitchen licking their chops as they watched all the authentic Italian dishes fly out to the dining room) We started with the calamari appetizer.  It was fried perfectly.  I had a cup of the soup of the day and followed with a salad that came with my entree.  For the meal I ordered the Nodino di Vitello alla Griglia al Rosmarino (Grilled prime veal chop in a light rosemary sauce) **** This might be the best veal I have ever tasted****  I mean fuggediboudit.... It was cooked perfectly, the flavoring was amazing...  If you are looking for Italian food in Chicago, this is a must see.  Everything was great.

This place is dark and crowded and our waiter wasn't the greatest (his Italian accent made up for it), but the food is sooo good.  We started with the scampi and eggplant appetizers.  I thought the scampi was going to be overly garlicky because it smelled so strong, but it was perfect.  The eggplant was great too and I don't really like eggplant.  I had the angelhair pasta with vodka sauce and a side of the meatballs....mmm....mmmm.....good!  Two other people at our table ordered the veal shank special and said it just melted in their mouths.  I'll definitely be back and look forward to eating al fresco in the summer.

Excellent and authentic Italian cuisine.  The restaurant is a little on the dark side but the decor, white linen tableclothes, and open kitchen make you feel like you should be sitting down to dinner with Tony and Carmela Soprano - I loved it!  I ordered the pesto risotto with scallops and it was great, the risotto was perfectly cooked, they used just the right amount of garlic, and it wasn't too oily (pesto dishes can tend to get that way).  One of the people I was dining with ordered the veal and could not stop raving about it, we were all very pleasantly surprised.  The prices were very reasonable and I can't wait to go back again and try one of their salads!

Wine was excellent, even if I picked out both bottles.  Had one Super Tuscan at $40 which was a steal for a restaurant.  Pasta and sauce was great, a little heavy handed on the salt with the sea bass special, the seafood and pasta special was large and tasty.  Two complaints.  One, what the hell is the problem with coughing up some lemons for the shrimp appetizer?  Jesus H, you think it would break the bank.  AND, because of it the shrimp were the shits.  The remaining four appetizers were spot on and so was the salad volare. Eight big eating guys and two or three plates didn't get finished.  Too full.

Great food and reasonable prices.  I've tried the gnocchi, risotto, and angel hair, and all are delicious.  And in the summer, it's wonderful to dine outside. My only complaint is the wait to be seated. Every single time that I've dined here (with reservations), I've had to wait.  I just ate there tonight, and my reservation was for 7:45, but we didn't get seated until 8:25.  Luckily, they do have a bar, and I didn't mind waiting with friends, but it can get quite frustrating when you're not seated promptly.

Yum. Its old school Italian food nestled just below Michigan Ave on Grand. Our server's italian accent was so delicious I wanted to spread it all over my foccacia. If you don't order the baked eggplant appetizer you're crazy. My recommendation is to order whatever your server tells you to. And don't leave out the pasta side. Their Al-dente is a don't miss-eh.
